{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
It was an incredible day out. While it had been gloomy and raining in the past couple of days, today was a day of bright warmth as sunlight cascaded down in golden rays. A perfect day for a ceremony, Icestar mused to herself as she reached the top of the Highledge and planted herself firmly at the edge. Her Clanmates were busying themselves with daily tasks but they could use a break and a morale boost. ” All cats who are old enough to catch their own prey, gather around for a Clan meeting!” Icestar called out the usual words for signalling her warriors to cease their activities and join her for a few moments while they cheered on their newly ranked Clanmates. This ceremony was only going to be held for one but it didn’t matter. Irispaw deserved the attention. She was an apprentice worthy of stepping up as a warrior. @ThunderClan @ruby ♡

prim 23-May-21 11:25 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Ceremonies
The sunny, cloudless sky was a great backdrop for today’s ceremonies in her mind. A good omen for what was in store for these young cats getting promoted, though she’d heard whispers on the wind that it was only one apprentice being promoted to a warrior. Nonetheless, it was a time for celebration, even one more warrior being added to their ranks was a worthy time for a joyous ceremony. The ThunderClan deputy sat herself down in her usual spot in the clearing, joining the rest of the crowd in their merriment as she watched Icestar from below the Highledge. Her ears flickered as she dipped her head to any of her clanmates who’d happened to be sitting nearby, curling her bushy tail around her paws as she prepared for the ceremony to go underway.

Ice 23-May-21 11:54 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
“Then by the powers of StarClan,” Icestar continued, raising her voice. As she raised her ocean-coloured gaze, a lone purple petal swirled in the air in front of her. Odd… Usually, the full flower would be caught in the wind, not parts of it. Before she could observe it further, the breeze carried it on into the horizon, out of sight of her studious look. The silvery-white leader paused for a moment, considering what she had just seen. Clearing her throat, the ThunderClan leader proceeded to look up at the vast expanse of the blue sky. There was not a cloud in sight. ” I give you your warrior name. Irispaw, from this moment on, you will be known as Irispetal.” That was the flower that the purple petal had belonged to. ” StarClan honours your kindness and bravery, and we welcome you as a full warrior of ThunderClan.” She twisted her head to the right, leaning forward to rest her muzzle upon Irispetal’s head. @/ThunderClan @ruby ♡ (edited)

irispetal

prim 23-May-21 01:23 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Ceremonies
The burly tortoiseshell had continued to watch the ceremony with keen interest, spotting the cat of the hour who was to receive her warrior name. She'd listened in carefully, a small smile adorning her battle-scarred features as the new warrior was dubbed with her new name, Irispetal. Laurelblaze cleared her throat before she began to join in with the chanting, as was the custom for these events. A cry of celebration, they were to chant this new warrior's name aloud: "Irispetal! Irispetal! Irispetal!" she made sure to yowl out the new name at the top of her lungs, to give this new warrior the celebration she deserved. This was to be a happy memory for her, as it was for everyone else who received their warrior name.

Shade 23-May-21 10:26 PM
As Tigerpaw padded slowly from the blue shadows still swathing the ThunderClan camp like thick cobwebs, her jaws parted in a massive yawn. She walked near blindly back towards the apprentice den, where she wish she could have stayed, but had been unable to stave off a trip of the dirtplace any longer that morning. Even the sleepiest apprentice couldn't resist nature's call. Usually she slept in until Aspenpaw dragged her out. Laurelblaze was busy sorting patrols for the better part of dawn. As golden light hit her brown fur, turning it a rich chocolate color, she was able to take some pleasure in the wee hours, but the new sun was still weak and offered little more than a hint of warmth to the zombie cat. Happening to look up just to be sure she wouldn't trip on anything, her eyes caught on a sturdy young tom - Juniperpaw, if her currently half functioning brain recalled correctly. Standing there with his muscles perfectly illuminated, Tigerpaw wasn't sure what to make of his potentially flashy attitude, but she did know that she wouldn't be outdone. The smaller she-cat braced herself as she drew closer to passing, flexing as much of herself as she could to try and match his presentation, despite the painfully obvious bags under her eyes. Her strength wasn't as impressive as his, but the tone was definitely there, a sign of a trainee who didn't slack despite her unorthodox sleeping habits. She thought she looked nonchalant, but the whole show was truly... silly. @tremb
tremb 24-May-21 04:57 PM
Juniperpaw & Tigerpaw | @Shade From his placement outside of the apprentices den, Juniperpaw took notice of the she-cat before she even realized he was there. He recognized her instantly, of course. He had seen her training before, and could tell that she was going to be quite the warrior one day. Just like him. He thought someone with her ambitions could make a great friend for himself. ”Hey, Tigerpaw,” he meowed silkily, a wide grin playing on his features. He tapped the ground beside him with his fluffy silver tail, inviting her to join him. ”Long day training yesterday? You look tired,” he commented with a soft chuckle. Of course, he meant no offense by that. He respected the apprentices that trained hard like he did, and didn’t bother to complain about being tired. Besides, it was all worth it in the end. The exhaustion, the sore muscles, the constant busyness with so little time for relaxation. Juniperpaw was savoring every moment of it, personally. He didn’t miss being a kit at all. The camp had always been far too boring for him, and when he was a kit no cat paid him much attention no matter what he did. Now that he was an apprentice, he could show off his skills and cats actually cared about them, and praised them. It was a nice change. ”I could fetch us a nice juicy mouse off the pile to share, if you like. I’m sure we can hunt later and bring plenty of prey back to replace it, anyways.” The silver and black tom said. Although his biggest focus was fighting, he made sure to focus on his hunting skills as well. Hunting was every bit as important as battle skills, even though battle training brought the tom more fun.
tremb 24-May-21 08:50 PM
Wrenkit & Coyotekit | @prim Wrenkit immediately noticed the look on Coyotekit’s face in response to her questions, and her own ears flattened to her skull. She realized that she’d said the wrong thing, though she didn’t think until now that it would have upset the other kit. Maybe he didn’t want to think about the future? Perhaps becoming an apprentice really didn’t excite him as much as it did most kittens. That was understandable, she supposed. Growing up could be kind of scary. Being a kitten was easy. No one expected anything from you, there was no real responsibilities or troubles to weigh on your shoulders. Being an apprentice could be quite overwhelming, so maybe that had caused Coyotekit’s attitude to change? Wrenkit bit her lip, staring down at her paws as she thought about what to say next. She hated to see any cat upset, even if it was only slightly, and her first instinct was to cheer him up somehow. He had mentioned the lake, perhaps she could go off of that. ”Seeing the lake will be amazing! Everyone says it’s so big, that they’ve never seen anything like it.” She said, grinning widely. In all truthfulness, there was a lot that Wrenkit was excited about. Perhaps she could get Coyotekit feeling a bit more positive as well. ”I’m excited to see the lake, too. And the whole of ThunderClan territory. It’s so much more than just this camp, it’s a whole new world out there to see. I’m excited to attend my first gathering and see what the other clans are like outside of the nursery tales we’ve been told. I’m excited to learn new things too, like how to hunt and fight.” She took a pause, smiling warmly as her amber gaze swept the camp. ”I’m even excited to take care of the elders, even though I hear all the apprentices complain about it a lot,” she said with a small giggle. She knew most kits didn’t get excited about having to tend to the elders, but she liked the idea of contributing to her clan in every way.
goose 25-May-21 04:47 AM
| Batears | @Ice )) Soft sunlight illuminated against the old tom's black coat as he stepped outside from the elders den, turning his dark pelt into a dim grey as he kept his grey eyes clouded from the morning light with his furrowed brows. Batears took a few rushed pawsteps forward to the fresh-kill pile, he hated the slow and weak pace that came with his old age, wishing that his youthful strength somehow came back one day and have the ability to run around without anycat slowing him down and scolding him for being such a reckless elder. Screw young people who actually care about his vulnerable health, he's gonna die anyway soon! But then he won't be able to spread rumors and gossip in Thunderclan... Oh wait, he can do that in Starclan too! Almost forgot. A flick gave out of his large ears, he leaned down with a small grunt as he tried to reach over for a vole— already feeling his frail bones shattering apart, especially in his legs. Batears dropped himself onto his side, breathing out a small sigh from his narrow muzzle before greeting his meal with sharp teeth digging into it's deceased carcass. The tom's grey eyes shifted towards every inch and corner of Thunderclans camp, hues turning into slits to anycat who looked at him weirdly— or just looked at him the way he didn't exactly please with whatsoever. 'Idiots...'
prim 25-May-21 10:29 AM
{Coyotekit} | Wrenkit | past I
Perhaps she was right, this would lead to new opportunities for them both. They could each explore the territory on their own at last and get to know the world around them. It was supposed to be exciting, though he figured he’d likely just be doing his own thing for the most part. Maybe that wasn’t exactly a bad thing, not everyone had concrete plans for their future. Besides, he wasn’t looking to strive for ambitious plans. He just wanted to live a calm existence, he’d sort out what he wanted from life later on. For now, he was going to enjoy whatever free-time he had left before it’d be taken up by training, patrols, or any other duties. I’m not gonna get in trouble a lot, I don’t want to clean the elders’ nests all the time. the thought was horrifying, even if there was a grand total of two elders within ThunderClan’s walls. One trait he seemed to share with most of the kits his age.
”I’d want to scope out places I can put my collections in, it’ll be much harder for anyone to find them then. Plus cleaning it up will be so much easier and discreet.” one thing he looked forward to, he could resume his operations without a hitch. The warriors stumbling upon his cache of bones would be much less-likely, and he could bury the remains of the specimens he’d studied to his heart’s content. He always cycled them out and was respectful towards them, he wasn’t hoarding every single bone he found anyways, usually just the interesting ones. ”Plus, I can get away from the crowds, I’m not really a fan of all the loud chatter. I can’t really think when there’s so much going on. Not that you’re bothering me, of course!” he shrunk back a bit, his fur bristling once he realized he might have said something inadvertently rude. Wrenkit was good in his books, he just did not like crowds. ”Uh, but the territory... yeah.” he awkwardly shuffled his paws as he glanced towards the Highledge, clenching his teeth as he was preparing an escape from his social blunders. He could be quite blunt with how he phrased things, often he forgot there were others around. @tremb
Ice 25-May-21 08:20 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Beatears (present) }
Her back lengthened as Icestar stretched her lithe body in a light arc. Her spine gave out a pleasant crackle, loosening up the tension that had built up there. The lynx-point’s muscles rippled as they strained to keep her whole self balanced. Boy, does a good stretch feel so good! Icestar thought with a quiet purr rumbling in her throat. Now all I need is a good hunt outside to warm myself up and get started for the day! Passing by the fresh-kill pile, the ThunderClan leader’s gaze caught on the only elder currently residing in her Clan: Batears. Her white-mittened paws rooted themselves in place as she observed the frail feline struggle to grab a vole and settle back down to consume his meal. The young feline watched, wondering if she would ever be able to bear becoming that weak if she ever lived long enough. @goose

tremb 27-May-21 11:01 PM
Wrenkit & Coyotekit @prim Amber eyes brightened and a grin flashed upon her lips at his response, glad to hear him talk about some things he was looking forward to. She waved her tail to and fro through the air as she spoke. ”Yes! I’m sure there will be plenty of nooks and crannies in the forest to store your collection. You’ll never have to worry about them being taken again,” she went on cheerfully. She had no idea yet, but she was sure that ThunderClan’s forest was quite large and full of places for new apprentices to explore. There were bound to be great hiding spots, too. Who knew, maybe Coyotekit would find some cool undiscovered locations in the territory that even the warriors didn’t know about in his search for hiding places. She tipped her head as he continued to speak about escaping the bustle of the camp and cats, feeling momentarily worried that she might be crowding him. Of course, that worry went away quickly when he reassured her that she wasn’t a bother. For that, she was glad. Wrenkit was much more social than Coyotekit, that was for certain, but even she valued her alone time. She knew that several cats could be quite overwhelming, and it was good to have time and space to think and have a clear head. ”I’m glad I’m not bothering you,” she responded softly. ”But, if I ever do, you can totally tell me. I’ll understand,” she added with a sweet smile. She would absolutely rather have him tell her he didn’t feel like socializing than not say anything and end up being annoyed by her. She had been called annoying in the past, so Wrenkit always carried the anxiety that she might be bothering any cat she spoke to. Though there were plenty of things that the young she-kit was excited
about, there were also things that scared her about becoming an apprentice. What if her mentor hated her? What if she got some cranky cat for a mentor, who got irritated with her bubbly personality and easily distracted nature? She shuddered at the thought. ”Do you ever worry about who your mentor might be? I-I kinda worry sometimes, now that my ceremony is getting closer. I hope we get along,” she said, shuffling her paws uneasily. Did other kits worry about that too? Maybe it was just her. But, she supposed any warrior who was going to be appointed as a mentor needed to have a certain level of patience and understanding, and surely they’d end up getting along fine. She hoped.

Marigolddust • Gathering At the sound of Laurelblaze's call and the stating of the word "gathering" Marigolddust was in camp. He was only given a moment to look up and enjoy the stars above him before he convinced himself that he should follow Laurelblaze and the others to the gathering. He had crossed it by himself a few times recently, and he was a grown warrior. He shouldn't fear such a thing. Shaking himself as if to force off the anxiety that had become to slowely cling to his fur, he quickly padded forwords after the others.

prim 29-May-21 08:00 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Speckleflame | present
As they were rapidly approaching the onset of greenleaf, the sunlight was only going to get harsher. At least, that would be a rational thought belonging to any cat living amongst the clans. For Laurelblaze, it meant suffocating in her fur for the most part. While having a thick, protective coat of dense, russet toned fur had it’s advantages, resistance against the heat was not one of them. The deputy often suffered in the boiling months, luckily they were still not upon their doorstep, still, she loathed the thought of having to put up with them. She’d been occupying herself with inspecting dens and planning out future patrols while she awaited results from the morning hunting patrols she’d sent out earlier, deciding to not accompany them for today. She hadn’t taken the time to inspect the dens for damage or natural wear and tear, nor had she maintained them as of late. Slacking... even if it wasn’t necessarily true, even if she was supposed to keep up with her clan’s affairs as their deputy, she was still only one cat. All the work couldn’t be left to her to make up. She deserved breaks too. Heaving a sigh, she’d decided to take a seat nearby one of her clanmates, who appeared to be in the middle of a meal at the moment. ”Oh, hey Speckleflame.” she greeted the tom with a flicker of her bushy tail, ”How’s your finch?” @Shadow

prim 29-May-21 08:35 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Speckleflame | present

Gently shaking her head, she chuckled awkwardly. ”Thank you, but I already ate this morning and it’d be unfair to the others. I still need to get out there and handle some more duties before the day ends.” her ears flickered a bit as she gazed back down to the tom from where she sat, letting out a small sigh as she relaxed into her sitting position. Might as well stick around and continue to strike up an interesting conversation while she was here and could afford to make the time for it. ”I gotta pull my own weight around here like everyone else. Can’t have special privileges just because I’m the deputy, gotta be fair about it.” she scratched her chin lazily, her lips curling up into an amused smirk. She held herself to high standards on her own, so she wasn’t going to shirk her duties or give herself any advantages over the others. @Shadow

prim 29-May-21 11:43 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Speckleflame | present
Well, he didn’t seem too keen on talking. A rare trait amongst her clanmates, they were a rather chatty bunch— at least compared to some of the members of the other clans she’d met. Maybe she could get a few words out of him, just so she could keep the conversation going and actually get to know him a bit. She always liked understanding her comrades a bit better. ”Well, are you looking forward to greenleaf? We’re definitely gonna have a busy season, I’m hoping for some thunderstorms. I love seeing the sky flash with each strike and the crack and roar of the thunder, it’s thrilling!” her eyes lit up at the prospect. Despite very much being outside for the entirety of her life, she still liked the idea of danger a good storm brought with it. Always the adrenaline addict she was, a quick thrill was always a way to get her riled up and excitable. Besides, they provided a nice, cool break from the typical heatwaves of greenleaf. @Shadow
Ice 30-May-21 09:29 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Beatears (present) }
She met Batears defending glare with a unfazed look . That didn’t last long for the elder soon quipped sharply at ThunderClan’s leader. Icestar’s stream of thoughts became jaggedly broken. Her white chin was jerked into the air automatically, a quick assertion of her dominance. The flash in her ocean-coloured optics spoke of surprise at the outspoken tom. It soon hardened into a stare of fiery infernos. ” I’m staring at you,” the lynx-point replied honestly. She wasn’t going to deny that. ” I got lost in thought.” Her mind had been darting past many subjects as of late. Fallen Claws. Echostar. Badgers. The safety of her Clan. Silentwing…Speaking of which, had Eaglewing managed to infiltrate the Dark Forest? She cast a quick glance towards the warrior’s den, doubting her stoic friend would be snoozing away at this hour. @goose (edited)

prim 01-Jun-21 01:30 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Speckleflame | present
It seemed she wasn’t the only fan of loud, crashing storms around here! Some cats didn’t like the loud, sudden noises, especially if they were prone to being startled by such sounds. She couldn’t blame them, though she really did like the noise. Reminded her of camp when it was in a stir, like in a ceremony. She always liked having noise around, especially a commotion, usually for good things of course. There was a difference between the yowls and screeches that came from battle than the yowls and cries of joy from a ceremony. Even if she enjoyed a little danger now and again. ”I’m definitely going to be putting my apprentices to work, I have to make sure that Bouncepaw and Tigerpaw are gonna be powerful warriors at the end of it all. They’re relying on me as their mentor.” taking on two apprentices at once was always hard work, but she enjoyed the challenge. It was a privilege to teach the youth of her clan in the ways of a warrior. Getting to know them, she saw them as an extension of her family practically. She had to protect them like she would her own kits, and to make sure they were ready to face the world. Of course she was dedicated and grew attached to them, but even she knew they would have to move on with their lives eventually, but she wanted to make sure they always had a place to go even after their apprenticeship ended. She wanted them to trust her no matter what happened from the moment they traded their apprentice -paw title for a bonafide warrior name. ”Do you have any apprentices? Or have you trained anyone yet?” @Shadow
Shade 02-Jun-21 11:46 AM
Juniperpaw's voice was impossibly smooth for so early in the morning - even the songbirds had competition. Tigerpaw stopped. "Hi JunipErp-" she squeaked, her voice cracking after a night of snoring disuse. She quickly shook her head and tried again. "Hey Juniperpaw." Her claws curled in and out of the sand a couple times in uneasy curiosity before following his gesture and padding to join him, keeping her brindled flank just comfortably enough away from his protruding fluff. The she-cat was busy rubbing her eyes clear of crust while he made his small talk. "Huh? Uh, yeah," she answered, surfacing clumsily from her distraction. "I mean no-ahhhw..!" The denial trailed into a refuting yawn. So much for looking alive. Determined to shake her drowsiness, Tigerpaw tugged her raspberry eyes wide open, willing them to look bright and alert despite the screen of sleep that still hung like a cloud in their facets. She found that the cold camp floor against her rump was shocking her further into consciousness, and after another survey of the camp her gaze circled back to him, just in time to sport and expression of stark opposition. "No way dude!" she objected in a squeal, quickly slapping a chocolate mitt over her mouth when she realized she'd be disturbing their still dozing clanmates. Tigerpaw dropped her voice to a hiss, leaning close to him, or more so under his chin, her eyes shining with great purpose. Jaggedfire wouldn't be so lenient on her again she guessed, and if Laurelblaze found out she'd been setting a bad example again, she'd have her head for it. Tigerpaw shuddered inwardly at the thought. Clearly she wanted to say more, searching for a way to explain herself casually, but instead all she said as her mew came back out of a whisper was, "I'm, like, not even hungry anyway." She sat back up and licked her chest, trying again to look dignified. A moment later her belly growled and she curled in on it vainly. (edited)
Good old self betrayal: story of my life. @tremb
prim 03-Jun-21 01:14 AM
{Coyotekit} | Wrenkit | past I
In truth, he didn’t find her annoying. She was good company and never poked fun at or ridiculed him for his hobbies. She was just more outspoken than he was, though it seemed she was getting him to speak up a bit more, at least around her. Perhaps it was just because they were friends, normally he’d just give quick answers rather than actually thinking over what he was saying. He ended up being quite blunt and came off as a bit rude or curt, even if it was not his intention. He was also incredibly formal in his word choice for a kit, but that was just him. He liked sounding mature for his age, someone had to be out of his litter. Even if he had morbid fascinations with bones, though it was purely for the sake of his own intellectual curiosity. Nothing more. ”My mentor? No, I’m not worried.” he shook his head and answered that question rather confidently. He trusted that his mother would give him a good mentor along with the rest of his siblings when the time came. She was a smart and dedicated leader to her clan, and surely that extended to her kits. He trusted that she would give every kit of the clan a reliable and trustworthy mentor. That would include Wrenkit, of course. ”I’m sure my mom will appoint someone good for you, I can tell her that you’re a bit worried about it, if it’s bugging you so much. You’ve helped me with hiding my collections a bunch, so I figure I could return the favor in a way... For your peace of mind, I guess?” paying it forward, he figured, if he got the chance to speak with his mother on the matter. She was awfully busy a lot, but surely she had time for one quick conversation. Only if Wrenkit approved of the idea, however, he wouldn’t take any action if she declined the offer. @tremb (so sorry for being so late on this reply!!)
Shade
"Bah!" a shrill, throaty yelp of surprise burst from the apprentice as she jumped and spun to meet the source of a sudden voice. What she found was a pair of arresting violet eyes, a sleek tortoiseshell pelt, and a judgmentally pursed mouth. Thick as her skull was, though, even Tigerpaw could see the hint of curiosity mixed in with her clanmate's freezing eyes. How did I not smell you? The question played clear as day in her own coral facets. Instead of chasing the answer though, Tigerpaw skipped straight ahead to trying to play off her bad behavior. "I was- um-" Her brown tabby pelt bristled and her eyes glittered as she fumbled wildly for an explanation. "I was getting moss for Icestar's nest-" One look at her empty paws and she regretted the lie instantly. "Wait, no, I mean-" Exasperation began to boil inside her like magma. Think, idiot, think!.. @spark's clone™

cake 03-Jun-21 11:34 PM
marbledpaw | @Shade actually crying rn)
The tortie fluffed up her for to seem larger - she was older, afterall, and should seem more.. authoritative. Yes, that was it.
She really didn't. Her ears were short, the tips of it fluffy with white tufts of fur, and it seemed like she had just hit a growth spurt but didn't nearly grow into it yet. Marbledpaw seemed to have taken after her mother in build, but somehow in the process of growth it got cut short and she was stuck in the process, her appearance more lanky than anything. She didn't particularly want to stay this way, and was too impatient to wait for herself to get older, too.
"Don't do that," she said with a scrunch of her nose, unable to hold the charming air Finchbriar had suggested she keep.
Tigerpaw fumbling for more lies, though, she could understand. The calico played with a sheepish grin before throwing it away instantly. Ears flickered backwards with faint embarrassment, regretting her decision to even approach the apprentice- but she got herself stuck here, and it could be worse, no? "It's- it's okay.. I think you should get down.. uhm.."
Come on. You can do better than that. Impressing someone, was abnormally hard. The thought flashed briefly across her head. Maybe she wasn't as a natural as she had originally thought.
"I'm Marbledpaw~" she introduced herself, voice nearly a squeak. "You're- I'm-"
She straightened up, holding her head straight so it wouldn't glance rapidly to the side pleading for help; they were still balancing on the cliff that lead near Icestar's den- she must have been fair entertainment for those watching below. "I don't think Icestar would appreciate you doing that."

She definitely wasn't as cool as Marbledpaw in demeanor - more of a hot potato, really - but like her she often tried to look dignified. This wasn't a great start for either of them... not that she could tell. The resurfacing of Icestar's name made Tigerpaw freeze. The cocoa tabby's veins turned to ice. She stared at her denmate for a moment before leaning in, her voice dry and desperate. "Will you tell?" she strained quietly, hoping for the best but expecting the worst. Jennstar 07-Jun-21 08:03 AM
Patchheart
@percy The white-and-ginger tabby laid at the edge of camp, staring quietly at her paws. It had been moons since Frecklewish had been found slain by a fox. Coupled that with the pain of Onionslice's exile, Patchheart couldn't help but feel distanced from her clanmates. She normally hunted alone, avoiding interactions with others as she tried poorly to process her grief. She felt so alone. Her orange eyes gazed sadly across the camp as she let out a sigh, knowing she would have to go hunt again soon to keep her clanmates from assuming she was being lazy.
prim 07-Jun-21 03:28 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marbledpaw | present
The past few days had been rather turbulent in terms of weather. As greenleaf was right on the horizon, there were major shifts in how it was impacting the clans. Some days it was sunny, warm, as the rays of the white star above illuminated their days. The next, the skies were gray and cloudy, with occasional rainfall that dampened the soil beneath their paws and nourished the plant life that littered their territory. On some occasions, even on the clearest of days, violent, tumultuous storms raged across the skies and darkened them in their path. They rumbled and roared with thunder, with the occasional white flash of a lightning strike nearby. Yet, as quick as they were to make their entrance, they were quick to retreat, wreaking havoc elsewhere. Greenleaf was always a busy time, not just for the forest creatures as well at the clan cats. Still, it always brought it’s own set of challenges unique to the season. They couldn’t slack on collecting prey for their storage just because it was so abundant. They would need to reap the rewards before it began to dwindle as they approached leaf-fall. She had to keep track of it and make sure she was sending out enough patrols to account for it all. ThunderClan would be strong as they entered leaf-bare, she had to make sure of that. There was no time of year where she could sit back and take a break, she had to uphold her duties, and she hoped that she was setting a good example for many of the younger members of their clan. @cake
percy 07-Jun-21 06:31 PM
Hawkswoop | w/ Patchheart
@Jennstar The large tabby tom's mouth opened wide in a yawn, as he crouched in a puddle of weak sunshine at the corners of camp. He'd spent the morning patrolling and hunting, doing his best to provide for his clan, but with no apprentice and no assigned duties or chores he was getting a little bored. Hawkswoop was still tired from patrolling earlier but perhaps a walk through the forest with another cat would wake him up a little and they might even be able to catch some prey to bring back. Heaving himself to his paws, Hawkswoop stretched for a moment before gathering his paws under him and standing up to his full height. He shook his fur gently to get rid of the dust and shreds of leaves it'd accumulated as he'd rested in camp, and scanned the clearing for someone to take with him. His attention was brought to a ginger and white she-cat laying quietly at the edge of camp. Patchheart was her name, if he remembered correctly. A melancholic air hung around her - her orange eyes were glazed, as if she was distracted or sad, and she seemed to be distancing herself from her clanmates. Hawkswoop padded over to her, moving slowly and making sure to make his pawsteps audible to avoid accidentally catching her off guard and frightening her. He slowed to a halt a few paces in front of the she-cat, ducking his head and offering a warm smile. "Patchheart, right? I'm Hawkswoop," he introduced himself.
Jennstar 07-Jun-21 06:45 PM
Patchheart
@percy The young shecat watched as a fellow warrior made his way slowly across the camp, dread filling her gut. She silently prayed he was going to pass her by and enter one of the nearby dens, but as his paws led him closer towards her, she realized she'd have to make small talk. As he bowed his head and introduced himself, she gave a small nod before replying, her voice slightly hoarse from lack of use. "Yeah, thats me..." she mewed. "Nice to meet you, Hawkswoop." she offered half heartedly in response, before shuffling her paws slightly in nervousness. "Did...uh...you need something?" she asked quietly, raising a brow.
percy 07-Jun-21 06:59 PM
Hawkswoop | w/ Patchheart
@Jennstar He hesitated slightly, unsure if he should push her to come with him. It'd probably be good for the she-cat to have some company but he didn't want to drag her along or make her uncomfortable or disturb her. "I was wondering if you wanted to take a walk with me - maybe check the borders or go hunting a little," he offered, ducking his head a little to her eye level. He made sure to keep his movements slow and predictable, his tone gentle and quiet - the last thing poor Patchheart needed right now would be someone ordering her around or being harsh. "No pressure, of course. If you don't want to come, or if you wanna come or not talk, or anything, really - then that's alright," he added. (edited)
tremb 07-Jun-21 08:58 PM
Juniperpaw & Tigerpaw | @Shade A smirk laced the toms lips at Tigerpaw’s cracking voice, though he said nothing. He understood her tiredness, even if she didn’t want to admit just how tired she really was. He had experienced it plenty of times. Though he seemed a ball of energy this particular morning, it was partially a credit to the fact that he had been up quite a bit longer than her. He had already managed to ward off his sleepiness, and she surely would soon as well. Juniperpaw chuckled softly, rolling his pale blue optics as the she-cats jaws parted in a yawn. ”I’m sure we can find a way to wake you up,” he said cheekily, giving her a soft nudge with a black forepaw. Now would be a great time to be a warrior. They could have gone for a hunt, or a walk through the forest to warm up their muscles. What a shame they couldn’t go out without an escort, unless they snuck out, of course. Judging by her response to his breakfast suggestion, he guessed she wouldn’t be up for that. ”Alright, alright, keep your fur on,” he teased. ”I wouldn’t dare get you in trouble,” he added sincerely. He scoffed lightly as her stomach rumbled in protest to her refusal of food. ”Ah, right. Me either,” Juniperpaw responded with a wink. ”So, no breakfast then. And I can only assume you don’t want to sneak out of camp with me, so… what do you propose we do? I’m bored,” he said with a mischievous grin.
Jennstar 07-Jun-21 10:37 PM
Patchheart
@percy He wants to hunt...with me? the thoughts raced through her mind as she contemplated his words. Her orange gaze was unsure at first, but as he spoke, she couldnt help but feel a little relief that he was making it her choice to go or not. She let out a brief sigh after considering her options, befote slowly rising to her paws. "Its probably good for me to stretch my legs anyway." she shrugged with a low voice, forcing a small smirk at him. "Sure, ill join you...i cant promise ill be the best company, but..it would be nice to walk with someone i suppose." she mewed. Her mind screamed at her to stay put, to not bother moving and continue isolating herself. But her heart knew she'd never get better if she didnt at least try to push forward, as much as it hurt.

Hawkswoop | w/ Patchheart
@Jennstar He blinked warmly, clearly happy about her reaction and agreement to join him. He stretched again as she stood, trying to shake the weariness from his paws. Tail flicking behind him, plucking at the ground with his claws - he wanted to make sure he was alert and ready for anything, just in case they ran into trouble. Checking to make sure the she-cat was following him, he made his way to the camp exit, muttering apologies to any cat he accidentally bumped into or had to step around - it seemed as if, in newleaf, every cat was eager to get things done and everyone felt constantly busy, and so at this time of the day the camp was usually bustling. "I was thinking maybe we could go around the Windclan border," he offered as he ducked through the camp exit, wincing a little as it scraped his ears. "We could check on it, and hey, while we're there we might even come across a stray rabbit or two on our side. Been a while since I chased after one." (continue in #thunderclan-territory ?)

Tigerpaw could ignore her stomach for the sake of rules any day, but her boredom?.. Not so much. Upon his musing her raspberry eyes darted sidelong at the camp entrance, which sat high on the cliff, open and tempting... Could they..? She shook her head. But the thoughts didn't cease. It wasn't like this was the first time she'd been out in the territory alone, or with other apprentices for that matter. She had recently been reaping the perks of being an older apprentice. tremb 08-Jun-21 11:06 AM
Wrenkit & Coyotekit @prim ”Hmm,” was the only response than Wrenkit could manage at first. He seemed so unbothered by the thought of his future mentor. Perhaps she was overthinking it? Wrenkit was an over thinker, even at her young age, and she was beginning to realize that not all cats analyzed everything the way that she did. Things that worried her seemed to be the least of anyone else’s concerns, and it made her think that perhaps she shouldn’t fret so much. She didn’t mean to, of course. It was just the way she was. She found herself constantly analyzing the tones in which other cats spoke to her, and often made assumptions about how they felt about her if they were anything less than cheerful. She hated it, of course, that she could barely get through a conversation without feeling as though she was annoying her counterpart. Coyotekit seemed to have great confidence when it came to the topic of his future mentor, and Wrenkit wanted that as well. After all, it was pointless to worry. In no more than a moon, she’d be appointed a mentor and that would be that. She should be excited, not worried! At his next words, her amber hues brightened immensely. ”You’d really do that for me?” She asked. Her mind immediately went to Marigolddust as her obvious choice, had it been here to make. She couldn’t just come out and ask for him to be her mentor though. What if he didn’t want to be her mentor? When she had suggested it to him, the idea seemed to scare him. She still couldn’t tell if he didn’t like the idea of mentoring her in particular, or mentoring any cat in general. He seemed to overthink just as much as she did, which was one thing Wrenkit liked about him. ”I guess I just worry that my mentor won’t be patient enough with me,” she said with a shrug. She was determined and good spirited, but she was distracted easily, and had often been described as too hyper.
She knew firsthand there were a lot of warriors that were easily annoyed by such personality traits. ”I suppose I shouldn’t worry so much. Maybe I’ll be… less annoying in a moon when I’m ready to be apprenticed,” she joked lightly.
tremb 08-Jun-21 11:36 AM
Juniperpaw & Tigerpaw @Shade Satisfaction burned inside silver blue optics as Juniperpaw took notice of Tigerpaw’s sudden interest in the camp entrance. Perhaps she was considering his idea? He had only been partially serious, of course, but then again it did sound fun. He had snuck out of camp a pawful of times before, as most apprentices did. Thus far he’d never been caught, which only added to his confidence that they could make it out and back undetected. He got to his paws, swishing his fluffy tail through the air and taking a few steps, glancing back at Tigerpaw over his shoulder. ”Well, only one way to find out, right?” He inquired, a grin parting his lips. His voice remained level, though his toes were tingling with excitement at the idea of sneaking out with Tigerpaw. He didn’t wish to disclose that with the she-cat, however.
Shade 08-Jun-21 12:23 PM
Tigerpaw only hesitated for a short moment before getting to her paws and lagging after him. "I guess so..." she mumbled, nervous at the prospect of what might await them upon their return, yet unable to keep her feet from following the silver-tongued tom. At first her steps were slow and cautious, then they quickened to catch up with him. Tigerpaw's heartbeat was steady but clear, a hard to ignore pin in her chest. Standing beside Juniperpaw, she tried to find comfort in the depths of his blue eyes. Her pink ones shone nervously, and a small nervous smile accompanied them. prim 08-Jun-21 05:37 PM
{Coyotekit} | Wrenkit | past I
It seemed his companion was really struggling with this. She seemed ecstatic to move on to this next part of her life, but it was obvious she seemed nervous as well. This was a big change, they no longer could goof off and do whatever they pleased, they needed to act their age. Not everyone wanted to let go of their childhood that easily, and she seemed worried that it was going to impact her experience. ”I don’t think they’ll find you annoying. It’s their job to teach you, and if you’re confused and unable to figure something out then they should help you more.” it was simple. If they weren’t doing their job correctly, then they need to do better. The apprentice needed to be the one learning, and the mentor was the one instructing. He didn’t plan on being a nuisance to his mentor though, he didn’t need his mother to enact her wrath on him for doing something stupid that required reprimanding. Though she’s not a troublemaker, not that I’ve heard anyways. She’s nice and if she’s so worried about this, I’m sure she’ll do okay. I dunno why she’s so anxious about it. He always had a very level head for a kit, he could remain calm even when it was a bit chaotic. He didn’t like loud noises, but if any of his siblings were scared, he liked putting up a stoic, calm front so they wouldn’t feel as scared. He thought he had to be strong and mature for them, to make sure they had someone to look up to at least. StarClan knows how many times his siblings found themselves into tricky situations. He had to help get them out of them. Maybe he could help other kits out as well with that. ”Whatever happens, I’m sure it’ll be all right. Just hope for the best, it’s not really in your control and I’m sure it’ll be okay.” @tremb

"Tigerpaw-" she repeated as she was introduced - like she hadn't heard the name before, but the calico liked doing research before getting to know someone.

Springy 🦤 10-Jun-21 06:48 PM
Marigolddust - Truthpaw - Near Future It was a fine day, with the large globe that provided the world beneath it with light letting it's rays run loose over the forest like a river over stones. There was no clouds that Marigolddust could see besides some wisps that made them look more like foam than any true cloud. Accompanying the decent weather, the air was warm and the humidity made his ash colored fur feel as if it was inevitably matted. With a twitched of his ear, Marigolddust gently set the mouse he had caught on the prey pile. Fortunately for him he had gathered enough confidence to feel more comfortable in his environment, although he still found himself nervous around any of the darker shadows or exceptionally large trees. Feeling proud, he expressed a satisfied smile. Today was a decently calm day, and he felt more at peace than he usually did. Turning, he padded over to the side of the camp in his normal spot, leaning some of his weight against the stone wall of the haven. Curling his tail around his paws, he lowered himself into a laying position with a calm sigh. @Shadow
tremb 10-Jun-21 07:00 PM
Wrenkit & Coyotekit @prim The other kits words soothed Wrenkit, and now she found herself feeling silly for being so worked up in the first place. Coyotekit was younger than her, yet seemed to have a calm and mature disposition of a cat many moons her senior. She almost felt envious. I must seem like a helpless mewling kit being so worried about something so trivial, she thought to herself, sinking her canines softly into her lower lip. Still, she was grateful for his words of encouragement. ”Thanks, Coyotekit. You’re right,” she replied with a soft smile. Dark amber optics flickered towards the moon as it slowly rose into the black sky, a wide yawn parting her jaws. Though she was beginning to feel tired, Wrenkit also felt restless. All this talk about becoming an apprentice had her paws itching to be out of the camp, to finally have the freedom to leave the confines of the stone walls. She would never dare to sneak out, but it was times like these when she really wanted to. It wasn’t worth the scolding she would receive, still, curiosity burned within her and she found herself staring longingly at the camp entrance. ”Do you ever think about sneaking out?” She asked suddenly. ”I never would, but sometimes I think about what it would be like to run through the forest. Sometimes I feel like I just need to run,” she added with a shrug. Perhaps her hyperactive tendencies would be subdued slightly once she became an apprentice. Hunting and training would serve as a good outlet for all of her pent up energy. For now, however, even though her eyelids were beginning to droop with sleepiness, she still felt like she could have run laps around the camp.

Springy 🦤 10-Jun-21 08:31 PM
Marigoldust - Truthpaw - Near Past Only the sound of his own name caused confusion to spark up in the young warrior’s optics.  Sitting up, he glanced around in an attempt to try and place wherever he had been called.  Unfortunately it seemed that whoever was trying to get his attention was concealed somewhere in the camp, or Marigolddust was too tired to truly realize where they were.  Standing, he took another glance around, unsureness brushing his fur into an uneven blanket.  Finally, he spotted the apprentice out of the other cats crowding the camp.  At the mention of a tree, he hesitated.                       ”Interesting about a tree?  I’m not sure what you mean,” he said softly, padding carefully to the tree and young tom, who’s name had yet to come to mind.  ”If it’s a prey of some sort I think you're allowed to try and catch it, since it’s in the camp walls, but I might ask Icestar first if you’re worried about it.” he suggested, feeling a bit self conscious at the fact that he was the cat who was chosen to investigate.  Going up to the tree, he glanced up a it’s branches.  He felt a bit woozy at the idea that something might be up there looking back down at him, hidden behind the new leaves on the branches.       ”You don’t mean dangerously interesting, right?” he asked reluctantly, keeping his eyes on the branches.  If there was anything up there he should be concerned about, he didn’t want to look away and give it a chance to pounce on him.

Shadow 10-Jun-21 08:34 PM

Springy 🦤 10-Jun-21 08:46 PM
Marigolddust - Truthpaw - Close Past Bark?  What was interesting about bark?  It didn’t seem like it was anything like blue, white, red, or yellow from where he was.  Eventually he assumed this apprentice had an odd fascination in bark.  Why else would they call another cat over?  There could be a bug of some sort that wasn’t all that common or some sort of irregular moss.  Marigolddust wasn’t the most intent on using up his time examining bark, but he also didn’t have the heart that most cats had.  Hr would prefer not to disappoint the apprentice.  A few minutes of his time was worth sparing the day for another, wasn’t it?       Deciding it was best not to refuse such a wholesome request, he slowly rounded the tree, stopping where Truthpaw told him to.  Again, he found himself confused.  Even when he squinted he didn’t see much of anything important or interesting.  Maybe it was a little more flaky than most of the trees in the forest, and there was a little bit of moss clinging to the trunk of the tree.  There was an ant or two, even a long legged spider.  That was decently fascinating.  Yet he decided to ask the question stuck in his head anyways.  ”What exactly am I supposed to look for?  The pattern is quite… interesting, that’s true,” he said, trying as best as he could to figure out what had caught the eyes of the tabby.
@Shadow
Shadow 10-Jun-21 08:52 PM
"Keep looking" he says quickly grabbing the stuff he starts tying him up with the vines and leaves he works quickly by the time Truthpaw had finished tying him up Marigolddust was high enough in the tree that his paws couldn't touch the ground but not high enough that if he were to fall that he would get hurt. He takes a couple steps back admiring his handy work laughing slightly
@Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 11-Jun-21 02:50 PM
Marigolddust - Truthpaw - Cose Past Again, confusion swept over him when he felt something press against his flank, then another, then another.  His heart skipped a beat and he froze, believing that it might had been a snake that could have fallen from the branches above.  But, when he took more notice of the increased pressure of the bark on his side and the fact that Truthpaw had taken a few steps back he glanced down.  Instead of the body of a snake he found a nbit of a thick vine, and his heart dropped as he realized his paw’s couldn’t touch the soil beneath him.  Perhaps he shouldn’t have looked so high in the tree for anything eye-catching.       Nervous, he wanted to figit or move some part of himself, but a the same time he was too scared to do so.  What if the vines were loose enough to let him go if he moved too much?  Instead, only the tip of his tail swayed back and forth anxiously.  Releasing a nervous chuckle, he looked away from the vines and at Truthpaw.  ***”Congratulations, you tricked me!… but can I get down now?” he asked, anxiety rising the longer he was attached to the tree.  He had a bad history with trees, and the last thing he wanted to do was relive it.  That’s why he avoided trees when hunting, patrolling, or helping Fernpaw with herbs.  Now he was *tied to a tree, and from Truthpaw’s body language it seemed clear that he wasn’t going to be freed any time soon.

cake 11-Jun-21 07:06 PM
marbledpaw | @prim Slightly exhausted but content from a recent training session, the pale apprentice had her paws splayed on in the cool shade of camp, a pair of dark lavender eyes glancing upwards at the large shape of a deputy passing by. "Hello," she greeted with a wave of her tail, clearly in a good mood today for she didn't frown or shoot an insult off to the side, deputy or not. Neither did she try and look away and pretend she didn't exist for the time being, either. In other words - she was having a very nice time. Marbledpaw pushed herself into a respectable sitting position, watching, and deciding that she wanted to go out for a walk, maybe, again.
prim 11-Jun-21 10:29 PM
{Coyotekit} | Wrenkit | past I
The coming of nightfall was prompting natural, tired responses from each of the kits in the clan. Even he was feeling fatigue, his eyelids growing heavy as he let out a small yawn. He’d better return to the Highledge before he was too tired to climb back up, but he could stick around for a little while longer. At least to answer her last question out of courtesy. ”No.” like most of his answers, it was quick, simple and to the point. Then followed by a more thorough elaboration of his response. ”If I attempted that, my mother would harshly punish me for sure. I wouldn’t blame her either, supposedly it’s super dangerous for kits out there.” his pale gaze wandered over towards the exit of camp, following up to the tree canopies that hung over the camp almost as if they were tempting the more adventurous kits into the outside world where danger could ensnare them like bear traps. While they would be able to freely traverse this new land once they came of age, it was still filled with the same dangers they’d face if they were to go out there now, but they had their mentors to guide them. They wouldn’t fall for dangerous traps nor let the world get the jump on them. ”It won’t be much longer, Wrenkit. Once we begin our training, we can run through the forest to our heart’s content. It’ll be safer that way, and we can’t get into trouble for it.” a logical conclusion, he wasn’t one to stick his neck out for no reason at all. Coyotekit let out another yawn, this one more apparent this time. He was growing more and more exhausted, it was time that he began to hit the hay and finally rest his little head. The young tom scratched his chin as he peered back to Wrenkit, shaking his head a bit. ”It’s not you, I’m just… Getting sleepy.” his voice grew sluggish, laced with grogginess as he then turned towards the Highledge. ”I’ll see you… later… Wrenkit.” he was rubbing his eyes now as he began to pad away, he really needed to get back to the den before he collapsed on the steps leading up to the Highledge, he didn’t want his mom or dad carrying him back up to their nest when he was at this age! He could handle making his way back to the den even in his tired state. His pawsteps were heavy, and he had quite the climb ahead of him. He had to focus on avoiding slipping and falling so he could just flop over into the nest and finally give in to his torpor and pass out into a deep slumber. @tremb
prim 11-Jun-21 11:21 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marbledpaw | present
As she picked up on a gentle greeting belonging to that of a nearby apprentice, the burly tortoiseshell turned to face the paler-toned molly sitting up nearby. A soft, lopsided smile graced her deeply-scarred features as she prepared to return the greeting to the young apprentice. ”Hello to you as well, Marbledpaw.” her bushy tail swished around behind her, her heterochromatic gaze glinting for a moment in the sunlight, as if they flashed with a friendly eagerness to speak with her clanmate. The deputy always enjoyed an engaging conversation with the youth of her clan. It was always good to check on how the apprentices of her clan and how their training was faring. Even if she was not their mentor, she felt obligated to be mindful of them and to ensure they were comfortable and excelling in their tutelage as they should be. Besides, she also liked to know what the next generation of the clan was providing, the state of the entire clan would be in their paws one day. She wanted to see if she could predict how they’d succeed her own. ”How’ve you been, dear? Is your training going well?” she tended to address the apprentices of her clan like they were her own kits to look after. She wanted to be a figure they could turn to for support, even if they were not family. Laurelblaze adored kits, and in turn it tended to extend to apprentices as well. The deputy always had a fondness and felt an obligation to be nurturing to them, she’d defend them as if they were her own. Came with kitsitting her younger siblings when they were young, and now her own children. Besides, she was meant to protect her clanmates like they were her flesh and blood. It was her duty as deputy. @cake
cake 12-Jun-21 02:22 AM
marbledpaw | @prim She pulled her tail closer to her as the tortie approached, gently tugging the kestrel feather closer to her as some sort of assurance. The tie of the vine was loose, now, and she fastened the vine tighter, teeth clamping on the edge firmly. "I've been-" wide violets glanced up to a suddenly very close mound of a cat. She lifted her chest, keeping herself from shrinking away as a natural instinct. Dear. She blinked upwards. No one had called her that since Hazelhues left. *"Marbledpaw." she corrected before she could stop herself, the words slipping rapidly out of her tongue with little filter. "My training has been going very well," she said with a soft purr, the nearly foreign action tightening her throat. Fernpaw doesn't mind her her, so she must be.. decent. "My mentor and I were just hunting. And.. you?" the inquiry was friendly, a sheepish grin appearing. "Must be a good time to be deputy," she mewed with a slight twitch of her whiskers, noting the greenleaf prey. Mostly as an ice-breaker - and to stop herself from nervously laughing at completely nothing. She paused a little, pale purple lanterns looking up curiously. "Have you been busy lately?"
prim 12-Jun-21 10:19 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Marbledpaw | present
A mere slip of the tongue led her to realize her mistake and she dipped her head in a quick apology to the apprentice. ”Sorry, Marbledpaw. I call a lot of cats that. Forgive me, I won’t make that mistake again.” she murmured, her ears flickering. It became habit for her when she was around her kits that it seemed to be translating to others apparently. That wasn’t necessarily a good thing either, she’d have to be more mindful of what she said to others in the future, unless they were fine with it. ”I’m glad things are going well for you then, what did you catch out there?” she tilted her head as she inquired as to what prey was roaming about. Might give an indication of where to send the next patrols if it meant bigger, better morsels of prey were roaming around the area. Imagine if we found a whole warren of rabbits! the thought was delectable, the clan might be fed for an entire moon if that happened! Then, Marbledpaw’s comment elicited a small sigh from the deputy in question, before being followed by an amused chuckle. ”More like a busy time, I gotta send out more patrols than ever to make sure our coffers are filled with prey and that everyone is getting enough to eat. I’m almost always on my paws moving around, which sucks because the heatwaves are coming.” while she had long since shed away her thick, winter coat, her fur was still dense and long. It was still not exactly the most pleasant time of year for her. Especially when she was working so much. ”Yeah, needless to say, I’m busy pretty much from dawn til dusk this entire season… And all year.” @cake
Springy 🦤 12-Jun-21 04:17 PM
Marigolddust - Truthpaw - Near Future Getting over his fear of trees… that was an outcome that Marigolddust couldn’t see.  Truthfully, he found his fur spiking up more than it would have the day before, even if he had been leaning against a tree.  He wasn’t accustomed to being in, or on, a tree without being able to touch the ground.  Climbing trees was the last thing he wanted to do whenever he thought of training or possibly mentoring in the future.  Even if he was in the tree alone instead of with another cat, he wasn’t sure he could trust the thick branches he might find himself clinging to.  But now he was experiencing yet another nerve-racking experience with trees and another cat.       Trying to calm himself a bit, he gave a try at a confident smile; unfortunately he didn’t succeed at it.  ”I-I’m not freaking out, this is just… inconvenient… I should be…” he began, trailing off as he tried to come up with an excuse.  Maybe he could scare Truthpaw into freeing him?  No, he wasn’t one for scaring.  He decided to go for a more truthful excuse instead.  ”Hunting!” he finished with a nod that was far too strong to be convincing.       As Marigolddust waited in suspense for what seemed like forever, he got a good look at the apprentice who had tied him to the tree.  Long fur, brown tabby, green eyes.  Why exactly he was noticing all of this, he wasn’t sure.  Perhaps it was to distract himself.  The hard, rough bark rubbing against his side and the continual laughter coming from the younger tom stressed him out.  Perhaps this was why he seemed to befriend she-cats more than toms.  First Lavenderpaw pushed him out of a tree and bullied him, now he was being bullied by this stranger apprentice.  An apprentice… How in all of Starclan had he let himself wound up in this situation?  Shame began to bubble inside his chest alongside his fear, which was caused both by the tree and the idea of cats in camp seeing him in the situation.

tremb 14-Jun-21 08:01 AM
The pale light of dawn accompanied by the shrill melodies of birdsong had drawn Wrenkit from her nest quite early. Amber eyes still heavy from sleep, dainty white paws dragging, she positioned herself just outside the nursery to observe the camp. Even as a younger kit, Wrenkit had enjoyed waking up early. Now that she was nearly an apprentice, it was part of her daily routine. She often looked on as the patrols were organized and sent on their way, and of course the best part of it all was watching the sun rise over the forest. The first rays of golden sun were setting the treetops ablaze now, and before long the ThunderClan camp would be bathed in the warm light. As she sat on her own, the brown and cream kits mind wandered. Very soon, she would be an apprentice and have her own role in camp life. No longer would she be a mere observer, she’d be a part of the very thing she’d spent so many moons observing. There was a time when Wrenkit felt as if she’d be a kit forever, confined to the camp to never see the outside world. Now, as her sixth moon rapidly approached, she realized she would be saying goodbye to her kithood and earning a real place among her clanmates. The thought sent shivers down her spine of both excitement, and apprehension. There would be so much to learn and so much to do. She had watched the apprentices as they came and went, quite the busybodies they were. She knew what would be expected of her as an apprentice, and yet she wondered if she could handle it as well as they could. Wrenkit gave a small shake of her head, swiping her tongue across an ivory paw and rubbing it over her dark brown ears. There was no point in sitting here worrying about what was to come. For now, she could just enjoy the sunrise. @cobra
cobra 14-Jun-21 10:08 AM
Another kitten preparing to let go of his nursery nest sat quietly. Foxkit and his gaggle of siblings were nearing the start of their 'paw' days. Outside the safety boundaries of ThunderClan's camp lay a world full of danger, adventure and mischief. And Foxkit wasn't sure he wanted to join that world. Historically, life for a cat who could only hear in one ear never went well. Long ago, when the ancient Firestar was a warrior, a deaf kitten got carried out of camp by a hawk. Foxkit feared that the same fate faced him. His thoughts consuming him, Fox didn't notice Wrenkit peeking out of the nursery. @tremb
tremb 14-Jun-21 12:34 PM
An ear flicked atop a cream furred cranium as Wrenkit detected the sound of another kitten, amber eyes falling upon Foxkit. She’d never spoken to the tom, but she knew who he was. They shared a den, of course. ”Goodmorning, Foxkit!” Came the young molly’s chipper mew. She didn’t know much about the tom, aside from the fact that they were close in age. Soon they would be sharing a different den together. She took a deep breath, pulling the crisp morning air into her lungs. As the sun rose higher, it began to bathe the edge of the clearing with light. ”Its a pretty morning, isn’t it? Soon we will get to spend our mornings outside of camp. I’m excited for that,” she said, a grin adorning her lips. @cobra
cobra 15-Jun-21 05:04 AM

'Featherkit, Tigerkit and Viperkit won't always be there when you are'. Determined to make a good impression, Fox offered Wren a friendly smile. "It is. I like to sleep later than this, but sometimes I just wake up and can't get back to sleep" Especially with three overgrown meatheads wriggling next to him. Foxkit leaned into the sunlight, enjoying how warmed his bones through his thin fur. "Me too, well, if Icestar let's me be an apprentice" Blue eyes shifted away from her gaze, suddenly taking interest in the yellowing grass beneath him. tremb 15-Jun-21 08:58 AM
Upon receiving a friendly smile in return from the tom, Wrenkit felt relieved. She always went through several moments of worry when greeting another cat, afraid that they wouldn’t want to talk to her. Foxkit seemed cheerful though, and already she was hoping they would become friends. Wrenkit would befriend anyone, really. ”I love being up early. I always seem to wake up around dawn, even if I don’t try to. I like watching the camp wake up,” she added with a little giggle. Being used to waking early would probably be a good thing once she was apprenticed. Wrenkit tipped her head to the side quizzically at his words. What did he mean if Icestar let him? A sympathetic expression fell over her features as Foxkit told her about his partial deafness, and she was quick to rest her tail over his shoulders comfortingly for a moment. ”Awe, nonsense! You’re going to be a great warrior.” Wrenkit said encouragingly. She meant it, too. She was sure he could adapt to only being able to hear out of one ear, he just needed some practice. ”Icestar has to at least give you a chance. I bet with a little practice you’ll learn how to make it work for you. You’ll be just as good a warrior as the rest of us,” she purred. @cobra (edited)

Bouncepaw had been training by Laurelblaze's side, working hard trying to trust her skills that she was learning and her own body. She hadn't known why she was like this but she was very gentle and didn't like fighting, the thing was she wanted to fight and hunt, it just wasn't in her brain to. Any prey she even scared off she said sorry to, although she did that when her mentor wasn't watching. This was just another training day it seemed and she was to meet her mentor in camp to see if they were training for fighting or hunting, or if they were really training at all. "I love training, I really do, it's just... I don't know why it's so difficult for me." She meowed silently to herself, "I mean I have never wanted to hurt anycreature but I want to be useful to the clan and prove myself worthy." She grumbled, brushing her paws lightly on the ground as she walked. She often wondered if she was a kittypets but she knew it wasn't right for her, besides, abandoning her clan would be pointless, and abandoning her clan when they need her generation most isn't fair. "Well, this'll be a long day." She sighed with a shrug, limbering up her muscles with different and effective stretches. @prim
prim 15-Jun-21 01:46 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Bouncepaw | future I
The day was bright and sunny out, a perfect day to get out into the woods and spend time with her apprentices and actually train. She typically kept their lessons separate for their own sake, being able to dedicate time to each of them so they could go over what they’d learned in the day and so neither of them fell behind. Besides, Bouncepaw was older than Tigerpaw and therefore farther along in her training compared to the much younger molly. Laurelblaze had to make sure she was ready for her warriors’ assessment. Six moons seemed like a long time, but before any of them knew it, it arrived. It was her duty as their mentor to make sure they were up to snuff, and she put them both through the wringer. Speaking of which, there was one of her little students now… Idling around in camp it seemed. Can’t blame her, not like they can go out without a kitsitter practically. she let out a small sigh as she approached the young she-cat with a small smile. ”Hey, Bouncepaw.” she greeted her apprentice with a small dip of her skull, her tail flickering around behind her as she approached. ”You busy? I was wondering if you wanna go hunting for a bit, get out of camp, no?” Well, even if she said no, they needed to get some training in. Though Laurelblaze wanted to start her off with something easy, nothing too grueling. A warm-up, essentially, for what was to come later on. ”Come on, while it’s still light out! We can get so much done today!” @🎃👾Spooky 👾🎃

tremb 17-Jun-21 12:05 AM
Wrenkit felt her own hopes soar as Foxkit seemed to cheer up almost instantly at her words. She felt very pleased that she had been able to help him, and a small purr rumbled in her chest. The story that he told her sounded familiar, and she was sure she remembered hearing it from the elders at one point. She loved listening to the elders telling tales of the history of the clans, and she knew so many it was hard to remember them all. She scrunched her face up a bit as if deep in thought, trying to remember the particular cat he was speaking of. ”Brightheart! Her name was Brightheart,” she suddenly blurted out, grinning from ear to ear. ”If she could be a great warrior without an eye or an ear, you’ll be just fine. You’ll show every cat that you don’t need to hear out of both ears.” Wrenkit pondered his next question for a while, having thought about the topic a lot over the past half moon. ”I’m not sure who Icestar will chose for me, but… I hope Marigolddust will be my mentor. tremb 20-Jun-21 12:47 PM

Ice 20-Jun-21 04:23 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies (present) }
Stepping forward to the edge of the now familiar cliff edge, Icestar took in the beautiful landscape of her home. It had been a while since so many of her Clanmates were transitioning to another rank at the same time. She smiled slightly. The Clan was developing so well and peace was firmly established. She hoped it was going to last for a while longer. Shifting her body, she then opened her maw to gather the Clan. ” All cats who are old enough to catch their own prey, gather around for a Clan meeting!” Icestar announced. It was nearing the end of the day. Patrol activity was to spike up after sharing tongues and a hearty meal but it could be delayed for an extra heartbeat or two. With the clearing mainly full due to her resting warriors, it shouldn’t take long for a crowd to form and attentively raise their gaze up to her. @ThunderClan

Springy 🦤 20-Jun-21 04:37 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies The sound of the silver point's call caught the warrior's attention, causing him to straighten. Just moments before, he had been lying down and resting from a long tiring trip. Yawning, he stationed himself onto his paws and lazily padded out of Fernpaw's den after offering her a small smile. Sleepily, the tuxedo joined the crowd of warriors and apprentices who had collected around the tower of a stone. Glancing up at Icestar with a flash of curiosity in his eyes, he settled down towards the outside of the group. Curling his tail around his own paws, Marigolddust tried to figure out who around him were the cats that would gain a rank that day. Or... Or maybe something bad had happened? Could that be the reason behind the summoning? Given his head a little bit of a shake, he examined Icestar's demeanor a little bit better. She seemed decently relaxed, so it was more than likely that this was a laid back ceremony. Relaxing, he waited patiently for whatever announcements might be said.
tremb 20-Jun-21 04:38 PM
From the shadows at the edge of ThunderClan’s camp emerged the watchful Wrenkit, bright amber eyes gazing up at her leader. Cream and brown pelt glossy in the evening light, she trotted closer to the center of camp, where her clanmates had already begun to gather.
frost 20-Jun-21 04:39 PM
The black tabby kit had been lounging around near the nursery, lapping at one of his charcoal paws absentmindedly. Truly, not a thought was going on in his head, instead zoned out into whatever world Featherkit went into. It was only when a voice rang over camp that his ears perked up, and he rushed back into reality. His head tipped to the side with curiosity, and alone, he wandered up to the group, not bothering to find his siblings and instead plopping himself down toward the back. Ceremonies, to him, were rather boring, but he supposed with Laurelblaze as his mother, the least he could do was half pay attention to them.
Ice 20-Jun-21 04:40 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies (present) }
Ocean eyes softened as they drifted down to the line-up of kits. This was going to be a very special ceremony for them. ” Coyotekit, Viperkit, Tigerkit, Featherkit and Wrenkit. You have all reached the age of six moons, and it is time for you to be apprenticed. From this day on, until you receive your warrior name, you will be known as Coyotepaw, Viperpaw, Tigerpaw, Featherpaw and Wrenpaw.” That was a mouthful but Icestar didn’t appear to have minded it. Her expression was solemn and concentrated as she spoke, wishing for this ceremony to be as good as it can get for the little ones. ” Coyotepaw," her voice warmed as pride filled up within her. " your mentor will be Strikethroat. Viperpaw, your mentor will be Cinderblaze. Tigerpaw, your mentor will be Finchbrair. Featherpaw, your mentor will be me and Wrenpaw, your mentor will be Marigolddust.” Her masked face turned to the crowd, beckoning the named warriors up the Highledge to join their apprentices. @prim @goose @frost @Springy 🦤 @tremb (edited)
@/ThunderCLan
{ ~ Cinderblaze ~ }
The silver tabby perked right up as her name was called suddenly. Leaf-green eyes focused on her new apprentices, curiosity and pure joy sparking within them. It had been a while since she had an apprentice and she had begun to miss having another friend! A brief moment of silence washed over her at the thought of Twoface. I won’t lose this one, will I? She wondered, worried that she would have to mourn again. I won’t! She brushed away the dark thoughts. Hopping right up onto her paws, Cinderblaze weaved through the throng of felines and trotted right up to the Highledge.
prim 20-Jun-21 04:46 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Ceremonies
As the deputy padded out into the clearing upon hearing the call from the leader atop the Highledge, she took her seat nearby her kits. This was a big day for her youngest kits to be promoted, the ones she’d found along with her mate just a few moons prior. Oh how the time flew by! They were already going to be apprentices, taking the next step in their lives as warriors. She was going to try so, so hard to not burst into tears out of joy and sadness. She didn’t want to embarrass her kits today, this was their moment to shine.
{Coyotekit} | Ceremonies
To say the young tom was nervous was an understatement. He swore he could feel his mother’s gaze bearing into him from the Highledge, even if she was only just watching the growing crowd of cats. Son of the leader, becoming an apprentice at last. He wanted to make her proud. Still, the hustle and bustle of the cats around him made him only a bit more uncomfortable, he never liked the confined feeling of other cats around him. Still, he had to keep his head held up high for them all to see he was truly ready.
{Viperkit} | Ceremonies
She practically had to be dragged out of her nest by her siblings, because it was some special ceremony because she reached six moons of age. That meant she was getting another name change and was becoming an apprentice. ’So what! As soon as I’m trained, I’m getting out of here. This isn’t my home, and I’m gonna make sure I can survive out there when I finally make my escape!’ she thought triumphantly, this was just another step in her grand scheme! (edited)
tremb 20-Jun-21 04:51 PM
Did she just say my name? At first, Wrenkit wasn’t sure if she’d heard Icestar correctly. Time seemed to slow, and the cats that huddled around her seemed to fade into the background. I’m becoming an apprentice… now? Right now? This was a day that every kit dreamed of, yet nothing could have prepared her for the ball of nerves that sat heavy as a stone in her stomach. Her heart pounded loudly within her chest, so loud she feared that the entire clan could hear it. A grin spread across her lips, so wide it made her cheeks hurt, and forcing herself to remain steady, she padded towards the Highledge. Wrenpaw. She was Wrenpaw now. As if her newly acquired name wasn’t enough excitement for the young molly, she then heard who her mentor would be. Marigolddust? Her eyes frantically searched for him among the sea of warriors, paws working furiously at the earth below her. No way! The she-cat felt giddy with excitement, and it took everything in her power not to begin bouncing around the clearing. The idea of embarrassing herself with the entire clan watching kept her rooted in place.
frost 20-Jun-21 04:52 PM

Though, as he noticed one of his sisters basically being dragged in by his other siblings, he couldn't help but to snort. He truly didn't understand her distaste toward ThunderClan. They were safe, they were warm, and they were fed. What more could they possibly want? As he noticed the other kits padding forward, he blinked. He supposed he had to do that too. Moving forward with the rest, he shuffled awkwardly into the line-up they had created. Looking back, Viperkit was no where in sight. Sighing, he ran back, hissing: "c'mon! There's nothing you can do to get out of it!" Grabbing her practically by the ear, he pulled her forward, which wasn't done without a fight, surely. He didn't recognize any of the names, but, he was met with confusion as a name wasn't listed after his name. Huh? Me? Who's me? He glanced around, confused, until he finally realized that she meant that she was mentoring him. Oh, that's cool! Grinning, he watched as the other mentors came to meet their new apprentices. Springy 🦤 20-Jun-21 05:15 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies All of the relaxation evaporated out of him when he heard his own name said. Stiffening, he tried to register whatever he had heard only moments before. Why was he mentioned? It took a few moments for the realization to finally dawn on him, seeing Icestar's gesture. Feeling his heart sink, he gulped, trying to push down the nerves that had bubbled up to the surface. You can't keep them waiting, he reminded himself, needing to repeat the sentence a few times in his thoughts for him to finally stand and get his paws moving. Holding his breath, he joined the others on the Highledge, anxiety slowing his movements, if only slightly. Marigolddust's apprehensive nature kept him from getting excited, although as he glanced over at Wrenkit he tried to reasure himself. He could help but fear that he was going to be a terrible mentor, and although he would never want to ruin such a kind and cheerful kit's life like he expected he would, he also felt relieved that he didn't end up with a apprentice like Truthpaw. Spying the soon-to-be-apprentice as her excitement flew, his worries couldn't hold back his smile. Maybe this wouldn't be a terrible experience? Only maybe. Hesitating for a moment, he made his way down to Wrenkit before clearing his throught softly to get her attention, noticing that she seemed a little confused as to where he was. Once he met eyes with the excited kitten, he couldn't help but feel nervous yet again. She was his first apprentice. What if he messed this up right from the start? Was there a specific way that he was supposed to touch noses with her? Forcing the thoughts to the back of his head, he smiled and bent down, touching noses with the joyful she-cat. @tremb#3692
