Springy 🦤 20-Jun-21 06:03 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies A blink accompanied Marigolddust's startement at the sudden series of words that tumbled out of his new apprentice's mouth. A new smile spread across his features, one a bit overwhelmed yet amused. Until now, the ashy colored tom hadn't realized how ironic the appointing was. He recalled being almost as nervous as he was now after he had assisted Wrenkit with her crouch. I guess I'm going to be doing a lot more than helping her a bit now, he realized, loosening up a little bit, although it might have been because he had begun to feel a bit dizzy. "No need to apologize, Wren...paw," he reasured, pausing a moment only to fix what could have been a mistake in Wrenpaw's new identity. Truthfully, Marigolddust felt a bit awkward as he realized he wasn't quite sure what they were supposed to do now that the ceremonies had been finished. It seemed Wrenpaw's was just as clueless, and so he tried to come up with something. What had Skycloud told him? He was supposed to teach what he had been taught, anyhow. After a moment of running through his memories, he decided on what to say. "We can start training tomorrow, as soon as you'd like, as long as the sun's visible over the trees around the camp walls." He said, his smile still present on his features. His nerves had laid dormant for now, and he expected that he would hopefully be able to collect himself by then. "You... Know where the apprentice's den is?" He asked, unsure whether or not a mentor needed to teach such a thing. Rooksnap had taught him, not Skycloud.

tremb 20-Jun-21 08:24 PM
Wrenpaw. It felt so good to hear her new name out loud, she couldn’t keep the smile off of her face. Today had started just like any other day, and she never expected it to end with her becoming an apprentice. ”I always hoped you’d be my mentor, but I never thought you really would be,” she purred happily, giving a little bounce. Now that the crowd had dispersed, she could finally let out more of her excitement. Her tail tip was twitching rapidly, and she could barely keep her paws in the same place for more than a moment. ”I can’t wait to start training! I’ll be up bright and early tomorrow waiting for you! You can show me the territory, and maybe I can catch a nice fat piece of prey for us to share when we come back to camp, and…” she trailed off quickly, realizing she was rambling again, and talking much too fast. She took a deep breath in, reminding herself that she needed to act more mature now. ”I’m sorry, I’m just so excited. I promise I won’t be like this all the time,” she murmured, smiling sweetly up at him. She hoped she wouldn’t get on his nerves too quickly. Or overwhelm him. He seemed to overthink things just as much as she did, and she would hate to make things worse for him. She giggled softly, pointing her white tipped tail in the direction of the apprentices den. ”Of course I know where it is! I’ve spent the last six moons watching everyone come and go. I know all of the dens, and all of the cats. I just have to… set my nest up. I hope the other apprentices like me,” she added, shuffling her white paws across the ground. ”Some of my friends became apprentices with me! Like Coyotekit- I mean Coyotepaw, and Foxpaw.. but I don’t know about the others. They scare me a bit,” she admitted. @Springy 🦤
prim 21-Jun-21 12:35 PM
{Viperpaw} | Wrenpaw | present
The fanfare after the ceremony had finally died down once they all were dismissed and free to go about their business. She’d gotten settled in the apprentice’s den with the help of her mentor in picking out her nest towards the perimeter of the den. The black-tortoiseshell molly was still a bit of a sourpuss the entire time however, and it was still bleeding into her attitude now, even hours later. What even was the big deal anyways? Sure she’s now an apprentice and gets a name change, but so did every other kit! Wow, I’m not Viperkit anymore, I’m Viperpaw now! I just gotta share that name with everyone else my age! she rolled her eyes as her claws slid out of their sheaths, her tufted ears flattening against her skull as she tensed up for a moment. If she had a long tail, it’d be lashing around like a whip right about now. Instead, her bob tail looked like it was wagging like a little dog’s. This apprentice was clearly a bit of an irritable one. Whatever, in my mind, I’m always gonna be Viper. No special titles are gonna change that, it’s not like it’s gonna last anyways. One day, I’ll leave this place and never look back! Her ultimate goal would be on her mind until the day she was given her warrior name. Then, she’d say adieu to ThunderClan, and the clans in general. If her siblings didn’t want to leave with her, then fine, she’d make it on her own. They’d be able to protect themselves by then, she couldn’t be the one to fight their own battles for them all the time! Still can’t believe they actually like it here… These cats are still strange to me, they still baffled the young molly to this day. Their lifestyles, their faith in something called StarClan that they claimed lived in the night sky in a band of stars they called Silverpelt. Could such a thing actually exist? She didn’t know, and part of her didn’t really want to know as it was where their dead warriors lived. She didn’t want to be haunted by ghost cats. Plus, they only had one territory? And they had to stay off other clans’ ones? What was the point of that? It meant less prey for them, it didn’t make sense at all! These cats sure are dumb, that’s why loners and rogues have it made! We can go wherever we want, whenever we want. Nobody is gonna stop us. @tremb
cobra 21-Jun-21 02:57 PM
His first night in the apprentice den went by fast - for once, Foxpaw appreciated his deafness. Viperpaw and Tigerpaw sure knew how to talk. 'At least I got a good sleep' Fox thought to himself as he ate breakfast. @Shade
Springy 🦤 21-Jun-21 03:10 PM
Marigolddust - Wrenpaw - After Ceremonies Wrenpaw’s words eased his thoughts even further; a case yet again showing that her reaction to this whole situation wasn’t as poor as his own.  He did wish he could be more excited and care-free, but as always his mind was plagued with anxiety that he was not yet aware that his new apprentice shared with him.  It was always hard, being relaxed, calm, or care-free with a mind like theirs.  But, as always he would deal with it, and try to overcome all that worry clinging so tightly to his flank, making his breaths a bit more shallow.  Part of this was through talking and listening, which did well at keeping him distracted… most times.  Angling his gaze away from Wrenpaw just for a moment, he glanced around to watch the majority of the crowd disperse and hide out in their dens, if not congratulating the new apprentices.  He kept listening, of course, and it didn’t take long for his gae to return to the small caramel furred feline.  Surprisingly, it wasn’t too hard for his cloud-tipped ears to register all that was bouncing off of them, although he couldn’t help but falter at her trailing off.       By now Marigolddust was quite used to this situation.  Although this might have been only the second time since they had truly had a conversation, it was clear that Wrenpaw was talkative, even if she found she could be annoying.  With his fears now blanketed by exhaustion and some comfort, he offered Wrenpaw a welcoming look.  ”I don’t mind the rambling all too much,” he reassured with a smile.  He prefurred being spoken to much better than speaking, and with Wrenpaw’s wordful nature it reassured that he would almost never have to carry the conversation.  ”You know where it is already?” he repeated, finding himself oddly embarrassed.  Wrenpaw was far more prepared than he was at her age.
- He could easily recall when he was convinced the elders' den was the apprentice’s den.  Fortunately Rooksnap had found him before he could do anything too humiliating. Swerving an ear as if flicking away the thoughts, Marigolddust tried to focus more on what else was said.  ”Oh, well then, our first ‘lesson’ could be how to properly set up a new nest, unless you already know that too?” he said.  Putting up a nest wasn’t too hard, and neither was replacing moss, so he expected that they could get it done and ready before all of Silverpelt made itself visible.       ”It’s always nice having friends appointed to a new rank with you,” he said with a smile.  Why did it feel like just yesterday when he and Fernpaw were appointed their mentors and given their new names?  This thought made himself feel old, although he was still decently young.  Not even twenty moons yet… oh, did he have to be a certain age to get an apprentice?  Maybe he should have asked or reminded Icestar before all of this.  Averting his thoughts away from the thought, he remembered his most recent ceremony.  The only friend he had graduated with then was his sister.  Oh, how he wished Fernpaw could have gained a rank with him again.  Shaking the topic off of his thoughts, he directed his mind back to what Wrenpaw was saying.  ”They can be a *little scary, but I think it’ll be much easier having friends with you to keep your confidence up.”* he said, speaking truthfully.  He didn’t exactly know the feeling, but he knew many other cats did.
@tremb
Shade 21-Jun-21 03:20 PM
”Not so fast.” The amused voice came from behind Foxpaw, in the direction of the warriors den where Needlestripe strode out into the dawned camp. He, along with the other new mentors, had been excused of their patrol duties that day to introduce their fresh apprentices to the territory. It was a sleep-in for him, an early morning for his pupil on the contrary. With a quick glance around the rather empty quarry, Needlestripe realized that the other promotees must still be asleep in their nests. Needless to say he was pleased that his had been the first up and out. ”You’re not a kit anymore, remember?” he reminded the young tom gently but firmly, resting the tip of his tail on a ginger-patched white coat as he drew up beside him. He prodded the half-eaten morsel with a claw. ”Now why don’t you start by taking this to one of the elders or queens?” @cobra
tremb 21-Jun-21 07:12 PM
Wrenpaw and Viperpaw | present @prim As the cats began to make their way to their dens after the excitement of the apprentice ceremony died down, Wrenpaw was still feeling too wired to even think about sleeping. She had gotten her nest arranged in the apprentices den, but she wasn’t ready to curl into it just yet. She still couldn’t believe that she was finally an apprentice, and tomorrow the next chapter of her life would truly begin. What would Marigolddust teach her first? Would the territory be everything that she had hoped for? Was the lake really as big as the other apprentices said it was? As usual, her mind was reeling. Ever since Icestar had called her name from upon the Highledge, Wrenpaw’s brain had gone into hyperdrive. So many emotions had overcome her at once, and she was still feeling the residual effects of them now. She was thrilled that Marigolddust was her mentor, even though it had been obvious how nervous the responsibility made him. She was determined to make the job as easy as possible for the warrior, and be the best apprentice she could be. Of course, that’s how every apprentice was, right? Dark amber gaze traveled around the clearing to her few clanmates that were still awake, falling upon Viperpaw. She certainly didn’t look very enthused for someone who’d just been apprenticed, and Wrenpaw wondered why. She knew that Viperpaw had been a notoriously cranky kitten, but surely the apprentice ceremony would have made her happy? Naturally, Wrenpaw was concerned and felt obligated to help the other cat, even if they weren’t friends, and began to head towards the dark furred molly. Her tone was as cheerful and sweet as usual as she greeted her den mate. ”Hey, Viperpaw! Mind if I join you?” She asked, standing a tail length or so away from the other she-cat. She wanted to ask what was wrong, but she knew it wasn’t polite to stick her nose into other cats business. She could only hope that maybe Viperpaw
could confide in her, and that she could find a way to help. The familiar anxious feeling began to creep into Wrenpaw’s chest as she studied the other cats expression, feeling like maybe she was unwanted company. Of course it wasn’t her intention to bother Viperpaw, but she felt as if her presence wasn’t exactly what the other wanted. As much as Wrenpaw wanted to be friends with everyone, she wasn’t so sure if this friendship would be easily made.
prim 21-Jun-21 09:36 PM
{Viperpaw} | Wrenpaw | present
Unlike Wrenpaw, her mind wasn’t buzzing with thoughts about what Cinderblaze was going to teach her in their training sessions. She didn’t exactly care, she’d follow along, if only to just learn the essentials and then take them with her when she began her life as a rogue. Might as well take advantage of the “kindness” the clan was showing her in the meantime. It’ll help her for sure when she was out there, living her own life, bound by no code. No need to get all sentimental and befriend anyone either, it’d just complicate her plans. Even if it stung that her siblings seemed more and more attached to this place every single day, she would resist. She knew who she was, they wouldn’t take that from her, she was sure of it! Still… I was hoping they’d want to come with me. They like it here, they actually call both the scarred cat and the dark-furred cat mother… a small sigh escaped her lips as she relaxed her tensed up form, if she kept frowning like this, she’d develop tons of wrinkles prematurely. She didn’t need to age fifty moons before she even earned her warrior’s name. My warrior’s name? No no, it won’t even matter! No! She let out a loud groan as she swiped at the ground in frustration, leaving a small gash in the ground where she’d kicked up dust in it’s wake. In all her brooding, she’d nearly missed the greeting coming from the cat behind her. The black-tortoiseshell molly craned her neck and scrunched up her nose at the cat who’d approached her. Wrenpaw, one of the cats she’d been promoted with, just who even was she? Viperpaw tended to avoid the others like the plague, unless they were her siblings, so she didn’t know her very well at all. ”What do you want, Wrenpaw?” she huffed, her fur still slightly bristling from her fit of frustration. It appeared she’d attracted an audience, one that was not welcome. ”I’m kinda in the middle of something, do you mind?” she clenched her teeth as she waved her away with her paw, immediately being dismissive. She was a tough nut to crack, it’d take a lot to try and melt her icy exterior. She’d walled herself off long ago. @tremb
tremb 22-Jun-21 11:27 AM
Wrenpaw and Marigolddust | after ceremony @Springy 🦤 The young apprentice felt relieved when he said her rambling hadn’t bothered him, and he seemed to mean it too. She only hoped that with how much time they’d be spending together from here on out that those feelings wouldn’t change. Although, Wrenpaw was sure that she would get better at the whole talking thing. And perhaps as she continued to grow and mature, she would be less overly excitable, too. Just maybe. She knew that eventually, bouncing around and fidgeting wouldn’t be appropriate for her age anymore. Sure, Marigolddust didn’t mind now, but she was still just a kitten - an apprentice for mere minutes. What if they were practicing hunting, and she got so excited over the sight of prey that she scared it off? Or, what if she rambled on so loudly or for so long about something that she scared all the prey in the forest off? What if she did that while on a patrol? How embarrassing that would be for Marigolddust. No way, she could never allow herself to embarrass him. She would just have to try to be better, calmer. Forcing her over thinking brain to slow down, Wrenpaw took a deep breath and waited for whatever else her new mentor would have to say to her. Her troubled thoughts seemed to fly away like a bird when he mentioned setting up a nest, and a smile returned to her face. ”Nope! I don’t know how to do that. It’s a good thing I learn now, too, because soon I’ll be changing the nests in the elders den and I’ll want to know how to do it right. I’ve heard that they can be really cranky if you don’t do it right,” she said sincerely. Wrenpaw was excited to start serving her clan. As a kitten she spent a lot of time playing, as most kits did, but she also spent a lot of time observing. She knew a lot of what was expected from the apprentices, and she was ready to take on those tasks for herself. It was hard for her not to think of everything that she had to learn
at once, but she had to stop overwhelming herself like that. Right now, she could just focus on learning how to set up a nest in her new den. Everything else would come later, and she could focus on them as they came. ”I know we need moss!” That much was obvious. She pondered his words, still feeling worried about sharing a den with so many new faces. It wasn’t so much the apprentices her age that made her nervous, but the older ones. Would they make fun of her? She wasn’t so fond of the idea of training in front of them. She supposed she would have to get used to that, though. Besides, she wasn’t the only new apprentice. And Marigolddust was right, she did have friends with her, and she would probably make more. ”You’re right. It’s nice to have some of my friends from the nursery in the apprentices den with me.” Wrenpaw agreed. She gave a soft giggle, tail sweeping back and forth. ”So, how bout that nest?”
peri™ 23-Jun-21 03:15 PM
The once-grey skies of dawn had, as time went on, slowly began to morph into a brighter and bluer atmosphere. The sun was starting to creep out from behind the horizon, her rays already shedding light onto the once-bleak camp. It was lovely, she thought, how mere hours can bring about such change. One thing had always remained a constant, however: her inability to sleep. Whenever she was left alone for a period of time, that’s all she would dwell on. She couldn’t help it! What else was she supposed to think about besides the shadow monsters that had haunted her in her sleep? There was one time, though, that they had even followed her into her waking hours. She saw them out of the corner of her peripheral every single time and it was beyond terrifying. They weren’t just one off things, no, they were terrifyingly consistent and they wouldn’t stop even if she asked them politely to. All they would do was laugh in her face and call it a day. What would you do if that happened to you? That thought lingered helplessly in her mind. Why did it happen to her? She was sure any cat from any distance away could notice the tiredness that hung from her eyelids that threatened to tear them down. StarClan, at this point, it was probably harder not to notice. She had gotten a multitude of comments on it - more than she had quite bargained for, to say the least, and every single time it was the same answer: ‘I didn’t sleep well last night.’ She wouldn’t tell anyone the real reason why, of course, for fear that they would only brush it off and laugh at her. She stationed herself outside of the warrior’s den, her blue/red eyes closed the slightest bit. Not asleep, no, but simply resting for the time being. blurryowl & laurelblaze | the twilight zone @prim
prim 23-Jun-21 11:54 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Blurryowl | present
She was well-acquainted with sleepless nights, hounded by incessant nightmares that plagued her subconscious. While she’d been having peaceful rests as of late, she always wondered whether it’d suddenly change. She’d been terrorized in her sleep before, by forces she knew well, but she’d been focusing on closing out her mind to them. It seemed to be working, as she hadn’t encountered Silentwing in the Dark Forest in some time, but perhaps that was just because the wraith wasn’t looking to toy with her then. She probably had other nefarious plans, ones that didn’t include infiltrating her dreams and trying to attack her. Laurelblaze was always in a perpetual state of fear when she laid down in her nest at night, even if she did not outwardly show it. Thankfully, because of the past few moons being rather uneventful in terms of restful nights and waking up alive, she’d been able to return to some sense of normalcy. Getting up early to conduct her business as deputy of ThunderClan, trying to assist her clanmates in any way she could. She adored them all, and they brought solace to her. Serving these cats was the greatest honor bestowed upon her, even when she was just promoted to a mere warrior. She always loved her clan, and the fulfillment at seeing all her hard work pay off. Even if it wasn’t fully appreciated by some, she still kept at it. Hence why she was up so early, practically at the crack of dawn. What she hadn’t expected to see was another face, typically her clanmates tended to sleep in at least a little while longer before getting up. Was this another eager soul seeking to get started with the day? Or was it mere restlessness? She’d find out soon enough, it was easy to tell whether someone was tired or not by mere looks. ”Blurryowl?” she’d approached her clanmate with a gentle greeting, inspecting her for a moment. By the way the young warrior was struggling to keep her eyes open even for a moment already gave the deputy her answer, was she just not a morning person though? ”Are you alright? Do you need anything?” sure, there really wasn’t much to cure a case of drowsiness aside from dunking someone’s head into a pool of ice-cold water for them, but since it was greenleaf, they were fresh out of luck there. @peri™

Springy 🦤 27-Jun-21 10:55 AM
Marigolddust • Wrenpaw • After Ceremonies Marigolddust felt content with not minding Wrenpaw's enjoyment in conversating. It kept a conversation afloat, especially for a warrior like Marigolddust, who, for one, was very bad at speaking. She was a good cat, anyhow, and was caring. That was more than could be said for apprentices like Truthpaw. It was a relief that he ended up with such a friendly apprentice over a more rude or snappy one, although it only elevated the anxiety he had about ruining her life with poor teachings. Not only would that be bad, but he would disgrace Icestar and Skycloud if he did terribly. Taking in a deep breath and exhaling, he tried to relax himself and his mind alike. He was supposed to be calm, and how could he mess up today, anyways? All they would have to do was set up a new nest for Wrenpaw. Perhaps the placement of the nest would be something that he should worry about, although he knew how he could fix that. As long as nobody else had taken it, he felt that it might be alright to put Wrenpaw's nest where he once had his, and where Rooksnap had her's before him. That seemed like a decent place, right? As long as Wrenpaw agreed with it they might do it, although he hoped Rooksnap wouldn't mind at all. The last thing he wanted was to push her recently thin patience. Listening intently to what Wrenpaw said, he could help but shiver at the mention of the elders. Elders like Lilacdew were the nice ones who would share a story to kits at any given time, but she had joined Starclan, leaving the clan with two elders total, and he knew one of them. Batears wasn't a cat he felt excited to meet again. The large-eared, raven colored elder was the most cranky creature he had ever laid eyes on. Hopefully he wouldn't give Wrenpaw too much trouble.
- "That's true; some of them aren't the most patient, although they'll deal. You'll be an expert by the time you help them with their nests, anyways." He said with a smile. "We *do need moss,"* he agreed, pausing for a moment to try and decide how they should approach the project. Skycloud had gone out into the territory to gather moss herself while Marigolddust, or Marigoldpaw cat the time, stayed behind and waited. But he had been, and might still be, scared of the outside world. Unlike he had been, Wrenpaw seemed excited to explore the forest. Your right.. Well, that was a good start, even if it was only because of such a small statement. All he had to do was prevent doing the opposite and messing up. No pressure, though- surely he could figure it out? Dragging his mind away from the distracting topic, he focused again on the topic of Wrenpaw's nest. "We just need to collect some moss from the territory and bring it back here. Or just I can, if you don't want to," he said, not wanting to make Wrenpaw think she'd have to come along with him, although he would prefer it. There were many dangers in the forest any time of the day, but at such a late hour he felt it would be even more dangerous. He had to hold back a gulp as he waited for his new apprentice's answer.

tremb 29-Jun-21 12:02 AM
Wrenpaw and Viperpaw | present @prim What do you want, Wrenpaw? The hostility of the words and the bristling of Viperpaw’s fur sent Wrenpaw’s ears back to her skull, and her tail drooped behind her. Certainly not the response she was expecting, or hoping for from the other apprentice. Though she always held some anxiety when approaching any cat, it usually went well for her. Tonight was different, however. The caramel furred molly suddenly realized that she didn’t know how to even respond to such hostility, as she had never encountered it before. ”Uh, I-I’m sorry, I just thought… I thought you looked like you could use some company,” she stammered. Her amber gaze flicked from Viperpaw to the ground and back again, finding it hard to meet the she-cats gaze for longer than a moment. She didn’t understand how anyone could be so cranky after becoming an apprentice. It was supposed to be an exciting thing, wasn’t it? As usual in any situation, Wrenpaw felt obligated to help. A smarter apprentice would have apologized for the intrusion and walked away, but not Wrenpaw. She wanted to make the other apprentice less upset somehow, even if she didn’t know how. There must be something she could do, right? ”Maybe I can help! I-I don’t want to bother you but… nobody should be so upset after their apprentice ceremony. Are you unhappy with your mentor?” As clueless as Wrenpaw could be, that seemed like the most obvious issue. Just because she had been so lucky with the mentor that she wanted didn’t mean the other apprentices would be pleased with their own. (I’m sorry this took me so long ;-; )
prim 01-Jul-21 02:45 PM
{Viperpaw} | Wrenpaw | present
A typical extension of kindness coming from a stranger, an attempt to get on her good side and become “friends”. She didn’t need to be friends with these cats, but if she were to ward off suspicion of her becoming a flight risk around the others, she needed to play along. That didn’t mean she had to be friends with just anyone, however, but Wrenpaw seemed to be the type to stay in her own lane. She respected that, but she wasn’t looking to get all amiable and buddy-buddy with her. Viperpaw didn’t know if she even had the capacity to be all cheerful and giddy like some of the others, the thought made her sick to her stomach. ”No, Cinderblaze is a fine enough mentor. I’m mostly just upset my brother had to drag me up to the Highledge and embarrass me in front of everyone. I was taking my time.” a half-truth, she wasn’t going to reveal her distaste for this clan and almost everyone within it’s walls. She was going to make Featherpaw pay later on for this transgression against her. Mark my words, he will face my wrath for that public humiliation! she inwardly cackled, and she was almost tempted to grin wickedly at the thought. She might end up weirding out Wrenpaw, though, she didn’t need to set that as her reputation amongst the other apprentices. Viperpaw was going to show them all just who she was in the short time she was going to remain here. This clan couldn’t contain her forever! ”I appreciate your offer, but nothing you can do right now can help me. Besides, do you really want to spend your time helping strangers out with impossible problems when you could be hanging out with your friends?” she flicked a tufted ear as she turned back towards the caramel-colored molly, narrowing her crystal-like gaze as she inspected her carefully. She knew this cat was somewhat liked amongst their peers, why would she select her of all cats to talk to when she was buddies with one of the leader’s sons? Even if Viperpaw was considered the deputy’s “daughter” along with being a senior warrior’s “kit”, she didn’t consider Laurelblaze and Hollyfrost her parents… Even if she did owe much of her survival to them. Her siblings seemed fond of them, so she stayed mum, but she was conflicted about how to feel about them, they were her guardians here, but she didn’t know whether to address them as her parents. @tremb
peri™ 01-Jul-21 02:46 PM
As much as she’d hate to admit it, this had always been her normal - though, the nightmares had seemed to increase in intensity as she had gotten older. When they had first come to her, they had been little things, barely anything to worry about. But now they were a huge fiasco every single time she fell asleep. There was, unfortunately, not a night she could remember where she had been graced with a pleasant dream. They were always there. Always watching her. Even now, in a somnolent state, they were there. She was awake and yet they were still there. She didn’t know why. What did they want from her? She couldn’t put a finger on it. Would they haunt her forever? Stars, she hoped not. The deputy’s voice roused her to open her eyes, a smile crossing over her lips as she saw who was approaching her. The two of them had talked once before, she knew, and so she supposed a little more interaction wouldn’t hurt. Besides, being on the deputy’s good side is always a good idea, isn’t it? Of course. Shaking the languor from her gaze and also from the cobwebs of her mind, she took a moment to think over Laurelblaze’s question. Was she alright? Well, in a way, yes, she was - the feeling of being alright was in itself a natural state of existence. Now onto the other question: did she need anything? That question was a little bit more on the complex side - how in the world could she say that she didn’t want to be haunted by nightmares anymore? That was a little bit outlandish. And also probably crazy if she said it to just anyone. ”Oh, Laurelblaze,” her voice was soft and as smooth as it always had been, a pleasant thing. ”I. . . am about as alright as one can expect, you know,” she raised a paw to gesture to her face and just how tired she looked. ”But, of course, the same could be asked of you. How are you doing? How have things been? I would hope everything has been good since we’ve last spoke,” a smile broke along the crease of her lips as she blinked slowly. blurryowl & laurelblaze | the twilight zone @prim (sorry for the wait lmao) (edited)
prim 01-Jul-21 03:11 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Blurryowl | present
It seemed her clanmate was also acutely aware of her exhausted state, something that made the deputy feel a shred of pity for her. Sleep was a gift to them all, they all deserved to rest properly and wake up feeling refreshed and ready to take on the next day’s challenges. ”I’m doing well, I’m used to getting up at these hours and getting to work,” truly, the tortoiseshell felt well-rested and energized, though she never had a low supply of that precious commodity. The deputy could take on the world and grapple with it to no end if she could, even she was bound to need rest here and there. ”I have to ask, are you feeling all right? Should I go get Fernpaw to check you out or get you some herbs? You look as if you rose from the dead, no offense.” she frowned lightly as she inspected the tired femora’s features yet again. It was her job to ensure her clanmates were fit for duty, she couldn’t send exhausted warriors out into the forest and risk their lives. Going out into the forest while running on little to no sleep was dangerous, it meant her senses would be limited and her attention might drift to other places. It was risky, and left them vulnerable to ambush. Then, a disturbing thought came to mind. Was Blurryowl being terrorized by enemies in the Dark Forest by any chance? Could that have been the reason for her sleeping problems? ”Are you having trouble sleeping by any chance? Dreams of a forest enshrouded in shadow? Did you see anyone in it if you have?” she had to ask, because if a Dark Forest warrior was going around and tormenting her clanmates, that was an issue. She needed to make sure they were all safe and protected. @peri™
tremb 07-Jul-21 10:00 AM
The young molly nodded as Viperpaw explained her reasons for being so upset. Granted, Wrenpaw had no understanding what it was like to be embarrassed by a sibling because she didn’t have any, but that didn’t mean she couldn’t try. ”Well, he probably shouldn’t have done that. Everyone has probably forgotten about it by now, anyways. I didn’t even notice, if that helps. Then again, I don’t notice a lot of things,” she added with a light chuckle. It seemed to Wrenpaw that Viperpaw wasn’t happy to become an apprentice at all. She found it hard to believe that the actions of her brother had ruined the whole night for her, and assumed that there was something deeper. However, that was none of her business. And frankly, she was too scared to ask. Viperpaw intimidated her, and she certainly wasn’t about to push any boundaries. Maybe Viperpaw was right. Perhaps there was nothing that Wrenpaw could do to help, but it wouldn’t stop her from trying. She had a pretty good track record for helping other cats with things. Friends are supposed to help each other, right? Although she and Viperpaw weren’t friends, they were still clanmates and Wrenpaw would always help her fellow clanmates. Who knew, maybe one day the two she-cats would be friends. Amber eyes flicked over to the other apprentices across the clearing, all smiling and chatting amongst themselves. She shrugged, returning her gave to Viperpaw. ”Yes, I’d rather help you, or try to I guess. They’re having fun without me, they don’t need me. I-I mean you don’t need me either, I just mean you seemed like you could use some company more than them right now.” Wrenpaw tried not to visibly wince at her own words, genuinely nervous that she’d said the wrong thing. She didn’t want to make Viperpaw feel like some sort of basket case. ”We get to see the tenure territory tomorrow, and the borders with the other clans. That’s something to look forward to, hm?” She asked, changing the subject. @prim
prim 08-Jul-21 07:54 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Kindlepaw | present
It had rained overnight, as indicated by the telltale scent of fresh rain against the soil. Patches of green grass that grew in select areas of camp drooped lower with condensed drops of water clinging to their blades as if it were the dew of early leaf-fall. The rainclouds had mostly moved on from this place, but the deputy could make out a few silvery-toned remnants that had not caught up with the rest of the pack. She didn’t hear thunder last night, much to her chagrin, it was just a rainy night. Laurelblaze always looked forward to watching lightning flashes at night, wondering where they were going to strike next from the relative safety of her nest in the warrior’s den. Now, it was all mucky and wet outside, and the evaporating water vapor felt as if it was clinging to her pelt as she stepped out into the sun. One aftereffect she loathed about the storms, the humidity. Letting out a small sigh, the gargantuan she-cat glanced towards the camp entrance. She’d done her rounds and inspected nests, ensuring everyone was accounted for during the night. Now it was practically midday, and here she was in camp. How dreadfully boring, she should have joined the morning hunting patrols. Maybe tomorrow, or I’ll send out another past sun-high… she often compromised with herself, putting off doing one thing for another, yet today she was just stuck in camp, awaiting her patrols to return or for her apprentices to actually get out of their nests. StarClan forbid she have pupils that were morning people for once. The deputy hated idling. @wild™
wild™ 08-Jul-21 08:41 PM
- ───────── 𝐊𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐋𝐄𝐏𝐀𝐖 !! // APPRENTICE OF THUNDERCLAN
Amber eyes peered into the clearing from the camp's entrance, flickering about for a few moments as they thoroughly searched the area. Whiskers quivering, the tortoiseshell hobbled into the camp, a bird clamped between her jaws as she awkwardly made her way toward the fresh-kill pile. The occasional slop was heard whenever her paws hit a rather muddy area, which was highly unpleasant to the tortoiseshell. Unfortunately, due to her being a tad short, she wasn't exactly able to see where she needed to step to avoid them, she wouldn't want to seem troubled anyway. Traveling more by scent than sight, the apprentice eventually found the fresh-kill pile, dropping her prey upon it with an audible breath. Shaking off her paws a bit, the apprentice turned to gaze over her fellow clanmates for a moment, most of which were already busy with other things. Glancing skyward, she noticed the time. Stars, she'd been gone for quite awhile. Or perhaps not, the morning patrols hadn't even returned yet. If only she'd caught them in time, surely she'd have something to do other than her current activity, which was to be bored out of her mind. Letting her gaze roam the area, she spotted a familiar figure among the various felines. The deputy! Perfect, she'd probably love to hear about what she'd done, she'd been such a good clanmate today, others had to be proud of her. Striding over to her, the small molly held her head high, tapping on the larger feline's leg with a paw. "Greetings, deputy! I'm happy to report I've brought back a really big bird for the clan this morning! I hope such pleases you." She said to her proudly, tail swaying. Truth be told, it wasn't big, only big for her. "Is there anything else you'd like me to handle, deputy?" She inquired after a moment, putting on her most serious expression. @prim
prim 08-Jul-21 09:25 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Kindlepaw | present
She made it a habit to get to know her clanmates on at least a first-name basis if she hadn't really spoken with them aside from the occasional organization of patrols or routine head-counts of hers. The apprentice who'd approached her was none other than Kindlepaw, not one of her own apprentices, nor a distant relative of her family... She thought so anyways. There were so many cats she was related to through adoption and blood in this clan that it made it a serious challenge for her to keep up with it all. Though the deputy was positive this cat was just a clanmate, it wasn't like her father could keep adopting kits from beyond the grave. If he was, she'd have to give him some credit, he was a dedicated and doting parent. He probably would try to do that if it were possible. She glanced downwards to the younger tortoiseshell and gave her a small smile, slightly lopsided and goofy looking with her minor underbite that left one of her lower canines poking out from her lip. This apprentice was addressing her as "deputy" rather than her name like everyone else normally would. Why she was being so formal about it was odd, and she would think they would at least call her "deputy Laurelblaze", but that even seemed like a mouthful. "Hey Kindlepaw." she greeted the young molly with a sway of her tail, before her heterochromatic gaze drifted towards the large bird she'd caught earlier. "Nice catch, at this rate I'm sure you'll ace that portion of your warrior's assessment, granted if your mentor even includes it in it." she complimented the haul with nothing but pure integrity, she would not undermine an apprentice's accomplishments to their face, or ever. Laurelblaze was not cruel the youth of her clan, they very much made her proud to serve them. "Not at this moment, no, perhaps later on though... But uh... Why do you keep addressing me as deputy? Why not my name?" she had to address this minor elephant in the room. While she appreciated the fact the apprentice was showing her respect for her rank, but there came a time where it felt as if she was addressing her like she was some untouchable, divine being whose name you could never speak of or something. It felt off-putting for some reason. I hope it isn't like this when I'm leader... StarClan forbid, make some of them insubordinate but not too much! @wild™
wild™ 10-Jul-21 12:07 AM
- ───────── 𝐊𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐋𝐄𝐏𝐀𝐖 !! // APPRENTICE OF THUNDERCLAN
Despite her impressive size and scars, Thunderclan's deputy hardly seemed very intimidating among her clanmates, at least, that's how Kindlepaw saw it. She couldn't imagine a clan having a deputy that scared their own clanmates, how would anything get done if such was the case? Or maybe I'm just different. I'm not afraid of anything anyway, I'd make a great deputy myself one day. She thought to herself, glancing toward the perch where Icestar would normally be positioned when addressing the clan for important matters. That would be Laurelblaze one day. Maybe even herself, but that would be generations from now. Way too much to think about. She'd leave the deputy stuff to Thunderclan's current deputy for now. She grinned at the larger feline's reply, glad to be assured she'd done quite well. "Thank you!" She replied with a dip of her head, whiskers quivering slightly. Ah yes, that would be something she could handle. Her warrior assessment. And warriorhood. Of course, it would be a couple of more moons before that happened, but she was practically a warrior already, leaving early to hunt and even return with prey! Most of the time anyway. If she didn't sleep in some days. Even so, she was already proving herself to be a reliable clanmate no doubt! Unfortunately, Laurelblaze had no tasks for her to take on, much to her disappointment. At the deputy's inquiry, the tortoiseshell looked surprised, amber eyes blinking. "Isn't that how others normally address you? You don't go by your rank? That doesn't seem very cool of you." She replied, wrinkling her nose at the idea. If she was deputy, she wouldn't want to be addressed as Kindlewhatever, but 'deputy.' It had such a nice ring to it after all. "Is that a problem? You don't like being formally addressed? Why not?" She asked. Perhaps there was a reason behind it. @prim
Shade 10-Jul-21 12:46 PM
Family fight Things hadn't been the same in ThunderClan lately. Everyone could tell that Rooksnap wasn't her usual self. She'd been distant and moody for moons, and worst of all it affected her many adopted kits. The group of them huddled together sharing fresh kill and tongues in the dying light of greenleaf sunset, but their stout chocolate nanny lay off to the side, hunching over a hardly tasted mouse alone. Turned away, it was hard to discern her expression, but easy to guess. She could feel their concerned glances every once in a while. They hadn't bothered her though, not for a long time. Until now. @Springy 🦤 @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ (edited)
cake 10-Jul-21 01:07 PM
marbledpaw | @Springy 🦤 @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @Shade @spark's clone™ While she had never been quite the same after Kestrelpaw's leave, the chocolate femme seemed to be back to herself, more or so. Soft beige paws lay slanted on the floor, her body following it as teeth were gnawing on a squirrel. Violet eyes set steadily ahead like there wasn't some looming shadow behind her, she forced herself to have a good time, even offering the slightest of smile at a jest made her way. Until finally, she turned back, lip curling briefly - however she tried to convince herself that she could do just well without Rooksnap, part of her missed when she was a kit and they had all the fun in the world. "You think she's alright?" the inquiry was left out in the open, quiet as if trying to ponder with herself but loud enough for everyone in the surrounding proximity to hear her.
Springy 🦤 10-Jul-21 01:17 PM
Marigolddust - Family Fight Marigolddust wasn't all too used to small gatherings like this one, even though he had gone through something very similar as an apprentice. The only difference was that the first picnic had Rooksnap there, as she had been the one who started it, and now she was one of the only ones absent. This realization stuck to the tux's mind the whole time he sat there with the others in the group, eating his small sparrow. More than just a little bit of words had managed to be formed on his tongue, as the tom was too sucked up into thought and anxiety over the whole matter. He kept his gaze away from her, hoping that she wouldn't notice too much of his attention, but couldn't help but fiddle with his paws as he ate. Some relief washed over him as Marbledpaw voiced her concern for Rooksnap, although it also made him tense some. Had everybody noticed? Had others been looking? Was it too clear that they were thinking, talking, and pondering over the deep brown munchkin stationed away from them? He remembered when he was a kit, and apprentice, before Beetlestreak died, and how much he loved hanging out with Rooksnap and Fernpaw. Rooksnap had even been more of a mother to him than his own mother, but now it seemed that actions were being repeated. Distant, neglective, and mysterious... all caused by a single cat's death. It sounded exactly like what happened to his mother, and now it was too late to try and fix the blue tortoiseshell's mistakes for her. But that wouldn't happen to Rooksnap, would it? No, she would get over it and get better, and then things could go back to what it used to be. he would never let it happen, either. Every fur on his flank wanted to go over and try and convince her to join them. It couldn't be that hard, could it?
- Biting his lip for just a moment as he pondered over what he should do, his tail flinched from one side to the other before he looked back to Marbledpaw. "I... I'm not sure... should I go over and check on her? Maybe she'll join us?" he suggested, wanting eagerly for Rooksnap to go back to as she was when he was a kit. He missed that Rooksnap, and wanted to see her again as soon as possible.
@Shade @spark's clone™ @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™
-Jayfang- 10-Jul-21 01:22 PM
Jayfang, returning from his standard routine of going on a single cat patrol in the afternoon, payed no mind to Rooksnap. Though she was his friend, he didn't exactly like to approach others, and would much rather continue on his routine. So, if she didn't come to him, he wasn't going to come to her. Either way, he noticed how.. distant she looked. Isolated away from the rest of the clan. He didn't feel like disturbing her if she didn't want to be. He turned towards the fresh-kill pile and snatched a shrew. A small break could be taken before he went back out, surely. Jayfang walked towards a section of camp with no other cats, but as he walked by, he overheard Marigolddust. "I wouldn't give it a shot," he cut in, forgetting he wasn't intended to be a part of the conversation. "She seems like she wants to be alone." (I don't know who to ping)

Blaze
The young tom huffed as he looked towards Rooksnap, his ear twitching as he swallowed down his bite, he had still been bitter over his and his sibling's abandonment. "She's probably fine." He said, rushing his tongue along his jaws as he watched the others, despite his words concern gleamed in his gaze. He was at apprentice age, but...he hadn't committed to the clan, really only tolerated thanks to Rooksnap's behavior.

spark's clone™ 10-Jul-21 01:31 PM

She gets distanced.” The black and white molly was gingerly cleaning her paws after finishing her own meal, but she faltered to look up at Rooksnap with an unreadable gaze. Was it happening again? Adults just start getting distant.. When Marigolddust spoke though, there was a bit of a worked gaze that tended to show when none of the others were looking. cake 10-Jul-21 01:36 PM
marbledpaw | @spark's clone™ @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @-Jayfang- @Springy 🦤 @Shade She stared at Rooksnap for several seconds longer before nodding along with the comment from the other apprentice. At Marigolddust's statement, though, her fur fluffed up,, "No." While the others voiced their concerns and dissent, hers was a demand, ringing clear with soft dislike in her voice; to her, it was up to the brown molly to fix things, not the other way around. It wasn't really that Rooksnap had missed her ceremony and never even apologized for it, though she was still a little upset from that - it was how she talked about Kestrelpaw's leaving with the bitterness in her voice, and the calico grew naturally defensive. Kes was her sister, and she did whatever she wanted to, and never because some warrior didn't like it. She hadn't talked with her nanny several moons now - and intended to keep it that way. She was concerned, yes, but not enough to subject herself to whatever the other was feeling. "You can go talk to her. Don't involve me, though," a tuck of her paws tightly to her flank, staring upwards challengingly even though it was herself that suggested if she was alright in the first place.
Springy 🦤 10-Jul-21 01:56 PM
Marigolddust Hearing the comments of the others, including a passing-by Jayfang, didn't give Margolddust much courage. None of them seemed to think it wasn't a good idea to go over and try to talk to the molly, but he felt inclined to. She was always there to invite him to have a bite before, anyhow, so why shouldn't he do the same for her? Maybe it would make her feel better, and help her progress through whatever she was going through a bit easier. What would the others think, though? They all advised against it, but he could see the concern displayed on some of their features. He thought again over what Jayfang had said. She seems like she wants to be alone. Perhaps he should just leave her be. He didn't want to be a bother, anyways. But... it was challenging keeping himself from approaching the older warrior and trying to give her some comfort that she may or may not need. In the end, he decided to just listen to one statement, even if that statement wasn't directing him to do anything. So, he wouldn't involve Marbledpaw. That should be easy, right? He just had to invite Rooksnap over, have Rooksnap sit farther away from the marble-pelted apprentice, and it would all go smoothly. It seemed like it was best for all of them if he invited the nanny over to eat, and nothing much seemed to be at risk. It was just an offer, and besides Jayfang he was the only warrior here. It seemed like it might have been under the many jobs a warrior had, taking charge and trying to help others who could be in need. Unless she's not in need, he reminded himself. But, even with the reminder, he nodded to Marbledpaw and stood, carefully padding up to Rooksnap. (edited)
- A small smile crossed the ashy warrior's muzzle as he came up to Rooksnap. "Hey, Rooksnap, I was... uh, wondering if you'd like to come over and join us? We could always use some more cats to talk to," he offered, clawing softly at the loos soil underfoot in an attempt to fight off the anxiety that was slowly rising inside his chest. What if she said no? What if she got upset? What if it was a mistake coming over here and inquiring that she could come over? Stepping firmly on his own tail, he brought himself back to focus. All he had to do was wait for an answer, and either bring her over or go back without her. That was a good plan, wasn't it? Oh, he sure hoped so.
@Shade @spark's clone™ @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @-Jayfang-
-Jayfang- 10-Jul-21 02:14 PM
Noticing how no one had objected to his comment, he assumed it would alright to remain. Jayfang settled on the ground, slightly further away than the rest of them, but close enough to seem part of the group. It was too late to get him to leave now. He took a bite of the shrew as Marigolddust seemed to be lost in thought, saying nothing as he looked at the rest of the group. Then Marigolddust seemed to make a decision, and stood up. He watched as the other warrior walked over towards Rooksnap. "Wow. He's actually going over there," Jayfang remarked. Despite being basically an outsider, as he didn't know most of the cats here very well, he felt comfortable enough to talk. "Even though we all said he shouldn't." Shade 10-Jul-21 06:45 PM
Family fight It was sad, the way she'd dissociated so drastically. Her kits depended on her. She was so young to be acting like a grumpy old badger. Rooksnap lived up to her name, sure, but the motherly talent she had was undeniable. In her time as a warrior she'd created her own mismatched family of sorts. She had empathy for them as an orphan herself. A quilt of misfits brought together under one wing. But what happened when that wing faltered? Beetlestreak's death had obviously perturbed her, and Shallow's had shaken her up, not to mention Kestrelpaw's leave. Perhaps she had grown up too fast. A shadow spliced the orange light, rendering Rooksnap's warm chocolate fluff a darker, more sinister henna. Then a voice drifted down to her, inviting and gentle. She didn't look up, nor behind her at the group. She knew who it was. "Go away, Marigolddust." She avoided the question with a firm but weary reply. A fly landed on her mouse, then took off again. She didn't even bother to bat it away. @Springy 🦤 @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang-
Springy 🦤 10-Jul-21 08:27 PM
Marigolddust Hope had a way of convincing cats to do things without imagining the possible consequences that didn't satisfy it, and this was exactly what Marigolddust was experiencing. He had more hope now than he has for awhile, and what better opportunity was there to fix things, even if just a little? Plus, it was good to be polite. Go away? Truthfully, the response was expected. Hesitating, he tried to come up with how he would approach the firm request. She just wanted to be left alone, and that was clear. A-alright, I'll see you later, then?" He said, waiting patiently for a reply. As he waited, he took the time to look around, perhaps to distract himself from thinking too far ahead. The sky had a grey pelt on today, with a thick blanket of clouds blocking out the majority of the sunlight, although there were still a few breaks in the cliuds where the sun's light leaked through. A weak breeze caused the branches of the trees surrounding the camp to brush against one another, creating a whole song of its own. The day was decently cool, and was a nice break from the heat of the new greenleaf season.
- Perhaps it was a mistake coming over and inviting Rooksnap to eat with him and the others that she had taken under her wing. This thought resulted in him pausing, second guessing himself. She had taken them under her wing. Would it really be more enjoyable being alone than with cats you considered family? From experience, Marigolddust felt this was false. Raising a moon-lit paw, he moved to swat the fly off of Rooksnap's food until it flew off itself. "We wouldn't mind your company at all-" other than maybe Marbledpaw... And the majority of the others, "-so if it would make you feel better-?" By now Marigolddust couldn't help but feel something was wrong. She sounded quite clearly upset, whether it was because of him or not, and he couldn't help but feel the need to try and assist her any way he could. Although, he knew he really should get back to his sparrow before too many flies bombarded it and made it their own meal. This would be the last attempt, he decided.

Shade 10-Jul-21 10:26 PM
I said go away… Irritation built inside her, simmering at first, soon to rise to a boil. Rooksnap’s claws curled into the soil where she lay. Just leave me alone. She cut off the younger warrior’s attempt at friendliness when she lurched to her paws, lumbering forward menacingly. It was hard not to be intimidated by her bear like paws and intense neon eyes. A shadow seemed to be permanently stuck over her eyes. ”Are you deaf?” The snap rang clearly throughout the camp, loud enough for all to hear. Marigolddust was in the spotlight now, and not a good one. She continued to go off as she walked him backwards. ”I said go away. I don’t want to see you. You’re a warrior now - grow up!” You don’t need me. Can’t a cat get some peace around here? @Springy 🦤 @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- (edited)
Springy 🦤 11-Jul-21 08:48 AM
Marigolddust Marigolddust's trail of thought was interupted right besides his spoken sentence as Rooksnap finally got to her paws. He only had a little time to take notice of how her claws had dug into the soft soil beneath her before she had stood, and the anger in her face took him by surprise. Although he had grown a bit taller than Rooksnap by now, he felt just as if he was a kitten again, being scolded heavily by a parental figure. A dark expression was displayed on the fem's face, and it did little good at making him feel any better than he did now. Stiffening, he took a step back, and before long it had started a pattern of him walking backwards away from the older warrior. He couldn't take his own bright gaze from that of Rooksnap's, and it took confidence on his part to speak. "I-im sorry, I didn't-" he began, but soon he was once again interupted by the angered feline. Grow up. That statement hadn't intruded on his mind to rouse insecurities for a few moons now, and it had been relieving. Unfortunately, the statement coming from a cat he thought he was so close to made them come back tenfold. He knew he wasn't as brave or confident as the majority of the warriors in Thunderclan, but that became only a small part of the situation. He should have left her alone the first time he was refused. Why hadn't he? Why had he been rude enough to ask again when she made it clear she wanted him gone? This all would have been fine if he had just left her as she had wanted him to. Even better, maybe. Perhaps leaving her to think about it would have convinced her to come over in itself, but of course he had to step up and ruin it. The other's were right. Of course they were, he thought. Dread and shame caused his face to turn red and tears to gather at the brim of his eyes, yet to fall but still present nonetheless. Finally, he adverted his gaze, although he continued to try to stay a tail-length away from her as he backed up.
- Nothing had his attention besides Rooksnap, her words, and the sick taste of guilt, so strong that it wouldn't allow any more words to be formed by tougue.
@Shade @cake @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™
prim 11-Jul-21 12:55 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Kindlepaw | past II
Being addressed so formally by her own clanmates was something she never truly got used to. It was true that she expected them to show her the respect they would show any other deputy, though in the past there were a few cats who believed they had the right to be insubordinate towards her based on their own personal judgements against her character. Perceived “wrongs” she made against them, intentional or not, only fueled the fire it seemed. She did not try to incite resentment from her clanmates, but like any deputy or leader before her, there would always be cats who did not agree with her decisions. She was mostly concerned with the safety of the clan as a whole. Being brave and strong wasn’t all there was to being a deputy, and while this young apprentice’s ambition was admirable… She hoped that any striving for this position take into account just how much of a burden it was to take on, and that there was no shame in not accepting it. Not everyone was destined to reign over a clan, as it was a stressful, difficult role to play. That was why the higher ranks of any clan expected at least some modicum of respect from their clanmates around them, for many did not understand just how much work they were doing to keep the clan running. ”No, not really. Even if it’s from a cat outside of ThunderClan, but even then, I just prefer someone using my full name. Some cats here actually call me Laurel.” she wasn’t a very formal and professional type around her clanmates. She saw them everyday, she had friends and family here, why shouldn’t she be on a first-name basis with them. ”I call Icestar by her name, not leader, or leader Icestar.” it was just a quick example, but it served her point. She did showcase the upmost respect for her leadership, but she liked to think she knew Icestar well enough at this point to be on friendly, casual terms with her. The lynx-point always was the type to be friendly towards her clanmates, as driven as she was. ”Even for others outside of ThunderClan, I expect them to address me by name. Not necessarily my rank, especially considering I have no jurisdiction over them.” she wasn’t exactly friends with many cats outside of ThunderClan though, she knew her counterparts from the other clans and had spoken with a few leaders during the Gatherings she’d attended, but to say she was close with anyone outside of the clan? No. Her brother was the Healer for the Fallen Claws as she’d come to learn, though. ”I do expect respect from everyone I speak to. When it comes to diplomatic discussions with others outside of ThunderClan, I try to show courtesy to them and behave as a deputy should.” It’s incredibly boring though, what I wouldn’t give to have a fun sparring match with some of the others. Now that would be insanely fun. @wild™ (edited)
cake 11-Jul-21 12:57 PM
marbledpaw | @Springy 🦤 @Shade @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @-Jayfang- @spark's clone™ We wouldn't mind your company at all. She coughed, once, twice, sharply, and it spitefully echoed across camp. Violet gaze pierced into the back of Marigolddust, and the apprentice hoped he would feel it. She was just about to pity the warrior - he would never convince her to join them, until she heard the rebuke, flinching and ears angling backwards even though she wasn't the receiver of the barbed snarl herself. "Hey!" a furious hiss and she was on her paws, storming in front of Marigolddust with her lip curled and eyes swimming with uncertainty, but there was no backing down now. "You don't get to tell him to grow up, you've barely been here for the past few moons." I shouldn't have said that. Immediately the thought crossed through in horror. "Not your fault," she muttered at Margiolddust, shoving him off to the side so he wouldn't be in direct proximity of the warrior, before turning back to stare at the two younger apprentices - Cloverpaw and Blazepaw would,, wouldn't they? "You're backing me up, aren't you?"

spark's clone™ 11-Jul-21 02:00 PM
Although Cloverpaw was the last of the younger kits to storm over, fury still filled her gaze. She watched Blaze go off on their nanny with such pure anger, but Clover’s reaction was a little more tamed.. well, that was only if she wasn’t considering murder in the back of her mind. The scrawny she’s green grass gaze landed on Marigolddust as she stood beside him, tail lashing in the air. She was one to take fights more coolly than the average apprentice - but that wasn’t saying she wasn’t absolutely livid towards Rooksnap. The black and white femme took one deep breath and looked the muddied she-cat straight in the eye. “What crawled in your nest?” she said in a note collected tone, swallowing hard. “We’re your stupid family and you chose to take us in, and you treat us like this? Marigolddust is the best of us, you stupid ignorant mousebrain. If you want to take your anger out.. take it out on me.” Their was a venomous hiss hidden in her quiet voice. Protective, hmm.. Shade 11-Jul-21 03:51 PM
Family fight Rooksnap's stance grew more defensive as she found herself suddenly surrounded by a team of angry apprentices coming to Marigolddust's rescue. The timid gray warrior's spluttered apologies were lost in the ensuing chaos. Toxic voices piling on top one another, Rooksnap's small husky-like ears hardly discerned each insult, but she got the gist. She glanced between each kit she had raised - or half raised in some cases - but her steely expression showed no signs of softness or overwhelming. They'd gotten their fierceness from her, and Rooksnap was as stubborn as they came. Her face hardened with competition. "Remember who you're talking to," she snarled, hiss dripping with poison, eyeing Blaze in particular in that moment, reclaiming her authority. The arch of her back grew more extreme. She held her ground, bushed tail lashing slowly but with force, unaware of her good friend Jayfang watching her ugliness come through. Her paralyzing sun-and-moon gaze swept the crowd of kits again. "What do you know about growing up?" The unrelenting swiftness with which her childhood had been robbed of her flashed in her mind. "At least you have someone, so don't act so special. If it weren't for me, you'd be dead by now - I'd keep my mouth shut." Her cents on Blaze and Cloverpaw cast, she redirected her fire onto Marbledpaw, who stood at the front of the group, shielding her adoptive older brother from the infernal nanny. Mismatched eyes locked with violet ones. "You." Rooksnap lifted her broad chin to look just slightly down upon the apprentice. "I had more faith in you. Out of all your littermates, you're still here. I thought I raised you better, to show respect. What would Hazelhues think?" @Springy 🦤 @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- (edited)
cake 11-Jul-21 04:33 PM
marbledpaw | @Shade @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @Springy 🦤 As Cloverpaw and Blazepaw took their rounds in throwing more than harsh comments her way, she found her tail gently curling around the warrior, assuring he would be alright. Her mouth opened for a snarky retort when the flaming eyes of her nanny settled on her, and... oh, she didn't. There was a time where she looked up to Rooksnap like she was some angel in the Dark Forest- after her mother left she was really the only cat she really relied on. The calico could remember trying to seek out her approval and attention desperately- and maybe even now, she did. Marbledpaw's ears flattened to the bottom of her skull at the words that pierced itself in flawlessly, lip trembling, lavenders trying desperately to look away but feeling the stare on the back of her head nonetheless, paws frozen still on the ground. Did she really.. disappoint her that much? "You have no right to bring up my mom!" A snarl, tear-streaked and shoulders now trembling as she shouldered herself forwards to stare straight at Rooksnap. With a shaking breath she calmed herself down, looked her square in the eyes. "She would be proud of me, for standing up for someone who's finally lost herself to her delusions," she spit out the words, forcefully taking a step forward so now they were nose-to-nose. "Doesn't it feel so good, to step on someone who just wants you to feel better? Berating everyone who cares about you is absolutely brilliant, too. Genius." Marbledpaw had grown, what awkwardness in her unusually tall build having finally vanished into lean muscle; she was surprisingly satisfied at how they were now nearly the same height. Yet there was now an edge of doubt against her stark-hard words, now, tail lashing anxiously. Mother and her were friends.. Would Hazelhues really be proud? (edited)
Springy 🦤 11-Jul-21 05:10 PM
Marigolddust Suddenly, his unbroken attention on Rooksnap was... Well, broken. The multicolored fur of Marbledpaw caught his eyes, and before long he realized that the others in the group had gathered around him. At first he felt relieved at the fact that he no longer had to deal with the wrath of Rooksnap, but this didn't last long as he realized it hadn't ended the conflict, and instead did quite the opposite. Before he could truly take in everything that was happening, he was pushed off to the side. Both of Marigolddust's ears swerved back as he took in the argument, going from the catalyst to the audience. Confusion stirred in his chest, although he got some clarity from Marbledpaw's words of reassurance. Giving her a bit of a weak smile, he looked back towards Rooksnap in time to hear her toxic words to the rest of the adoptees. Why the others had defended him so quickly, he wasn't sure, but it was comforting; until he realized that everyone was involved now. Stronger than harsh words entered his ears and angry faces obsorbed all of his attention. Relief and resentment mixed, overwhelming him as he stood mainly in the background and observed it all. As Rooksnap and Marbledpaw were face-to-face, sharing words Marigolddust would have rather they kept to themselves, he tried to think up of some how to bring an end to this whole ordeal that he had started. Hazelhues? The warrior's ears perked at the sound of the name. She was Cloverpaw's mother, wasn't she? Now family's being insulted, he thought, dread crawling up his spine. "M-maybe we should relax a little? I-I'm fine," he spoke up, although he doubted his voice could be heard over the aggressive words coming from both she-cats. When he received little to no response, he stepped back again. Why had he invited Rooksnap in the first place? Marbledpaw even asked him not to drag her in and here she was, more involved than he was.
- Maybe he could get Cloverpaw and Blazepaw out of this before they got thrown too deep, too? No, he doubted he could succeed, even if he did try. So, instead he just stood back, speachlessly taking the spot of a bystander, even if he would rather be cooling everyone off. All he could do at the moment is keep his eyes from watering any more than they were and hope nothing got any worse... Although perhaps if it did he would be a bit more... Useful.
@Shade @cake @spark's clone™ @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @-Jayfang-
Shade 11-Jul-21 05:56 PM
Family fight Rooksnap didn't flinch a single hair as Marbledpaw shoved up to her. She could see the insecurity in her violet eyes, see right through her. The fierce façade she wore over a storm of desperation and hurt was no match for the munchkin's astuteness. "Is that what you really think? Where did standing up get her, hm? Exiled. That's where it got her. Hazelhues had to leave you because she couldn't stop running her mouth. I suppose the apple doesn't fall far from the tree-" Where was all this coming from? She and Hazelhues had been friends. Rooksnap had been sad to see her go, travelled to the outskirts of the territory to see her even, before she was murdered. But the words kept tumbling out like spilled blades in a blur. She thought about Hazelhues's funeral, where Icestar's banishment had ultimately landed her. Dead in the ground. It had been nothing close to a proper burial for a warrior of her caliber, and a new mother nonetheless. The world is a cruel place. Time and time again, Rooksnap had found herself disappointed in the inner workings of their reality. Famine and disaster had taken her father and mentor away from her - her own mother had died because of her. Beetlestreak had destroyed Fernpaw's dream, changed the course of her future, then left her to figure it out all by herself. Cloverpaw's, Blaze's, and Shallow's parents, whoever they were, had abandoned them without a second thought. Shallow had left them too soon, Kestrelpaw had gone off all on her own... Rooksnap's trust was wavering thin, and consequentially her logic. If only she could snap out of it before- @Springy 🦤 @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- (edited)
spark's clone™ 11-Jul-21 06:12 PM
Quietly stunned as she was that Rooksnap had brought Marbledpaw’s exiled mother into the conversation, she had a surprised and almost impressed look on her face. She stood between Marigolddust and Blazepaw as still as a statue, wondering how she was gonna hold both Rooksnap and Marbledpaw back if this were to escalate. Quietly her gaze traveled to the young tuxedo warrior in an almost silent apology - maybe this had gotten too extreme. Cloverpaw did quite literally thrive in these circumstances, but she could tell that Marigolddust definitely didn’t, and part of her wanted to grab him by his big head, cover his ears and tuck him away from the yelling. But at this point, it would be quite pointless. “This is getting kind of pathetic.” But alas, Clover’s pleas were drowned out by the constant back and forth yelling. Wow! It was almost as if somebody had taken her back to the forest with the rogues. Marigolddust wasn’t the only one about to emotionally lose it. Because it was quite clear Rooksnap was going down the same path as poor, poor Grouse. @Shade @Springy 🦤 @cake @-Jayfang- @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™
-Jayfang- 11-Jul-21 06:14 PM
Jayfang stood up. He supposed he should've cut in sooner, instead of letting.. whatever this was drag out for a bit. It was okay at first, seemingly a minor discussion that he assumed would just end in Marigolddust coming back defeated and nothing else. Marbledpaw jumping in was a surprise, but he guessed it was just because she didn't know any of them very well so he couldn't tell what they would or wouldn't do. However, Rooksnap's performance surprised him the most. Though they didn't interact too often lately, he had assumed she just needed a bit of space.. but now? The words she said, though not affecting him whatsoever, seemed to have been said with the worst intentions. She didn't seem like she needed any more space. "Hey," he greeted, standing slightly off to the side. "What warranted those words?" Jayfang asked, staring directly at Rooksnap. Without waiting for a response, he shook his head. "Nothing. Now go apologize." The silver tom acted as if he was scolding an apprentice, despite the fact that Rooksnap was older than he was. In all honesty, Jayfang wasn't usually a mediator—he participated in fights, not stop them—so he probably shouldn't have stepped in whatsoever. However, his slightly delusional confidence lead him to believe his appearance would be enough to get both sides to back down. @Shade @spark's clone™ @cake @Springy 🦤 @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™
cake 11-Jul-21 06:32 PM
marbledpaw | @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- @Shade @Springy 🦤 @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ A stone dropped and sank into her stomach, a torrent of water swirling against her heart till it twisted into something foul and eventually, grew hard. Decisively, the apprentice made up her mind that she wouldn't hold back anytime soon. "Shut up," she stated once, quietly. She did not shut up. Definitely not. And when a different warrior joined, violet gaze was pure poison, each glare shooting daggers at Jayfang's fur as he tried to intervene. Then a whine of a roaring truck that passed by in her head made it's way across her ears till all Rooksnap's words flew across her and knocked breath out in the mess and jumble of tears and anger and hurt; disappointment in herself, bitterness for her mother's death, determination to avenge someone and not just be the kit that was left behind in ThunderClan because of exile. Claws unsheathed, and recklessly, swung it across Rooksnap's face. It hit the sweet spot - her eye, and a sick feeling of satisfaction bloomed from the blood that followed. Her paw, now soaked in blood, stamped on the ground. "Insult her again, I dare you." “I dare you!“ her body shoved forward now along with her words, still trembling as her voice rose an octave to an unrestrained scream. Marbledpaw charged towards Rooksnap for a second blow, only to be shoved aside before she could do more damage.
Shade 11-Jul-21 06:41 PM
Slice. Before Rooksnap's words could tear the family apart any further, an unsheathed paw flew into her vision and caught her across the eye. The rip of claws stung her face, spraying blood which freckled the scene. Rooksnap just barely saved herself from stumbling back, not even a roar of pain or infuriation rising from her. The warrior stood with her head hung low, face to the ground, freshly wounded eye closed tightly shut, panting slowly. Crimson fell in delicate strands visibly from the laceration. After a moment she raised her head to survey the group again. Some stood in shock, others struggling to hold a furious Marbledpaw writhing to the ground. She could feel the glowy eyes of the rest of the clan watching them from the surrounding dens. Only her blue eye shone clearly now, cold and icy, the once warm yellow of its counterpart squinted behind a growing curtain of foul scarlet. "StarClan help you all," she growled resentfully just as the last rays of sunset vanished from the quarry, then turned and bounded out into the forest. @Springy 🦤 @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ @-Jayfang- @prim (edited)

{Laurelblaze} | Witnessing the Family Fight | present
She’d been outside of camp hunting while this altercation had been taking place, a bundle of two voles hanging from her jaws as she’d emerged from the camp entrance. When she stepped into the clearing, she was greeted with a clearly furious Rooksnap with blood streaming down from her eye, away from a group of apprentices clustered around Marigolddust. The deputy had dropped her prey her tufted ears flattened against her head as she let out a small gasp. ”Rooksnap?!” she turned towards the smaller she-cat as she tried to stop her for a moment, only to see her already storming off. What happened here? Abandoning her parcels at the fern-guarded entrance, the russet-toned tortoiseshell approached the group that was holding Marbledpaw down. The metallic scent of blood hung in the air, and she could see it staining the young molly’s paw which she’d used to swipe at her clanmate. Her amber and blue gaze was burning, clearly enraged by the sight she’d witnessed. cake 11-Jul-21 07:30 PM
marbledpaw | @prim @spark's clone™ @Shade @-Jayfang- @Springy 🦤 @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ She was about to sprint after her, tackle Rooksnap to the ground and ruin her entire life over and over till Cloverpaw collided with her, pinned her tightly down and she stared up balefully, violet gaze looking upwards with furious intensity. "Get off me, you idiot-" a hiss, tail lashing, but her breathing was already slowing down as her head wrapped around the crime she had done, blood draining from her face. "I.." left suddenly at a loss of words, she shoved Cloverpaw off, brushing herself down and finding herself inable to explain what had hapened. It felt like a fever dream, passing by with her vision tainted red and nothing else. "I attacked her." she responded coldly at the demand for an answer and surprisingly unfazed by the rage present in the deputy's gaze. She straightened up, no sign of guilt apparent. Breathing thick and heavy, she looked at Laurelblaze firmly in the eye, though her throat was already trembling as if ready to cry. "She deserved it, and I don't regret it at all." "I need some space." And she turned tail so no one would see the tears that were springing now the faze of anger was over, slipping into the apprentice's den and deciding to do nothing but lie there. -Jayfang- 11-Jul-21 07:35 PM
Jayfang was stunned. At least, for a bit. He hadn't expected this fight to get physical, or for Rooksnap to run off, but it wasn't all that confounding.
