Springy 🦤 11-Jul-21 07:46 PM
Marigolddust The argument continued on for a little bit, and when Marigolddust realized Jayfang was attempting to handle the situation he relaxed. This new sense of calm didn't remain long, though, as Jayfang was ignored and Marbledpaw had her claws at Rooksnap's eyes. The tom couldn't help but gasp at the sudden, swift movement of physical offense against the nanny. He stood still there for a moment, stunned, as he looked over Rooksnap's fresh injury from afar. The group of apprentices gathered around him disappeared and instead gathered around Marbledpaw and the muddy pelted molly, and it didn't take long for him to follow in persuit. Worry and concern showed clearly in his lemon-toned gaze as he watched Rooksnap stalk away like a angry, defeated fox after being harmed by a patrol. Biting his lip, he tried to get over his overwhelming confusion and clear his head. It was hard to do this when he was still standing in the middle of the ruin after the war, but he couldn't bring himself to leave the situation without making sure things were alright. Meeting the vivid green pools of Cloverpaw's eyes, it wasn't hard for him to figure out what unspoken words were being said with the look. Returning her question with a helpless expression, he shrugged and looked back in the direction that Rooksnap had left. Could he have prevented this somehow? Of course. Why hadn't he? Every muscle in his body froze with fear as he heard one of the two voices he didn't want to occumpany his ears in such a situation. With his guilty conscience causing the fur on his spine to prickle, he hesitantly turned around to face Laurelblaze. What happened? Not a very complicated question, but enough for him to feel shame resurface. Although he seemed to have such a small part of this problem by now, he couldn't get it off his mind that he had caused Rooksnap to snap in the first place.
- Swaying his tail back and forth anxiously, he tried to decide whether or not he should further explain the situation off of what Marbledpaw had said. Reluctantly, he took a few steps forword to properly approach Laurelblaze. *"Um... I-I angered Rooksnap a little, a-and cats started getting dragged in and harsh words were shared, and it resulted in... Well, I think you know..." He trailed off after saying the words so quickly, scared out of his pelt as to how the deputy would react. He hadn't seen her so seriously angry until now, and truthfully it made her even more intimidating than she was.

Right now, she needed to have a discussion with Marbledpaw about this outburst. While she understood her frustration and anger at this betrayal, she needed to make sure this was not going to spiral. prim 16-Jul-21 10:52 AM
{Viperpaw} | Wrenpaw | past I
She really didn't want to think about her brother potentially skewing the perceptions of the others of her. She wasn't eager to start training, nonetheless, she was going to try and get it over with. Like ripping the bandage off a healed wound, it would sting for a little bit, but it was better than prolonging the pain. She'd have to suck it up for now, until she received her "warrior name", as if she was going to keep it once she finally ditched this place. She hated being contained to these walls of stone, only allowed to go out when a warrior permitted it. It was as if she was being perpetually watched and prevented from seeing the world without someone to guide her. The black tortoiseshell huffed at the comment about her seeming to "need" company at the moment. She never was a social butterfly, if she was talking to someone, it was merely to either dictate what she wanted or it was with her siblings. "Listen, Wrenpaw, I don't get why you're under the impression that I'm in need of company. I get your heart is in the right place, but I'm perfectly fine." her icy gaze narrowed as she twitched her whiskers in annoyance. Her words were a little harsh, but she never really curbed her language. Driving others away from her was best in her eyes for now. Viperpaw did not see the point in establishing connections to cats she'd be leaving behind in the future, aside from her family. She'd only be causing more pain for others and herself. It'd be easier that way. It seemed like a lonely existence, but she was perfectly content being on her own. She was independent that way, loneliness did not scare her. She could handle it easily. "The territory doesn't scare me, that's for sure. I don't know why clan cats like to constrain themselves in little territories, seems as if you're only willing to see one part of the world." she'd only been a rogue for two moons of her life practically, as she was that old when she was brought here. Yet she was still a little spitfire, she missed being able to go wherever she pleased, now she had to obey borders. Set by who? Some ghost cats they believed lived in the night sky? @tremb
Viina 16-Jul-21 02:35 PM
A fluffy mix of grey-colored fur slid through the entrance to ThunderClan camp. Now that he was finally an apprentice, Marrowpaw clearly enjoyed his freedom to come and go as he pleased. He trotted over to the low opening to the warrior’s den and shyly peered through the darkness with his bright amber eyes. What was his name again..? the young tom pondered to himself as he tried to remember the name of his new mentor. The warrior had been present among those at the ceremony, standing out like a stray burr with his large jet-black appearance. Marrowpaw mustered his courage and called out carefully into the den: ”Hello? Is Nightpanther here?” He gulped slightly, hoping he wasn’t disturbing the other napping warriors who were a few feet away. @finn (edited)
finn 16-Jul-21 02:46 PM
Nightpanther’s expression on this beautiful day was anything but pleasant. His narrowed eyes glittered with the usual contempt and his lips were drawn back in a scowl. Sure he’d been hoping to be assigned his second apprentice for some time, but nothing was thrilling about meeting another mewling mess. As he slid through the opposite entrance of camp Nightpanther caught a glimpse of Marrowpaw’s turned back in front of the warriors den. What in Starclan’s name the adult tom snorted silently. Without a word he approached his new apprentice from behind and tapped the younger cat’s shoulder with the tip of his tail. ”If there’s something you should know about me, it’s that I’m never in there.” He said sternly. @Viina
Viina 16-Jul-21 02:59 PM

I’ll keep that in mind, sorry.” The apprentice nodded, noticing the harsh note in Nightpanther’s tone. finn 16-Jul-21 03:10 PM
”I’m quite aware.” The brute muttered scathingly as he gestured his new apprentice to follow. They moved in the direction toward the entrance of camp with the intent to leave for their first lesson. His gaze rounded on the poor fellow beside him. How can I cat live with so much fur attached to their hide Nightpanther glared down in disbelief. A normal cat would overheat and die.. the tom let out a low growl as their sides brushed from the sheer volume of Marrowpaw’s fur. ”Starting today you’re an apprentice. Which means you’re in training to become a warrior that ThunderClan will utilize in any and all situations. I expect you to apply yourself and train hard so don’t let me catch you sleazing around.” Nightpanther lectured, unintentionally emulating his old mentor Gorsebite. ”And one more thing,” He reached out with an enormous unsheathed paw and pushed the younger tom a little further away from his side. ”Some distance will you? Your fur is going to smother me in this heat.” @Viina (edited)
Viina 16-Jul-21 03:30 PM
Marrowpaw suddenly felt nervous. It sounded like this mentor was not going to easy on him. He wondered if Nightpanther was known to be this strict and harsh.. he’d probably have to find some friends and ask them instead. Even if it seemed like his mentor was going to be hard to please, he inwardly resolved to follow Nightpanther’s orders to the best of his ability. If anything else, Marrowpaw knew his determination would carry him through. Before he could react, Marrowpaw’s body was shoved so easily to the side that he almost stumbled into the dust of the camp floor. Nightpanther was definitely packing a bigger punch than Marrowpaw could tell. Pulling himself up quickly, he hurriedly strode back up to his mentor’s side and sheepishly lowered his head. ”Noted, I’m sorry.” And the two left camp, heading deep into the territory. @finn

Viina 16-Jul-21 04:50 PM
Marrowpaw was so sore from training that every step felt like fire. His paws were slow and unsteady as they dragged his tired body across the camp. Nightpanther had strictly ordered that he spend as much time in the territory and even comprised a list of tasks to complete aside from lessons. prim 16-Jul-21 07:15 PM
{Viperpaw} | Marrowpaw | present
Viperpaw had been spending her brief break from training in camp. Instead of lounging around in the patches of sunlight littering the ground, she’d opted to stay under an overhanging canopy that provided an ample amount of shade. The black tortoiseshell did not feel up to sunbathing, not yet anyways. It was already rather hot out due to the fact that it was the middle of green-leaf, and they were approaching the height of the season rather quickly. It was only going to get hotter and hotter from here on out, until leaf-fall provided a nice respite from the ferocious heatwaves. So, she stayed in camp, enjoying her time in the shade before Cinderblaze called upon her to return to training for the day. Her mentor wasn’t nearly as strict as Marrowpaw’s it seemed, but Viperpaw was not looking to cause trouble for her. She was keeping her nose clean for the most part to ward off suspicion from the warriors. The dark-furred molly was a bit of a flight-risk to put it lightly, she’d always been looking for ways to escape from this clan ever since she and her siblings were brought here as kits. In her mind, she was still Viper, the ferocious rogue kitten who could conquer the world. Not Viperpaw, the clan cat who was “collared” by some phony Warriors Code and the eyes of their ancestors, not hers. She had romantic views of the rogue territories, not truly understanding that she likely would have starved to death out there along with her littermates. Four kits could not fend for themselves out there, it wasn’t possible. The clan cats had saved them, but she didn’t view it as such. Speaking of which, one of them had passed her by on his way to the fresh-kill pile. Her icy-blue gaze narrowed, and she twitched her bobbed tail. Definitely someone her age based on how he was carrying himself. Exhausted and hungry it seemed, probably was out training. ”Keep working like that and you’re gonna end up looking like an empty shell.” she muttered to herself with a slight roll of her eyes. Even she knew working too much could lead to overexertion, he clearly seemed like he was suffering from it. ”Not that I care, it’s your funeral, you know.” @Viina
tremb 16-Jul-21 07:49 PM
Wrenpaw & Viperpaw // past You don’t seem perfectly fine to me, Wrenpaw said silently to herself. Of course she’d never have the nerve to say anything like that out loud. Especially not to a cat with an attitude like the one Viperpaw harbored. The caramel furred molly wasn’t the type to stick up for herself when someone was being rude, nor could she bring herself to be rude in return. It just wasn’t in her nature, for now at least. ”I don’t think you need it. I don’t know, I just thought you looked upset and I thought some company could help. My bad,” she said with a shrug of her shoulders. She still couldn’t hold the other she-cats gaze. Every word that came out of her mouth, every move that she made felt so awkward. Perhaps one day she would learn that she couldn’t solve everyone’s problems single pawed, and that was okay. For now however, the naive feline was convinced that she could be of use somehow. She tipped her head to the side at Viperpaw’s next words, thoughts churning with curiosity. She’d never heard anyone else in the clan speak of the clan territories or customs that way. She was also puzzled as to why Viperpaw seemed to separate herself from the rest of ThunderClan, as if she wasn’t a clan cat too. Maybe she didn’t see herself as one? ”I’d never thought about that before. I guess it’s safer to stay in one place? And if we had too much territory we wouldn’t be able to protect it.” Everything Wrenpaw said was just an educated guess, really. She didn’t know why the clans restricted themselves to their lands and never traveled elsewhere, aside from the stories she’d heard of them traveling across the mountains in search of their current lake home. She was grateful for the subject change, but she knew Viperpaw still wasn’t a fan of her company, no matter what they were talking about. ”Listen, if.. if you want me to leave you alone I will. I’m sorry I bothered you in the first place.” She muttered awkwardly, shuffling her paws against
the ground. @prim
Viina 16-Jul-21 07:53 PM
Marrowpaw’s ears flicked toward the direction of the she-cats voice. He didn’t recognize it, but furrowed his expression at her chilly comment. ”I can’t really help it.. I’m starting to think my mentor finds it fun.” The long-furred tom huffed with halfhearted enthusiasm. Nightpanther was demanding for sure, but it didn’t faze him. If anything, Marrowpaw’s strong work ethic led him to enjoy hunting and training. The tom made eye contact with Viperpaw. She seemed a few moons older, but he couldn’t recall seeing her at an apprenticeship ceremony. Maybe she wasn’t from ThunderClan? Marrowpaw pondered, but quickly pushed the thought aside. He lowered his head and gently picked up a vole, knowing that it was alright for him to take a bite since it was after sundown now and most cats had already been fed. ”Do you want to share?” The polite note in his tone was cautionary, but only because he didn’t want to intrude on the other apprentice’s time. ”I’m Marrowpaw by the way, you are..?” @prim (edited)
prim 16-Jul-21 08:19 PM
{Viperpaw} | Wrenpaw | past I
Wrenpaw was rather lucky, Viperpaw was known for having a short fuse when others were bugging her. She understood the other apprentice did not mean her any harm or offense with her words, but she truly felt that she’d be better off by herself. Yet at the same time, isolating herself and becoming a recluse from the rest of the clan was just a recipe for gaining a bad reputation amongst them. She’d be more conspicuous whenever she made an appearance in camp. It would not bode well for her in her efforts on returning to a rogue’s life. The black tortoiseshell let out a small sigh as she saw how the caramel-colored she-cat seemed rather despondent about her being unable to make her smile or something to indicate she wasn’t upset. Viperpaw nodded to her peer upon her suggestion. Perhaps it’d be best if they parted ways lest she accidentally make this other she-cat cry or something. Now that would be bad. ”Go hang out with the others. Really, I’m fine.” she just wanted out of this conversation really, not trying to cause any more problems that had already been stirred up. Wrenpaw didn’t deserve to face her wrath or anger, but she didn’t want her to feel too upset. Viperpaw knew she was a bit cold, but mostly to those who she felt needed a reminder to be humbled a bit. Some of these clan cats walked around all high and mighty sometimes, it irritated her to the high heavens. Wrenpaw wasn’t like that though, given her compassion towards others. It was admirable, but again, she wasn’t looking for new friends. Not ones she might actually miss when she left this place anyways. @tremb
prim 16-Jul-21 09:03 PM
{Viperpaw} | Marrowpaw | present
In truth, she was only just appointed to being an apprentice, she just acted much more mature for her age in her speaking mannerisms. She wanted to carry herself like she would as an adult, yet in some aspects she still retained her immature, awkward transition from a kitten into a young cat. Her attitude was a clear indication of this, she behaved rather childishly with how she regarded the clan and did not let go of grudges easily. Viperpaw was stubborn to a fault, a keystone part of her personality since birth it seemed. One that would take time to outgrow. If she ever did, at least. She flicked an ear upon hearing his offer, quickly declining it with a shake of her head. ”No thanks, I ate earlier. I’m Viperpaw.” the suffix these clan cats gave her made her skin crawl, that wasn’t her name. It was just Viper, that was all. Yet she had to blend in for now, she’d have to cope with it for now. ”You might want to take a swig of water with that one to wash it all down you know. I heard dehydration is a pretty bad way to die.” her words were ever so grim, almost as if she was purposely trying to ward him away like she did to pretty much anyone she wasn’t related to. It became a second language to her practically, and if the stubborn ones weren’t so easily shooed away, she wasn’t afraid to bare her fangs and tell them to get lost. This was her version of being polite, as harsh as it was. Still, she figured it was time she actually did look as if she had a social life, just to avoid questioning from her mentor or the deputy and that mate of hers, her “adoptive mothers”. Springy 🦤 17-Jul-21 12:36 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Current Marigolddust was lying down in his nest, seemingly lost in his thoughts as he played with the new feather he had earned from his most recent meal. Although he was examining the brown-marked feather so closely, he didn't really take in any of the patterns that he would have otherwise admired. It had been a day since the whole picnic incident already, although the sun had yet to reach its peak in the sky. There weren't many clouds to save the camp from Green-Leaf's heat, and the high temperatures and humidity made him feel as if he was melting. He felt lazy, comfortable, and tired, but there was no chance that he would be able to sleep while his mind was so busy. He had only recently woken up, anyways, and he wouldn't stay true to his role as a warrior if he slept the day away. Fernpaw was away temporarily, having had gone off to gather herbs before he had truly gotten over his grogginess. Did Rooksnap really not want him anymore? He had thought she was just sad and distraught, not... Angry. But she had seemed so enraged when he tried talking to her the day before. It was for a good reason, though. He shouldn't have prodded her like he had, and everyone else had even thought of his actions as unwise. Well, he knew now how much more wise the group of apprentices, and Jayfang, were than him. Sticking the feather snuggly and securely into his nest, he set his paw over his eyes to block out the headache inducing sunlight. Grow up. Rooksnap had finally voiced it, and he felt it was necessary. He had been more cowardly than any of the apprentices who had been by his side, and the majority of them were many moons younger than him. Wasn't he supposed to be the adult? He didn't even stand up to Rooksnap when she beat up on Marbledpaw! He knew the multicolored fem would have defended him. Technically, she already had before that whole fallout had happened.
- Releasing a sigh, he brought himself to his paws and stretched. Breakfast... That was a good idea. His stomach seems to agree as it growled in protest to the lack of food. Perhaps it would have been a good idea to grab something a bit larger than a sparrow for dinner the day before. Yawning, he sleepily padded out of the den, not realizing how close he was to the vines until he was reminded by the leaves as they brushed against his face. Scrunching up his muzzle, he brook a step back and went around the vines and out the exit. Once he had gotten to the prey pile, he picked out a small rabbit and brought it to the side of the camp with him. Lying down, he placed the rabbit in front of him before taking a small bite.
@prim

prim 17-Jul-21 01:43 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marigolddust | present
The air in camp felt tenser than usual in the days that passed since the incident between Rooksnap and the apprentices. She’d only witnessed the end of it, where the munchkin warrior had left camp, clearly enraged with a wounded eye. Needless to say, things were a bit rocky around camp, cats were in bad moods, and others were just utterly confused as to what had happened. Even she was suspended in a state of disbelief, how could a cat like Rooksnap turn on the cats she raised with nothing but affection? It was strange, as if something came over the earthen-toned femora, but what? She likely would never know, and part of her was afraid to ask. Nor was it her place, even as the deputy. Right now, she was focused on checking up on the targets of the warrior’s wrath, having started with Marbledpaw, the one who’d dealt the blow to the warrior’s eye. She and Icestar would have to discuss how to go about the whole assaulting another clanmate issue at a later date. Right now was not the best time, the tortoiseshell knew she must have been hurting in that moment. StarClan knows I might have done the same if Rooksnap said that about my mother, even if she was nothing like Hazelhues. Her family meant everything to her, and she could sympathize with young Marbledpaw. She’d lost nearly everyone, even her extended family save for one uncle was no longer within the camp’s walls. It was isolating, as if she’d been marooned within a forest with no one else to turn to… She couldn’t even imagine what she had been going through, and for Rooksnap to even say those things about her kin? I’m going to have a long talk with her if she shows her face around here. No one deserves that cruelty, even she knows that. the thought made her fur bristle, and she clenched her teeth in her jaw. Raising kits meant loving them unconditionally, and Marbledpaw did nothing to her to warrant that kind of treatment. None of them did. Now she wasn’t even here to try and fix the problems she had made, refusing to fess up to it and making amends. It was cowardly in her eyes, that wasn’t the Rooksnap she knew. She let out a shaky sigh as she relaxed a bit, the deputy could not keep thinking about this, lest she go on a rampage on the tree bark in the forest. They’d end up getting marked with her claws permanently at this rate, but this entire situation just made her want to rip her own fur out of her sides, that was how angry she was. Her heterochromatic gaze drifted across camp, before landing on the familiar sight of Marigolddust, munching on a rabbit. Perhaps she should go talk to him, to see how he was coping. Maybe she’d end up calming down a bit, StarClan knows she nearly scared the daylights out of them all when she approached them with fire blazing in her eyes after the fight. Laurelblaze stepped over to the tom with a dip of her head, ”Hey, Marigolddust.” before she came right out and asked the question that had been sitting on the tip of her tongue for a while: ”Are you doing all right?” @Springy 🦤
prim 17-Jul-21 02:09 PM

Springy 🦤 17-Jul-21 05:30 PM
Marigolddust - Laurelblaze - Current The sight of the deputy's large form didn't fail to catch the young warrior's attention as she came a bit nearer, even if it was before she had took notice of him. He couldn't stop his tail from twitching nervously as he met her eyes. It was hard for him not to feel like he had done something wrong, and with the look she had on her face- was it conflicted?- he didn't doubt that she was thinking about something in particular. It seemed like a lot of cats were, no matter how strongly Marigolddust wished it would just be swept away by the wind and never brought back. But, he gave the tortoiseshell a smile as she approached him as he curled his tail around himself, close enough where if he had to he could trap it. Body language was always a bother when a cat wanted to look like they felt something different than they did in reality. "Hey Laurelblaze," he said, his tone friendly as he spoke the well known name. In truth, the sudden approach with the question wasn't as expected as the greeting had been. Going quiet, he adverted his gaze to his rabbit, thinking over the question. Quickly bringing an end to the short silence, he nodded, returning the smile to his face. "Mhm, maybe just a little tired," he responded, although he knew that if he met her eyes it would be revealed that he didn't just feel tired. Instead, he glanced around camp, trying to locate some cat unknown to both Laurelblaze and himself. He didn't exactly feel the want to talk about the whole situation that had happened or what was left with him afterwords. What good would it do him if he did? He doubted it would make him feel any better, and he didn't want to be insulted or humiliated by himself.
- Biting his lip, he decided he'd try and change the subject early. "What about you? How are you today?" he asked, returning his gaze to the deputy. He was sure that the emotions he wanted to hide had finally heeded his wishes and covered themselves up deep in his mind again by now. Raising a paw, he stripped off another piece of the meat and stuck it in his mouth, savoring the full flavor that the rabbit offered. It gave a distraction and diminished some of his hunger. Although, Laurelblaze gave him another distraction. If he succeeded in changing the subject, then perhaps the conversation would be easy going and nice. It would be distracting whether he was successful or not either way, though, wouldn't it? Talking wasn't his favorite thing in the world, especially when it made him feel exposed, but he had heard many times from queens when they chided a kit taken out of the nursery that talking was a good release from negative feelings. Would that be true to him, though? His problems were't about some other kit accidentally stepping on his tail, they were about his own poor realizations of things he'd rather have never learned, such as the fact that Rooksnap didn't want him around. Curling a moon-shaded paw, he dug his claws into the blades of grass and the soft soil under the rabbit. He had no need to go down that train of thought, not right now. He still had duties after he finished breakfast, and being plagued by such upsetting topics wouldn't make catching a mouse any easier.
@prim

prim 17-Jul-21 10:29 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marigolddust | present
She used to bottle up her feelings for a long time, though in private she often released her rage or frustration against a tree or the ground when she needed to relieve her stress. When she was conflicted or upset however, she’d often struggled with processing her emotions. So when the time came when she couldn’t possibly hold them in anymore, she practically exploded in emotion. She remembered a few times where she had utterly broken down as a result of her feelings. It wasn’t healthy, and over time she’d come to realize it wasn’t weak to feel sadness or grief outwardly, or even frustration. It was healthy to talk about it, to overcome her struggles with the support of her clanmates. That was what they all were there for, protect and help one another when they were going through their own struggles. They were meant to be a support system, as the individual did affect the clan as a whole. ”I’ve just been thinking a lot lately. Got a lot on my mind.” she sounded rather weary mentioning this, as if she’d been dwelling on the same thoughts for days on end. Yet that was exactly what it was, she’d been stuck on the same thoughts as if they were playing in her mind on a loop, never ending, at least not until she voiced them to someone else. She trusted Marigolddust though, he was a good cat in her book, sometimes he reminded her of a little brother of hers. ”I’m worried about you and the others, after the whole incident with Rooksnap? Are you sure you guys are gonna be all right? You know you can always come to me if you need to talk.” the deputy was not one for beating around the bush and rambling about other things before getting to her point. She’d rather get this over with and actually move past it so they could enjoy a normal conversation. That was usually how she approached these things, even if it wasn’t the most delicate means. Still, letting these issues fester was never a good thing, so it was best they dealt with it right away. ”Just let me know if any of you need anything, I saw things got ugly.” @Springy 🦤 (edited)
Viina 17-Jul-21 10:37 PM

In the recent years, it had become widely known that ThunderClan was one of the more forgiving clans when it came to accepting outsiders. Rarely were they turned away, especially if they had the potential and means of pulling their own weight. It seemed that the concept of “pure-blooded” clan cats were antiquated. Viina 17-Jul-21 11:26 PM
{ Marrowpaw } | Viperpaw | present

prim 18-Jul-21 09:45 AM
{Viperpaw} | Marrowpaw | present

Most of the time the others would back off by now, she knows she’d already scared poor Wrenpaw off when she insisted on being alone after their shared ceremony. ”Wow, do all ThunderClanners have mind-reading abilities? I’m thinking of a number between one through ten.” her response to his observation on her happiness was sardonic, though truly she wanted to see what sort of witty responses he had in that noggin of his. She actually didn’t mind cats as sharp-tongued as her, in fact the molly found it amusing. ”You think they’d just let me walk out of here if I ask politely? You’ve gotta be joking, you don’t know how clingy some of these cats are.” she can imagine Laurelblaze blocking her path to the entrance trying to convince her to stay. That burly, scarred beast was nothing if not persistent, she’d be a blubbering mess though. No, if she were to leave she’d have to go in the middle of the night on her own with not a single word to her family or the clan. That was how it was supposed to be, she wanted to disappear without a trace. ”I want to live the life I feel was meant for me, it’s what I want. How others feel about the choices I make for myself shouldn’t influence my decisions.” she was dead-serious about that too, she did not want any of them influencing the choices she made for herself. Making her feel guilty, supporting her, no, she had to remain impartial. This was her choice, not theirs. @Viina
Viina 18-Jul-21 12:13 PM
{ Marrowpaw } | Viperpaw | present
Marrowpaw was glad that Viperpaw hadn’t been offended. Instead, she seemed equally amused by his responses. Her soft chuckle made the atmosphere a bit more friendly as he did the same. The tom rolled his eyes jokingly as he glanced back toward the tortoiseshell feline. ”On a scale of how badly you wanna get outta here? “ A light smirked lined his lips. ”28.” Marrowpaw was enjoying the conversation, glad that he could find somebody who wasn’t sensitive over witty remarks. His ears flicked forward as he listened to her prediction of Laurelblaze’s reaction. ”Is she?” The tom’s question was of course, rhetorical. His amber eyes glanced to the highledge, realizing that her expectations were realistic. After all, Viperpaw could be barred from leaving for a few reasons. Especially if she had clan intel.. He wouldn’t put it past the other clans to not try and take advantage of Viperpaw if she had valuable knowledge on ThunderClan. She was also close to the deputy.. she could find herself being used as leverage in a worst-case scenario. The tom made a slight grimace as he dismissed the unpleasant thought. ”As you should. In the end, nobody’s opinion really matters anyway.” He affirmed her final statement. ”Do you like training?” The tom asked, changing the subject to something a bit more lighthearted. ”You seem like you’d enjoy fighting over hunting.” @prim (edited)
prim 18-Jul-21 03:03 PM
{Viperpaw} | Marrowpaw | present
She couldn’t stifle a chuckle at the jab at her scaling of how much she wanted to leave this clan already. ”Wrong, make it a hundred.” her eyes glinted with amusement, for once someone wasn’t actually making her want to slam her head against a wall. Viperpaw wasn’t entirely sure she’d met her match just yet, however, she could be rather vicious when it came to the creativity of her insults. She’d rather save them for someone worthy of them though, if they decided to test the severity of her wrath. That’d be a confrontation that would likely be their last, she did not hold back and would not until they gave in to her. She hated losing, especially in arguments. ”Both of them are attached to their kits practically at the hip, wanting to keep their big happy family all together. So that’s pretty clingy.” she huffed quietly, without taking into account that randomly ditching her family might make them feel as if she were abandoning them for her own selfish wishes. This clan wasn’t her home in her eyes though, and if they were family, they should be supporting her in all of her endeavors. So much for that, it seemed. ”Training is boring, I just deal with it so I can get to doing what I want. Usually I’ll find quiet spots in the forest, climbing trees is tricky with my tail being so short.” short was an understatement, it was a stub practically. It made balancing tricky, and climbing required a lot of it. One thing she’d have to account for when she was out hunting, she had to take extra precautions while she was out there trying to do so. ”Fighting is a little easier, I guess.” @Viina
Viina 18-Jul-21 03:46 PM
{ Marrowpaw } | Viperpaw | present
Marrowpaw couldn’t resist a quick glance at the stub and then back to Viperpaw’s face. He wondering if it had been altered or if she had been born that way, but didn’t venture to ask. In fact, he was glad to hear that they cared so much about their offspring. I’m not the best, but if you ever want to practice to pass the time, we could go out together.” He offered. @prim
prim 18-Jul-21 04:22 PM
{Viperpaw} | Marrowpaw | present
Well, from her own observations the two she-cats didn’t take on any more mouths than they could handle. Both were heavily involved with their kits, along with their own duties to the clan. Neither of them were true queens in a way, Laurelblaze had to remain focused on her duties as a deputy and Hollyfrost was equally as headstrong about serving her clan. They both were extremely dedicated to duty, something she didn’t understand fully. Shouldn’t living also have time for things besides family and work? It seemed miserably stressful. She wasn’t going to spend so many hours of her day on work like they did, she didn’t have any aspirations like they did. Viina 18-Jul-21 04:38 PM
{ Marrowpaw } | Viperpaw | present

Still, he couldn’t complain as it was benefitting him more in the end. ”A half-moon ago?” He blinked. ”That’s not too far off from my ceremony..” He looked upwards as though trying to count how many weeks had passed since. ”I think in a few more days it’ll be my first moon as an apprentice.” But he sounded unsure. ”Sure. I’ll ask my mentor about it.” He said cheerfully, collecting the bits of prey that he had finished. He carefully stood up, swaying slightly on his paws. ”I’ll catch you later then Viperpaw. I should probably get some water like you were talking about and then head out for some tracking practice.” He waved his fluffy tail as he turned toward the entrance of camp once again. He paused, throwing one last look at her over his shoulder. ”You know, even if you really hate it here, I’m glad you came.” the tom chuckled before contentedly padding away. @prim (edited)
prim 18-Jul-21 04:57 PM
{Viperpaw} | Marrowpaw | present
Well, it seemed he was finally letting her off the hook. She could get back to silently brooding on her own at last. She sat up a bit and nodded, watching as the tom began to pad off a bit, but not before shooting one last exchange in her direction. I’m glad you came. the words rang in her ears like they were a foreign object, and she visibly stiffened up upon hearing them. Her eyes widened and she stared at her paws, and she felt her cheeks grow surprisingly hot from embarrassment— What? No! I can’t have people liking me, no no no! she couldn’t process the compliment since they were rather rare to come by from her peers. It was strange, someone actually said something nice about her despite all her efforts to drive them off! She clenched her teeth a bit as she looked away with a low growl, muttering to herself a bit. Her fur was bristling for a moment, before she let out a resigned sigh. Just great, she might have just made a friend, one she actually didn’t mind and might have actually liked to talk to! ”Stupid mousebrain.” she huffed under her breath, an insult meant for the cat who’d just walked away, but she didn’t actually mean it. The beast was growing soft it seemed. @Viina (and scene )
Springy 🦤 18-Jul-21 06:42 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Current Covering up his feelings was something that Marigolddust had gotten used to, and he preferred it far more than sharing his emotions and thoughts. Although it always made him feel better when he had opportunities to speak to another cat about his feelings, such as when Fernpaw had found him broken down over the loss of his mother, the more relief he felt the more convinced that it was being shared or given completely to the receiver of the words. It scared him, the idea of causing others to hurt or have conflicted emotions just to get them off of himself, and he never enjoyed the idea of it. If he had been free of this fear it would have been a completely different story. But that, unfortunately, wasn't the case here, and probably wouldn't be for a long while going forwords. Thinking a lot? What had she been thinking about? Perhaps she was overwhelmed by her responsibilities? Maybe Silentwing had raged some more chaos and more apprentices were being trained by her? Or was there drama between her and some other cats in the clan? He could easily see it being the whole Rooksnap ordeal, and would be the opposite of surprised if that turned out to be the case. I guess a lot of cats were effected by the whole situation... He thought, dread clawing at his chest as it threatened to overwhelm him. The next sentence quickly concluded his suspicion, or at least hinted at it being more probable. The offer tempted him to accept it, but he bit his tongue. It didn't seem like he had much that needed to be answered, and he didn't want to take up the deputy's time with any rambling.
- His expression became soft as he offered a bit of a weak smile. "I'm a little worried about a few of the others too," he agreed quietly. Truthfully, he had only really thought of how the whole conflict had affected Marbledpaw and Rooksnap until now, and he couldn't help but feel guilty. Cloverpaw and Blazepaw had both already lost at least two parental figures, and this was just as nother to add to their list. Personally, this was only his second, and if he felt so poorly about it, then he doubted that the two apprentices felt any better. Jayfang didn't seem like he had been all too effected. The warrior seemed strangely nonchalant for the majority of the time the problem was going on, much more than Marigolddust had expected. He didn't know the grey warrior all that well, only that he was good friends with the short brown nanny who'd earned a new injury that day. "It did get pretty messy, didn't it?" He agreed, his voice still barely over a whisper as he struggled to get through all of his thoughts. Again he felt the want to say something that could give himself some sense of relaxation or cure these negative thoughts and ideas. This time, though, he made sure he didn't stop himself. Reluctantly, he met the odd gaze of Laurelblaze's. "Do you think I act... Mature enough? For a warrior, I mean? Please be honest," he asked, unsure quite how the large she-cat would respond.
@prim
prim 18-Jul-21 07:12 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marigolddust | present
Losing family was never easy for anyone, especially if one was particularly close to said family member. She’d lost much of her own in her life, and she knew it would continue as the years passed. Her mother had joined StarClan when she had just been promoted to a warrior, and her father only mere moons ago joined her. Her brothers had left the clan and set out to make lives for themselves in the rogue clans. She didn’t know where Jasper was, but she knew Privetpaw had made a life for himself out in the Fallen Claws as their Healer. She’d lost sisters, brothers, and other family to death’s grip, and one day she knew her time would come to an end. When, she didn’t know, she just knew that she wasn’t ready for it yet. She still had a lot of life left to live, she’d be receiving nine of them in the future anyhow. Hopefully the far-off future, please… Her gaze of honey-amber and sea-blue met yellow as she listened to his words, tucking her large paws underneath her frame as she grew more comfortable. His question stuck in her mind for a bit, it was hard for her to answer immediately. She still remembered when he and the others were just energetic little kittens, having free-roam of the camp and announcing their presence wherever they went. Yet they all had grown up, they always do, and new kits take their place. Perhaps Rooksnap wasn’t ready to let them go? Insinuating they weren’t mature enough and not acting their age? Hard to imagine though, Marigolddust is one of the more level-headed ones of the young warriors. He puts some of the older ones to shame, definitely me when I was his age. she thought with a slight twitch of her whiskers, before she craned her head over to speak with him once again. ”You?” she murmured, looking him up and down for a moment. ”You’ve been pretty mature for your age since you were an apprentice. Why do you ask?” from her own observations, he was a more friendly, easy-going type. Not eager to start useless fights or cause trouble on purpose. Stuff she’d want to see in a warrior she helped oversee. She had a great level of respect for him, he acted with more integrity than she did when she was a young warrior. @Springy 🦤
prim 18-Jul-21 09:09 PM

Today had been rather eventful, but internally she’d been seething over the fact she actually had a nice conversation with a peer of hers. For once one of these clan cats actually didn’t annoy her to the point where she wanted to cover her ears and scream until it was over. Usually she would try to utilize sarcastic, biting remarks in order to drive others away, however it had the opposite effect on one apprentice. She actually liked talking to him, it drove her nuts! Stupid clan cats! I should try and get myself exiled or something at this rate, it’d be a whole lot easier than waiting and actually getting to know them, dammit! Yet she was too much of a coward to, plus it seemed counter-active. Exiles were reserved for the worst of the worst, and while she was a menace to ThunderClan, she wasn’t an outright monster. Viperpaw had some form of a moral compass, she wasn’t evil or anything! Didn’t stop her from insulting others until they left her alone though. @spark's clone™ (had to get this started before I forgot LOL)
Springy 🦤 19-Jul-21 04:05 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Current Out of his biological family, Marigolddust bad only lost his youngest sister, his mother, and the father that he had never met, even if he wished he could have. There were many, many times in his childhood where he had imagined what adventures his father must have gone through. He had created his own image of who his father was since his mother had never told him anything about him, and every new thing he imagined added to how dearly he wished he could meet him. Recently, that wish had died down. He was never visited by whatever tom had contributed to his existence, and didn't expect to be visited in the future. He would just have to wait until he himself joined his father in Starclan. As for his mother, she had seemed like the only cat he looked up to until she became neglective with the loss of Periwinklekit. He often wondered what it would have been like if his small, frail and ill sister had survived. Would his mother have made it to his first ceremony? Would he have been closer to her before she died? Would he have been able to go with her and somehow prevent loosing her? Although it wasn't as common anymore as it once was, these wonders occasionally made their way into the spotlight again. Bluebellmist had become neglective because she lost a kit, but what was the reasoning for Rooksnap? It seemed first like it was Beetlestreak's death, but she hadn't seemed as close to the medicine cat as he would have expected to cause such a reaction. So what could it have been? The Tom's nerves continued to elevate the more he waited. The suspense didn't end immediately, but when he finally got his answer he relaxed, even if there was still tension in his position. He was surprised to hear how Laurelblaze had responded, and wasn't sure whether to believe her. After looking at her face closely, he realized she wasn't lying. Either that, or she was skilled in hiding it.
- Unable to keep from feeling flattered, his smiled a relieved smile. If Laurelblaze thought he was mature, then it wouldn't be very likely that every other cat in the clan would think the opposite. So... Why had Rooksnap? Perhaps Laurelblaze's view had changed, since he had become more close to the deputy than before Rooksnap had become so snappy? Or maybe it was Rooksnap's? Could it be evident that Marigolddust looked up to the deputy more than Rooksnap recently? Both were confident, but Laurelblaze managed to care and deal with every cat in the clan. She even remembered the majority of their names! No, if Rooksnap were jealous she wouldn't have refused me, would she have? And why would she get jealous in the first place when she's cared for so many other cats, too? The question made Marigolddust freeze for a second. How would he respond? If he told Laurelblaze that Rooksnap had told him to grow up then he would just be giving the angry warrior another reason to think he was immature. It would be as if he was snitching on her, and who could consider a snitch grown-up? He didn't want to risk it, and therefore tried to avoid pointing paws in the nanny's direction. "Well, someone I'm close to recently.... *hinted, to me, that I wasn't acting as grown up as I should be, that's all,"* he said with a meek shrug, looking down at his paws and his rabbit as he spoke.

finn 19-Jul-21 06:38 PM
[ Duskpaw ] There was a brief disturbance in the bramble that protected the camp‘s entrance. A sleek dark bengal tom seemingly materialized from the shadows casted by the tall canopy of deciduous trees overhead. The tom was no other than Duskpaw, Gorsebite’s son and final apprentice. The tom, though younger than most of his predecessors had already completed his father’s rigorous traditional training expedition. He was a loyal member of ThunderClan though rather absent in past moon, leading a busy life of training and hunting with his mentor. Despite not being popular for his serious demeanor, his level of skill and talent allowed him a place amongst the top apprentices in ThunderClan -just as his father had expected him to. Still, his modesty stayed intact as he considered his skills useful only when contributing to ThunderClan. Truthfully, carrying Gorsebite’s name as both his father and the pinnacle of his mentoring career weighed heavily on the poor boy. He secretly envied a more forgiving and less structured life that allowed him to have more friends and time to himself, but knew this would only come as a disappointment. Soon the tomcat murmured inwardly I’ll be a warrior.. and then I’ll do more of what I want He thought hopefully. Even now, as he came to a slow halt in front of the fresh-kill pile, his expression remained solemn, examining what it had to offer. He gave a disdainful sniff at one stale squirrel before deciding that his appetite was unaroused and turned toward a mossy spot next to the apprentice’s den. (Open just tag) (edited)
Viina 19-Jul-21 07:35 PM
{ Marrowpaw } | Duskpaw (Open Roleplay) | future
”H-hello?” The apprentice meowed tentatively from inside the apprentice’s den. Marrowpaw could have sworn that he’d just seen a shadow pass by, maybe it was Viperpaw? The thought of the feisty she-cat made an unexpectedly warm feeling rise in his chest. He would readily admit that she had been quite amusing to talk to despite her usually crass attitude toward anyone other than her siblings. Poking his head out from underneath the den, the gray tom let out a slight breath as he came face to face with Duskpaw who sat wordlessly on top of some moss. Marrowpaw’s ears pricked forward with interest. He recognized the dark bengal, knowing he was one of the senior apprentices in the class above them. Rumor had it that he was a fine talent and training under Gorsebite. Even if Marrowpaw was still a bit slow to catching onto names, he was well aware that it was not only his mentor’s mentor, but also the mentor of some of the most prominent figures in ThunderClan. I wonder who’s worse... Nightpanther or Gorsebite. He chuckled before realizing that he was awkwardly staring down the other tom. ”Oh.. you’re not Viperpaw..” Marrowpaw said suddenly feeling hot with embarrassment. ”Duskpaw... isn’t it?” The tom asked. @finn (edited)

prim 20-Jul-21 12:20 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marigolddust | present
In her eyes, as well as most others, maturity wasn’t necessarily due to age. Sometimes there were adult cats who never truly grew up, keeping up with childish tendencies. Even she had her moments, but she knew she had to be serious and rational in her position as deputy. Goofing off wasn’t part of her job, and she often had to be the adult she was in situations where it was required. Her youthful flames had seemed to fan out into controlled burns at times, her passion for her work hadn’t died down in the slightest. Still, for warriors, they often had trouble finding themselves and who they were in the world. They made mistakes, not able to hold another hand to be led around and told what to do. Freedom came with it’s price, and thus they often had to figure it all out by themselves. Marigolddust seemed to be having that struggle right now, especially since someone just pointed it out to him directly. ”Well, if anything I was worried you weren’t acting your age when you were younger.” she flicked an ear as she spoke, shrugging her broad shoulders. He was calm, quiet for a kit and an apprentice, he didn’t do stupid, reckless things most would do at their age. He stayed out of trouble, and perhaps as a result he grew up rather sheltered. Perhaps even a bit of a people-pleaser, she worried that others would walk all over him and he wouldn’t defend himself. She saw how he’d frozen up around Rooksnap, even after she’d stormed off… Might have explained a few things. Her kits she made sure knew how to defend themselves, she didn’t want them to be walking targets. No one was going to take advantage of them, even their kindness. ”You’ve always played it safe, to be honest, and while that’s not a bad thing, I think it might have limited your field of view a bit. When was the last time you did anything stupid just for the hell of it, even if it seems to be a bad idea but would be insanely fun?” the question was rhetorical, but he was free to answer it if he pleased. These types of experiences helped others get out of their comfort zones, and often they did teach life-long lessons to the participants. Maybe he needed to go out and break out of it a bit, expand his horizons. Knowledge was power after all. ”Also, you’re fretting over what someone else is thinking about you, why? Why do you care so much?” @Springy 🦤

I’m sure you saw my ceremony, it was a pretty big one.” her tone was sarcastic as always, almost exasperated at the fact she had to deal with yet another cat getting in her business. Her lips were curled into a slight frown, and she was clearly in a bitter mood at the moment. Talking to her right now might lead to an argument if Cloverpaw hadn’t treaded carefully around her. ”You’re Cloverpaw, right? What are you doing wasting your time talking to a new apprentice? Don’t you have friends your age?” she was quick to start off with a sharp, cutting remark. Maybe that’d get her to back off if she wasn’t thick-skinned and soft. Perhaps they shouldn’t be destroying each other, they both had a penchant for being sharp-tongued and irritable. Maybe they could combine their powers. ”Also, it’s VIPERpaw, not Vaporpaw, get it right. Anyways…. You wanna hang out or something? I’m bored.” she flexed her claws for a moment, staring at the ground as she sat back onto her haunches a bit. Clearly she was fed up with throwing childish insults around when there was no gain to it, she actually liked cats who shared that passion of hers. Showed that not every single one of these insufferably uptight and rule-abiding clan cats weren’t totally lame and soft. Some actually made her laugh with the creativity of their insults, Cloverpaw might be amongst them. She’d never know unless she found out. ”Seriously, this place is so crowded I actually feel claustrophobic. Let’s get out of here, unless you’re scaaaared.” a challenge, her attitude was quick to change. She always hated staying in camp, and getting out was one of the luxuries she now enjoyed as an apprentice. @spark's clone™
prim 22-Jul-21 11:05 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Foxpaw | future I
The skies were a pallid shade of gray as clouds began to form above the camp, indicating a storm was going to arrive rather soon. Though for Laurelblaze, how she could tell a storm was coming was the smell of water vapor on the air. As if it was a warning to take shelter inside rather soon, yet the skies had only just started to get covered, and not even fully just yet. They still had time before they needed to hide in their dens in case there was thunder and lightning. If not, well a wet pelt wasn’t ideal for anyone. Some of the lazier ones might take it as an opportunity to clean off their pelts and save some time that they’d usually spend grooming it themselves… Not that it really helped much at all. Rain wasn’t going to push debris out of fur, especially if they had thick, messy fur like her own. The deputy had been lounging outside upon one of the large boulders besides the camp wall. She’d awaited the patrols she’d sent out earlier in the day to return with their hauls of prey, or a report on the situations at various borders. They were lucky that no skirmishes had broken out in quite some time, and she was pleased to notice their coffers of prey had not been growing smaller. The clan was prospering with the season, as oppressive as the heatwaves and thunderstorms were, they made do with what they had and were thriving as a whole. Laurelblaze couldn’t be more proud of them all. @cobra

"Hah! As if my mother cares." Came a venomous scoff- of course, she'd only ever known one mother and that she-cat had abandoned her.. Never once had she referred to Rooksnap as a mother. prim 22-Jul-21 04:54 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Bouncepaw | past II | repost
The day was bright and sunny out, a perfect day to get out into the woods and spend time with her apprentices and actually train. She typically kept their lessons separate for their own sake, being able to dedicate time to each of them so they could go over what they’d learned in the day and so neither of them fell behind. Besides, Bouncepaw was older than Tigerpaw and therefore farther along in her training compared to the much younger molly. Laurelblaze had to make sure she was ready for her warriors’ assessment. Six moons seemed like a long time, but before any of them knew it, it arrived. It was her duty as their mentor to make sure they were up to snuff, and she put them both through the wringer. Speaking of which, there was one of her little students now… Idling around in camp it seemed. Can’t blame her, not like they can go out without a kitsitter practically. she let out a small sigh as she approached the young she-cat with a small smile. ”Hey, Bouncepaw.” she greeted her apprentice with a small dip of her skull, her tail flickering around behind her as she approached. ”You busy? Springy 🦤 22-Jul-21 06:41 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Current The words were initially mistaken for a hint that he hadn't been very mature when he was younger, but after a few moments of his worry elevating he realized what Laurelblaze must have meant. If what he had originally took the words to mean had been their true intention, then it would have gone against what Laurelblaze had said only moments before. He never thought that a cat could be too mature, and thought the more mature someone was, the better others thought of them. Immaturity had been more of a fear of his than the opposite, although even if he were to start worrying about it now it would be too late. According to Laurelblaze, he acted well for his age, so wasn't that all that he needed for reassurance? Marigolddust had noticed other cats going through things like what he was, and he often tried to think of ways that he might help them. He always came short, but he had never connected that with the idea that he was going through the same thing. If was hard, for him at least, to identify things like that. He knew who didn't seem to be going through doubts and who did most of the time, and he usually wished he could have things more figured out like cats such as Laurelblaze seemed to. The idea that this meant he hadn't figured out whether he felt mature enough, though? Never before had that come to him.
- Marigolddust had known for awhile that he might have been playing everything he did safe, but that was fine with him. As long as it kept him out of danger and prevented him from getting hurt... Even if he often got harmed in some way, shape, or form anyways, he was okay with it. Fear was a constant drive behind his actions, even though he didn't always appreciate it. The question made his mind crank and turn. When was the last time I've done something stupid for fun? He wondered, frowning as he realized he couldn't think back on any situation of the sort. Sure, he'd broken the rules... Maybe three times, although one had just been risky while the others had been actually against the rules. But the first time it had been pushed on him, even if it did turn out being fun until it resulted in him falling from a tree, the second wasn't at all for fun, and the third... He shivered just thinking of it. Otherwise he had stuck to the laws of the clan, never stepping more than a paw out of the boundaries he followed. She didn't mean rule-breaking specifically, though, did she? "It doesn't seem like things turn out very well when cats do that," he pointed out, although the question had clearly gotten him thinking. The last question was one that he occasionally found himself thinking during situations like this; why did he care? In truth, he had no idea. Sometimes, like this time, he cared because he was close to the cats who said such things. In other situations, he didn't quite know.
- Perhaps it was because it seemed a cat's identity was affected by those who observed them, although maybe it was for some other reason he didn't understand yet. "Well... There's a lot of cats, and it's good to have.. criticism?" He said, the statement a bit weak as he grew unsure of the words. What was someone supposed to do when others stated what they thought about them? It was like advice, wasn't it? You listened to what others said about you, and then you altered that "problem" so that it fit what cats thought they were supposed to be. Oh, how terrible that mindset sounded now that he thought about it! But how else would a cat feel? He was confused, embarrassed, and maybe a bit shameful at the idea that he figured this all out in the wrong way.
@prim

prim 23-Jul-21 03:37 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marigolddust | present
When she was a young warrior, around Marigolddust’s age, she was a hotshot, a total spitfire looking to cause as much trouble as she could. The power that came with being a warrior easily went to her head and gave her an inflated ego. She believed she was invincible, able to take on any challenges life threw at her. Laurelblaze picked pointless fights, and engaged in reckless behavior just to show off to the others. Not only that, but she was absolutely one of the most arrogant and cocky warriors the clan might have ever seen. It was because of this behavior that she’d cultivated a rather bad reputation for herself when she was young, she was a troublemaker. She stirred up problems wherever she could, just so she could prove to the others she could solve them and therefore do anything. The tortoiseshell now was mortified by this behavior of hers back then, looking back on it always made her cringe from embarrassment, it was utterly horrific. Fortunately for her, she was humbled rather quickly… Or perhaps not so fortunately, much of it came from learning that she wasn’t in fact invincible, and that she too could be hurt, and that she wasn’t immune to suffering. These experiences shaped her into the warrior she was now, one that dedicated herself to her clan. One that protected her clanmates with her life. One whose loyalty was unfettering and powerful. All because she learned from them, and still had room to grow from her experiences. She was never going to achieve perfection, and she’d take her experiences from being deputy of her clan into account for the future. Perhaps that was why Marigolddust was questioning himself. While she didn’t advise that he go ahead and make mistakes on purpose, perhaps he was missing out on a few things. He needed to find his confidence, to have the ability to lift himself up. Learn to truly defend oneself when their character was questioned. ”You’re your own cat, Marigolddust. Other cats shouldn’t dictate how you should change for them to like you. In truth, not everyone will, but you shouldn’t let them tell you how you should live your life… Unless you’re doing something completely nuts and bad, maybe listen to them then, but I don’t think you have that sort of problem.” she shrugged her shoulders as she flicked an ear, her gaze drifting down to the tuxedo tom with a small smirk. Yet here she was, giving him advice on how to go about his life. All she wanted was for him to grow a spine a bit, to not let anyone walk all over him. He shouldn’t be a total pushover, it’d make life a lot more miserable if he let everyone tel him what to do or bullied him into submission. ”You’re really quick to let others tell you what to do. If they say anything rude to you, you need to tell them they’re a mousebrained crow-food eater and need to buzz off. Got it? Don’t let others push you around, especially when you know what they’re saying isn’t true in the slightest. And that’s an order.” @Springy 🦤 (edited)

{Laurelblaze} | Foxpaw | future I
Well, it seemed one of the patrols was right on time to return, one of her own kits among them. Seeing Foxpaw brought a smile to her heavily-scarred features, lopsided but ever so genuine. The russet-toned tortoiseshell looked down at the mouse her son had brought to her, a pleased purr escaping as she acknowledged the successful hunt with a firm nod. ”That’s great, Foxpaw!” she sounded proud, and why shouldn’t she be? The deputy couldn’t wait to see how they’d progress further into their training, it was ever-so exciting for her. She’d worried about them as kits, but she always fretted over her children when they began their apprenticeships. It was never easy letting go of those cute little kittens, but she knew they needed to grow up eventually and have their own adventures. { ~ Icestar ~ }
A great big yawn stretched Icestar’s jaws wide open, revealing a set of sharp canines that glistened in the light that managed to filter through the thin blanket of clouds that gloated by. The trees bristled gently with the wind, sending a thin spray of water from this sunrise’s shower raining down upon the lynx-point. She squeaked in surprise but didn’t mind the dampening of her pelt. Afterall, she was Nightstorm’s daughter. Padding down from her position on the Highledge, Icestar entered the camp clearing. Her feathery tail flicked back and forth gently, taking in the pleasant scenery of Clan activity. Young apprentices and kits scuffled in the mud while the older trainees scowled disapprovingly. Warriors weaved through the dens, busying themselves with daily activities. Queens chattered and helped with reinforcing the dens with thicker material to prevent the rain from soaking through. Icestar watched their expert work before flitting her gaze over to the entrance.

Springy 🦤 25-Jul-21 10:59 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Current The idea of being completely in control of who he was seemed like something that, although it sounded as if it were true, was really false. Cats changed according to their surroundings all of the time, such as a kitten getting sick from a undiagnosed sickness and the mother turning cold because of the loss. The way that others changed changed you. If a cat were to be attacked often, they would naturally grow more cautious and untrusting. So, if a cat got positive feedback from others, they would most often stay the same or feel more confident. If this were a negative case, than it would effect the cat poorly and cause them to want to change and become insecure. Wasn't that just the way of life, though? Events always made something change or shift inside someone, and the events of honest speaking couldn't hardly escape this. He was just a cat who received a bit too much negative feedback in his past and life currently. Didn't that mean it was natural to become unsure about it? But, if that was the case, then he didn't understand why so many others in the clan seemed to feel so confident in themselves. Surely they must have received negative comments too, right? Every cat did, so they must have. Then why weren't they thinking like him; doubting, thinking, and believing? Didn't they ever feel the way that he did now?
- Maybe they had and he just failed to realize it. It wouldn't be too surprising, taking his inability (or refusal) to take in the changes going on around him to consideration. He had never been a fan or things changing or moving on. If he could, he would stop time as it was, keeping everything the same so that he didn't need to fear the future or what it would bring. Perhaps he would even try to fix some things that have gone wrong, such as Rooksnap's new found temper or Fernpaw's loneliness. Enough of that thinking, though. He had to keep his mind on the topic that was being discussed and that target alone. Glancing over Laurelblaze once more, he took her role in his story into consideration. He aspired to be as confident or sure of himself as her, so why was he finding himself not trusting what she said? He wished he could have her sureness, and she was like this partly because she didn't mind what others thought of her. Hearing Laurelblaze's question echo through his head, he realized that instead of the deputy's voice, he heard his own self consciousness wondering. Why did he care? There was really no reason to, was there? The tortoiseshell's sequence of insults brought Marigolddust to attention, catching him off guard. He couldn't conceal the surprise and startement on his face at her words. The 'order' part of it was just as unexpected as the rest. Although he knew that it wasn't completely serious, and he'd hopefully not be punished too badly for disobeying this 'order', it still managed to make him a little nervous. This didn't prevent him from voicing some form of objection, though. "I-isn't that a bit rude?" He stammered, stunned. He could never see himself repeating the words, and wasn't a cat supposed to respond to rudeness with polite matters? Wasn't that how things didn't elevate to anything too much worse?
- By now it seemed like he he didn't understand how to properly react to anything. It sure seemed like he would have to work on this...

{ ~ Icestar ~ // Icepaw}
It appeared as if something was bothering the apprentice. The unfocused glaze of the eyes as she had begun to groom her fur. The perplexed expression on her face as she stared into empty space. Since when had the ground become more interesting than ThunderClan’s very own leader? The lynx-point cocked her head to the side with a small frown. Abandoning her original pursuit, she made her way over to Icepaw. Is something the matter? She stopped right in front of the smaller feline, her figure blocking the cast of the sun. Icestar’s elongated shadow stretched right up to the camp wall, becoming disfigured by the rough terrain. Was she intimidating? Yes but not by her figure. In fact, her size was just that of the average warrior. It was her confident stance and blazing eyes that startled many. ” You look as if you’re bothered,” she added in a softer tone.

{ ~ Seakit ~ }
Seakit had been entranced by a toad that had unfortunately stumbled across the camp clearing. Large ocean-coloured eyes - just like his mother’s - observed the fat creature with great interest. A small paw snaked out to pat the back of the frightened toad, black paw pads feeling the bumpy and dry texture of this toad’s skin. The toad, startled by the gentle squishing, hopped forward to escape any further contact. The gray-and-brown tabby lowered his body clumsily in an attempt to mimic a hunter’s crouch. He wriggled his haunches, preparing to hop after the toad, only to give a surprised shout as two of his Clanmates barreled right into body. ” Oof!” His face slammed into the muddy dirt. Seakit tasted soil in his mouth and felt his temper shoot upwards skyhigh. Puffing out his kit fur with the attempt of bold intimidation, he rose up to his paws and glared at the disturbers. @Claw can’t really see…
prim 27-Jul-21 07:00 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Marigolddust | present
She’d always exuded confidence wherever she went, it was like that since she was born. Supposedly she was strong even upon birth, gaining not only the attention of her family, but any onlookers as well. Laurelblaze had carried herself with a regal stride wherever she went, always staring up at the Highledge as if it were a symbol of her lofty goals. Yet looking back on it, they weren’t so far out of reach now. Not everyone had that same level of confidence, however, it was clear by the way she saw how Marigolddust was doubting himself. He needed to find his footing, a way to figure out that he would be okay. That he was going to be a successful warrior and prove it to any naysayers. That was the thing about their clan, they valued courage and loyalty above all else. Confidence, in a way, could be lumped in with courage, and her clan could be a hard bunch to please. Maybe he needed a chance to prove himself, that he did change for the better. That he was a warrior of his clan and was proud of it, and that he had matured into this role.
His surprised reaction to her rather uncouth and vulgar phrasing of an insult towards anyone trying to mess with him made her let out a deep roar of laughter. She threw her head back and let out a set of hearty chuckles before she took a deep breath and composed herself again. It was always hilarious to her to see the reactions of her clanmates to her encouraging them rather aggressively. Admittedly, it was part of the reason why she did it, just to startle them a bit. They were used to her kind yet professional persona, but she wasn’t afraid to be a little casual around them and use some language their parents told them not to use. What were they going to do, call the deputy a bad influence on their kits? The audacity they would have had to do so! Once she’d calmed down a bit, she stared at the younger tom with a wide grin, ”And them insulting you isn’t? It’s self-defense, stand up for yourself Marigolddust. Don’t hold back either, make them think twice before insulting you again. What I said before is nothing compared to some of the things I’ve said to others.” she could be rather hurtful if she wanted to. Not that she chose to, but she wasn’t going to let others walk all over her. She wanted to make sure he knew to not let anyone treat him that way either. He was Marigolddust, a warrior of ThunderClan, not some meek kittypet addicted to eating dry, bland food that looked like rabbit droppings. @Springy 🦤
cobra 27-Jul-21 07:05 PM
Her pride for him made his chest tight. So what if Viperpaw didn't like Thunderclan. At least here, with Laurelblaze and Hollyfrost, they had a family and others to protect them. They weren't alone anymore. Foxpaw wiggled excitedly on the floor, going through his hunting moves as he continued to clammer on. "It never saw me coming. I was like" A pause so he could adjust himself steadily. "Then I was like" Ginger and white hurled into the air. "And I got it in my jaws! I felt the vibrations of the little paws in my own! And then I used that help me catch it" Being half-deaf, the poor apprentice couldn't realise how loud he was. "I'll be chasing down all those little guys! Nothing can escape from master hunter Foxpaw!" The old Foxkit could never imagine standing in front of the deputy and reenacting his greatest catch. Just a few weeks ago, he had complained to Wrenpaw -then Wrenkit - that he would never be an apprentice. How the tables have turned. @prim
welcome to rping with cobra outside of bloodclan - itll take five days for a tiny response) (edited)

Shade 27-Jul-21 09:51 PM
Not expecting the overreaction, Needlestripe's whiskers twitched questioningly, but he didn't distract his apprentice from his errand. When he returned he nodded approvingly. "We're going to tour the territory," he announced, sweeping his tail at the trees that loomed over the quarry cliffs. Dawn was growing brighter but a lilac aura remained in the air. It was the perfect taste of his new life as a warrior in training. "Are you ready?" he smiled. @cobrarepost)
prim 28-Jul-21 12:48 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Foxpaw | future I
The deputy was filled with utter joy that her kits were doing so well in the clan now. Foxpaw especially was excelling, she couldn’t be more proud of her son in this moment. The burly tortoiseshell was glad he was so eager about his training and something that would become so routine as a hunting patrol. That enthusiasm reminded her of when she was his age, bright-eyed and bushy-tailed. Now her kits were making her feel old, even if she was in her prime and would still be for quite a bit. All of her children had a habit of making her feel old. ”You’re doing wonderful, Foxpaw. I’m so proud of you.” she doted upon her kits equally, but she couldn’t help but to feel utter joy at the fact she was witnessing their achievements first-hand. She felt so lucky, though she still worried about them. Every day they entered the forest, not knowing what might happen. She’d seen how cruel the world could be to someone, how they could meet terrible fates because they weren’t careful. Laurelblaze knew that very well. ”If you ever catch some voles, save me one. They’re my favorite.” she nudged his shoulder with one of her large paws, almost as if she was signaling to him to get the hint for next time. Now she was not going to abuse her power as deputy and as a mother, it was merely just a suggestion. ”By the way, I’ve been meaning to ask. What’s your favorite prey anyways? Just curious.” her motives were pretty obvious, but she felt a mini celebration was in order in the future. They’d have to get the family all together for this, this was monumental! Or she could just gift him his favorite prey that she caught herself. Just to show him he had her full support no matter what. @cobra

{ ~ Icestar ~ // Icepaw}
She arched a delicate eyebrow. Hasn’t seen her mentor since the ceremony? Icestar was going to have a chat with that warrior but for the meantime, she was going to squeeze some training in for Icepaw. Today was going to have to stick to being a one-on-one. ” Let’s go then.” Turning around, Icestar finally managed to slip through the thorn tunnel. She had been yearning for this for too long! The moment they reached the other side, it was a whole new world filled with space and fresh air and freedom. Just how she liked it. Glancing back at the apprentice while starting the trek up to the top of the stone hollow, she assessed Icepaw. It’d be best to start with basic hunting crouches. Battle-training would have to be for another day.

Springy 🦤 28-Jul-21 06:39 PM
Marigolddust - Laurelblaze - Current The booming laughter that exited Laurelblaze's chest made the young tom jump, although once he realized that she was laughing a confused smile crossed his features. He would have tried to excrete a laugh or chuckle to accompany the deputy's, but he was thoroughly not understanding what she was laughing at. Wasn't it normal to feel surprised when your deputy told you to spit a bunch of insults at any cat who was being rude to you? If it wasn't, than other cats were more odd than he originally expected. Physical self defense was always the first thing that came to the warrior's head when self defense was mentioned. He never really thought of insulting a cat back or standing up for himself as other cats thought he should was really a form of defense, just an exchange of offense. Weren't they the same thing, though? If it was, then how could he be sure that insulting the offender would be strong enough of a defense to truly make them doubt whether they should insult or judge him again? He tried to imagine a situation where he was standing up for himself for once, but his heart just didn't seem to believe that he was capable of doing such a thing. "So... you're sure that it'd work? How am I supposed to be sure when I should say... *that... to another cat?"* he asked. Marigolddust didn't want to slip up and end up being the first to throw a punch, even though he doubted he would be able to throw a punch in the fight at all.
- He went silent for a few moments before thinking over what she had said again. An opportunity to change the subject showed itself, and Marigolddust felt the urge to ask this question not only because of that but because of pure curiosity. "When did *you need to stand up for yourself?"* he asked. He could never even imagine anybody being rude towards Laurelblaze. She was gigantic in both size, confidence, and position, anyways. Was she talking about the earlier days when she didn't have the position she had now? Or did some cats really have that much courage? If they did, then he might have been even more doomed than he had thought before.
