"Be careful!" The words finally seemed to be able to escape her mouth as she watched the tom run off to help others, before she started to move, looking around her to help anyone else that she could also. What was going to happen to all of them? Was StarClan trying to send them a message? Did they do something wrong? Scrambling on her paws as she tried finding purchase, but it was proving to be difficult with the muddy ground that seemed to be making her slip constantly as she hurried forward. Anyone she came across, she would try helping nudge them along, feeling the overwhelming doom descending upon them with each passing second as the landslide only came closer and closer. If only there was a way to pause time? It was a stupid thought but all Honeydrop could think about was how they needed more time, and what time they did have was not going to be enough for them. Were they all going to die? @wild™
prim 29-Aug-21 01:56 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide
She couldn’t ignore the mixture of sand, dirt and water surrounding her paws and rising up against her limbs. The flood was only just beginning as more and more earth was collapsing from the walls of the camp, swallowing up the branches and ferns around the dens designed to protect it’s inhabitants. ”Evacuate the dens!” she cried out yet again, hoping to alert anyone caught inside before it was too late. They could not afford to lose any of their warriors or clanmates, they’d either be crushed to death of suffocate under the mud if they remained here. ”Head to the Highledge! Get to high ground!” this places was the highest area in camp, even if the rocks leading up to it would be slippery and difficult to climb, they’d be able to avoid most of the destruction. ”Get the youngest and the queens up first. They need help!” she was trying to keep a level head even with all the chaos happening, her teeth clenched and her stance firm. Suddenly, she saw a large boulder being washed in her path from above, and she dodged the incoming piece of blunt debris into a patch of mud. Her paws sunk in for a moment, causing her to panic a bit as she scrambled to get them unstuck from the wet clay-textured earth. They couldn’t stay here, it was surely going to spell their doom if they had. ”Now! We can’t stay on the ground! Don’t trample anyone! Get the injured now!”
wild™ 29-Aug-21 01:58 PM
──────────────── 𝐌𝐈𝐒𝐓𝐘𝐏𝐀𝐖 // APPRENTICE OF THUNDERCLAN
The world was spinning with chaos and destruction, the very earth seeming to fall beneath her. The skies above roared with fury, lightning tearing apart the clouds for a moment and giving that which lurked below a brief moment of light. Heterochromiatic gaze flickered about wildly, a rare hint of uncertainty and perhaps even fear held within them. All that she'd known was being destroyed right before her eyes. And there was not a thing she could do about it. Cursing the stars above, the young apprentice forced her way through the waters that had flooded the camp, half-heartedly searching for any souls that might need a paw to aid them in their escape. Her whiskers quivered as the wind whipped about her pelt, the ground trembling quite a bit as the landslide neared the camp. Mistypaw had quite the task with remaining on her paws, avoiding the debris that constantly tried to bring her down, mud clinging to her fur and weighing the rosetted apprentice down. The molly snorted as twigs and leaves began to tangle among her pelt, quickening her pace. Forget the others, they'd get out with time. She just needed to get out of this chaos.
Spriteling 29-Aug-21 01:58 PM
No, no no no no no. I won't drown again! be it in earth or water. She was terrified, shaking, bloodied. But she could feel a voice in her ear, or perhaps a tongue on her forehead, telling her it would be alright. Fernpaw didn't have fear anymore. At least, that's what she believed. Instead, a boiling rage filled her gut. No, I refuse! She felt angry - angry at the rain, the earth, the forest. She had tried to make it her home, why would it betray her like this? All her fear in this moment spilled over. Curses fell from her lips, damning those she had lost. Damning those who she had pushed away. It was everyone's fault, that she should find herself staring down the mouth of the land, its fangs of stone and branch bared. Why was she burdened with this, because of some silly dream Beetlestreak had? Why has she never had a say in her own life! Warm tears rolled down her cheeks. She heard another cry, turning at the sound of her own name, but in her choking anger and returning fear, she wasn't able to respond. She either had to hope to be found, or get out there herself. She whimpered softly, almost resigning herself to her fate, before a strange color hit her nose. It was yellow, like sunlight. She huffed lightly and watched it flutter below her, and in this moment of strange calm a brilliant idea began to swirl all around her. Maybe, for once, she could have a say.. With notable effort, she clawed up the shallow pit she had fallen in, her pelt truly earth toned now. Where are the rest of those marigolds. Her breath was labored, and she definitely sprained something. Yet still, she was determined to continue, her fear and anger and unresolved grief all coalescing into an eerie calm. Come on, I know the patch is here somewhere! There were bright yellow marigolds, just at the top of the quarry outside of camp. She had tended to them with care, for they were used for many things, from infections to coughs. And now, rewriting fates.
spark's clone™ 29-Aug-21 02:09 PM
Cloverpaw | Chaos Unfolding
One moment it was like the camp was comfy, cozy - and the scent and sound of rain had always calmed the bi-colored molly when she was younger, like some sort of nature's lullaby. Now the rain has caused everything to come tumbling down, almost as if the entire world were about to cave in. All that came to Clover's ears was the sound of dozens of screeching yowls of one word, Landslide! Here was a secret Cloverpaw had never really shared with anyone, she despised water and she couldn't swim even if it was for her life. A never before seen expression crossed her face, almost as if she were actually worried for Marbled, for Marigold, and Blazepaw, especially. The cracking of thunder and nearby branches caused fear to pound in the black and white she-cat's chest. She could hardly hear Laurelblaze's instructions over the pounding of her own pulse. Water splashed around her paws and she looked around with an almost disgusted look. Gah, she hated clan cats! But they could definitely swim a lot more efficiently than she could. Her thin pelt dampened and she shivered under the heavy weight of water, wading through the water suddenly with baited breath. But.. what if it got deep? UGH! She wasn't supposed to feel scared. This was awful! Yep, this is it. I'm gonna die trapped in this god awful camp. This is how I'm gonna go out.
tremb 29-Aug-21 02:12 PM
Wrenpaw Time seemed to stand still and and every noise seemed to fade away to mere whispers and echoes around Wrenpaw. It felt as is everything was moving in slow motion, unfolding before her terror struck amber gaze. And then, in an instant everything was back in real time. The sickening sound of sliding earth, the loud pounding of the rain, the screaming of the wind mixed with the yowls of her clanmates, it all came back to her like a harsh blow to the face. She strained hard to hear Laurelblaze’s next words, whipping around to face the Highledge. High ground, yes, that made sense. The muddy furred molly looked around frantically to see if any cat nearby needed her help, as she wouldn’t dare leave anyone behind. It seemed as though she was the one who was falling behind. The panic had overwhelmed her and held her in place for far too long. A determined look plastered across her face, she began to claw her way towards the Highledge. Crack! As loud as the thunder that clapped in the sky the sound of a large tree branch i hinging from a tree cut through the rest of the noise. Wrenpaw looked up just in time to realize that the branch was careening straight towards her. ”Look out!” She screamed, more to herself than any cat else. Scrambling wildly through the mud she managed to escape the thick of the branch, but the other smaller branches landed upon her and sank into her flesh like claws. She screeched in pain, writhing around in the mud as she struggled to free herself from the clutches of the tree branch. Finally she freed herself, a new color of scarlet trickling down her muddied and sodden pelt. Wrenpaw didn’t know where she was bleeding from, and at the moment she didn’t care. Squinting to see through the haze of rain she continued her way towards the higher ground with the rest of her clanmates, a limp in her step.

Spriteling 29-Aug-21 02:20 PM
She dragged herself along the edge of the camp, her front leg twisted in a way where she couldn't really look. The marigold petals were just about within her reach now. She hadn't prayed to starclan in ages; hopefully they'll still accept one made in desperation. Please, don't let me be seen. With a swift bite, she beheaded the golden flowers, their petals all beaten and bruised from the constant rains. "I'm sorry, Marigolddust. The clan has gotten too much for my paws, and you know I've always been the clumsy sort." Smiling softly, she pressed her nose to the center of the flower. "Please, take care of them for me?" Her eyes darted across the camp, trying to find her storm grey friend amidst the chaos. "I love you. I'll be back when I have healed." She bit at the base of the flower, breaking up the petals from each other. Opening her jaw, they scattered into the gale, the heavy rains forcing them into camp proper. Hopefully the flurry of sweet honey blooms wouldn't distract everyone from getting to safety. Forcing herself to be content with such a goodbye, she made quick work of the other flowers, careful not to damage the stems or pick to many, but still scattering the drops of sunlight into the clearing so they would be unmistakable. Hopefully that was enough of a message, and hopefully she could deal with whatever her ancestors had to say about impersonating a sign. Another crack of thunder stole her moment away from her. Trees were rattled by this torrent, looking as if they were going to uproot. And she wasn't going to be around to watch it happen. She had to leave, and quickly. Tripping over herself, the former medicine cat scrambled to get away from the quarry's edge. Perhaps some solitude could be found closer to Skyclan... No no, she had to go to Windclan. Honeysong would surely know what to do. She couldn't confide in Specklerose like she used to. Not since.. ~
The sound of snapping branches made her leave that thought behind as she stumbled away from her home in a blind panic. @Ice @prim @Springy 🦤 @/thunderclan
Ice 29-Aug-21 02:22 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Landslide }
” Damn it!” Icestar snarled, pacing the edge. She couldn’t see through the dust. All she could hear were the cries of panic and anguish and Laurelblaze’s commanding tones. What happened to Fernpaw? Was she imagining things when she heard her call out her name? Were all her Clanmates alright? Where was Bearmask and her kits? Her feathery tail lashed sharply in frustration as she helplessly watched. No one from the forest had arrived yet. She was the only one atop the quarry. Casting quick glances back towards the undergrowth did nothing. Not a familiar face popped out. She didn’t know whether to be grateful that they hadn't arrived at such a dangerous time or worried about what could have happened to them. The rumbling had been too immense to ignore. Were there other spots that had caved in?
Dormamoon 29-Aug-21 02:32 PM
Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
Time appeared to move by so differently. When mere seconds had only passed, it felt like an eternity had taken it's place. The shouts of her clanmates rang out around her as everyone scrambled to help each other and get to safety, but yet it felt like she did not hear a single one as she only wanted to hear one voice at the moment...her eyes darting around to try and find her tom. Her tom? Was she finally admitting her feelings for him in such a time like this? Hardly now was the moment for it, and she was not going to waste any more time on thinking about it. The only thing that mattered right now was making sure Cardinalspark was okay. Honeydrop moved away from the safety of higher ground, desperately searching for the russet male in all of the chaos before her eyes landed on him, trapped underneath a large tree branch. "Cardinalspark!" She did her best to rush over to him, partially sliding over most of the way as she tried to keep the worry and fear from showing on her face, but she had never been one to hide her emotions well. "Are you alright? Oh StarClan, don't worry. I'm going to help you. I'll get you out of here." She had started to mumble in panic, unsure if she was trying to be reassuring to him or for herself as she tried getting a shoulder underneath the branch to help lift up the weight a little. It was in these moments that she wished she was stronger...but she did know one thing...whatever happened, she was not going to leave his side. @wild™
Springy 🦤 29-Aug-21 02:44 PM
Marigolddust • Landslide Loud sloshing seemed to shout at all being close to or inside the camp, the dirty water below him making its own type of hurricane of what had once been on the enterance's camp wall. Fear brimmed his eyes, making his heart feel like it was going to pound through his ribs. Worries for himself quickly turned of that if the others below. He was safe, it seemed, at least for now. Unfortunately, everyone else seemed to be right in danger's path. Fernpaw was the first thought that came to his mind, and he desperately searched below him for the ever familiar sandalwood pelt, yet it was nowhere in sight. Wrenpaw was next, and at first it seemed that she was missing in action as well, although it didn't take so long for him to spot his apprentice as he heard the loud SNAP of a broken branch. Eyes following where the limb would go, he finally found Wrenpaw, although not in the situation he wanted to see her in. "Wren-!" He began, before being interupted by the lading of the branch. His whole being froze in that moment, petrified, until he spotted Wrenpaw climbing to safety. There were so many in danger, so many missing... And no matter how much he cared for them, his cowardly mind held him back, keeping him in safety. Starclan, what a mouse brained fool he was! His thoughts all came to a pause as bright yellow caught his eye. Focusing hard on it, he tried to figure out what it was from so far away. It took a moment, but another one came, and soon another. More and more marigold petals drifted down to the chaos below. He felt his heart sink ad he figured out what exactly was raining down on the destroyed camp.
- Why was it that a bright sight such as this disappointed him? Why was he feeling so... Morbid? Was it because it could have been the petals to flowers Fernpaw could have had moments ago, and this was a sign of her demise? But it seemed too... Intentional. Perhaps it was a sign from Starclan, although what it meant, he wasn't sure. Nor did he feel excited to learn. He searched the remaining ground above for any signs of the cat responsible, but he saw nothing. Only the snowy form of Icestar in the distance, and she was too still to o have been doing this. Where was his Fernpaw? Why were there marigold petals? A petal landed at his paws, and for some reason the bright, cheerful color only made him feel saddened pain. (edited)
wild™ 29-Aug-21 02:57 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
His breathing became heavy as he continued to try and wriggle out from under the branch, though if he moved wrong, he'd get even more tangled up in it. He could already feel the sharp ends cutting into him, entangling themselves among his russet pelt. Come on, Cardinalspark. You cannot go out like this. Forcing his claws into the ground, he attempted to wriggle out from under it instead of forcing it off of him, but alas such a task wasn't an easy one. But he couldn't give up. He couldn't... And then, a familiar voice reached him. The russet's head rose and his gaze met Honeydrop's. His tail shifted a bit, a feeling that was a mix between hope and fear rising within him. He was glad that the molly had found him, forcing the branch up a bit to aid him. Though he knew that time was short and he wasn't sure if they'd make it out in time. This is all my fault. You should've ran, stupid! "I'm glad to see you Honeydrop, but you should get going! I don't know if i'll be able to free myself, much less if we'll have enough time to get out if I do get out!" He replied, slowly pulling himself forward, pieces of bark snagging at his pelt. "You've...you've got to go! Don't worry about me, I just want you safe with the others!" He added after a moment, feeling a pang at his own words. But he wouldn't risk her safety for his own. Nonetheless, he slowly worked his way from under the branch to his best ability though the thought of getting swept away at any moment never left him. @Dormamoon
Dormamoon 29-Aug-21 03:08 PM
Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
Hearing him speak at least gave her the comfort he was still conscious and moving, though the words that left him pierced her heart and soul, shaking her head in response as the tears she fought so hard to hold back slowly came falling down her cheeks. "I am not leaving you, Cardinalspark. I don't care what happens...I am going to stay with you, no matter what." She made the promise, whether he liked it or not, and she was determined to stick by it. Of course, she was utterly terrified, and full of fear as the chances of them dying grew higher, but she could not imagine ever forgiving herself if she left him now. They either both got out, or she would die trying to help him. Honeydrop tried even harder to lift the branch up more, wincing a little as she felt a few areas on her back getting scratched though none of it was that bad. "Come on, Cardinalspark...you're almost there. Just a little bit further." She was trying her best to sound encouraging without acting like they were going to die if he did not end up getting out from underneath the branch soon, but her firm stance was starting to falter as the mud was making it difficult to hold steady for a long amount of time. Please StarClan. Just a little longer. @wild™
prim 29-Aug-21 03:14 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide
The clan was working together it seemed to help the weak and the injured get to safety amidst all the wreckage. They were all working as one even in the face of a tragedy, where many might succumb to fear and panic and be swept away. Not everyone was safe, she knew that, but it was still comforting to know they were all looking out for one another. ”Work together! Don’t leave anyone behind! We can do this ThunderClan!” she was encouraging them, trying to appeal to their loyalty and sense of altruism towards one another. They’d increase their chances of survival if they helped one another, and they were doing it. ”We’re gonna be okay! Everything is going to be okay!” She could never make promises of safety or survival, but if they did, she swore they were going to recover from this and move on, just as they always had in the past. Laurelblaze had an incredible amount of faith in her clan. The deputy had been pulling herself out of the rising muck by clawing her way up the slope that led up to the Highledge, mud caked on her fur and twigs and other junk clinging to her frame. She could feel that her limbs were tired, bruised from debris that knocked into her, but she was otherwise uninjured. Thank StarClan… even if it was a bad time to be thanking their warrior ancestors, she was glad to still be alive. As she began to do the exhausted climb up towards the leader’s den, to safety, she noticed a curious sight. Bright yellow petals were flowing into camp from the medicine cat den, swirling around in the torrent of mud and earth below. What? What was that? her gaze narrowed, and she shook her head as she began to climb higher and higher, away from danger. ”Follow me everyone! Get to the Highledge!
Shadow 29-Aug-21 03:23 PM
Speckleflame stands on the highledge looking down trying to find others who may need his help his leg bleeding and his wound covered in mud. He runs back down the highledge and into the mud helping to grab more kits and helping some elders he brings the kits up and helps the elders up onto the highledge and immediately goes back down to help others. At this very moment he doesn't care that his wound might end up getting badly infected all he cares about is getting his clan mates safe even if he is slowly running out of energy.
Pip 29-Aug-21 03:32 PM
{Sparrowfeather} | Landslide @Bronzewing Sparrowfeather stormed into the camp, restless and upset. How dare Sandstride forget? She didn't even get to carry the squirrel she caught because the rest of the patrol had felt they needed to hold more than necessary. But whatever-. She can move past this. She lifted her head to try and spot Pinefoot out of the crowd. Painfully aware that Sandstide must have just been catching up now. She was moving towards the warriors den. She was going to just make a new nest and hope Pinefoot was in there- but it had started to storm- rain pouring from above and into the clearing but something was up- the water seemed to leak bits of dirt and mud- a big mud glop fell next to Sparrowfeathers paw....grasses and roots were uprooting themselves- bending towards and down to the clearing like they were slowly bowing to the cats. The rain picked up, the wind started to roar in Sparrowfeathers ears- leaves fell into the many puddles forming flying past Sparrowfeather like a flurry of wasps. Sparrowfeather gasped as she finally realized what was going on- she had never seen it happen, but she had heard of landslides happening moons ago... She was startled and panic striken- she had only just begun to move her paws- picking them up slowly- she couldn't look away from the walls...she was afraid if she did, something would happen she couldn't see- she heard this horrible CRACK and a tree hurtled into the camp. Sparrowfeather was dimly aware of cats yowling in fear around her. She finally came to her senses and scrambled to the side- the mud making every step she took agonizing slow as she tried to balance. This all happened in seconds but it felt like minutes...hours... She had barely cleared the large oak. It had slammed in between the camp walls- ...but Sparrowfeather wasn't in the clear. Large rocks fell in to her side and smacked her down. She couldn't breath- she tried to run but more were falling around her. (edited)
Ice 29-Aug-21 03:32 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Landslide }
It felt as if she was stuck in a nightmare. Forced to be a bystander, she watched in utter helplessness as her Clanmates scrambled up the Highledge, led by Laurelblaze. Devastation ravaged her expression as she checked off each of the cats. So much more missing… Her pacing ceased, pausing by what used to be the winding trail that led up to the stone hollow. Now it was blocked by the landslide, preventing her from racing down to help her Clanmates. She was safe while they suffered. Gritting her teeth, Icestar remained rooted to the spot. Pelt drenched in rain water and clinging to her lean-muscled form. What can I do? Out of the corner of her eye, she spotted Marigolddust from where she had heard Fernpaw’s initial cry of her name. Could I even reach him? If she didn’t try, she would never know. Desperation seized her splintered heart as the silvery-white molly searched for solid purchase in the sifting ground. ” Marigolddust!” She cried out. @Springy 🦤
Soop 29-Aug-21 03:37 PM
Gracklequiver and Gullykit
As the environment began to rumble, Gullykit's heart had alrrady started to race. The tense atmosphere. Crashes, crackles, yowls of fear drowning out the ones that were trying to help. He knew it all too well. The flashes of fear in his mother's eyes and her chokes and gurgles as the overflow of water constricted her throat and lungs. Gullykit and his grandmother had really tried to help, but this just hadn't been enough. And as the rushes of fear ebbed into his veins, it almost tuned out the cries of his grandmother. Loose earth, rock, and shredded plants blocked Gullykit's road to his grandma. "Grammy!" he shrieked, trying to call to her over the immense sounds of panic attacking his ears and sending a high pitched whine into his ears. No, no no no no no! he thought in panic. He didn't care what his grandmother thought of him - she was the only family he had left and he would not lose her! Scrabbling desperately through the loose earth, the small tabby tom thrashed through the mud and branches, adrenaline blocking out the pain from the scrapes and scratches and splinters daggering, slicing, and scraping his legs. Before long, he felt the mud rising, and soon his legs were fastened to the ground by the mud as it edged closer to every nook and cranny of ThunderClan's camp. NO, NO, NO NO NO NO! NO! All that raced through Gullykit's mind was just that as the earth surrounded his vision, blacking out his thoughts, filling his nose and throat. This can't be happening... - [ i missed so much sjzjsjkz i hope i didnt do anything that goes against anything - ]
wild™ 29-Aug-21 03:44 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The rain pelted down upon the two felines, thunder roaring overhead. The russet warrior could feel his strength slowly leaving him, exhaustion coming into play. Honeydrop had refused to leave his side and while such was comforting it was also terrfying. If she dies...it'll be your fault. A quiet voice said to him. He would put himself before her. But he could only do it if he managed to get out. He had to try. He had to. With a heavy breath, he gave a slight nod at the cream-furred warrior's words, dragging himself onward. He grimaced, a hiss escaping from him as the branch cut into his back, but such couldn't stop his progression forward. He might bear some scars at the end of this...but he'd be alive. Hopefully. At last, with one last heave the tom was free. He gasped as he did so, rising upon shaky legs. "Stars, you're stronger than I thought. Next time, we should do this the other way around though." He said to her, a brief smile appearing on his face. "Though seriously...thank you. Let's hope my little stumble won't be the end of us." He added after a moment, urging her onward and toward the higher ground where the rest of their clanmates were gathering. He momentarily noticed the sight of yellow petals flowing about the camp, but there was no time to question the oddity. Turning back, the tom bounded onward, keeping Honeydrop within his sight. @Dormamoon
prim 29-Aug-21 03:48 PM
{Coyotepaw} | Landslide
The young tom had been in the apprentice’s den when the landslide had initially struck, and he was awoken when water and mud began to fill the den. He’d nearly gotten stranded inside before he managed to claw his way out, panting and gasping for air as he struggled to get into the flooding camp. The apprentice stared up at the camp walls, seeing his mother on the outside. He wanted to cry for help, but he was exhausted and out of breath, all he could make out amongst the loud cries of his clanmates and raining debris was the cries of their deputy to get to safety on the Highledge. His gaze traveled towards other members of the clan, until it settled on the familiar caramel pelage of Wrenpaw, as well as the sight of blood staining her pelt. ”Wrenpaw!” he cried out to his friend, before he realized she was climbing out of the way of danger, but she was clearly injured. He could feel stinging on his sides, he’d gotten cut by debris in his way as he clawed out of the apprentice’s den, nearly suffocated by the earth. ”I’ll help you! Keep going!” he called back to his friend, stumbling over rocks and debris in his path as he followed after her via the path she was taking, his fur stained with mud and blood from his own injuries. He needed to get to safety, he was worried about his family and his friends, but the only way he could help them was if he stayed alive! @tremb
Dormamoon 29-Aug-21 03:52 PM
Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
A few more moments, and Honeydrop was sure her strength would have given out, but luckily that did not happen and Cardinalspark was now free. She silently thanked StarClan for the extra bit of strength as she moved away from the branch, letting it drop back down to the ground as she quickly moved forward to nuzzle the tom, though she did not dwell on it since they did not exactly have time to rejoice in the moment of small victory. "Let's hope there is not a next time." She responded, gazing at him with a faint smile before hearing his words. "None of it is your fault." She pointed out softly, before starting forward as he nudged her along, knowing they needed to hurry up before they could get swept under the oncoming landslide. A small yelp escaped her as she slipped, falling to the ground, before scrambling to try and get back up again to keep moving on. Every second counted and none could be wasted. She just hoped they would have enough time to get to high ground...she had to believe they would make it. StarClan wouldn't have given her the strength to help Cardinalspark, just for them to die...right? @wild™
Springy 🦤 29-Aug-21 03:55 PM
Marigolddust • Landslide Yet another interuption snatched his attention, bringing it to another familiar voice, this time belonging to the fem he had spotted not long before. Ears perked and eyes wide, Marigolddust tried to concentrate on what was happening. Was he going to get off of this small ledge? But he was safe here so far, and the idea of trying to move feared his heart with fear. The last thing he needed was to take a wrong step and slip down into the wreckage below, especially when it was still active. "I-Icestar?" He said, his voice weak yet his tone strong enough for her to hear over the sound of wet ground against wet ground. A question was continually ringing in his head, echoing so loudly that it got rid of all other thought. So, what was he to say other than what was filling his brain to the brim? "What should I d-do? How'd this happen?" He stammered, unused to much of any natural disasters. This was new to him, and he couldn't help but wonder how this could have happened to them. They had such strong walls, always keeping them safe from outside dangers... But, for once, their walls had betrayed them, bring death and blood onto their ranks. He doubted he'd ever be able to trust them again, even if they did survive and fix all of this. @Iceywicey#3780
Bronzewing 29-Aug-21 03:56 PM
@Pip
Sandstride|| Landslide
Sandstride followed after with the rest of the patrol, stretching out her paws, still thinking nothing of the Sparrowfeather incident and instead chatting to many of the other nearby cats. Somehow she got into the camp before the new warrior did, moving fast to deposit the prey she had caught before looking at it happily....and what was that noise? Mud. All over the place, falling from the sky, creating puddles on the soft ground, a mess all over the place... Puddles, mud, a disaster, grasses and leaves moving all over the place like a river of land... Sandstride was always good at running in emergencies. It would take her a while to calm down and come back for other cats, instead running in a flurry of paws as far as she could go... the yowling of cats and breaking of ground taking out any other noises in the world. A crack broke the silence and she heard a tree flatten the ground behind her, but she was already too far off, making her way out of there, running as fast as she could... everything felt fast, as if the world was on double speed. Her paws, as fast as a leopard, striking at the ground in speeds unheard of until she was out of the camp, sliding on the wet ground as she moved, seeing other fellow Clanmates running beside her.... It took her a while to realize that other cats were calling out for their friends and families. Sandstride didn't have any real family to call for, but her mind went back to some of her friends- Pinefoot and Sparrowfeather, and some of the cats on the patrol- and this is when she started to hesitate. Was she going to go back there, find the injured cats that she had thoughtlessly left behind? Yes. It was the ThunderClan thing to do.
tremb 29-Aug-21 04:02 PM
Wrenpaw The sound of her name, though cut off from the cracking sound of the branch that had fallen, allowed her to pinpoint her mentor at last. She breathed a sigh of relief knowing that he was okay, and out of harms way for the most part. She didn’t know what she would do if anything had happened to Marigolddust. Again, her own name rang in her ears, though this time it came from another direction and another voice entirely. She spotted her friend, covered in mud, blood and debris just like she was. So much anxiety and fear was lifted away from her shoulders at the sight of her friend. Though she would have felt better if he was already safe on the Highledge, she was grateful that she didn’t have to struggle alone anymore. ”Coyotepaw! Are you okay?” She asked, her features brimming with worry. He looked relatively okay, aside from the blood on his fur that was just visible through the thickness of the mud that clung to him. She supposed he didn’t look too much worse off than she did. She nodded at his next words, turning her attention back towards the outcrop that they were heading for. ”Thanks,” she breathed, panting much more heavily now. Together, they scrambled up the path that led to the Highledge where much of the clan was already gathered. Every now and again she would lose her footing and stumble into Coyotepaw, and she would mutter out and apology. ”Sorry, I hurt my leg when that branch fell,” she panted. Her hind paw stepped on a loose rock which was barely held in place by the unstable ground, and sent it tumbling back down the hill. Her hind leg was pulled out from under her and she fell flat into her stomach, her chin thrusting into the mucky ground. ”Yuck!” She spat. @prim

The camp was in ruins, desecrated beyond repair. She sighed and stumbled to where the clan was gathering. Through hazy eyes she searched for any dead, her clanmates that may have succumbed to the landslide. Queens and kits were reunited, nuzzling each other as they embraced. Apprentices and warriors grouped together. Wolfshine realized for the first time how alone she was. She looked at her belly in sadness. Ice 29-Aug-21 04:13 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Landslide }
It was quite a good question to ask. How exactly could a structure that was supposed to protect them collapse in on itself? ” Stay where you are!” Icestar commanded. The ledge he had found looked solid enough compared to the unpredictable ground around. ” I’ll come to you!” The silvery-white molly was careful to alternate between sheathing and unsheathing her claws as she slid down slowly, grabbing at any momentary purchase. All it took was one wrong step and she could wrench a claw right out from her paw. Almost there! She was only a few fox-lengths away... Unfortunately, luck wasn’t on her side today. The earth moved again and she was skidding down the slope quicker. The pebbles skittered underneath her. She heard the rock shifting before she saw it rolling forward. ” Marigolddust!” Icestar shrieked out a warning. Instinct seized control of her movements. Her masked face darkened with determination, sea-green optics blazing in its strength. ThunderClan’s leader then darted forward, shoving the young warrior from his safe spot. Standing atop the ledge, Icestar looked at the boulder with widened eyes, backing up to the outermost edge of the ledge but there was no escaping it. In one desperate attempt, the silvery-white molly whirled around and leapt right off. Thick mud sloshed around her dark limbs. Icestar half-slid, half-sprinted down but it was still too steep. Half-way down and her paws caught on a rogue tree branch. A sickening crack and her body tumbled to the ground. She pulled at her stuck paw but only pain shot up into her heart. She caught Marigolddust’s eyes one last time, fear and panic lingering in the depths of her gaze, before the rock reached her. Then it was over. (edited)

”It’s fine, Wrenpaw. If we work together we can get to the Highledge.” he wasn’t going to let go and let his friend potentially die when he had the chance to do something. They were going to get out of this and live to tell the tale. This was not the end! He could feel the mud tugging his friend down, trying to suck her under as it only flooded more and more. He pulled harder, trying to lift her out of the earth without trying to injure her leg. ”I’m not leaving you here! We’re in this together!” he was incredibly loyal to those he considered a friend or family, and he liked to count Wrenpaw among the cats he was closest to. Earth was still falling on her- covering her view to the point it was so heavy she couldn't lift her head up anymore- she sagged under the weight- her mind moving quicker than a rabbit- she didn't know what to do- the dirt was already starting to cover her nose...breathing was getting harder. tremb 29-Aug-21 04:33 PM
Wrenpaw ”Well, I’m glad you didn’t,” she replied, grunting with the effort of pulling the weight of her own body. Exhaustion was making her limbs tremble and quake, as unsteady as the very earth they walked upon. A dark thought entered her mind about what it would have been like if Coyotepaw really had gotten buried alive in the apprentices den. He was her closest friend in the clan, and it was hard to think about going through apprenticeship without him. She shook her head to rid herself of the thoughts, blinking gratefully at the tom as he helped her regain her footing. Wrenpaw was known for being a clumsy cat, but it was even worse now with how slick and wet the ground was, and how utterly exhausted she felt. Her features twisted and scrunched with the effort, but soon she was scrambling back up the slope determinedly again. ”We can do it, we’re almost there!” Wrenpaw said, responding to his encouragement with some encouragement of her own. She wanted to be able to help him just as much as he was helping her. They were getting closer, and as each moment passed it seemed more and more within reach. She nudged Coyotepaw with her nose, beginning to quicken her pace. ”Come on, we’re so close,” she panted, still remaining close to his side. There was no way she was going to reach the top before him. They were going to do this together. Her heart plummeted into her stomach as she heard the yowl of their leader, and she followed Coyotepaw’s gaze to where Icestar was. She winced as he cried out for his mother, who had disappeared beneath a large rock. Oh no. No, no, no, she thought, dark brown ears pinning flat to her skull. She laid her tail across her friends shoulders, bowing her head for a few moments. She couldn’t imagine the kind of pain that he was
feeling. The ground beneath them was growing looser and wetter by the moment, and Wrenpaw knew they had to keep going. ”I’m so sorry Coyotepaw, but we have to keep going. The ground won’t hold much longer,” she murmured softly, nudging him towards the top of the rise. @prim
wild™ 29-Aug-21 04:37 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The tom was exhausted beyond belief, his gaze beginning to fade just a tad. They'd come so far, yet they were nowhere near being close to things being over. All about him cats were experiencing some sort of chaotic event within that which was already happening. All the noise, wind, rain and emotions...he'd merely wish to curl up into a ball and cease from existence for the time being. There was just so much and more and more continued to happen. He could hardly take it. For once, the tom's usual playful nature faded entirely, even Honeydrop's words did little to soothe his worries. He might've not caused everything, but their lives could very well be on the line...well, more than they already were. But there seem to be just the slightest bit of hope nearby. The ledge. "We're nearly there." He noted after a moment, eyes poised upon where many others gathered. But alas, that hope would banish within an instant, as he watched in horror as their leader fell, a boulder falling upon her. He nearly fell upon the ground in despair, dread resting upon his face. Was she...dead? "No...No!" He hated this. He hated it all so much, and yet it seemed as if the destruction would never end. "Let's hurry...we have to get to safety..." spark's clone™ 29-Aug-21 04:40 PM
Cloverpaw | Chaos Unfolding

It wasn't like it was the clan cats' fault that she was in this mess.. it was the stupid weather. Her family would be safe, and it wasn't like she could care anyway. Her mother hadn't been there for her, Grouse hadn't been there, and now Rooksnap wasn't here. Why should she care to ask for help anyways? She didn't need it. A soft gasp passed her lips as she felt the heavy weight of an object suddenly land on her paw. When the ground had gave way, there had been a rock that had broke lose from the ground.. and she had blocked it's path. Her paw was caught! WHY is this happening to me? She snorted. Yet as stubborn as Cloverpaw was, she didn't dare call for help. That would show weakness.. something she wasn't. She wasn't stupid, though. She knew she was in danger.. but she was.. almost. there. Pulling with all her might, the scrawny she-cat bit into the inside of her lip and pulled with all her might to release her paw from the boulder's grasp. "Ugh!" Her paw sliced against the sharp edge of the rock, but with a wince and a soft but painful intake of air, it was free. Ow... She thought to herself but pushed further up the hill, totally choosing to ignore her gimpy walk and the blood stain that tainted her the white parts of her pelt. See? Who needs help? But as Cloverpaw made her way up, she hadn't realized just how dizzy causing herself so much pain had made her.... And nausea followed soon after.

Springy 🦤 29-Aug-21 04:46 PM
Marigolddust • Landslide Stay where he was... That sounded like a good plan to his ears. He wasn't sure he would have had the guts to move even if he had been directed to by the silver point. "Okay, please be careful," he said, although his strong words had weakening into muttering as he anxiously watched Icestar's slow progress down the slope to him. If she fell, would he be able to catch her? What if she slipped out of his grasp? Would he even have much of a grasp while being so... Distracted? Another snap met his earlobes, causing him to freeze, eyes on a significantly large part of the ground above. The boulder was unexpected, but at the same time he felt he shouldn't have been surprised by the large rock. Everything else was falling, why wouldn't it? What truly startled him, though, was the pressure that came to his side suddenly. Gasping, he was pushed backwards. He felt his side land on a wet piece of ground sticking out of the majority of the deep mud. He barely managed to focus on what was going on again. But, he barely managed to; unfortunately, he witnessed everything after he was pushed away. His eyes met the icey hues of the leader's for just a moment before her form was completely taken over by the hard flank of the stone. Everything seemed to freeze besides the tightening in his chest and the frantic towel that left his maw, a louder noise than any that he had made since this all began. "ICESTAR!" The exclamation was tense, full of panic, horror, regret, and more.
- He laid there on his side for a moment, eyes as wide as they could be as he stared at where Icestar had been standing just moments before. He wasn't sure how to react. The only emotion he could truly distinguish was the pain of the guilt that he felt with the knowledge that Icestar had last her life for his own. Why had she done it? Her life was so much more necessary than his! The clan needed her! He didn't even know how much she had lost already. What if this was her last one? Suddenly, the earth beneath him began to crumble apart with the pressure of the muddy water. Frantically, he splashed through the water, trying to find some sort of sturdy ground he could use as an island. He sent one more look to where he had witnessed Icestar's death before focusing on where Laurelblaze and the rest had seemed safety. Although his side ached with bruises, he made his way to the temporary refuge and, after some moments, he made it to the top of the rock with the others. He panted, his eyes watering yet no tears having the confidence to fall.
Shadow 29-Aug-21 04:52 PM
Speckleflame nods and sets her down gently laying her flat. "im going to go find more stay here" he says going back down into the mud.
@Stark✨@ruby ♡

@Pip
Sandstride| Landslide| Rescuing
Sandstride came back, moving fairly quickly, jumping over piles of mud and grasses that had been uprooted from the landslide. How much of the camp was destroyed by the landslide? How much was different just off that one horrible swoop?! The dens... the food they had just caught.... any cats left behind... it was horrible, and she didn't want to think about the mess that would happen afterwards. If the land had already finished destroying the camp, she would do her best to help any cats that had been trapped... or maybe just cleanup. Of course she wasn't looking forward to it, but it was part of what she needed to do as a warrior of ThunderClan. She rushed in, looking for any cats she could help dig out, or anybody she could assist... any cats she could save from the landslide would be good. She didn't bother sitting around and instead hopped over the luckily stopped slide of mud, looking for any signs of cats...
Dormamoon 29-Aug-21 05:05 PM
Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
Hearing the hopeful words that they were almost there, almost to the ledge which would grant them safety, just like how their other clanmates were currently situated on top of it, away from the chaos that seemed to reign down below them. But the moment of light, of something hopeful, slowly was distinguished as she watched in horror when the beloved leader of ThunderClan was...crushed. It was a terrifying sight to behold, and her whole body seemed to freeze to the spot. Did...did their leader just die? She almost could not believe it...but why would StarClan allow such a thing? Honeydrop was drawn out of her thoughts as Cardinalspark spoke again, knowing he had seen the horrific death just like she had. She felt almost lost for a moment, as if she was unsure what to do or how even to get past this, but every instinct in her body was still reminding her to run. A landslide was still coming at them, and no matter how much she wished she could do something....Icestar was gone. There was a moment of hesitation before she started moving again, making sure the tom was still beside her as they headed to the ledge. How was ThunderClan going to be able to recover from this? @wild™

prim 29-Aug-21 05:12 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide
While she’d been overseeing the evacuation of their warriors to the Highledge, she’d been taking shelter somewhere relatively safe from the majority of the chaos. Her spot was elevated, and she’d been guiding her clanmates up the slope in order to get them out of the mess. The deputy had continued to call out to her clanmates so they knew where to retreat to, to seek shelter from the storm as they prepared to weather it out. She prayed the den would be safe enough from the debris. She didn’t know where else they could escape to. The entrances had been blocked off by boulders, earth, and other obstacles lining their path. When this was all said and done, they’d have to clear it in order to head out into the forest. ”Here! Go go go!” she gestured to her clanmates from above, her tail swaying around behind her as she called to them, trying to catch their attention so they knew where to go once they’d cleared the majority of the debris in their path. She could feel the rain was starting to lighten up, but this was only the beginning, more displaced debris and remnants of dens swept aside from the storm could pose future danger in repair efforts. Ah hell, that’s going to take forever. She shook her head as she let out a small grunt of dissatisfaction, shaking her head as she glanced down at her clanmates struggling to get out of the muck. Their cries for help was making her heart ache, and she’d tried to assist those trying to go up the slope as they climbed through more mud and over slick stones as they went. It was precarious, but it was the safest place they could take shelter in. Then she heard a loud cry of “Marigolddust!” Belonging to a familiar voice, before it was silenced by a loud CRACK and the sound of mud sloshing around and sealing her away. The deputy’s gaze widened in sheer horror, her pupils narrowing to slits as she let out a loud, shrill cry. ”ICESTAR!” she yowled for the lynx-point she-cat she’d served as her second-in-command, her throat tightening up as she saw muddy water begin to rise up towards her paws and where she stood. I can’t leave her, she’ll drown! She can’t die here! she shook her head as she let out a growl, before jumping into the muck and slowly trudging over to where the leader had been buried under the stone. ”I’m coming Icestar! Don’t you DARE die on me! I’ll kill you if you die!” she hissed aloud as she struggled through the current and the debris, but she was not going to stop. ”I’ll get Icestar, everyone else get to the Highledge! You will NOT throw your lives away for me!” she snarled at her clanmates she could see, insistent on being the one to rescue Icestar, if she even could. She didn’t want anyone to die for her, she refused to let them. The deputy would gladly sacrifice her own life if it meant her clanmates were safe. ”I’m here Icestar! I’ll get you out!” she wasn’t strong enough to push a boulder of that size, but she could try displacing it by digging out the earth holding it in place. It was wet and easy to manipulate, and she’d been clawing at the earth desperately to free the lynx-point leader from her tomb, her ears flattened against her head as she felt water rush around her paws. ”Come on, come on! LOOSEN ALREADY, DAMN IT!” she hissed as she continued to scrape at the mud holding the boulder in place, before one particularly loose piece of earth came free and the large rock got swept away, but not without her having to evade it’s path. ”Icestar!” she could see white fur stained both red and brown, and her heart sank. ”Icestar! Its Laurelblaze, you’re not dying that easily!” @Ice
Springy 🦤 29-Aug-21 05:20 PM
Marigolddust • Landslide The warrior didn't receive much time to recover, as it didn't take long for his sister's voice to meet his ears. Quickly trying to shake off the forming tears, he looked over to meet eyes that matched his in color. Even more panic sprung up at him. The Icestar situation had caused more stress to be built on those in danger, and he couldn't wait to see his sister share the leader's fate. "Daisyglow! I'm coming, hold on!" He called, his voice shaky as he went as close to the edge as he could manage. He brought down a paw to try and catch her's in, hoping that he could help her high enough up to grab her scruff and drag her out of the mud. It would need some cooperation from both of them, especially since Marigolddust wasn't the strongest, but he could only hope it would work. @ruby ♡
Pip 29-Aug-21 05:26 PM
{Sparrowfeather} | Landslide. | Trapped @Bronzewing Sparrowfeather wanted to give up. She couldn’t move. It all seemed too difficult. Everything had always been. Water and mud was in her mouth. She could feel it when her lungs would expand to take a painful breath. She didn’t want to die… not really. But what choice did she have? It was probably impossible for anyone to see her- and who would look under the dirt for her when there were others cats out in the open that needed help? But she couldn’t die… please… not like this. She couldn’t move but she could make noise. She yowled under the debris. Knowing it would make little noise from all the cats scurrying around. But she needed to try… she screamed and yowled. It sounded so loud in her ears. She was going on and on. She went until her throat was hoarse. Until she felt like the earth was enveloping her insides. And she went silent again. She tried to kick out… maybe move any dirt above her but she doubted she was successful. She couldn’t breath well anymore. Her vision was clouding up. Which made little difference as the soil was against her eyes. She found it harder to think…. Her lungs wanted air but she couldn’t do anything about it. She felt her grasp of reality slip away… her eyes lids were already closed and it was dark. And she simply dipped into unconsciousness.

wild™ 29-Aug-21 05:52 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Cardinalspark could hardly believe the tragedy that Thunderclan had undergone in such a short period of time. The flooding was bad, the landslide even worse. He'd thought that there would've been a point where they'd be able to catch their breath, retreat to safety and then return. But regardless of where he looked, he only saw signs of trouble, destruction and despair. He had no idea how to react to it all. He merely felt...tired. Once reaching the ledge, the tom half-heartedly pulled himself up, turning around to aid Honeydrop if she needed such. His ears drooped, tail dangling just above the ground as he watched Laurelblaze bolt to where their leader had been crushed only moments before. He hoped that somehow, the stars had protected her...but a sickening feeling in his stomach doubted such. All of this had happened...would they be spared in the slightest? As he gazed about, he noticed that Fernpaw was nowhere to be found either. They couldn't have just lost two important figures among the clan...could they? Once Honeydrop had joined him, the tom settled down, a helpless expression upon his face. "A-Are you alright? Please tell me if something is wrong..." He asked after a moment, though silently hoping nothing was. "So much has happened...I don't know what to make of it." @Dormamoon

Marigolddust • Landslide Marigolddust could hardly hold back his own stressed filled sobs, although the fact that they were going to come at all made him feel shameful. Nobody else seemed on the verge of crying, so why was he? It could have easily been because of the fact that he had witnessed a death of a cat important to him because of him, or perhaps it was the lack of knowledge on Fernpaw's wellbeing or the landslide in general. Why would this happen? Couldn't the cats among the stars that they followed so faithfully have helped them? Clenching his teeth, he pulled up his sister with a final tug, releasing her from the mud. He let out a shaky yet releived breath, giving his sister a weak smile to show he was happy they had gotten her out. Soop
Gracklequiver and Gullykit
As the environment began to rumble, Gullykit's heart had alrrady started to race. The tense atmosphere. Crashes, crackles, yowls of fear drowning out the ones that were trying to help. He knew it all too well. The flashes of fear in his mother's eyes and her chokes and gurgles as the overflow of water constricted her throat and lungs. Gullykit and his grandmother had really tried to help, but this just hadn't been enough. And as the rushes of fear ebbed into his veins, it almost tuned out the cries of his grandmother. Loose earth, rock, and shredded plants blocked Gullykit's road to his grandma. "Grammy!" he shrieked, trying to call to her over the immense sounds of panic attacking his ears and sending a high pitched whine into his ears. No, no no no no no! he thought in panic. He didn't care what his grandmother thought of him - she was the only family he had left and he would not lose her! Scrabbling desperately through the loose earth, the small tabby tom thrashed through the mud and branches, adrenaline blocking out the pain from the scrapes and scratches and splinters daggering, slicing, and scraping his legs. Before long, he felt the mud rising, and soon his legs were fastened to the ground by the mud as it edged closer to every nook and cranny of ThunderClan's camp. NO, NO, NO NO NO NO! NO! All that raced through Gullykit's mind was just that as the earth surrounded his vision, blacking out his thoughts, filling his nose and throat. This can't be happening... - [ i missed so much sjzjsjkz i hope i didnt do anything that goes against anything - ]

prim 29-Aug-21 08:16 PM
{Coyotepaw} | Landslide
The sight was unbelievable, his mother, flattened under a large boulder hurled by the torrent of mud and rainwater. He let out a shaky breath as he felt tears begin to form at the rims of his gaze, only to be forcefully snapped back to reality by the voice of Wrenpaw. He sniffed quietly, rubbing his eyes as he tried to bury it, she was right. They couldn’t keep standing here, and supposedly his mother had multiple lives, if she lost one, she’d be okay! She had to be! His stomach was still sinking at that thought, she still died, he witnessed it happen, and she’d be coming back like nothing ever happened. What a horrible way to live, remembering the pain of all the injuries and illnesses that took your life before. He turned towards his friend silently, nodding a bit as he tried to breathe. Never had he felt so scared so horrified by what he had seen. How did his mother cope with the physical trauma? Did her body just magically return to it’s former state whenever she lost a life? How would she deal with something like this? Coyotepaw never wished to see something like this, it was too horrific. He was glad he didn’t see any of his siblings around, they might not have seen it happen. His siblings. His father. The young tom visibly shuddered, his eyes widening further as he realized his family might have been trapped. Here he was, escaping to safety when they might have been trapped, might have died. ”B-But, my family, they might be-“ he stopped himself from protesting, if he left now, he might put her in danger, he might get them both killed. The best course of action was to keep going, so he could at least keep them both safe. No matter how bad he felt about the whole situation. It was unfair. Please, if anyone hears this prayer, keep my family safe! @tremb

[ Scorpionpaw ] W-what was that? His lime shaded optics grew wide as his ears picked up more cries of.. his Clanmates? Panic swelled in him as he drew closer, picking up speed as his ginger tabby pelt dashed through the entrance of camp. Immediately his vision was greeted with frantic cats, foul scented fear scent rushing through his nostrils like a skunk’s gas. It was only then that his mind processed what else he was seeing. Earth. Mud. Everywhere. It was steadily building up - splats of it lapping at his paws. Though none of it registered in his mind as he stood there, frozen in confusion and astonishment, each and every strand of fur prickling on edge. ”Wh-whats happening..” he alas piped out, shuddering backwards, the wails around him growing louder than anything he’d ever heard before. wild™ 29-Aug-21 08:34 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Disaster had pounded down on Thunderclan since the skies had begun to weep, perhaps a sign all along that chaos would befall them in the near future. Flooding, a landslide and even death had all happened within this short amount of time, even she couldn't fathom what had happened nor how she hadn't gone insane among the destruction that raged about them. Letting out a breath, the tabby worked her way through the brown sea of mud, violet eyes flickering about to locate any struggling felines. For a good while, she believed that she'd be able to make it to safety without a singular thought spared to help another. Before long, a cry rang out among those around her, another cry for help among the dozen others. Whiskers quivered slightly, momentarily questioning the idea of seeking out the source before grudgingly doing so. Her gaze landed on an elderly tom, whom seemed to be having some sort of trouble. With a huff, the molly approached him awkwardly. "Speckleflame." she named the tom aloud, moving toward his side. "Relax. Just walk alongside me and we might get to safety." She said to him, wondering how much the injured tom would slow her pace. Hopefully, he wouldn't end up being the death of them both. Thus, she slowly began moving through the mud again, keeping close to the tom's side to guide him. @Shadow
Soop 29-Aug-21 08:36 PM
Gracklequiver and Gullykit

No matter how much she tried, she hadn't been able to free herself as the moist earth caved over her, clogging her muzzle of its soily contents and preventing, no, depriving her lungs of any oxygen. She had tried, she really did, to free herself. Claws scraping against the dirt that seemed to get thicker as she fought it, and thrashing around like a worm to find any opening. Anything at all. Bronzewing 29-Aug-21 09:42 PM
@Pip
Sandstride | Helping
She scratched at the mud, claws sharp and getting caked with dirt before they were no longer effective- she took a second to clean them by rubbing them against the ground before she got back to work trying to free any cat she could see. It wasn't easy to do, and she could sometimes hear cats in her mind and scratch at the ground when nobody was there- or was somebody, and she was leaving the site of another trapped cat? Sandstride had no idea. But she did hear one faint yowl and rushed over, digging at the ground with heavy breaths before she found the area right above the cat- the noises were right below her. She tapped on the earth above before digging, making sure the cat held on for a bit longer before she could haul them up. Her paws were tired, and she was moving at a slower pace-
Pinefoot | Helping
He rushed into camp, realizing what had happened. His thick fur quickly got soiled with mud as he plunged into the dirt, scratching to reveal dens and whatever was left of the fresh-kill pile, tearing things apart with heavy claws... he was a stronger cat, built for the fight and not speed, and the dirt gave way to his claws. He was tired, barely able to move a lot of the time, but after his many days of constant patrols he had more stamina than he would expect from himself. He noticed Sandstride and moved over to help, picking up where the tired tan cat had left off, tearing apart grasses and twigs and the wings of birds- he wondered where his own bird had gone- before he finally saw a scrap of a cat, breathing, alive, unconscious. He ducked his head in, picking up the cat, the dirt making them hard to recognize especially in his frenzied state. And he turned back to Sandstride, but she was already digging at another spot. Guess he should get this cat out of here at least, and he started to move.
wild™ 29-Aug-21 09:57 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The tabby rolled her eyes, before letting out a breath. "Well, I'm no medicine cat, but I'm sure that'll all go away with time. For now...we'll have to wait until some of this chaos dies down. in the meantime, you can rest a bit." @Shadow
Shadow 29-Aug-21 10:00 PM
he lays down with a sigh closing his eyes since he can't do anything which upsets him because he may have to retire@wild™
tremb 29-Aug-21 11:25 PM
Wrenpaw Wrenpaw didn’t know what to do or what to say. All she knew was that she felt horrible for her friend, and that she would do anything within her power to help him. Realistically there wasn’t much that she could do, but that had never stopped her before, and it certainly wouldn’t now. If Coyotepaw had asked her to leap back into the landslide to go look for the rest of his family, she wouldn’t hesitate. Of course, she knew he’d never ask her to do such a thing. The familiar feeling of helplessness settled in; a feeling that Wrenpaw hated more than anything. Deep down she knew that there was nothing she could do to make Coyotepaw’s current situation any better. She couldn’t bring his mother back, she couldn’t hunt down the rest of his family, and she couldn’t find the words to comfort him because those words probably didn’t exist. After all, how do you comfort someone after something like that? So much loss and so much grief hung in the air around her, she felt as though she might collapse under the weight of it all. How many other clanmates would they bury after this was all said and done? The one thing she could be grateful for was that she and her friend had made it safely onto the Highledge. After that, everything else was uncertain. She lay her tail upon his shoulders once more, and pressed gently against his side in a feeble attempt to comfort him. ”Hey, it’s gonna be okay.” Was it? She didn’t even think she believed the words that had come out of her mouth, so why would he? ”Maybe it won’t be okay, but I’ll be here no matter what. And I promise you that I’ll help you find the rest of your family. Okay? I promise.” She said. Sighing heavily, she scanned what was left of the clearing with somber amber eyes. Her home didn’t even look like home anymore. Every den had been ripped apart and washed away, and the large amounts of mud and debris and floodwater made everything else look
unrecognizable. It seemed like only moments ago she’d been sitting in the clearing watching the rain fall. She let out a long, shaky sigh, realizing only now that her entire body was trembling. Was there any coming back from this sort of devastation? @prim
Ice 30-Aug-21 06:28 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Landslide }
Icestar’s prone body remained still underneath the thick sludge. She was long gone. The shrieks of anguish and Laurelblaze’s threatening snarls did not reach her ears. Just like with the lives she had lost before, the silvery-white molly was slowly healing from the injuries obtained from the collision. However, if she wasn’t rescued soon, another life would soon be lost from suffocating amidst the mud. Icestar! She finally heard her name being called again as she returned to her body. She instantly felt cool air brushing against parts of her fur as Laurelblaze slowly recovered her bit by bit. While her wounds were no more, blood splattered along her fur in gruesome ways, mixing in with the mud that coated her body. She couldn’t respond yet or struggle to escape. Not when her senses still haven’t fully returned. Hurry up! She thought angrily, wishing to thrash until she got out. @prim
Pip 30-Aug-21 07:24 AM
{Sparrowfeather} | Landslide | Saved @Bronzewing Sparrowfeathers head lolled to the side as she was roughly picked up from the debris. As soon as her body hit the air and was moved away her eye lids snapped open, blinking rapidly to move the dirt away from her eyes on an instinct as Sparrowfeather began to cough up dirt and mud from her mouth. Taking in stuttering gasps of air. But she wasn’t allowed to breath long. She was picked up quickly and rushed over to the safe area the camp had made away from the wreckage. She was still taking in grateful breaths. She finally got a good look at the cat that had lead her out- to her knowledge anyway. ”Pinefoot!” she chocked. ”You’re okay!” He was barely recognizable because of the soil that almost covered his pelt. She couldn’t feel any pain yet and wasn’t sure if she was hurt. But she still stumbled forward weakly. ”Is Sandstride okay?” she meowed worriedly. She looked to the anxious meows of their clanmates. Already dealing with wounded cats and bowed over the dead quietly. Sparrowfeather looked at the scene with shock before realizing that more cats were probably still trapped. ”Pinefoot- what can I do to help? Are there more trapped? What’s going on!” she doubted he had any more answers than her but she wanted to know so badly.
prim 30-Aug-21 09:09 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide
The rain was starting to soften up, and the dark storm clouds were beginning to part above to reveal bright blue skies ahead. Light was streaming through these cracks in the clouds, almost dramatically like they were spotlights upon the figures in the camp. Yet it also revealed just how much devastation this storm had wrought upon the camp. The dens were buried under earth, some likely being completely destroyed from the rubble. Laurelblaze could see the branches and ferns that were sticking out of the mud at odd angles, the nursery was lost for sure. I pray everyone got out of there, if we lost any kits in this storm, it’d be tragic… she winced at the thought, before she stared down at Icestar at her paws. Her body was looking less-mangled than she would have expected from a boulder landing on a cat. Yet she still didn’t appear conscious, the injury must have been bad, ”After something like that, she must have lost a life… I gotta get her to safety.” Laurelblaze crouched down into the mud and picked up the lynx-point leader by her scruff with her teeth and pulled her out of the muck. She then crouched again underneath the paler-toned she-cat and hauled her over her shoulders. It was better than being dragged over debris, and she could keep her nose above the water and mud in case she ever regained her breath. Staying down here even when the storm was ending wasn’t a good idea, they had to wait and make sure everything was stable before daring to enter camp and attempt repair efforts. The clan lost a majority of their dens to the crumbling earth and the mud, and she could see even from here the entrances to camp were sealed. Nobody could get in, and nobody could get out. They’d starve to death if they didn’t get to work on that right away so they could get supplies funneled in, that was to be a priority, aside from rescue efforts. But if someone got caught under the mud and debris by now, we’d just be retrieving bodies. She squeezed her eyes shut at the thought, she hadn’t seen any of her kits or her mate during this entire ordeal, and it was killing her. She prayed they were still out on patrol or somehow made it to the Highledge where they’d be safe. They needed to do a headcount to be sure. Laurelblaze began to ascend the steps to the Highledge with Icestar hanging over her shoulders, being careful not to jostle her in this sensitive state she was in. She’d likely wake up momentarily, but she wanted to be courteous to her at this time. Getting a life taken away was always an arduous ordeal, and she had to be gentle about it. Once she’d stepped up to the ledge that jutted out from the leader’s den, Laurelblaze slipped Icestar off her shoulders and softly placed her against the ground. Here, she could recover without worrying about suffocating. ”We got you, Icestar, don’t take too long though because you might worry a lot of cats.” @Ice
Shade 30-Aug-21 04:44 PM
"Wolfshine!" A familiar voice echoed from the top of the quarry. Needlestripe crouched there, a paw outstretched down towards his clanmates. He'd opened up a small hole in the barrier, enough to haul cats through to safe ground but not permitting debris that would hurt them. At least, he kicked away the branches that rammed into his back, water spilling around him. His voice and tabby figure were muted behind the sheets of rain, but his eyes were intent on the white she-cat. "Bring her up to me, you'll be safer up here." A crumbling wall was no place for an injured cat and her rescuer. Especially not Wolfshine. @Stark✨ @ruby ♡
Shade 30-Aug-21 04:54 PM
In the recent weather training had come to a complete halt, and while she loved spending more time with Juniperpaw in the apprentice's den while rain washed normalcy away outside, she found it hard to enjoy being trapped in a storm with him now. It was on this fateful day that the bad omens gathered into one collective disaster - a landslide, and while Tigerpaw was lucky to have gotten out of it mostly unscathed, she wandered frantically at the top of the camp now, searching for her most precious clanmates. "Juniperpaw! Aspenpaw! Marigolddust! Laurelblaze!" The young tabby, her stripes erased by mud, stopped and whirled around, wide pink eyes searching weary huddles. "Juniperpaw!" @tremb
-Jayfang- 30-Aug-21 05:09 PM
[Jayfang] While not one to usually want to stay in camp, Jayfang absolutely despised rain and water. He hated the feeling of wet fur slowing him down, and would do anything to avoid it. After arriving back at camp from that patrol where they found the very peculiar dead bodies that Jayfang hadn't thought about much, he swiftly lunged for one of the dens to take shelter in. He hadn't even thought about which den, just the nearest one with sturdy walls that surely wouldn't collapse. And for the most part, he was right. The walls of the den hadn't collapsed. But the walls of the camp did. Mud and dirt fell into camp, and though Jayfang tried to run out of the den to escape the landslide—he'd prefer to be wet than to suffocate—but he wasn't fast enough, and the dirt caught him within it. @cake @Shade @Whoever else I was suppose to ping-
Stark✨ 30-Aug-21 05:16 PM
Wolfshine|Needlestripe The pale white warrior was tending to Irispetal when her ears suddenly pricked at an all too familiar voice. Joy surged through her as she spotted Needlestripe on top of the cliff. Finally, she had felt less alone. Her earlier thoughts of motherly longing faded. A friend had made that better… or maybe something more… She shook her head and grabbed the young warrior by the scruff. Irispetal was still unconscious, which made the job even more difficult. Wolfshine hauled her up to where the Tom was standing, hoping he could grab hold of her. @Shade @ruby ♡ (edited)
tremb 30-Aug-21 05:21 PM
A scowl was painted across the large silver tabby’s face as he trudged through mud that was up to his underbelly, creating a rather loud sucking sound every time he took a step. ”Mousedung!” He spat. Despite his aggravation, his silver gaze glittered with worry as he struggled through the mud and debris. He had been outside of the camp hunting when the landslide had happened, and came back to witness the entire camp destroyed. Most of his clanmates seemed to be okay up on the Highledge, but right now he didn’t really care about them. He hasn’t seen Tigerpaw since the morning of the landslide, and he was worried sick. She wasn’t inside the camp, that had to mean that she was safe, right? He prayed to StarClan that she hadn’t succumbed to the floodwaters or the deep blankets of mud that had consumed everything. Large black ears swiveled upon his skull as a faint voice was carried across the breeze, and hope flared within his chest. ”Tigerpaw! Tigerpaw!” He howled, clawing his way faster through the muck towards the sound of her voice. He paused again, chest heaving as his breath came in rapid pants. Again, he heard the sweet melody of her voice, closer this time. He carried on until finally the molly was finally in his sights, relief flooding over him to see that aside from being caked in mud, she looked okay. He pressed his nose into her cheek, a deep purr rumbling in his throat. ”Tigerpaw, I’m so glad you’re okay!” @Shade
Bronzewing 30-Aug-21 09:49 PM
@Pip
Pinefoot || Rescuing
The thick brown cat breathed in heavily, tired after his work- he didn't speak much, conserving his breath for the digging. He was a mess, not covered in as much dirt as some of the trapped cats but still a deeper brown than his usual ruddy pelt due to the mud inside it. He wouldn't even groom that- he would probably dip into the lake, honestly. This was so bad that he would prefer water over having his tongue touch even a bit of this. He watched the cat he had rescued breathe before he started to pad back to the dirt. He turned his head back to answer their questions, at the same time eyes darting around to find more and more possible cats to dig out. "Sandstride is helping to dig out more cats. She's fine, albeit as tired and muddy as I am. he meowed. There are more trapped, but you don't need to worry about it. You should be getting to a medicine cat, or at least resting. He looked back towards Sandstride, who was already working on getting another cat free. Were the rest of the cats still alive? he wondered, but even if they were not, he would at least get their bodies back to the Clan for vigil. (edited)
Pip 30-Aug-21 10:00 PM
{Sparrowfeather} | Landslide @Bronzewing Sparrowfeather knew she wasn’t fit for going out and helping but she still felt an immense amount of guilt staying back as Pinefoot went back into the mess of the camp. She couldn’t bother Fernpaw- she has no idea where the she-cat even was. And other cats needed help much more than she did. She tried to focus on taking in large breaths. Amazed how easy it was to breath. She had taken it for granted… She looked around, seeing how filthy and distressed every cat was, like her, had either gotten out as everything collapsed or was saved. Her mind wasn’t even focusing on how bad it was to be trapped under the Earth. It was almost like she had made it out when everyone else did. And that’s what she told herself. To shove away the image of boulders falling on cats and covering her vision. She gingerly stood up. But that was enough in itself- she gave a painful gasp- her side was jabbing her- like someone has taken a rock and was grinding it against her ribs. She couldn’t rest either. Her adrenaline was so high that her mind was buzzing. Casting a sad glance at the camp she resulted to trying to help the cats in the pitiful huddle as much as she could. Very slowly making her way to grab moss, drench it in a nearby stream of water and giving it to anyone who needed it. Which was a lot of cats…

tremb 30-Aug-21 10:45 PM
Following her question, the tom looked himself over, appalled with his own appearance. As far as injuries, it was hard to tell beneath all of the mud that clung to his long pelt. His claws felt sore from tearing through the sodden earth, and he was certain the stinging he felt on his flanks and sides were scratches from branches and other debris. Aside from that, and the fact that his pelt felt as heavy as stones, he felt okay. ”I think I’m fine. I’m sore.. I’m tired, but I’m alright. I’m better now,” he said, not hesitating to rasp his tongue softly over her head. It was a little muddy, sure, but he didn’t care. He had grown a lot more comfortable with showing her affection lately, especially now after being so worried about her. The silver tom wasn’t sure what he would have done if he couldn’t have found her, or worse, if he’d found her dead somewhere. His silver gaze was clouded as he peered down over the camp. What once had been there home was unrecognizable. The amount of time and strength that it was going to take to rebuild seemed like an impossible task. ”Everything is ruined. I don’t even know how we will get back inside camp,” he said, flattening his ears in frustration. And how was he going to get all this mud off of himself? He certainly didn’t fancy jumping into a stream, nor did the like the idea of grooming it all off. This was absolutely awful. Had it not been for Tigerpaw at his side, his mood surely would have been much worse. @Shade
Shade 30-Aug-21 11:01 PM
