tremb 30-Aug-21 11:19 PM
Juniperpaw stared over at Tigerpaw, suddenly feeling a bit uneasy. ”What do you mean? Where… where do you want to go?” He relished in the warmth of her body as she pressed up against him, even though they were both muddy and soaking wet. He had to admit, he didn’t want to go back to camp that badly either. It was in ruins, and without a doubt he knew that the apprentices den was destroyed along with everything else. There wasn’t even a warm dry nest to go back to. The day was still young, and the storm seemed to be blowing away after weeks of downpour. He supposed they could go anywhere, if they really wanted to. Of course their clanmates would probably expect the worst if they just disappeared like that. Juniperpaw felt rather unsure about their current situation, but there wasn’t anything he wouldn’t do for Tigerpaw. If she didn’t want to go back, then they wouldn’t be going back. @Shade
Shade 30-Aug-21 11:38 PM

tremb 30-Aug-21 11:46 PM
A frown formed upon his lips, feeling a bit sad at how disappointed she sounded. Had he not said the right thing? He barely had the energy to care anymore. He was famished and exhausted, and more than anything he just wanted to get dry, clean, and to lay down beside Tigerpaw. At least the rain had finally subsided. Perhaps that would give them some chance at drying off. Juniperpaw felt like he hadn’t been dry in moons. He followed close behind Tigerpaw as she led them to a hollowed out tree. His legs felt shaky, but more than ever he was determined to show Tigerpaw that he could take care of her. ”Maybe I can find us something to eat,” he suggested, sitting down under the tree. @Shade
Shade 31-Aug-21 12:34 AM
Tigerpaw felt her stomach grumble just at the mention of food. Hunting had been difficult in the recent rains, now their fresh kill pile had been washed away, and after this any prey on the territory would be drowned, save for the birds which had long fled. But she wasn't about to turn down his offer. "Sure," her mew was weary but clearly grateful. Before he could stand and leave her, the sodden tabby apprentice reached a paw out from the hollow where she'd curled up and rested it on his. Her round raspberry eyes searched for reassurance. tremb 31-Aug-21 09:59 AM
Silver eyes lowered to stare at her paw as she placed it upon his, a smile returning to his lips. He stretched down to touch his nose lightly to hers for a moment. ”It’s going to be okay,” he promised, although he wasn’t entirely sure. He hoped that everything would be okay, but in the face of so much destruction it was hard to imagine things going back to normal. ”I’ll be back soon. Maybe I can find something on higher grounds,” he said before disappearing into the undergrowth. The rains may have gone, but hunting was still just as bad as Juniperpaw had expected. All he managed to catch was a vole, and by the time he returned to the tree where Tigerpaw was, he was more exhausted than ever. He dropped the vole down at her paws, flopping down beside her. ”Better than nothing, I suppose,” he said, resting his head on his paws. @Shade
Shade 31-Aug-21 12:38 PM
The touch of his nose was icy cold, but just like hers, so she didn't care. Her striped back was turned to the cold forest and she hadn't moved from the position she'd taken when he set out. To his comment she didn't respond. The only sound from her were coarse raspy breaths, and her pelt radiated uncanny heat. Tigerpaw was sick. @tremb
tremb 31-Aug-21 02:31 PM

Soop 31-Aug-21 06:18 PM
Gracklequiver and Gullykit
| @atticuwus Gullykit watched, relief easing his soul and spreading throughout his body to relax his muscles, sheathe his claws which were digging into the ground, and calm his racing heart down. Thank StarClan - his grandmother was alive! Gracklequiver shifted slightly on the ground, relieved to have her small, wrinkled paws plantex back on solid ground, though she shivered at the sight of her beloved camp that had been ruined by this horrid landslide. Though, she was suddenly distracted from her thoughts as Gullykit skittered up to her and hugged her ankle tightly. She gave a raspy breath outward, starting to groom her grandson's fur which was caked with dirt. She decided to answer Larkplume's question for Gullykit, as he seemed too fixed on loving on Gracklequiver. "He's the only one in his litter," Gracklequiver rasped, looking back down at Gullykit with an emotional gaze. "His father, Nighthiss, was convinced he was.." She cut off, lowering her voice to a whisper in hopes it was out of earshot of Gullykit. Leaning slightly forward, she continued. "..Cursed."

marbledpaw | @Shade @-Jayfang- She could see the rain clearing up from above, but as Marbledpaw desperately tried to scramble up the mud that had barraged through the apprentice's den, she found herself stuck, teeth gritting in concentration as she braved through the pelting rain, tail lashing as claws scraped the rocks leading out of camp. She was nearly out when boulders started to crash from behind, a whine creaking from the top of camp. The calico turned with violets wide as something dark and brown and fast swung violently towards her. It missed only to crash her exit. Ears flattened and claws dug into the dirt below. "Kestrel-" she wasn't here. "Fernpaw? Jayfang-" No one was here, either too busy getting stuck or somewhere far away. "I'm going to go find them!" that was the last thing the striped warrior called over his shoulder before leaping back down into the quarry, his silver pelt melting in with the rain. @Stark✨
Shade 03-Sep-21 01:52 AM
She had been at her parents' graves when it all started. Rooksnap's visits to the edge of the territory had been more frequent lately. She almost spent more time there than in camp or around her clanmates. The recent storms had her worried about the integrity of those special tombs, but she couldn't ignore the yowls of cats and crashing of nature when it echoed through the forest that day. She was quick on her feet, for being so short in stature and weighed down by the water logged in her thick chocolate pelt. The closer she got to camp, the more sure she was that something was wrong. And she was right. Rooksnap's gut had never betrayed her. Landslide. A simple thought to describe the chaos she saw when she arrived at the top of the crumbling quarry. When the nanny's figure appeared, it stood there for a moment, but it didn't take long for her to realize that cats were in danger - cats she loved were in danger. Jayfang was being sucked into the mud, Marbledpaw trapped behind rubble- Oh dear..- "Hang on! I'm coming!.." her yell was drowned by the sound of the pounding rain. Rooksnap pelted down into the clearing, sliding down the path that had fallen. After a few bounds she was pulling Jayfang up by the scruff, and in a few more she'd reached Marbledpaw and dug her out with big grizzly paws. A lost looking Blaze was herded by the munchkin she-cat and received a lick to the eyes to restore his soiled sight. When they were huddled close, Rooksnap took the lead up the rocky path to high ledge which would eventually lead them to safety- "...as long as we stick together. Now, one at a time and we'll-" RRRRRRRRRRREEEGH... Dread dropped in Rooksnap's chest. Her odd eyes floated up to where- CRASH Another set of rocks came lose from the camp wall and was falling straight for the trio. "Watch out!!!" Wild eyed, Rooksnap barreled into all three cats, wide armed, and sent them tumbling out of the way. Only to be buried, beneath the fall. (edited)

-Jayfang- 03-Sep-21 07:35 AM
[Jayfang] Until Rooksnap arrived, Jayfang had been twisting around in the mud, trying his best to wiggle his way out. However, being dragged out was a huge relief. Spitting out the mud that had got in his mouth and rubbing his eyes, he looked up to who had saved him. To his surprise, it had been Rooksnap. "Huh. Thanks." Now she hurried him, and two other cats up the high ledge. "Isn't this just for the leader?" he pointed out, though he didn't waste any time following her. Mud clogged his ears a little, and though he was trying his best to get some of it out, he wasn't able to hear the rocks tumbling down. Jayfang was going to keep walking, until he was shoved and promptly fell quite far down the path, nearly to the bottom. He leaped back to his feet at once. "Hey! What gives-" but his thoughts were cut off as he noticed the rocks covering where they had once been, and Rooksnap missing. Immediately, he darted up towards it, and tried his best to shove aside the smaller rocks. "What are you doing? Help me!" he ordered the two apprentices. @Shade @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @cake

Springy 🦤 03-Sep-21 07:49 AM
Marigolddust • Landslide Although he himself was in safety, it was made clear that more than half of the clan seemed to be in a very different situation. Even though he felt desperate to help at least one if them, he knew that in the jambled state he was in it wouldn't be a good idea. But, he hardly knew the majority out there in the ruin, unable to escape from danger alone. The only voice calling for help that he knew well was Marbledpaw, and then Rooksnap's. A sudden sense of dread began to intrude on everything; his thoughts, his posture, his desperate wishes. He couldn't exactly hear what they each were saying, but he knew that at least one of them had to be in danger. Despite the sour treatment he received from Rooksnap recently, he found his eyes searching through the muddied rubble for both. It took a moment, but he finally caught sight of them. It seemed like Rooksnap was pulling the younger fem out of rubble, and more familiar faces came into view as she unblinded and assisted Jayfang. He sighed in relief, more than pleased to see that they all got out safely. Unfortunately, he was meeting assumptions too soon. As he was turning around to search for any other cats he was close to, he heard his nanny yowl. The high pitched demand caused him to quickly to his attention back to the group, just in time to see the falling docks heading straight towards them. Although only one cat was exchanged for three, his heart immediately dropped, feeling as if it were twisting up on itself.
- "ROOKSNAP!" he cried, eager to leap into the mud and help but unable to because if his cautious fear. His lungs hurt from the desperate yell, but the tears that had been held back didn't fall because of that. His tail went slightly under and between his legs, fear displayed stronger than before on his features as he frantically tried to figure out a way the nanny could still be alive. This could happen, not again! He hadn't made amends with her yet, and now she might be just as gone as his mother had been. He couldn't hold back the trembling of his lip as more tears fell from his eyes to the already wet stone below, Fernpaw's absence, the stress of witnessing and causing Icestar to loose a life, and finally Rooksnap's demise all finally getting to him. @Shade @-Jayfang- @cake @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ (edited)
cake 03-Sep-21 08:34 AM
marbledpaw | @Springy 🦤 @-Jayfang- @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @Shade One minute she was shaking and read to accept that she was possibly going to die, and the second she was flying through the air after brown fur shoved them across camp. She landed crookedly on one. leg, crashing and stumbling onto safety when a grumble sounded and Rooksnap.. "Rook," the soft whisper of an exhale escaped her, tail quivering as she held her feather close - she hated her, she hated her, she got saved by her, and Marbledpaw practically killed her in the end by bringing her in the mess. The brown tabby's name was yelled across camp by several, but all she could do was to stumble towards where a blurry vision of denial over Jayfang's sharp demand and rushed over to him, paws tripping over each other. Where the rocks were safe, shaky paws brushed over the two smallest ones before ramming herself on the larger ones trying to wedge a gap. "Rooksnap! Can you hear me? Rook-.. can you-.." her voice broke as her body failed her after a slam into the rock failed again, ears flattened backwards and rain above decorating the sunbeams that weaved into her tears below, chest heaving as the overwhelming belief she murdered her nanny after giving her that scar because of her sick, sardonic heart sprung again, herself shaking sharply and jerking backwards as if it would throw the thought away. A claw wedged into the jagged line split against the rocks, staring down with violets wild with a desperate hope her nanny would pop out of the shadow and crack a joke. Marbledpaw couldn't stop pawing desperately at the smaller rocks even when the larger ones failed, shoving them apart and peering in distress for some sign from StarClan of life. (edited)
~ Dead. Her tears got clogged in her throat and to her the droplets that pelted her fur wet was nothing - or maybe it had thinned out to a drizzle, she wasn't sure. When she got a wet tuft of her fur that was waterlogged and muddied, Marbledpaw snatched it, slipping it under her claw. The revolving thought of laughter chortling in her ear singing dead, dead, dead, dead, dead fell down rapidly and the thoughts that danced in her eyes fogged up one by one, from everyone and herself till all she could hear was the ringing in her ears directing her to... safety. She couldn't die. She stumbled back up to where everyone else was and stared at the one cat up there - Marigolddust. "She's dead," she informed, simply. (edited)
spark's clone™ 03-Sep-21 08:55 AM
Cloverpaw The injured molly had almost given up on hope of finding her brother, and was rested against the outline of a boulder, observing the blood that stained her entire leg, and the muddy water that barely soaked up to the top of her heels. She looked slightly dejected, but the bi-color never usually let anything get to her too bad - she often stayed quite strong in the face of danger. Hah, and those clan cats.. some of them hadn’t survived. As the apprentice lifted her head, she saw a very worried Marigolddust peering over the edge and through the rubble. Maybe he’s found something! Maybe Blaze was okay.. Hobbling over almost excitedly, Cloverpaw then began peeking over the edge too. “What-” She noticed Rooksnap, who had come back.. also Jayfang, Marbledpaw, and Blaze! “They’re alive,” came a breath of relief towards Marigolddust. Yet, perhaps Cloverpaw had spoken too soon. She watched as the brown she-cat leaped and shoved all three cats aside with baited breath and then… the cry of Marigolddust rang in her ears, but Cloverpaw was silent as she watched. Not one single cry or gasp escaped her chest. What had just happened? The world seemed to go numb around her. “No!” she suddenly yelled. “You have to get out the way, you guys! Move! Before more rocks come!” she called in protest to Jayfang’s desperation. Only one of them was allowed to die today. @Springy 🦤 @cake @-Jayfang- @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @Shade
Bronzewing 03-Sep-21 12:29 PM
@Pip
Pinefoot| Rescuing
Pinefoot rushed back over to help dig out some more cats- most of the felines had already been taken out, and it was mostly the dens and loose fresh-kill that was still being salvaged. He heard concerned voices and panic, and so he hoped that cats had already been dragged out of there... anybody still stuck was most likely dead by now. He didn't want to imagine the vigils they would be having for all these cats. What would they do with the camp now? It was a disaster, mud and clumps of grasses everywhere, the dens destroyed... they could rebuild the dens of course, but how would they get the mass of dirt out of there? It would take many paws, and with the injured and tired cats they had, it would be a while until they could really start on it. Scratching at the earth again he uncovered the torn wings of birds, whatever was left of their prey- definitely not something they could eat, so he threw it to the side and kept working. Looking up at Sandstride, she was still exhausted beyond belief- he was tempted to tell her to take a break, but had a feeling that the she-cat would refuse. No use wasting his breath. (edited)

[Jayfang] He kept shoving rock after rock out of the way. Even when he was told she was dead, he persisted. "She can't be dead. You must be mistaken," he denied, pawing aside every stone in the way. "It's only a few rocks." Desperately, he kept moving the rocks until he found Rooksnap's body, tattered and very much dead. He stared at the corpse for a few seconds in disbelief before grabbing her scruff and trying to drag her body out of the rubble. Jayfang managed to move a little of it, but not very much. Eventually, he gave up on trying to move her, and just looked at her with sorrow. Then came rage. "Of course, she's dead. Couldn't even stay alive long enough for me to save her," he hissed. prim 03-Sep-21 01:18 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide | present
The clouds had finally parted, only shreds of the dark nimbus clouds remained in the all-too-mockingly blue skies above the camp. The rain was replaced by harsh sun, and the mud and earth slowly begun to come to a stop, the devastation highlighted by the rays of the sun like it was a spotlight upon a stage. Overturned rocks and boulders remained, and the mud slowly began to harden in place, like clay drying in the sun. It was over for now, but they had a great challenge ahead of them. The camp was utterly destroyed, and from where the deputy stood upon the Highledge, she could see every entrance was blocked, ThunderClan’s warriors were trapped. Laurelblaze stared down at the body of their leader at her paws, no sign of consciousness just yet, but she had a feeling she’d get up soon. She knew Icestar was sturdier than she looked, she might have lost a life here, but that was not going to do her in. She had faith in her, she wasn’t getting stuck leading the clan without her while they had this mess to clean up. They had enough on their plate without power being shifted from one cat to another. ”Wake up soon, seriously, this place is a mess.” the tortoiseshell murmured as she gazed upon the wreckage, her eyes darkening at the sight. How do we even begin with this? Everything is just… Her line of thought had been interrupted by the sounds of wailing cats, and the sound of a name she didn’t expect to hear. Rooksnap! her eyes darted to the camp below, where cats were clustered around a large boulder that had come loose and were desperately trying to claw out. ”Don’t tell me she-“ her voice cut off, and her heart sank down in her chest, a choked-up noise escaping her throat as she overheard the confirmation… Her friend was dead. She wasn’t going to allow any more of them to die today, not when Rooksnap gave her life for them! ”All of you! In the camp! Get to the Highledge! Its still unstable, get to safety now!” she called down to the group of apprentices and warriors down below, her voice commanding and stern. Even if it was masking her own grief, she had to be strong in the face of it all. @-Jayfang- @Sleepy Old Man Coy (He/Him)™ @spark's clone™ @cake @Springy 🦤 @Shade @Ice
Springy 🦤 03-Sep-21 01:44 PM
Marigolddust • Landslide Guiltily, Marigolddust had completely forgotten about Cloverpaw, mainly because she hadn't been spotted by him as she had gained her injuries. He took this moment, though, to take in her bloodied leg. While still on the idea that the group that had gained his attention moments before was safe, he took in the apprentice's injuries. Concern suddenly flashed over his face. "W-what happened? Are you alright?" He asked. If Cloverpaw had been so hurt without him noticing, who else could be? How injured might Wrenpaw be? Anxious for his apprentice, he was about to look around for her when the sound of shifting stones met his ears. After he witnessed his nanny's death, he wished he could have said something in response to Marbledpaw's conclusive words, preferably around the lines of "no, she can't be dead," Sure, this was a but of a cliche statement, but it would have given himself a little bit of hope to hold onto. Instead, he already felt that what she said was true. If Icestar couldn't survive being crushed like that without losing a life, then it wasn't likely that Rooksnap could. His vision began to blur as his eyes watered, wetting his cheeks with more tears than rain. It seemed as awefuly ironic for the day to suddenly grow so bright when a death as dark as this one was witnessed by so many. For once, he actually felt resentful for the lack of rain. Why couldn't it rain now, instead of raining and causing more unnecessary distress? A bitter taste grew on his tongue, and for the first time he found himself angry at Starclan. Why would they let so much distraction happen when they could have stopped it? Rooksnap would be alive, the camp would be intact, and Fernpaw would be by his side instead of missing.
- The uncharacteristic anger that began to twist his gut faded some as Laurelblaze's voice met his ears with more directions. At least she provided him with some guidance when everything was just so... Chaotic. Chaotic, distressing, stressful, traumatizing, even, and so much more. Raising a paw to wipe away as many tears from his eyes and fur as he could, he stepped back to allow the others to have enough room to get onto the safety of the Highledge he found himself on. Only Jayfang seemed to be unwilling to come to the point, at least from what Marigolddust could figure out, and in truth the warrior was the least of his worries, no matter how rude the thought sounded in his own head.

Pip 03-Sep-21 08:47 PM
@Bronzewing {Sparrowfeather} | Landslide (You need to respond to my Skyclan thing, lol) Sparrowfeather hadn't even noticed the feather she wore behind her ear was lost in the dirt until she tried to clean herself up a bit. Moving her paw behind her ear and finding it gone. She numbly looked at the clan, in shock and every cat had a look of concern or grief at the camp and their loved ones. Sparrowfeather shook her head. How could this happen? she thought dully. She still had a hard time getting up and moving. She felt like her ribs were grinding everytime she got up. But she felt absoloutely dreadful sitting still. She couldn't stand still...it's like she still had a bunch of adrenaline pumping through her so she did the best she could. Fetching supplies and bringing cats water. Gritting her teeth the whole time. Her calico pelt was still smudged with dirt like every other cat- there were very few that had mildly clean pelts. Sparrowfeather coughed, she still felt the dust and dirt in her throat. Like it was still in her lungs. But she knew that probably wasn't it. Despite her injury and almost-death. She just couldn't stand the look of grief on her clanmates faces and went down into the ruins of the camp to help everyone else. Which wasn't a better choice either- the dens were demolished- soil was everywhere. Practically in layers around the whole camp...the large fallen tree in the middle- dens could be replaced. But this was a whole other thing. She sighed. Moving towards Sandstride. She didn't say anything. She just bent down and did her best to move with a purpose. Digging at the dirt and trying to see if they could find anything or maybe just clear it out. She saw a near-by pile and started to sweep it out of the entrance. Shivering at the thought that she was under all of this...the whole time...and she still could've been if Pinefoot and Sandstride hadn't found her.
frost 04-Sep-21 12:40 PM
He could still hear everything, though the camp was quiet. The rumbles of rocks and den walls collapsing, the terrified cries of his Clanmates, names being called out to eachother as felines desperately tried to help their friends and family. Within the flurries of running cats and falling debris, Featherpaw had been frozen in place. He hadn't been able to find his siblings or his mothers, and fear had completely taken over his entire being. All that the black tabby could remember was pain searing through his leg and shooting up his spine as a rock fell onto him, his attempts at leaping out of the way failing as his back leg was crushed by the boulder. Shards of rock had flown up into his face, and then everything had faded to black. Groggily, a pair of cerulean eyes flickered open. His head throbbed, and he squinted against the morning sun as it rose over the horizon. The muddy ground had now hardened, and what had splattered over his pelt had crusted. Wincing, he tried to get to his paws, but instantly let out a yelp and fell to the ground as something hindered his attempt. Glancing backward, his gaze widened with horror as he didn't see his leg, instead a boulder that had buried his limb beneath it. Swallowing roughly, he tried to lean back and push it off, though his back cramped and his attempt was too weak. Letting out a hiss of frustration, his chin fell to the ground with exhaustion, ears flattening against his skull. Mousedung. I'm gonna die here. @prim
prim 04-Sep-21 01:12 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide | present
The adrenaline that had been coursing through her veins in the entire duration of the landslide had begun to subside, leaving her feeling exhausted and haggard-looking. Her once russet-toned tortoiseshell pelage was stained with splotches of light brown where dust and mud were clumped up in her thick fur. Her limbs ached from the strain of hauling herself through the mud in order to guide her clanmates to safety, all while dodging debris being sent her way while they were trying to escape the devastation. Laurelblaze sat down and hung her head for a moment, letting out a deep breath as she tried to compose herself. Their camp was utterly destroyed, and they’d lost cats today, it was not a day she’d look back on fondly. After this, they’d have to find their clanmates, dead or alive, and then they’d have to proceed with clearing out the camp. Den arrangements, assessing the damage… The camp looks like a total loss right now. her gaze narrowed a bit out of dismay from the mere sight of it all. Was this some sort of punishment from their ancestors? Or was it something else entirely? She didn’t want to believe she or the clan did anything to prompt StarClan to send this disaster upon them. They all abided by the Code rather closely after all. The deputy glanced down towards her leader’s unconscious form for the moment, before murmuring: ”I gotta do something about the others, you’re in good paws here.” she trusted her clanmates would alert her to her awakening, it was bound to happen sometime or later. But she needed to focus on getting survivors out of the wreckage. ”Anyone not injured by the storm, begin searching for any missing cats! I want no stone left un-turned! Do you understand? Leave not a single cat behind!” another set of commands was issued and the rescue effort was underway. The deputy began to scale down the rocky steps of the Highledge into the camp below, her jaws parted to see if she could make out any scents of her clanmates caught under the earth. There was a chance some of them were still alive. Then she heard a hiss, and her ears flickered. She could spot a pair of familiar cerulean hues, and black-tabby fur. Her breath hitched as she let out a small gasp, her son, he was alive, but trapped. ”Featherpaw!” she cried out, immediately rushing towards him with a widened gaze. He was sprawled out across the ground, all except for one limb trapped under large rock. It’s got to be crushed under there, that injury may not recover fully when we get him out. she winced at the thought, her son would likely be forced to recover for a long time until his leg was mended, but an injury like this was permanent, and she would know from first-hand experience. ”Featherpaw, I have to get this rock off of your leg… It’s going to hurt a lot, even after its off, but I promise I’m gonna get you out. Okay? Just breathe.” she was trying to keep him calm, this was not going to be easy, for either of them. Laurelblaze didn’t want to cause him even more pain, but this was the only way to save him, and she’d rather have her son be alive than to let him suffer here. She braced herself as she placed her forepaws upon the rock, getting ready to push. ”Ready? Three… Two… One!” she grunted as she shifted to put all her weight into pushing the stone off of her son’s limb, growling as she felt it shift against the ground. She wanted to be quick and get this over with so he wouldn’t continue to suffer, but she could feel her efforts weren’t enough, she’d need help. ”I need help here! Featherpaw’s trapped under this stone!” @frost

"I'm going to go find them!" that was the last thing the striped warrior called over his shoulder before leaping back down into the quarry, his silver pelt melting in with the rain. @Stark✨

Springy 🦤 04-Sep-21 08:23 PM
Marigolddust - Landslide Finally, the mud and wrecked forest matter stopped flowing into the camp, ending the landslide. Instead, mud dried on the camp and the cats' fur as the clouds dispersed and the sun shone bright. Although his throat was still tight from the witnessing of Rooksnap's death and his mind overwhelmingly scattered at everything he had witnessed and felt that day, Laurelblaze's orders met his ears with ease, her voice being more cutting and attention-catching than the panicky cats around them. Search for missing cats? Well, at least he could help now, and maybe he could prevent something like what happened to Rooksnap and Icestar, too... he tried to shake of the distressed emotions he was feeling to no avail. Who could he help? There were so many in camp, but he couldn't quite tell if some of them were dead or alive. He wasn't strong enough to move stones on his own, so if he were to do a job like that independently he wouldn't be of much help. The image of Fernpaw being trapped under rubble flashed across his sight for a moment, and he was just about to try and search for his friend when he heard Laurelblaze's call yet again. Confused, he looked over in her direction, only to have his eyes widen at the sight. Oh Starclan, the sight was gut-twisting. The warrior wasn't at all used to seeing injured cats, despite his previous stay at the Fernpaw's den, and laying his eyes on a cat with their leg crushed under a rock was more than unsettling. Either way, he forced himself to run over to Laurelblaze's side, focusing on Featherpaw and his mother.
- "I-I'm here to try and help," he spoke softly, stuttering as he was again distracted by the situation. When Laurelblaze began to work on moving the stone again, he pushed his own side against the rocky surface in hopes of helping them push the boulder off of Featherpaw's leg. He couldn't even imagine the pain the apprentice must have been doing through, and he didn't care to try to, otherwise it might make him cringe and mess up their rescue attempt. @prim @frost
Bronzewing 04-Sep-21 10:54 PM
@Pip (I did) Pinefoot had to sit down for a rest now, folding his paws, breathing in heavily- his chest felt tight, and the world felt heavy, and he wasn't sure what to do. How much dust got into his nose? How much dirt, and grass, and whatever else was kicked up by the landslide and the panic? They had lost the camp for a while, he knew that. It would be a lot of work coming, and he had a feeling that most cats... most cats would be too busy mourning. Where even were the cats he knew? The medicine cat, who should have been treating people? Keenstreak, his old enemy who he doubted was even in camp at the time? He knew Sparrowfeather and Sandstride were fine, and he didn't often think about the crow's safety- it was a bird, and they were better at living than he thought. Just look at all the times he had failed to catch one! "Well," he said to nobody in particular, "this is a mess." He would wait for instructions before he tried to clean out any dens, and besides, he was exhausted after the rescuing. He hoped the leader would understand that. He heard cats calling- some Clanmates were missing, others were hurt- but there wasn't much he could do in this state. (edited)
frost 05-Sep-21 12:20 AM
Pointy ears twitched as he could hear chattering within the distance. At this point, he wasn't too sure if it was his mind playing tricks on him, or if his Clan was still nearby. He gazed out helplessly ahead of him, in that moment, thinking of nothing but his siblings. Viperpaw, specifically. He had equal love for all of his littermates, though him and the she-cat held a bond slightly closer than the others, in his eyes. Besides, he had made a promise - if she were to leave the Clan after all, he'd take care of Fox and Tiger, if they wanted to stay. If I die here, I break that promise, he thought sadly, wincing at the thought. The wince caused his face to sting, in which he let out another hiss. Three large gouges sat across his face, only barely missing his eyes. It seemed that if StarClan was real, they had spared him his sight - it was the least they could do, after crushing his leg. It wasn't long before movement in the far distance caught his eye, and weakly, he lifted his head. Squinting, he could have sworn that those were the pelt hues of his mother.. "Featherpaw!" The apprentice could have almost cried with relief as he heard the familiar voice being called out to him, tears stinging at his gaze. And though his whole time knowing the she-cat he had called her Laurelblaze, a new name escaped his lips. "Mom!" As the deputy rushed over and began to speak reassuring words, his ears flattened once more and he nodded. He chewed on his lips nervously, the pain was bad enough as it was, surely it couldn't get worse than this? Though, as the countdown lead to nothing but the rock shifting over his leg slightly, another yelp of pain escaped his lips and his claws sunk into the hardened mud below. "Mousedung! StarClan, that hurts!" He cried out, a string of curses following that he'd never usually dare use infront of his mother. He was sure, though, that with his current state, she'd let it slide. As she called out for help, Featherpaw let out a small whimper. "I-I'm gonna be okay, right?" As another feline, Marigolddust, bounded over to assist, his ears flattened and he looked away. He could feel the boulder shifting, and every movement sent pain shooting up his spine. Droplets of blood formed around his fangs as he bit into his lip, trying to hold back the cries of agony. He didn't want to worry the duo too much - they were saving his life, after all. @prim @Springy 🦤
prim 05-Sep-21 08:00 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Landslide
Her heart lurched when she heard the muffled cries escaping from her son when she was shifting the boulder off of him with Marigolddust’s aid. She’d be forever thankful for the tuxedo tom’s help, but right now her son needed to get out of this. ”I’m so sorry sweetheart I know it hurts, you can cry, its okay, I know this is painful.” she didn’t want her children bottling up their feelings, not like she had in the past. Especially in the case of if they’re injured badly and need to let it out while they’re being rescued, how Featherpaw was trying not to cry in front of her was mind-boggling. ”Once we get you out of here we’ll get you looked at, you’ll be okay, I’ll make sure of it.” the deputy was praying her son’s injuries weren’t fatal. Even if they weren’t dealt to vital organs or arteries, these sort of injuries could be deadly if not treated quickly, and she wanted her kit alive. She growled as she used her remaining stamina to do one last push against the boulder’s surface, her eyes burning with hatred towards the inanimate object. It was the source of her child’s pain, and she was removing it like she was cutting down an enemy. She felt it roll backward, and her stomach churned at the sight of blood staining it’s surface, before she saw her son’s mangled leg. Oh StarClan… I don’t even know if this can even be mended, this is bad. she blinked at the sight, before she gazed back towards her son, giving his forehead a quick lick. He was freed, but she needed to get him to safety. ”Thank you, Marigolddust. Truly, he wouldn’t be out of this mess if not for you.” her gaze softened as she graciously thanked her clanmate and friend, slight tears beginning to form around her eyes. She needed to go and get Featherpaw help, he couldn’t stay like this. ”I gotta haul him up to the Highledge…” @frost @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 05-Sep-21 11:14 AM
Marigolddust • Landslide It was an understatement to say that Marigolddust was surprised Featherpaw wasn't verbalizing much of his pain when he arrived. If he was in the apprentice's position, he probably would have been crying at least a little bit, no matter how pathetic the thought was. Bracing himself, he continued to use as much strength as he could to assist Laurelblaze with getting the large stone off of her son's leg. He himself winced at the small, yet impactful noises from black tabby as he and Laurelblaze continued to work at moving the stone. He hardly knew the younger tom, other than the fact that he had been adopted along with his siblings by Laurel and Holly, but any sound of pain like this could likely get to any cat if they had a heart. Fortunately, the two managed to get the small boulder off of Featherpaw, despite how terrible of a sight came as a result. Marigolddust cringed when he finally caught sight of the injury, suddenly feeling sick. Could it even be healed? It looked so terrible, and he knew that Fernpaw had a big job coming once they could figure things out. Maybe he could try and help, despite how hesitant he was to even look at it. Meeting Laurelblaze's odd gaze, he gave her a bit of a weak smile. "Thank you, although I probably just happened to end up here before anyone else could," he said, turning his attention again to the taste of not looking too hard at Featherpaw's injuries. He wasn't sure when they would be able to find medical help for Featherpaw in the midst of this mess, but he had an idea on how to make it faster. Perhaps he wanted to do this for himself, too. *If you don't need help, i'll go try and find Fernpaw for you if she's in camp," he offered.
- Maybe he could search for her, and then while he was searching he could help anybody he could find. Yes, that sounded like an alright plan, although he doubted he could help a cat under a large stone like Featherpaw alone. @frost @prim

wild™ 09-Sep-21 04:51 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Destruction. Utter, complete destruction. Such had been what had plauged Thunderclan as of late, but truly the landslide had to be the worst of all. The mere urge to survive had been great - but the sounds of her clanmates crying out in terror had probably been the worst of it all - not to mention, witness various other horrific events. Even so, her ears no longer rang from their cries, the rain, thunder nor trembling of the ground. It was over...and thus no longer needed to harbor within her mind. The tabby slowly made her way through the destroyed camp, her violet gaze flickering about momentarily over those held captive within it alongside her. The feline allowed a breath to escape from her, whiskers quivering as she slowly allowed herself to be settled among the ground. How boring this all was. She could hardly keep her head on straight with the lack of activities one could accomplish - it felt like being trapped among a den with no way out. surely, she'd find something of interest soon enough. But for now...she'd wait. @GahlikPAh
Ice 10-Sep-21 08:10 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Landslide }
The prone body lay on the Highledge, breathless and silent. Icestar’s damaged body was shaped awkwardly but the gruesome concept was censored by the smearing of brown and gray over her light-coloured fur. Fortunately, this predicament she had was only temporary. Being granted nine lives had its perks and this was one of them. Even more fortunate was that she only needed to use up one life to revive herself. Just as it had occurred quite a few times before, her body slowly began to heal. The strange angles of her neck and limbs straightened again. Her sprained ankle recovered. Splintered ribs reconnected into one. Then her first breath came: a shallow, ragged inhale of air. Pain strung at her nerves but that was a good sign. It brought her back into consciousness. By the time Icestar’s eyes flew open, she was fully healed and very much alive.

Speckledivy
The tips of the half clans cats ears curled ears were so flat against her plush head they almost appeared nonexistent- giving her head the roundness of an owl.The spotted faes bright green ivy hued eyes dashed around the destroyed camp- her heart blistered with the pain of wondering- how many lives were lost- who was injured, how would they clean this mess up… if they could. She was much like her father in that aspect- the continued observation and empathy, Panicflare had been a slave to empathy. The black and white spotted cat spoke to the nearest cat to her, it was a cat who bore a violet gaze. The shecat wasn’t one for small talk- she would rather sit in ants than discuss give in to idle chatter. She just needed to hear something- really anything, a distraction. The most simple but genuine words were spoken to her clan mate, ”You good?” of course no one who had ears was good in this moment. "Dusty~"
>
Swiping her tongue across her son's ears, the wraith does aim to stir her eldest from his sleep. Their nests, makeshift and shabby, provide little warmth during the nights. It's beneficial this just so happens to be when Hollyfrost wakes, still keen on perpetuating her nightly, habitual outings.
>
It deems itself only natural for her to request the presence of her child on one of these ventures, testing his ability to provide for the Clan in their most dire moments. Though night does fall, soaking the world in shadow and frost, those undaunted by danger thrive most here.
>
He lacks his sister's courage, or his brother's snark, and the wit of Featherpaw and the tenacity of Foxpaw . . . Hollyfrost knows Dustycloud is, to say the kindest, the softest of her offspring. It doesn't diminish the fact she still needs to provide for him despite his maturity.
>
A mother's job is, after all, never done.
>

Springy 🦤 18-Sep-21 08:39 PM
Marigolddust
•Near Future• It was a day after he had been appointed the new medicine cat of Thunderclan, and he was beginning to discover the surface of his new difficulties. He was in charge of a whole den now, by himself for that matter, and said den was absolutely destroyed. Once they had finally dug their way through the enterance so they could temporarily enter, it seemed like all of the herbs had been destroyed. It seemed a bit stranger that no herbs remained, but it was hard to think further on it when he was so stressed about how he would be able to access what he needed to help all of the injured. Could he even help the injured? He only knew the basics, and it made him sick to his stomach whenever he thought of Featherpaw's wound. He would have to fix that. He'd have to heal Cloverpaw and the others, too. He tried to push down his growing nerves, instead focusing on the camp around him. Everything was destroyed, and they'd all figure it out... Eventually. It was only his first day with this new rank... Not much could be expected of him, right? Raising his paw, he used it to scoop away yet another paw full of muddy dirt from the camp's wall. It was a lot to work on, but if he planned on being of any use now that he was in Fernpaw's place he would have to be able to get out of camp... Even if he was making little to no progress besides the others of the clan. Taking a step back, he examined his progress. Doubt filled his gaze as he took in how little work he had really done. This landslide was making things so difficult! Sighing, he raised a paw and gave it a few licks, hoping to clean some of the mud out from under his claws. It was difficult, but provided him with a break. (edited)
- There was little more that he could do besides try and help with the covered enterances, at least those who could fit a warrior. He couldn't hunt, he couldn't try and practice his new role in the clan, and he couldn't really train with all of the debris that had to be moved. What if they starved here? The apprentices were doing well, but their work might not be enough to feed a whole clan. He could feel his own hunger itching for him to eat larger meals than the few mice or a rabbit, but he often ignored it unless it was actually time for him to eat. Now, he sat there quietly debating what to do as he tried to rid the muddy taste from his mouth. @wild™ sorry this took forever!))

Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 18-Sep-21 10:13 PM
At least squirrels get to scavenge in the day. He thought but kept it to himself, watching the older warrioress leap up onto the land bridge with little care for its splintered ends. Dustycloud looked to Hollyfrost and then the wood, apparently contemplating his choices before finally taking the leap onto the wood, landing quietly. He may not have the brute strength or the cliche bravery of a Thunderclan warrior, but if he had one good quality it was his agility. On second thought, there were times he was clumsier than a bird with one wing. It was ironic, how the older and more seasoned of the pair was somehow more young at heart than the relatively fresh warrior. At the mention of Featherpelt he couldnt help but brush off most of his complaints. "He wouldve been sensible enough to wait until after... whatever in the dark forest is out at this time of night." He countered, gesturing abstractly with his paw towards the darkness that awaited them. By no means was he in love with the idea of venturing out into the night, but at the end of the day anyone knew Dustycloud was a loyal follower. He'd conquer all his fears at once if it meant journeying to find one cat he was faithful to. Besides, sneaking up on a bird in the dark would be something new to try. "If I break a leg Im telling Marigolddust that you dragged me out here against my will." He mewed, anxiety creeping up on him the closer he made his way to the end of the log. @fuzz

"You're getting so big, I mistook you for Laurel mama for a minute," she laughs, finally relaxing her grip on the young she-cat.

YAGPDB.xyz BOT 19-Sep-21 03:23 PM
Gave +1 Rep to @goose
tremb 21-Sep-21 11:57 AM
{ Wrenpaw } The way the golden sun lit up the land made it hard to believe that not long ago the forest had been ravaged by terrible rains and a landslide which had all but destroyed the ThunderClan camp. Despite the positive change in weather, prey still remained quite scarce, and as Wrenpaw wriggled through a tiny gap in the barrier she only carried two small mice in her jaws. Not much to show for her hunting trip, but she supposed it was better than nothing at all. Her tail dropped behind her, dragging through the mud as she made her way towards the pathetic excuse for a fresh-kill pile to deposit her mice. Normally as an apprentice, the opportunity to leave the camp and hunt without an escort would have been a very exciting thing since apprentices weren’t allowed out alone. However, the circumstances had sucked all of the fun out of it, and a melancholy look was evident on the caramel fem’s features as she made her way towards where the apprentices den used to be. She sat down outside the skeleton of the den, her stomach rumbling as she did so. She couldn’t deny the fact that she was hungry, but she wasn’t going to eat until there was more prey on the pile. The warriors were working tirelessly to rebuild the camp and create an entrance large enough for them to come and go, and they would need every bit of prey they could get to keep up their strength. The first two moons of her apprenticeship had been so wonderful, it was hard to believe this is what it had come to. Wrenpaw never could have expected to face such hardships at such a young age, but perhaps in the end it would only make her stronger. As her amber gaze swept across the ruins of her home,
the anxiety in her stomach only grew. In fact, she couldn’t remember a time she had felt calm since the storms started, and yet she felt as if this whole thing was far from over. Perhaps she was being overly anxious, but typically when she was worried about something there was a good reason for it. With a heavy sigh, she closed her eyes to the chaos that surrounded her and focused on the warm feeling of the sun on her fur, and thought of better times. Things will get better. They will. @Ginger

A small hole shifted in the wall of mud near the camp entrance, sending rubble cascading about. A dark tabby head poked through, coated in dust and mud. The toms deep amber eyes were alight with amusement despite the situation, a small smile upon his face, until his gaze snagged upon Wrenpaw.  Adderpaw trotted over to the she-cat, his tail held high. He shook out his fur, sending dirt and mud showering around him like rain in a storm.  "Hey Wrenpaw!" He chirped, plopping down near the other apprentice. He was still a new apprentice, and although he wouldn't admit it, he was desperate to make friends. He wanted others to like him. Maybe Wrenpaw could be a new friend? Hopefully she wouldn't find him annoying. @tremb

Wrenpaw was always open to making new friends. ”Oh, hey Adderpaw,” she returned his greeting, a small laugh following as he shook the debris from his pelt. She was glad to see that her fellow apprentice seemed to be in good spirits, though she had to admit it was hard to understand how he managed that. prim 21-Sep-21 03:37 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | present
The dust had settled at last, and she’d begun ordering whatever able-bodied cats she had in camp to begin unearthing the debris around camp. She had been working at the obstacles herself as well, considering she was able to as she was relatively unscathed from the landslide. She’d be using her strength for the greater good of camp, and to honor the cats who were lost in the landslide… Though some cats had mysteriously disappeared after the event. Her apprentice, Tigerpaw, had been accounted for when the landslide ended, but all of a sudden, the next morning she had disappeared along with another apprentice, Juniperpaw. The deputy was worried sick over her, especially since the mysterious deaths that had also occurred prior to the landslide, she didn’t want Tigerpaw out there with only another apprentice at her side… Yet, almost conveniently, before she could organize a search, Tigerpaw was here, calling out to her from above the quarry. She was alive. Laurelblaze had been digging into a wall of dirt that was blocking the entrance, attempting to dislodge a boulder that was blocking more earth. Her fur was stained light brown, and was visibly messy— but when she heard her apprentice’s voice, it visibly bristled, and her pupils narrowed to slits from shock. Her head shot up for a moment, and she couldn’t believe her eyes, Tigerpaw was alive, and well. Just what was the meaning of this, disappearing without a word?! Her better judgement was being trumped by her instinctual fury of her apprentice’s late return, it was as if her own kits missed a curfew by hours, except this was days! Tigerpaw could have died! ”You have ten seconds to get your sorry little behind down here NOW.” Needless to say, Tigerpaw should be very afraid. @Shade
Shade 21-Sep-21 03:42 PM

Small smudges of blood were left where she set her paws, their pads cracked and bleeding from hasty travel back home. Her striped brown fur was bushed and her eyes wide but her lips remained glued shut. She braced herself for the storm that was inevitably to come. @prim
prim 21-Sep-21 04:27 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | present
“Furious” couldn’t even describe her emotions at this moment, “Livid” was a better descriptor. She was nearly shaking from rage, how dare her own apprentice decide to go galavanting across the forest without a single indication she was okay? That she was alive? Laurelblaze couldn’t believe the audacity of it all! She felt her teeth clench as she forced herself to keep her claws sheathed, as much as she wanted to rip her claws through the earth she’d been working at for hours now. That was how angry she was, and Tigerpaw was about to learn her lesson. ”You think you can just go running off without any word, not even telling us where you were going, and expect to come back here without anyone being upset?” she bore her fangs as she spoke, disappointment in her apprentice’s actions very evident in her voice. ”I was worried, do you even understand how dangerous it is out there by yourself? Did you forget what we JUST found on the northern border not even a moon ago? Is there a beehive where your brain should be? An empty space inside your skull? What the hell were you thinking?” she was laying into the young tabby, giving her a lecture not much unlike those of a parent giving to their misbehaved child. Laurelblaze was pacing now, shaking her head and muttering in between her sentences, her tail wildly lashing around behind her. All of a sudden, she stopped, and she stared down the younger she-cat with death in her gaze. ”You don’t even understand how much trouble you’re in. This was reckless and stupid, and I’m not going to let you forget anytime soon.” @Shade
Shade 21-Sep-21 04:37 PM
Tigerpaw's head grew lower the more Laurelblaze talked. By the end, if it hung any more it'd be inside the ground. The young she-cat already felt guilty, and Laurelblaze's words only amplified this. On top of that she had broken up with Juniperpaw. She had expected this. I deserve it. After a few moments her whole body began to shake. "I'm sorry..." she choked quietly at first, then burst into full on tears. "I'm sorry, Laurelblaze! I'm so sorry-" Sobs stole her voice away. Tigerpaw collapsed where she stood, outstretched arms reaching desperately for even one of her mentor's grizzly ones. "I got sick. We don't have a medicine cat, so... I left. Juniperpaw only came to protect me." This was a lie, but she wasn't about to tarnish his reputation too. "But I'm back now, and I'm better, and I won't ever do it again. I'll do anything you ask. Just tell me." Tear-filled pink eyes bore into stern blue and amber ones. "Please." @prim
prim 21-Sep-21 06:15 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | present

This was practically desertion of the clan in one of the greatest disasters they’d faced in quite some time. ”Sick or not, you should have stayed here, we could have cared for you where you would have been safe. wild™ 22-Sep-21 08:14 AM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Oh how the mighty had fallen. With each passing day, hope seemed to shrivel continuously, a sense of uncertainty settling over the more or less trapped clan, leaving their last traces of optimism among those deemed apprentices. They were their only hope and if they failed...then surely, the clan would perish and Thunderclan would be no more. A legend lost upon the realms of time, an unfortunate and perhaps, unworthy fate for them. But alas...such was seeming to become quite possible, a destiny that no one wished for and yet, could very well receive. How unfortunate, indeed. The skies were overcast, dark and gloomy as if even the heavens above were mourning. No rain had fallen, which was fortunate concerning they had no dens to flee to if such an event were to happen. There was enough to worry about currently. The lack of prey, which left various felines hungry, thus heavily low on energy, their strength steadily weakening. Even more so for the injured, whom had received no treatment as of yet. The medicine den had been blocked just as the rest of the dens. And along with that, their medicine cat had more or less gone missing among previous events...perhaps falling to the same fate as Icestar. If not...where exactly had she gone?
As the tabby's violet gaze hovered over the destroyed camp once more, she began to feel overly large among the ruins, a heavy breath escaping her. She'd never felt so...trapped before. Perhaps it was the outsider rising within her or suddenly bound in anxiety, but whatever the case, she was about to escape it. Rising to her paws, Hollowgrove strode rather quickly away from her resting spot, eyes searching for anything she could busy herself with for the time being. Many seemed just as upset as she felt or were occupied with some sort of interaction or past. Finally, her gaze landed on a particular feline who seemed to be by himself and questioning what to do. She'd never been overly social...but perhaps, she could aid him in whatever task he'd paused from doing. Padding over to the bi-colored tom, her tail waved once in a supposedly friendly manner, forcing a generally neutral expression upon her face. She cleared her throat once reaching the young warrior, sparing a moment of silence to gather her thoughts. "Marigolddust." she greeted in a voice that was neither friendly nor unkind. She glanced at his work, letting her gaze rest upon it for a moment or so, before returning it to the tom. "Helping out? Would you by chance, consider the aid of another?" she offered, before unsheathing her claws and taking a few swipes at the dirt, not even waiting for a proper response. After a moment, she glanced over her shoulder. "Forgive me, you simply seem...unwell. Though not in the manner of being ill. Fearful, perhaps. Or tied up in stress. Various things it could be...many feel such a way, these days." she finished, before returning her attention to the dirt covered wall before her. @Springy 🦤 (Apologies for the super late reply! </3)

She’d be able to keep her eye on her apprentice this way, and it wouldn’t be forever. ”Now, get some prey and eat if you’re hungry. Springy 🦤 22-Sep-21 04:47 PM
Marigolddust - Tigerpaw
- Present - Tigerpaw's absence had been yet another that joined the large pool of lives lost, in any way that could be considered. Although there was no doubt that Marigolddust had worried about Tigerpaw, he wasn't quite as stricken or angered as Laurelblaze had been when he finally set eyes on the dark raspberry chocolate apprentice. His attention was first caught when he had heard the pained wimpering coming from the direction of the prey pile, and the noise would have gained his attention even before his promotion. He had first stiffened, caught off guard despite how many injured there were here in the camp, although once yellows met pinks he felt the tension wash away. A smile broke out across his features as he recognized the cat who he had, for awhile, been convinced had joined so many of those cats he was close to that he couldn't save. With swift movements, the tom approached Tigerpaw, his expression friendly and relieved. "Tigerpaw, you're alright!" he exclaimed, tail raised high with the slightest arc at the tip, showing off the feeling of excitement that had now joined him. He looked her up and down for a moment, trying to take in where she had been without pushing the question, and in the midst of the search he caught sight of the apprentice's crimson-stained paw pads.
- Milk-tipped ears swerved back as he noticed the more hidden injury. "What happened? Where were you?" he asked, finally voicing the question Tigerpaw must have been asked a million times already. Last time he had seen her she didn't have the paw injuries she had now, and the blood was fairly fresh, too. He felt the urge to bring Tigerpaw to the Medicine cat's den and have Fernpaw check out the subtle injury, but the bitter realization that Fernpaw wouldn't be healing any more paw pads came back to him, draining a large amount of his previously joyful energy. Tigerpaw was a part of the many cats that needed medical assistance yet couldn't yet receive it, and he couldn't help but feel guilty. He was the cat in charge of giving them that assistance, anyhow, and here he was, standing uselessly with paws matted with mud and dirt from digging. Sure, he had opened up his den not long after he had been chosen to take his friend's place, and it was an oddly easy task at that, with the dirt already seeming fairly loose, but once he had entered it everything was covered in dirt, mud, and more ruin. The herbs were destroyed, not a single survivor, and the small pool that Fernpaw had kept the mossballs besides had filled with mud during the disaster. He had work ahead of him, a lot of work. Unfortunately, he wouldn't be able to do anything about it until they opened the entrances.
@Shade
Springy 🦤 22-Sep-21 05:25 PM
Marigolddust - Hollowgrove
- Near Future- The tom's silent debating was interupted as a noise came to his ears, one that quite clearly came from another cat. Ears perking our of surprise and a bit of curiousity, he turned to spot a fem he didn't completely recognize at his side. It caught him off guard to hear his own voice when he had been standing there in silence, only hearing the quiet shifting of the dirt beaneath his was for quite awhile. Unable to help it, he kept eye contact with the she-cat for a few moments more, trying hard to try and remember her name. Why was it so tricky to memorize all of the cats in his own clan? It should have been easy, yet it was always a struggle for him. Finally, though, a name came to mind. "Oh, hi... Hollowgrove," he greeted, hesitating for just a moment before speaking the name in fear that it was incorrect. It didn't take long for a considerate offer to be made, and the young warrior didn't exactly expect it. "Help-?" he repeated, although before he could continue much farther the other warrior already set off to work. Pausing, a small smile crossed his muzzle. "Oh, thank you, it's appreciated... I wish there wasn't so much dirt, or it might not be as much of a hassle." he said softly, standing up to get back to work when Hollowgrove continued. "Oh, I'm not sick-" He began, before he realized he hadn't heard all she had to say. Feeling his chest get a little bit heavier with the mention of his emotions along with the rest of the clans, it took him a few seconds before he nodded in agreement to her words. Raising a paw, he began the laboring process of scooping dirt away from the camp wall again before he began to speak.
- "I guess I'm not usually very confident in many things, but this whole.. landslide business hasn't been the easiest." he admitted. He knew that none of the cats in the clan were having any fun with this, other than perhaps a few that remained out of his knowledge and hidden among the ranks of those sharing in his suffering, even if each cat in the camp had a bit of a different flavor of sorrow and stress than others. A few scoops managed to fit themselves into the time of silence before he sent a glance over to his companion. "How are you today, other than... well, I guess there's not much to be said about all of this.." he said, feeling a bit awkward as his attempt at normal conversation. It felt only right to ask about the other feline's emotions, but at the same time the answer was quite easy to guess, with everything that was going on. @wild™

Springy 🦤 23-Sep-21 03:54 PM
Marigolddust • Tigerpaw
• Present • It was such a relief to see Tigerpaw here and overall well, besides her paw pads of course. He had lost too many cats over the past few days, and too much change was approaching him much too quickly. It would have been helpful to be warned before all of this so that he would be a little bit more prepared, although perhaps they just missed the warning. It had been so rainy and stormy for so many days, and at this time and season, it was far from normal. How could they have missed the message? They could have saved so many lives, kept so many that they loved... Yet here they were, and he absolutely despised it. He felt more bitter than he ever had before, although it wasn't towards any cats, but his own negligence and uselessness. The tom was a bit startled at Tigerpaw's reluctance to catch him up on what happened, but he didn't push her. No, instead he did a small nod in acknowledgment of the desire, leaving the topic behind with the gesture. Marigolddust's attention was immediately caught at the sound of the name that had caused him the most sorrow these past few days, the name no longer sounding as sweet as honey. Instead, it felt quite the opposite, with it's sweet berries poisoned from more sadness than the tom had ever experienced before. Some of his resurfaced sorrow leaked to the surface as he met the strawberry gaze of the tabby's, eyes watering slightly despite his efforts to hold it back. Other cats sometimes built a stone wall over their expressions to keep others from recognizing their emotions, but he had never been good at such a thing. Adverting his gaze, he looked up towards the sky as he tried to come up with the right words.
- "L..Laurelblaze... doesn't think Fernpaw's going to be returning any time soon..." He murmured softly, hating how horridly sour the sound of his own words made him feel. He wished that the topic hadn't turned to this, but at the same time, someone had to tell Tigerpaw, and who better than the cat who would be taking the sandalwood's place? He hated to have to be the one to ruin the hope shining so brightly in the apprentice's gaze, but he couldn't come up with an excuse for a topic so serious and close to home. @Shade (edited)
Shade 23-Sep-21 06:18 PM

"This... was all we found. Take it up to Finchbriar. We can't risk the clan's last herbs getting lost in here." Springy 🦤 23-Sep-21 09:01 PM
Marigolddust • Tigerpaw
• Present • Without a medicine cat... The thought gave him conflicted emotions. Should it make him upset at the idea that Fernpaw was no longer there, or proud at the fact that he made sure such a situation never happened? Looking over, Marigolddust focused his gaze on Tigerpaw again, suddenly feeling figity at the idea of what he was going to say. Twitching an ear, he looked down at his paws, rubbing one against the other in an effort to keep his mind on what was to be said, not what might come as a response. "W-well, Icestar and Laurelblaze *did choose another medicine cat..." He said softly, and for a moment it seemed like he wouldn't continue. But finally, he spoke again, although his mouse was little more than a soft murrmer. "I'm not sure if he'll be a very good one, though... Not quite as good as Fernpaw..." he mumbled, whether to himself or Tigerpaw, it was hard to tell. He found that he had very little confidence in himself when it came to his new rank, especially when it was mentioned while also being on the topic of his absent friend. He still didn't understand what made him worthy of such a role, or why Starclan decided they'd replace Fernpaw with a cat who would likely be unable to do the job half as well as her. Was Starclan's goal to tear the clan apart slowely? Or was this the Dark forest's doing? Whoever was in charge of this, they were doing their job well, if what he expected was truly their goal. The camp was a wreck, their leader lost a life, and a new, inexperienced and amateur Medicine cat was chosen at a time where cats needed professional healing more than anything. @Shade
Shade 23-Sep-21 11:21 PM
If even Marigolddust, one of the nicest cats in the clan, had doubts, Tigerpaw couldn't see why she shouldn't feel at least a twinge of hopelessness. She sighed. "Well, who is it?" My paws are killing me! @Springy 🦤
tremb 23-Sep-21 11:41 PM
{ Wrenpaw // the naive apprentice } The molly’s deep orange gaze widened in horror at the herbs that the warrior presented her with, dark brown ears laying flat against her skull. Every new apprentice was taught about death berries and how terribly dangerous they were, because apprentices were often too curious for their own good. ”D-death berries?” She asked. If that was the only herb they had managed to salvage from the medicine den, then StarClan help them all. Furthermore, she wasn’t entirely certain why Needlestripe wanted her to bring them to another warrior instead of just destroying them right away. Then again, it wasn’t exactly safe to keep them anywhere inside the camp, either. She also had to remind herself that warriors were too large to exit the camp themselves, so the job would be best carried out by an apprentice anyways. Wrenpaw gave herself a little shake to calm her nerves, followed by a small dip of her head to the two warriors. ”I’ll take them to Finchbriar. Surely he will know how to dispose of them properly so that no one gets hurt. Right?” She wasn’t entirely comfortable with the idea of carrying death berries, but she would do anything to help her clan. After all, what kind of clanmate woulds she be if she didn’t play her part in removing potential dangers from the camp? Finchbriar was a prickly warrior, but was trustworthy nonetheless and would surely protect the clan the same way any other warrior would. @Shade @Stark✨

tremb 24-Sep-21 01:50 PM
{ Wrenpaw & Adderpaw } She giggled at his energetic display, feeling some of her usual giddiness coming back as well. She had never been the type to mope around, but today had been different until Adderpaw came along. Usually she was the one trying to cheer up other cats, so it was sort of nice to have the role reversed for a change. ”Don’t worry, you’re gonna make a fine hunter. Practice makes perfect,” she said with a grin. She gave an eager nod of her head, and though her stomach was rumbling and her paws were sore, she stood up anyways. She was always ready to work for her clanmates, no matter how much her body protested it sometimes. ”I’m ready,” she assured him. She thought back to a day only a few moons prior when she had told Marigolddust that she would never get tired. That she felt like she had enough energy to get her through even the hardest of days. Wrenpaw began to realize now that had been a lie. At this moment, she yearned for the energy she had when she’d first been apprenticed. Food had been scarce and repairing the camp was a full time job, it had everyone feeling a bit run down. She began to pad towards the camp barrier, finding a spot both apprentices could squeeze through. (It’s okay! Take your time c: next post in territory?) @Ginger

prim 24-Sep-21 06:34 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Gingerstep | present
In the time since the landslide, Laurelblaze and the rest of ThunderClan that had been fit for duty had been at work trying to restore the entrances around camp. Earth caked their paws and their fur, loose boulders pushed aside to make room for those trying to unearth their collapsed exits. They were so close to getting out, they’d breached the surface on the other side just recently, but it was still too snug for a grown warrior to fit through just yet, they were so close. Since this milestone had occurred in their recovery, Laurelblaze had been elbows-deep in dirt and rocks as she was heading up the excavation effort, using her strength to her advantage as she raked her claws through the walls of the quarry. She wasn’t alone, thankfully, her clanmates had been a great help in their efforts of restoring their camp back to its original state, and she couldn’t be more grateful to them for their assistance. If it weren’t for them, they might never have gotten this far. She was so proud of them, and wouldn’t stop praising them for their hard work for moons to come. We can do this! The brawny tortoiseshell let out a loud grunt as she gripped her claws against one of the heavier boulders she could latch them around. Most of the time with the bigger stones they’d dislodged the earth around them to get them to move out of the way. It was risky, essentially causing a miniature collapse, but it was controlled for the most part. Still, someone could easily get hurt if they weren’t careful, thus with the smaller ones, manual power was better for the job. She snarled as she pulled backwards, feeling the stone shift under her weight as she finally ripped it free, another obstacle cleared, but they weren’t finished. She was exhausted. ”Come on… I can get this cleared today, I know it! I wanna get the hell outta here already!” @Ginger
Springy 🦤 24-Sep-21 07:08 PM
Marigolddust - Tigerpaw
- Present - "Well, who is it?" The question made Marigolddust hesitate; hesitate even more than he had just moments before. What was he supposed to say? He knew that she had to know, and he was going to tell her, even if his mind yelled at him to just cover the conversation with a new topic, hiding the knowledge under new words. Wincing at the mere idea of Tigerpaw's response, he began quietly at first, although his voice gained more volume the longer he spoke. "Well, he's a bit... *tall... and he has golden eyes, dark and light grey fur, and... he's sitting in front of a particular brown tabby.."** His voice returned to a soft whisper as he said the last words. How would she react? She already seemed a bit hopeless and disappointed. Would knowing that he was the cat who was meant to heal the clan provide her with any reassurance? Oh, he sure hoped so. Or... did he? What if he messed this up, and caused her reassurance to be crushed among the debris lying here in the camp? "I'm still not the most sure in their decision, but I'm hoping they chose correctly." he added, his voice no longer as quiet but his tone remaining just as unsure and disappointed. Not even he believed he would do nearly as well as Fernpaw, and even the fact that he had stepped up to the plate when the clan truly needed it no longer provided him with as much comfort as it had. He felt ashamed to have so little confidence in Starclan's choice, but how could he be as sure as them in a decision like this? Well, as long as he was able to at least slow the harm that the injuries gained in the clan, he might have some hope yet, but he wasn't even able to do that. Not yet. @Shade
Shade 24-Sep-21 07:15 PM
Tigerpaw's pink eyes held wide and round. She blinked at him a couple times, processing the allusion. "It's... you?" first her guess was barely audible. Then the apprentice snapped to her paws, striped fur spiking. "It's you, isn't it? Is it really?" The excitement in her weary voice had grown. Tigerpaw looked him up and down again as if he were a new cat. Finally a grin bloomed on her face. "Marigolddust, medicine cat of ThunderClan." Even if the circumstances of his promotion weren't ideal, she was happy for him. The younger she-cat stepped forward and nuzzled his cheek lightly, a faint purr quivering her chin. "You'll do great," she assured him, then her expression sobered again. "Sorry about Fernpaw..." @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 24-Sep-21 10:52 PM
Marigolddust • Tigerpaw
• Present • The positive reaction caused Marigolddust to falter, taken aback by what was going on. He blinked, confused. "U-um- yeah, yeah it's me," he said, although his voice didn't sound nearly as bewildered as he felt. She seemed just as excited as Laurelblaze when he had accepted the rank, and it would be an understatement to say that he was startled. This wasn't exactly the response he expected, and he wasn't sure how he was supposed to think of it. A smile slowely formed on his lips as she said his name and new rank besides one another, although his ears had yet to adjust to the foreign words. It didn't sound like the two were meant to be combined, but at the same time it didn't sound too terrible... although there was still sorrow strung through the title. A small purr was his initial reaction to her affectionate nudge, and he smiled again at her reassuring statement. Laurelblaze and Icestar had said something similar to that, too. Perhaps that meant something? Was it possible that he might end up being alright at his new role? Even if the words gave him some confidence, he knew that healing the cats of the clan was a large job for any, and likely every, cat who had been assigned it. It wasn't going to be easy, being a medicine cat, but he hoped that things might just work out alright. The mention of Fernpaw did well as depleting his previous positivity, causing his smile to fade. He couldn't help but curl his tail close to his side, twitching it slightly in an effort to flick off the new uncomfortable feeling of grief. Sure, he was well aware that his friend might not be coming back, but it was taking longer than he expected for it to sink in. The thought always saddened him, just as much as when he woke up in the morning to see that Fernpaw wasn't among the many cats with him in the camp, or more of a prison, at this point.
- Quieting, he gave Tigerpaw a small nod, hesitation dragging the first syllable of what he said next as he looked over the camp. "It's.. alright... I'm sure everyone's probably mourning her, huh?" He said softly, not exactly facing Tigerpaw as he said the words. He was probably not the only cat in this camp feeling such a strong sense of pain... Fernpaw had been the whole clan's medicine cat, anyhow, and she wasn't only his friend. It felt selfish to feel sorry for himself when there were so many others to feel sorry for. @Shade
Shade 24-Sep-21 11:10 PM
