Springy 🦤 25-Sep-21 10:01 AM
Marigolddust • Tigerpaw
• Present • With a small, soft purr he nodded. "I hope so." He said, his voice fairly quiet with a hint of hope, although it sounded as if it would easily be overrun by sorrow. The tom sure hoped that Tigerpaw was right, but at the same time he knew that what she said wasn't certain, no matter how sure she sounded of herself. They couldn't find anything relating to Fernpaw anywhere besides the medicine cat's den, and it seemed like she had just... Disappeared. Although, there were still possibilities of them finding Fernpaw, as not all of the debris had been cleared yet and she could have been outside of camp when the landslide occurred. Was it a bit cynical of him, thinking about the negatives when Tigerpaw was trying to be so reassuring? Of course part of him believed her, and believed that he was just holding Fernpaw's place until she returned. But, another part of him told him that, if she hadn't returned yet, then she won't. They were two conflicting sides, and it was tricky for him to try and decide whether one or the other was true. Perhaps they both might be accurate, where Fernpaw escaped but couldn't come back? Had she been injured, and that's why she wasn't here now? What would he do then? Blinking, he was snapped out of his thoughts as he heard Tigerpaw's offer. "Really? You wouldn't mind?" He asked, pleasantly surprised by the offer. Maybe if he had some herbs he wouldn't feel quite so useless, even if everyone else in the clan was unable to do just as much as him. Perhaps he could heal some of the injuries with an herb or two if he requested them, and he could have a head start of sorts. Relieved by the very idea of finally being able to do something with his new role, he tried to come up with herbs that were necessary at the moment. It was tricky, knowing exactly what he needed when he hardly knew any of the non-basic herbs, but two particular ones came to mind.
- "Well, moss would be handy, perhaps soaked in fresh water if you can find any and don't mind, and perhaps some marigold, too, if all of it isn't destroyed. You should have an easier time finding it in the meadow," he explained, hoping that it was enough detail and not too much for the apprentice to handle. With wet moss he could slow some bleeding, although there was no clear water remaining in the camp to do such a job. He could crush or chew marigolds and spread the poulice on injuries to make some effort against infections. "Thank you, Tigerpaw." He said, a grateful and perhaps excited shimmer going through his eyes. @Shade
prim 25-Sep-21 10:17 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Gingerstep | present
The deputy had always tried to be a role model to her clanmates, even if in the time before she became deputy she wasn’t exactly the best one. She’d made mistakes in the past, she caused trouble wherever she could find it. Butting heads with other cats was a common problem she had back then, and occasionally it reared its ugly head nowadays. She wasn’t perfect, but she wanted to inspire loyalty and motivation from her clanmates. She wanted to be seen as a paragon of ThunderClan’s warriors. Exemplifying their courage, their strength, and most of all their camaraderie as clanmates. By working together, they could conquer all of the obstacles laid out in front of them. ”Well, its not every day I’m hauling rocks out of the tunnel leading out of camp, am I?” she let out a half-hearted chuckle at the comment made by the younger warrior. She’d be stuck crawling for the next few days, but maybe she could make a plea to Icestar to expand the camp entrance so she didn’t have to inch her way through every single time. They were nearly there, but it still required more work, enough to free them all. Ginger 26-Sep-21 11:08 AM
Gingerstep . Laurelblaze
The young femme let out a soft huff, amber eyes flickering with amusement. It was true, they all wanted to be free of the camp, even if it was their home. They wanted to see the trees overhead and feel the grass underpaw. They wanted to run wild and free through their territory, relish in every blade of grass and gust of wind. Soon. Soon, they would all be free. They just had to keep digging.  "I'm gonna sleep out in the territory for a moon," Gingerstep announced, only half joking. She let out a soft laugh, even if it did feel like claws raking down her throat. Hell, it felt like someone had dragged their claws along her whole body. She had only suffered minor injuries during the event, but the work that followed had caused more damage. Her soft fur was in ruins, tattered and ragged, and the vibrant colors had vanished. The bright ginger and snowy white had melted together beneath layers and layers of earth. No longer was she a pretty orange and white tabby, now she was just...brown.  In all honesty, the young warrior didn't care much about the destruction of her fur. She had witnessed horrible things in such a short time. Clanmates had been horribly injured, buried alive, and even killed. Whenever she closed her eyes, all she could see was the death and destruction. She could still hear Laurelblazes cry after Icestar had been crushed, could still hear that sickening crunch of bones. It still twisted her stomach when she thought of it. Gingerstep had lived an easy, carefree life before, unaware of how horrible things could truly be. She knew now what the world could do. She knew it had changed her, perhaps damaged her, in a way that would never be mended. But the warrior didn't fear the world. No, this was just a lesson, and she was listening. Enjoy those moments where things seem good, even if they're not perfect, because you never know when the good will be stripped away. @prim (edited)
prim 26-Sep-21 12:20 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Gingerstep | present
These kinds of things happened in life, it was impossible for a single lifetime to pass without experiencing pain or major loss. Their lives were never easy, and often it felt as if their ancestors were unfairly testing them to see how much they could take before cracking under pressure. All under the guise of “seeing how a warrior would step up and excel under a great ordeal.” In a way, she felt it was unnecessarily cruel, even if they didn’t cause every single disaster. Still, if one of them decided to show up and explain it was a test, she’d likely start swinging her claws at them for it. Her family suffered, her son was severely injured and wasn’t recovering well from the lack of herbs they had and without an experienced healer. She held no resentment towards Marigolddust for this of course, but she wished Fernpaw was around right now so Featherpaw had someone to rely on with a bit more trust. Not only that, but she lost an old friend, Rooksnap to the landslide. Needless to say, she was put under quite a bit of duress. ”I hear ya. There’s nothing I hate more than being confined to camp against my will. This isn’t the first time it’s happened for me, believe it or not.” how it happened, she didn’t plan to elaborate on. She’d actually been grounded before as a warrior for acting insubordinate, and that was the reason why. Looking back on it now was a bit embarrassing for her, so she wasn’t going to talk much more on the subject. ”Just a little more now. I think its enough room for if I stuck my head through. We just need to widen it a bit more for everyone and we’ll have a working entrance!” her clawing grew more desperate, quicker as she was kicking dirt down below. She’d likely have to groom herself for the next moon if she wanted to get all this dirt off, but it was worth it. They were going to get out, their clanmates would be freed at last! @Ginger

Ginger 27-Sep-21 01:42 PM
Gingerstep . Laurelblaze
Noticing the deputys quickened pace, Gingerstep found herself growing more frantic as well, clawing at the walls with renewed fervor. She felt the mud and rock tear at her talons, threatening to yank them out with every move. But it didn't matter. The pain was nothing, because they were about to get out. They were about to be free. With a thrash of her tail, Gingerstep leaned into her paws, putting all of her weight against the remaining wall. A soft growl of determination escaped her maw and her amber eyes turned fiery as she felt a shift in the mud. With one final push, the remaining wall crumbled around them, showering the cats with debris. As the opening finally yawned around them, Gingerstep struggled to lean back - too late. The delicate feline stumbled forward, tumbling through the opening with paws flailing.  The young femme finally stopped as she slammed onto her back, snowy belly to the sky. Shade 28-Sep-21 08:18 PM

Springy 🦤 28-Sep-21 09:06 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl
• Close Future • A lot of cats had been getting sick recently, but unfortunately the cat who had the job of curing this sickness was too oblivious to be of much help. The sudden illness was add, at least from what Marigolddust could tell. It had sprung out of nowhere, cat after cat complaining about how they felt nauseous, sick, or how they often vomited. It was concerning, to say the least, to have such a pandemic break out during such a trying time. Buy what could have caused it? Almost everybody in the clan seemed to be having some sort of symptoms that others have shared, but so many cats got it in such a short amount of time that it couldn't have possibly been just contagious. It wasn't rational for a contagious sickness to spread at such speed, was it? It seemed more logical to assume that it came from a source in particular, although what source, Marigolddust couldn't be sure. The clan had such minimal resources, but one of them must have been the culprit... Oh, it was far more stressful to be the one needing to deal with such problems than be the assistant, and although he had expected it, he didn't think he would need to deal with such a situation so... Early. So, it was up to him, and Laurelblaze and Icestar, too, to figure out what was causing all of this. Could it be mold that had formed in the rubble? Maybe some sort of fumes were coming from the fallen soil that had yet to release until the landslide allowed it to. Perhaps the landslide had affected outside prey or the water in camp, causing something to make it dirty or dangerous? Personally, Marigolddust seemed to be feeling the lesser parts of the sickness. He felt nauseous and sometimes had a bit of a stomach ache, but otherwise he was fine. It was the towers he was worried about, and one of these others seemed to be... Getting rid of whatever was infecting the clan.
- Ears perking at the sound of the retching, he reluctantly followed the noise, curious and concerned over who it was. Multiple cats came to mind, all of whom he could only hope weren't the source of the sound, although the feline that his eyes finally laid on wasn't the most expected. "Wolfprowl-?" He stated, a bit too startled to keep the name trapped in his thoughts. Instead, the syllables escaped through his teeth as he spoke them, each sound a bit more hesitant than usual. Marigolddust wasn't quite sure what he thought of his brother. He didn't really like him all that much, which was saying a lot when it came to the tux, but at the same time he was family. Did family count for anything if the bridge between them had been burned, though? This was the very cat who had pushed hi out of a tree as a kit, and the same one who had bullied him the whole way back to camp. The stormy toned tom had even changed his name to conclude his dislike towards those who shared his blood, and Marigolddust always found it difficult to fake a friendly smile around the tom. But, now was one of those resentful times. Putting on a small mask of a smile, he approached his younger brother. "A..are you alright? Is there any way I can help?" Even though there was no other cat that he would rather try and avoid, he knew that it was his job to check up on every cat, no matter the past that he had with them. At least he knew that about being a medicine cat. @Shade
Shade 28-Sep-21 09:23 PM
Wolfprowl continued to retch, the sound and smell anything but pleasant. "Go... away-" gruffed the tom weakly before another bout took him over. There was no extra hostility in his decline; he was too busy vomiting to notice who had approached him. When the fit was finally over he raised his head level with his hunched shoulders and looked at his company. "Oh.. Marigolddust, it's you." Tone flat, face unmoving. The brothers were uncanny in appearance yet the warrior hardly treated him like they were family. He wiped the bile from his muzzle with an ashen paw. "..Come to make dirt?" @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 28-Sep-21 09:50 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl
• Close Future • The young tom's muzzle could only wrinkle in disgust as the smell finally hit him, and he tried to not focus on the result of the noises he heard coming from the other tom too hard. The whole situation was a bit disgusting, but he held back any gagging that might have come as a result. The least he could do was be a little polite while his Wolfprowl was... Getting over things. "Oh, um, no, not exactly. I was just.. wondering who might have been having some troubles," he said, unsure how else to word the idea. He didn't know how to say many things correctly around the familiar yet foreign tom, and only reluctance and assumptions came easily at times such as now. "I just came to see if I could help whoever might have been the source, or *you, in this case,"* he clarified, trying to push down the awkward feeling stirring in his gut. His brother's tone wasn't nearly as welcoming as one might have expected from family, but Marigolddust had grown to expect it. At first he had thought that he himself was the only problem to the smoky feline in front of him, but not too long ago, his brother had made a choice that disowned his own family. Let him disown us, he's just going to bring himself more loneliness. The sour thought made him flinch, caught by surprise. He hadn't meant to think something like that at all, but it just came naturally. The cat in front of him was the only one he would think such thoughts about, and although he felt guilty for his mind's words, he also couldn't say that he didn't mean them. Marigolddust's time with Wolfprowl had all been negative, and even though he himself had grown distant from their family, too, he felt resentful towards the other. Sure, a cat could stay away from his family, but making it known that he despised them enough to change his own given name was too far.
- To put it simply, Marigolddust couldn't help but view his brother as more of an edgy apprentice than a mature warrior. "I'm assuming you might not need much assistance, taking into consideration that you don't seem too eager for it.." he said, his voice quiet as he sent a glance down to the puddle that had formed. Of course his brother needed help. Almost every cat in the clan had to be assisted with their illnesses, but Marigolddust had hardly been given any time to try and fetch some herbs to assist those in need. He could leave Wolfprowl for now, couldn't he? From what it looked like, the warrior wasn't all too keen on receiving assistance from him, although even if he did, Marigolddust doubted he would figure out a proper solution. @Shade
Shade 28-Sep-21 09:57 PM
While Marigolddust talked nervously, he buried the bile and scraped freshly fallen leaves over it. Still, the acidic stench remained, mixed with the slightest irony hint of blood. "I'm fine," was all he said, turning towards camp. Sure, his brother was the medicine cat now, but he doubted the other tuxedo had learned enough in the past couple days to be of any use. Wolfprowl walked slowly, a hunch lingering in his posture. He paused his steps as he passed the other tom, screwing his eyes shut as though his stomach had given another painful twist, before carrying on. He was definitely not fine. @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 29-Sep-21 04:27 PM
Marigolddust - Wolfprowl
- Close Future - Blood was the first real hint to the new medic that his brother wasn't as well as he claimed to be. Although the scent of the crimson substance was dulled by the damp scent of the soil, there were still hints of it that managed to waft into the air, reaching Marigolddust's nose with a message as sharp as a thorn. Sure, there had been plenty of retching going around the clan, but very few cats had a mixture of blood mixed into the bile. It was definitely not a reassuring sign, and that was exactly why Marigolddust blocked Wolfprowl, done in a much more polite way than the action might have given off. Releasing a sigh, Marigolddust closed his eyes for a moment, trying to put a claw down on what he was to do. Opening his lemon-tinted gaze, he made an effort to try and look his brother in the eyes. "Look, me and you both know you're not fine. Can you... at least just take it easy?" he suggested, although the sound of the words sounded useless only to his own ears. Why would Wolfprowl have any reason to listen to what he had to say? If only I knew a little more about all of this... then maybe I could actually be of some help. "Maybe we could both go somewhere in camp and just relax, maybe share some sort of prey. You could choose what, if you'd like," he offered. Marigolddust was giving it his best effort to try and figure out and help Wolfprowl somehow, even if he wasn't the most fond of the cat, and the warrior definitely didn't think very approvingly to the milk-dipped paw that Marigolddust was offering to him now. But, despite the fact that Marigolddust would rather have found some other cat and assisted them, Wolfprowl was a clanmate and a cat in need. It was Marigolddust's job to try and offer the tom some relief now. It was a negative factor that Marigolddust had grown to recognize fairly quick, especially now.
- He was giving it his all, or at least all he wasn't afraid to give, to make Icestar, Laurelblaze, and Starclan proud, even if they did choose quite the useless cat at such a troubling time. @Shade
Shade 29-Sep-21 11:09 PM
Wolfprowl stopped and glared at him faintly, most of the yellow fierceness clouded by exhaustion and poisoning. "The clan needs its warriors. There's no time for me to just sit around and-" he began to object but was forced to bite his tongue. "...Fine." he agreed begrudgingly, still no hint of happiness on his face. The darker tom flicked his stunted tail and stalked past him into camp. @Springy 🦤
prim 30-Sep-21 03:54 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Gingerstep | past I
As Gingerstep began the last leg of their excavation effort, her ears picked up on the crumbling and cracking of the earth from within the tunnel, and she felt her heart leap into her throat. When she saw the younger warrior burst her paw through a shallow section of dirt, sending debris flying down the chute, she instinctively shut her eyes and held her breath as dirt and dust rained down from above. When everything finally settled, however, the light from outside streamed into the tunnel, basking their earth-stained forms in bright white sunlight. The deputy’s gaze widened, and she let out a loud cry of joy at the sight. ”We did it!” she began to let out a fit of laughter out of relief. They were free! She immediately began to race out of the camp entrance, scrambling to get out of the tunnel and out into the clearing leading to the woods. The tortoiseshell still couldn’t believe it, freedom at last! She was beaming, her exhaustion replaced by utter glee at the fact her clan was now able to leave camp again. They’d been freed from their earthen prison! ”Tell everyone! We’re out! We have a way out!” @Ginger
Shade 30-Sep-21 05:49 PM
Past Tigerpaw dug at the fallen camp wall feebly. Twilight was well upon the quarry now. The apprentice had been working all day every day non stop to re earn ThunderClan's trust, especially Laurelblaze's, who dug beside her. The younger she-cat kept quiet, the only sound between them being the scrape of their paws against the earth. She wore a weary frown, seeming either deep in thought or absent altogether. Clearly something more than her guilt was bothering her though. @prim repost) (edited)
Springy 🦤 30-Sep-21 06:45 PM
Marigolddust - Wolfprowl
- Close Future - The glare he received wasn't the most unexpected, although it did waver Marigolddust's confidence in convincing his brother to take care of himself. Why was he trying on a cat who would likely ignore his advice any day, let alone one where he was as weak as now, over the so many elsewhere in camp needing the same medical help? Despite the urge that Marigolddust felt to turn around and leave his brother as the tom seemed to want him to do, his reason overran the desire as, once again, he remembered the wavering strength behind Wolfprowl's movements and the distant look that overcame the tom's gaze, emphasizing the sickness enough to keep Marigolddust on his brother's back. Furrowing his nonexistent eyebrows, Marigolddust listened to the warrior's excuse. "The clan can't use warrior's who can't think enough to take care of themselves, especially ones who are puking up their guts," he pointed out. Wolfprowl was clearly not going to be much of a help in tasks such as hunting if he ended up retching before even catching a scent. Finally, Wolfprowl agreed to some sort of assistance. With the tension that had been sticking to his fur now washed away, he let loose a sigh of relief. It had taken long enough for him to figure out how to get through this situation successfully, and now he finally had. The only problem was, he didn't know what to do from here-on-out. Sure, relaxing could give Wolfprowl's stomach a bit of a break, but he would be just as sick as he was when Marigolddust first found him once he stood again. Who knows, maybe he would even loose all of their meal before he could digest it. Marigolddust couldn't decide whether it was a positive thing, not having the sickness personally.
- If he had the full punch of it, it would probably make him unable to focus on much work, but at the same time he would be able to know the symptoms when cats to stubborn to tell him came around. Instead, he only had a small discomfort in his middle, even now. He didn't feel the best, but he didn't feel as terrible as his brother must have. Recently, he had been taking in less of every resource they had; he was eating less, drinking less, digging less... if you could think of something the clan was using during these trying times, then he was taking smaller morsels of it all. It seemed to be working, almost concluding his idea that it was something with what they clan was using, but at the same time he might have just had a better immune system against it. Either way, he had begun to feel his own ribs recently, even with the recent opening of the camp. He wouldn't take in any less food than he already was, at least he wasn't planning on it, but he still knew it would probably be best if he figured out a treatment for what was going around. If he didn't, then small meals might start catching up to him, making him even slimmer than he was naturally. He would eat the normal amount as soon as he found out how to treat this illness; that way, even if his case of it got more severe, he would be able to treat himself along with the others. It was better being hungry than retching what you have eaten out.
- "Great," Marigolddust said, his tone still holding onto the relief that he felt. This was going at least a bit better than he had expected, and that was a good thing. Following next to young warrior, Marigolddust glanced sideways towards the other. "What would you like? I'll go get whatever it is while you choose a place to sit." he offered. He wanted to add, as long as it isn't a vole or mouse, afterwards, but he held his tongue. Whatever Wolfprowl wanted, he would be fine with, although maybe he should double check the meal before they took a bite of it. Maybe some prey was sick, and that was what was causing this? @Shade
Shade 30-Sep-21 06:55 PM
Desperately Wolfprowl wanted to wash the acid taste off his tongue, but he couldn't even think about swallowing water right now, let alone ingest an entire meal. He lumbered towards one of the few flat spots left in camp, pausing only to decline Marigolddust. "I'm... not hungry." Scrutinizing yellow eyes combed his brother. "You look like you need it more than I do." He settled down on a moonlit stone several more strides away with a sigh, sounding like an elder rather than a strong young warrior. Wolfprowl was not one to show pain; if even he couldn't keep his symptoms completely in check, whatever was causing this sickness must be severe. @Springy 🦤 (edited)
Springy 🦤 30-Sep-21 07:31 PM
Marigolddust - Wolfprowl
- Close Future - It was a bit scary, if Marigolddust were to be honest, seeing what a toll this illness had taken on his own brother. Sure, any stomach bug might have caused something like this in some cats, but his brother had a strong immune system, and on top of that, he didn't often show much of his trouble when it came to most any sickness. He began to realize how lucky he was to get off with so little symptoms as he looked over his brother, who of which now looked fairly pitiful. With this realization, it didn't take much for Marigolddust to feel startled by Wolfprowl's response to the idea of food. Sure, the smoky furred tom would likely end up loosing his food to become bile after their meal, but either way, he had to eat something, even if Marigolddust found himself so suspicious of the prey. It seemed the most likely source of this sickness problem, since not everybody was digging, such as the kits. He faltered when his own state was mentioned, sending a quick glance to his sides, he paused for just a moment before shaking his head. "No, I'm fine. You're the one who has to eat. You need your strength if your going to get any better, and not eating is a great way to do the complete opposite. At least take a few bites?" he suggested. This was beginning to become a little more difficult than he had once foresaw. He had imagined his brother would have agreed to the meal, even if it was quite the absurd hope, and now he had to try once again to convince the warrior to do as he suggested. There wasn't much difference in standing in place while retching and sitting around somewhere in camp, and he had looked forwards to this being a little easier than it was serving to be.
- Why couldn't Wolfprowl be as tolerable as some other cats? What other cats, he wasn't exactly sure quite yet, but he doubted that Fernpaw would have refused such recommendations. Or would she, just as he was, to convince himself that he was helping himself and the clan both better? No, no thinking about the lost sandalwood. Now right now. Raising his pale-furred tail, Marigolddust brushed it against his brother's shoulders before using it to gesture towards the prey pile, hoping the gentle prodding would get his attention better than his words. The gesture was one that was often much more friendly than he felt now, and was meant for cats that were usually closer to him. But, he was using it as a second-to-last resort of sorts. "You can't say that the prey doesn't look at least a little bit tempting.. can you?"
@Shade

{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | past II

She was worried sick, and Tigerpaw returned without any reason why she had left. She had scared her, she thought she might have died in the disaster, or went missing and ended up like one of those rogue bodies on the border. Laurelblaze was very protective over her pupils, she saw them as her responsibility. She had to set an example to them and to ensure they’d behave from now on. This was about the equivalent of nest duty for now, but she was sure Tigerpaw would learn from her mistake now. ”How’s digging coming along for you?” she peered over towards the smaller molly with a raised brow, her claws raking into a patch of earth and ripping it out of the wall that acted as an obstacle in their way of freedom. Laurelblaze was determined to tear it down, they needed to clear it out before long, otherwise they’d start going hungry. Even she was starting to feel hunger pangs, but she resisted the urge to go and pick a piece of prey out of the pile to sate her hunger. They were surviving off of scraps at this point, they’d have to begin rationing prey until she could get patrols out again. This is the worst… She too, was deep in thought in this moment. @Shade
Shade 30-Sep-21 11:56 PM

Ice 01-Oct-21 05:32 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
Icestar’s paws were still raw from all the digging they had to do this week. Her pads were viciously cracked and dried blood caked the bottom of her toes. Marigolddust’s herb reserve was limited and as usual, the lynx-point had avoided the medicine cat den to allow her other Clanmates to get treated first. When everything gets resolved, I will go straight to Marigolddust, she promised herself. She looked down from the Highledge, knowing that each and every cat down there was suffering like her. Mentally and physically. As part of her duty as leader, Icestar needed to boost morale and what better way than to celebrate the coming of a new warrior and medicine cat. ” All those who are old enough to catch their own prey, gather around for a Clan meeting!” Hopefully, this worked. @ThunderClan @Springy 🦤 @cake

spark's clone™ 01-Oct-21 05:44 PM
Cloverpaw
She wouldn't be the one to admit, but Cloverpaw was exhausted - she of course never was very expressive about any emotions aside from frustrations. The recent events had only pulled the black and white femme into a darker place. Rooksnap's loss hadn't hit close to home, or at least that's what she wanted everyone else to think. Quietly, she had told herself that she had to be the tough one in this situation.. and in turn she'd even closed herself off from Blaze - her one and only outlet. Hearing Icestar was a change, a sign that life had to move on no matter the circumstances. Muscles aching, Cloverpaw rose from her laying position and slowly slithered her way closer to the high ledge, striking emerald gaze landed on the leader intensely. New ceremonies meant better times, or at least that's what she'd been taught to think. (edited)
prim 01-Oct-21 05:53 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | past II
”Ah. I see…” In truth, she didn’t really know how to respond. She didn’t have someone she was fond of when she was Tigerpaw’s age. So she really didn’t have much advice to give on this front. When she was her apprentice’s age, all she was focused on was aiming to fight almost every single one of her peers in order to claim herself as the most powerful apprentice of ThunderClan at the time. She had a penchant for the rush of battle, rather than romance. Still, her apprentice seemed rather disheartened and down, she had to say something. ”It happens sometimes, relationships are like that.” she murmured quietly, but she realized if she didn’t elaborate soon its meaning would most certainly be muddled. ”Not always, though, I’m sure things will work out one day. Besides, you’re still young to be dealing with these things, give it some time.” Tigerpaw was still an apprentice, but she still wanted to give her a warning. Sometimes cats rushed into relationships without warning or care, and she didn’t want her to get hurt along the way. Ice 01-Oct-21 05:59 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
She wasted no time. The moment the last of her Clanmates settled below, Icestar stepped forward and set her chin. Her ragged build and mud-smeared pelt blended in with the rest but the fire in her eyes was no different from usual: it blazed it in its blue-green glory. ” Life isn’t perfect,” she began. ” It is a challenge. In order to succeed, we must overcome the hardships and since the beginning of the Clans, generations of ThunderClan warriors have been fighting to preserve the life of ThunderClan. Through their effort and sacrifice, this Clan has lived to see another day. That duty is now passed onto us.” Her gaze burned across the crowd. ” The passing of Rooksnap and Fernpaw’s absence is truly a tragedy among this horrible turn of events. They were all amazing cats in both personality and loyalty and were committed in their hearts. We must mourn for them but never forget to honour them and the legacy they have created within the Clan. We must hope that they have made it to a safe and happy place where they can spend the rest of their lives.” Icestar would have never thought that their lives would remain absent from ThunderClan so soon. She took in a steady breath, continuing with her speech: ” Despite what has happened, we must keep moving forward for the sake of ourselves and the Clan. We have to continue to work hard to find a way to clear the tunnels and bring everything back to its peaceful state. Hope is the most powerful weapon against these rising shadows. It’s the light that pierces even the darkest of eras. Life, while brutal, has hope growing in the corners. Use this hope I give you in order to pursue onward." (edited)
She turned towards Marbledpaw. The form of hope she was going to give them was life itself. “I, Icestar of ThunderClan, call upon my warrior ancestors to look down on this apprentice. They have trained hard to understand the ways of your noble code, and I commend them to you as a warrior in their turn. Marbledpaw, do you promise to uphold the warrior code and to protect and defend your Clan, even at the cost of your life?” @ThunderClan @cake (edited)
Springy 🦤 01-Oct-21 06:07 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies & Meddie Announcement
- Present - Today was the day. He knew, or at least believed that he knew, what Icestar's voice calling for the clan would eventually lead to. He hadn't heard the call ever since the disaster of the landslide, and now that he heard it again it felt a little bit nastalgic, no matter how short the time was between then to now. Perking his ears, he quietly padded up to the crowd. At first he was about to sit where he usually did, but with a moment of hesitation and thought he decided it might be best to settle a little closer to Icestar's perch. Whether he decided to do so to be a little more hidden or closer just incase he was called up, he wasn't quite sure. It made him uncomfortable as he sat with his flank nearly touching others, and it was far from natural to him, but hopefully it would work well enough for whatever he meant to sit here for. Icestar's voice met the young tom's ears once more, catching him off guard as she mentioned the losses of the two cats he was closed to. Feeling a pang of pain hit his chest, he lowered his head and sent a glance to the cats around him. Shouldn't he have known that the names were going to be mentioned? It was much better to take care of their memory through the first ceremony prior, even if it did sting. Biting his tounge, he looked towards Icestar again, trying not to get any more distracted from his thoughts than he already was. Marbledpaw? The ceremony was a bit unexpected, despite how normal it was supposed to be. Marigolddust, although feeling guilty, couldn't help but be confused on whether he should be excited or not. This was an amazing day for the young she-cat, and usually cats he knew getting their names was always exciting, even if it was yet another bringing of change.
- Unfortunately, it wasn't such an amazing time, although it would hopefully lighten the spirits of the Thunderclanners, or at least Marbledpaw herself. Giving the apprentice a smile, he tried to figure out what name Icestar might gift her. What would he have to call her from here on out? @Iceywicey#3780
Bronzewing 01-Oct-21 06:12 PM
@Pip Sandstride had gone out on patrol, but Pinefoot had decided to take a quick break, staying back at camp to watch the ceremonies. He hadn't seen one of these in a while, and he didn't mind them much- they were always the same, and nothing met the same rush as his own ceremony, but he never minded watching them. And this should be an important one. he thought, tail twitching. He had no clue that Sparrowfeather was looking for him, as his eyes were fixed on the leader- and he had also lost track of the bird for the time being.
cake 01-Oct-21 06:13 PM
marbledpaw | @Ice If Cloverpaw held in most of her emotions, Marbledpaw was what most would define a wreck. Desperately dragging herself out of pits of hell everytime she woke up, lack of sleep, ruffled fur, panicked stare, and nightmares- the ceremony was a relief, maybe a drench in cold water to wash herself out of the repeated cycle she had been going through. Rooksnap's name was mentioned and her ears flattened, unsure to whether be upset or furious or.. both. So instead she attempted to squirm backwards only for her name to be called and a pathway separate for her to walk forwards. Do you? If she had refused here and there, her nanny's sacrifice would have been in vain- no, that couldn't, it wouldn't happen, she would ensure it. Cost of her life... maybe after everything that had happened it would hold a new meaning; her gaze glanced backwards to the expectant gazes of her clanmates, and realized that maybe they did need a new warrior in their ranks for hope. "Yes- I do," the words were a little rushed and voice cracked as if she hadn't spoken in days, but steeled with newfound iron, chest lifting, eyes fixing determinedly on the sky above instead of directly at Icestar, trying to search if the beginnings of stars were already showing despite the sun.
Ice 01-Oct-21 06:26 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
The crack of the apprentice’s voice was one that was injured by grief and distress. Icestar felt her jaws tighten in response. Initiating this ceremony during a crisis was a bold move. One might think it was a slap in the face to pretend everything was alright amidst the chaos. However, it was a useful tactic to encourage her Clanmates to draw their courage and determination. They needed them now more than ever and Icestar wished to remind them of that. ” “Then by the powers of StarClan, I give you your warrior name. Marbledpaw from this moment you will be known as Marbledskies. StarClan honours your cleverness and diligence, and we welcome you as a full warrior of ThunderClan.” Leaning forward, Icestar rested her white muzzle upon the newly-proclaimed warrior’s forehead, soaking in the warmth of Marbledskies’ scent. @cake @ThunderClan
prim 01-Oct-21 06:31 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Ceremonies
This day would be the start of a brand new spark of hope among the populace, even with so much destruction and the death and disappearance of beloved clanmates, Laurelblaze understood that they could not wallow in misery. They had to find joy in the moments wherever they could. This day would mark the start of their recovery, the celebration of the elevation of an apprentice into a warrior, Marbledskies. The deputy nodded firmly and begun the celebratory chant for the newly-dubbed warrior, trying to kill the solemn mood by desperate celebration. They needed it. ”Marbledskies! Marbledskies! Shade 01-Oct-21 06:33 PM
Almost as if she were summoned by the words of the leader and the thoughts of her subjects, Rooksnap's spirit wandered among the crowd. She had been watching the ceremony from a darkening sky, where stars finally began to show through the pastel citrus. After moons of anger and tension, the dead nanny had found peace. In the form of a cold yet comforting breeze, she brushed past each of her gathered kits in turn, reaching Marbledskies last. Though she couldn't see or hear her, the familiar milk scent of the munchkin wreathed around the new warrior. The message was clear. I'm proud of you. And I forgive you. Would Marbledskies forgive her too? A stronger wind shook the tops of the trees now, behind them the thin clouds creating a beautiful mixed pattern on their colorful backdrop. Somewhere in another realm, Rooksnap cheered the new name of her kit. 'Marbledskies! Marbledskies!'

spark's clone™ 01-Oct-21 06:36 PM
Cloverpaw
For a moment, the stone cold expression on the slender she-cat's face faltered. It was Marbledpaw's ceremony. She wasn't upset, truthfully.. she was supposed to remain strong, but seeing the previously bitter light-colored calcio in such a state actually made her feel some sort of sympathy. Even though she herself was just a bit younger than Marbledpaw, the two had always had their complicated relationship that started when they were no more than a few mousetails tall. She was becoming a warrior now. Although she couldn't even hardly bare to cheer, Cloverpaw had to feel pride - as she wanted Marbledskies to feel proud in this moment. It was part of a healing process.. she guessed. With the sorest of throats the younger she-cat gazed at, well.. she supposed they were sisters of some kind.. ironically to be the only "sister" Clover would ever know. Hearing the chants reach the air, she also happened to notice how she longed for her own ceremony.. even though she had claimed to hate every clan tradition there was. One thing was certain. There was a congratulations written all over her face.
Springy 🦤 01-Oct-21 06:43 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies & Meddie Announcement
- Present - Marbledskies. The name was far more beautiful than he might have expected during such a trying time, and for a moment the ceremonies made his own heart skip a beat in excitement, feeling the same joy that he did with previous meetings such as this one. "Marbledskies! Marbledskies!" He called out, his voice only one in the mixture of dozens as the clan cheered for the emotional fem. The name rolled off of his tounge with ease, and his happiness for the new warrior wavered only when he felt a small breeze. Usually it would have meant little to nothing to him, but it seemed... Odd, as if it weren't the average stream of wind. Glancing over, he tried to see if anybody else had felt it. The majority of the cats seemed to have not felt it, unless it had just gone unnoticed. As he sent a quick glance around at the faces surrounding him, the majority not seeming all too well, he caught sight of Cloverpaw. His thoughts seemed to align with hers as he wondered what her ceremony might be like and when it would happen, along with Blazepaw's, for just a moment before he focused again on the new recruit to the rank of their warriors. The gentle breeze stuck in the back of his mind as he put all of his focus on Marbledpaw- no, Marbledskies, now. He tried not to focus on the illness that had plagued the camp, nor the injuries. Icestar wasn't the only one with injured paw pads, and he wasn't quite sure if he was capable of fixing everything that had happened. Instead, he tried to focus on the she-cat gaining a new title, and that she-cat alone. @Ice
Shade 01-Oct-21 06:47 PM
"Marbledskies! Marbledskies!" Tigerpaw and Needlestripe cheered.
Ice 01-Oct-21 07:08 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
It warmed her heart watching Marbledskies’ eyes light up. The chanting of the Clan rang right up to StarClan. There was no doubt. If this wasn’t a morale booster, the lynx-point didn’t know what else could be. Icestar remaining on the Highledge was an obvious sign that there was more to this meeting than ceremonies. She waited patiently as the cheers subsided, leaving behind a gentle glow of joy. ” As I have mentioned before, Fernpaw has disappeared. Hence, ThunderClan is missing its sole medicine cat.” With no apprentice to take her place, the Clan was in a dire situation. Or would be if that had been the case… ” However, Laurelblaze has discovered marigold petals unusually placed by the medicine den and to our interpretation, it is StarClan’s way of showing us that they wish to encourage a particular cat to take this position.” She paused, letting the words sink into each and every being. Slowly and with great care, Icestar looked over to the tuxedo tom with intricate daisy yellow hues. ” Marigolddust, would you like to take on the role of ThunderClan’s new medicine cat?” @ThunderClan @Springy 🦤 (edited)
Springy 🦤 01-Oct-21 07:38 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies & Meddie Announcement
- Present - Words that he had already heard once before still sounded foreign to him as they were repeated, his own ceremony of sorts following close being Marbledskies'. He might have guessed that his chosen rank would solely be announced today, not asked of him, but perhaps it was good to have a second chance to go back. Although he couldn't see this situation as a choice to turn around and go back to being a warrior, it seemed like it easily could have been meant that way. He took a moment to think over the question. Yes, it had been answered already just a day or two ago, but he thought it would be more respectful and conclusive to give it a second thought. He was committing himself to a life of healing if he were to say yes, and now that he has truly gotten a chance to take in all of the problems that the clan was having medical wise, he felt more than intimidated. Fear was something he felt often, but he had never quite felt fear like this. But that was all that held him for the few seconds. He had already said yes to the question once before, and it would be rude and terrible to say no to it now. Sure, he had yet to truly figure out how he will move on from here, but he could do it nonetheless, with enough time.
- Getting onto his paws, he looked up at Icestar and tried not to focus on everyone else. This was far more awkward now that the factor of the whole clan was added, but he felt it wouldn't be enough to say the two words that would finalize this turning point for him sitting down. With his ears going a little flatter on his head as he felt apprehension push them down, he gave a small nod. "I will," he finally said, wincing a little at the idea of what the others there would think. Would they view him as worthy enough? Did they see how terribly he could fail, just as he did? All he could do was hope they didn't. Maybe they even wished Fernpaw was still there. No, of course they did. Fernpaw deserved to be just as greived over as every other cat in the forest. He couldn't be the only one who would surely find himself letting some tears fall as he lay in his nest at night, letting the grief truly settle in. Way to turn such a good situation sad, Marigolddust. He thought quietly, feeling sheepish for his own thoughts. @Ice
Ice 01-Oct-21 07:56 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
The silence that fell before them was enough to cause Icestar’s dark ears to prick with interest. Was Marigolddust reconsidering his new position? The masked leader remained still, not even the usual twitching of her tail tip disturbed the wind. Marigolddust wasn’t one to dishonour his own words. If he had agreed to do it, then he would follow through with it. Just as he had agreed to mentor Wrenpaw and had decided to continue despite his recent role. Icestar admired that trait of his. It must be serious if he would back down from it. I will. Those words rang true. Icestar faced the Clan once more. ” Then it is settled. Once we have found a way out, Marigolddust and I will venture to the Moonpool to receive his official title as ThunderClan’s new medicine cat.” They were going to get out of this just like they always did. While the progress was slow, the fruit of their labour was nearing and all it took was to keep at it until they could reach out and grab it. @ThunderClan @Springy 🦤
Shade 01-Oct-21 08:28 PM
While Marbledskies hadn't been able to see her, if Marigolddust looked out across the crowd, he'd see a faint outline treading above them. Sun-and-moon eyes filled with stars, Rooksnap smiled and dipped her head to him before fading away. Her appearance and the gesture were a sign that StarClan had accepted the new medicine cat. @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 01-Oct-21 09:47 PM
Marigolddust • Ceremonies & Meddie Announcement
- Present - The moon pool was another important factor of this new role that he had in the clan that he had, somehow, forgotten. It was odd, how easy it was to forget what you might be signing up for at a time with as much excitement as becoming a medicine cat. Marigolddust nearly shivered at the idea, perhaps out of fear, but also possibly because of excitement. He had never been to the pool before, and he didn't feel worthy enough to go to the legendary waters. What if it really wasn't a sign from Starclan, the marigold petals? What if he went to the moon pool and received nothing, unable to sink into the deep sleep that all star-chosen high ranks did? Would he end up there, awake in the small cavern while Icestar slept? What would she and Laurelblaze think if he turned out to really not be destined for the job? Soon, the excitement that may have lied behind his shiver dispersed, overtaken by fear and apprehension. So many things could go wrong, yet he wouldn't be able to know what will and what won't. Trying to ignore the doubts and realities running through his head, he gave a small smile to his leader and a soft nod of agreement. He would be going to the moon pool with the silver point, and that might have been the only thing he knew if he hadn't caught a glimpse of stars that seemed a bit out of place. Turning his attention onto the early coming stars, Marigolddust froze as he took in the sight. The stars looked like a cat he knew all too well... But that couldn't be, could it? No, he must have been seeing things. Worry must have finally made him hallucinate. But, imaginary or not, Marigolddust couldn't bring himself to move a muscle. He could just stare at the familiar form, meeting eyes he knew better than his own mother's.

prim 01-Oct-21 09:54 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Ceremonies
Truly, this day was going to mark a new era in ThunderClan, the title of medicine cat has been passed to a new holder officially. Marigolddust was Fernpaw’s successor, and he had not only the eyes of his clanmates trained upon him, but those of their warrior ancestors as well. She prayed for his and Icestar’s safety for when they eventually made the trek to the Moonpool in order for him to be officially recognized by StarClan as ThunderClan’s medicine cat. Goodness knows what potentially lied out there, but she had faith they would return to the clan safely when the time came. For now, he’d be a medicine cat in name only until the pair could make the journey to the Moonpool. He’s gonna be great, I believe in him! The deputy couldn’t contain her joy as she began the chanting again, ”Marigolddust! Marigolddust!” the cries filled the air, and she hoped she was chanting so loud that StarClan could hear her, that they knew that Marigolddust was their new medicine cat, and that they were going to accept that no matter what!

Springy 🦤 01-Oct-21 10:15 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl
- Close Future - A smile spread across his grey features as Wolfprowl accepted Marigolddust's suggestion. The little bit of irritation that his brother expressed might have made the moment more sweet, showing Marigolddust that he had managed to convince even Wolfprowl to take are of himself. Maybe he wouldn't be all that bad at this, after all, if he kept this up. That was, besides the fact that he hardly knew any more herbs than poppyseed, marigold, cobwebs, and chamomile. "Something small.. I can do that," he agreed, looking over towards the prey pile. Anything small? Well, it was a good thing that there were some small birds, and maybe some small squirrels, too, although their tails had a bit too much fur to make them all that satisfying to eat. A finch could work, couldn't it? The prey was small, with a thinner layer of feathers instead a thick coat of fur. It was also decently tasty, and perhaps he would even take a feather or two for his nest. He was about to set off to get the small meal when his brother spoke again, distracting him from the small mission. Pausing, Marigolddust glanced back at the other grey tom. "I-- I'm.. fine, don't worry about it." He said, before softly adding, "I'm not puking my guts out nearly as much as any of you."**** He turned his back on Wolfprowl once again, hoping to leave the topic behind as he took off for the short trip to the prey pile.
- There was indeed a finch that he found in the pile, although it's feathers were brown, more like the common finch rather than the sunny colors of the goldfinch. Deciding it would be best not too be too much more picky than he already was being, he lowered his head and nudged the morsel of prey, turning it as he examined it's exterior. The small animal seemed to have been fine when it still had life behind it's eyes, and still seemed just as fine now, besides perhaps a little bit of mud. Pensive, he picked the finch up carefully before bringing it back to his and Wolfprowl's resting place. "How's this?" He asked, setting it in front of his brother for his judgment. @Shade (edited)
Shade 01-Oct-21 10:31 PM

prim 01-Oct-21 10:56 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | past II
She hadn’t expected a response like this from her apprentice, but considering her personality and how earnest she was in almost everything she did, she probably should have. Of course that behavior would extend into her sadness, especially with something like this. No one liked having their heart broken by someone they cared for, it was never a cake walk. It took time to heal from the initial blow, but all Laurelblaze hoped was that her pupil would chin up soon. This was definitely concerning for her, as she couldn’t train or work when she was holding back tears. Gotta let her let it all out, she’s definitely in a lot of pain right now. Laurelblaze relaxed her stance a bit as she let her apprentice use her fur as a comfort zone, it wasn’t the first time someone came to her to act as a shoulder to cry on. The deputy wanted to be there for her clanmates, especially her apprentices. They needed to trust her, she wanted them to trust her. ”Its okay, Tigerpaw, you’ll get through this. Its not the end of the world.” a bit of an understatement, but Laurelblaze really didn’t understand why the apprentices were so eager to hop into relationships, these things took time— but she was speaking from personal experience of course, it took a long time before she and Hollyfrost decided to confess to one another. Shade 02-Oct-21 02:50 PM
Tigerpaw and Juniperpaw had been deeply infatuated with each other, and even though she was beginning to gain some perspective from it, the lesson was a hard one to learn. He saved my life... but she couldn't explain that guilt to Laurelblaze, after lying that it had been her idea to leave to protect his reputation. prim 02-Oct-21 09:31 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | past II
In a way, life couldn’t be a fairytale where two people who meet immediately fell in love. It was unrealistic, and Tigerpaw had learned that lesson relatively early on. Not every relationship worked out, and that extended to all kinds of them. Friendships sometimes drifted apart, betrayals occurred, and even sometimes two cats met at the wrong time in life. The world could be cruel, but that didn’t diminish the amount of joy that could be found in it once it was discovered. She had faith her apprentice would one day discover that for herself, and recover finally. ”You know, I never really spent my time focusing on that sort of thing when I was your age honestly, I think I scared the other apprentices. I always wanted to brawl with them, so imagine how that worked out for me.” her lips curled up into an amused smirk, and she couldn’t help but to let out a chuckle. She had a point behind her words, she wasn’t spouting empty nonsense at her to make her feel better. ”But there were a few cats who did let me into their lives, they saw past that, and even if some have moved on from my life, I haven’t forgotten about them. Even if it hurts, one day you’ll look back and enjoy the time you did get to spend in each other’s lives. The happiness it brought, and you’ll experience it again, and hopefully it does last.” the deputy let out a small sigh, before she shot an oddly, deathly serious glare down to the young molly. ”But not anytime soon, you’re focusing on your training until the day you get your warrior name, missy. I still haven’t forgotten.” @Shade
wild™ 05-Oct-21 04:34 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The trek across Thunderclan territory had been more than easy, his russet paws seeming to almost glide across the terrain with ease. His eyes and ears had done the most work, constantly searching the area for the slightest thing that could mean potential danger for the tom and his companion. He spared a word or two with Skyclan's medicine cat, once or twice as to break the silence, yet his main focus rested on the journey ahead. And yet, before long they had arrived. Safely, as predicted. Cardinalspark led the way through the camp's entrance, his ears twitching as he inhaled deeply. It was quite nice to be able to come and go as he pleased again, though there was still quite a lot to be done. Currently, they needed Beanspark to help aid Marigolddust in his new life as Thunderclan's medicine cat. With a toss of his head, the russet feline urged the tortoiseshell forward. 'Well, we have arrived. I'm pretty sure if he's not in camp anywhere, he'd be in the medicine cat den." he said after a moment, casting a glance about the camp for the tuxedo tom. @Captain⛵
Captain⛵ 05-Oct-21 04:48 PM
Beanspark - ThunderClan
Beanspark silently followed Cardinalspark, the lone warrior he managed to catch on the border. Beanspark's eyes remained on the ground before him, his mind filled with murky water. Sure, he was now a fully fledged medicine cat. Everything he had been working towards was starting to pay off. But... Hemlockpaw stayed on the edge of his mind. Every time he walked through camp he always swore he could see his mate standing there. Beanspark needed a break from camp, desperately. He assumed that Specklerose could sense this somehow, as she sent him to train with Marigolddust. Beanspark shook his head free of the dirt as they entered ThunderClan camp. He had never entered another clan's camp, minus WindClan. "Oh wow! ThunderClan is quite beautiful this time of year." The oak trees were littered with orange and brown, as leaffall had begun. Even with the landslides damage, it still looked so peaceful. "I really appreciate the escort, Cardinalspark. I'll find him." Beanspark bowed his head as if to excuse him, then turned around to look for the esteemed Marigolddust. @wild™ @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 05-Oct-21 06:02 PM
Marigolddust • Beanspark
- Present - Cardinalspark was right; although the grey tux was nowhere to be found in the camp, he was in fact nearby, trying to sort through things in his new den. It was an absolute disaster, and all that was there were the few, most basic herbs, and he was even low on those, despite how long he spent trying to collect everything he recalled being a healing plant, rather than the average greenery. The painted wall was, fortunately, still intact, although it was a little muddy and dusty even after he had dug away the debris that had lied infront of it. The paintings on it were beautiful, although what they meant, Marigolddust wasn't sure. If only Fernpaw was here to explain it all to me, he thought, yellow gaze blurring at the sadness that was lifted from the thought. If only he could go back, go back to a time when everything was alright, at least on the surface. Even though that time was not even a moon ago. Maybe then he could make sure to spend as much time as possible with Fernpaw, to learn all he could and perhaps even warn her, if he was able to. Maybe he could have prevented this whole landslide, if he hadn't been so oblivious, even if everybody else was as unaware as him. Large ears perked as voices joined his ears, one faintly familiar while the other was completely foreign. Usually he would have been uneffected by something like that, since he was so bad with remembering the names and stories of those who even shared his same clan, but a scent accompanied his nose that caught him off guard, dragging him out of his thoughts. Straightening, Marigolddust recognized the scent that he was warned might be the hardest to remember as a kit. Or was it the easiest? It already seemed so long ago that he was still on talking terms with Rooksnap, and now they wouldn't return to such domain.
- Biting his lip, the tom tried to push away all of the thoughts. Now wasn't the time for things like this, not with who had come to visit. Marigolddust knew, of course, about Beanspark coming to help him with his new rank, and immediately felt nervous as he heard the unfamiliar voice. Quickly stepping on his tail to distract him from everything going through his head, he prepared to meet the other young tom. Finding temporary peace in the deep waters of his thoughts, he turned and reluctantly exited the den. Near the center of the camp, he spotted the two other toms, becoming more apprehensive as his lemony hues landed on a specific tortoiseshell. He had managed to inch close enough to hear Beanspark's comment on the camp, along with his next words. Stepping forwards, Marigolddust hesitantly spoke up. "Oh, um- no need for that," he said, his tone quiet but his words quick as he approached the two shyly. This was the first time that he had met a cat from another clan in his own territory, and it was quite nerve-racking, to say the least, especially when the other was searching for him. After a moment of pause, the new medic realized he didn't introduce himself. Was he supposed to? Beanspark clearly knew who he was, although Marigolddust had never actually interacted with the tom. Maybe he should mention that he was who the Skyclanner was looking for, on case he had expected something different. "O-oh, I'm Marigolddust, by the way," he said, almost cringing at the awkward tone in his voice as his nerves got the best of him, making him trip over his own words. "I'm... Glad that someone can still see this as pretty. It looks much better than it did before." Marigolddust said, his words finally more stable as he gazed around at the camp.
- Maybe it was the fact that he had spent moons living in a place that looked just as this did now, rather than rocky terrain, that made it so he wasn't able to see much beauty in his surroundings. Mainly, there was only misfortune and ruin, despite the fact that it had been fixed up quite a bit. @Captain⛵ @wild™ (If you'd still like to be pinged, since I believe you can have Cardinal leave now! <3)

The rosetted feline could hardly imagine the camp any better than its destroyed state, but surely enough - that day had finally come and cats were able to come and go as they pleased. Mistypaw hadn't truly been affected by the blockage, managing to make her way through the small entrance thanks to her size. Yet it had been tiring being among the only ones able to gather prey for their clanmates. If this would be what warriorhood would be like, she wanted no part in it. Such would be...much too tiring. Even so, as she laid sprawled out in camp; she was no where near exhaustion. She'd had a few days rest since the entrances had been cleared and now, she desired nothing more than to do something of some sort. It was a moment of conflict however, as she wasn't the type to actively seek out chores nor duties of any kind. Besides, though the itch to move was nearly unbearable, she couldn't bother to move. Beanspark - Marigolddust

Springy 🦤 05-Oct-21 09:53 PM
Marigolddust • Beanspark
- Present - Marigolddust sent Cardinalspark a thankful look as the tom turned and walked away, although guilt and doubt from the fact that he couldn't recall the warrior's name held back the words of gratitude that were on the tip of his tongue. Now, it was only Beanspark and him... He hoped he wouldn't mess this up too badly or give off too poor of an impression. It was already an embarrassment, the fact that he knew so little about herbs, but how would it feel to display such a weakness Infront of a cat who had spent his whole apprenticeship studying and mastering the topic? Tearing his eyes off of Cardinalfall's leaving form, Marigolddust focused on Beanspark again. Sure, the Skyclan Medicine cat was a bit shorter than him, but he was just as worry-inducing as Laurelblaze, if not more. It was only the warm smile the tom offered that calmed Marigolddust's doubt, if only the littlest bit. Beanspark didn't seem like a cat who would be too quick to judge another, and he must know the difficulties of learning herbs too, mustn't he? Beanspark might have to take it easy on him, even if Marigolddust wanted to learn all he could as fast as he could. He had so, so many cat's to heal... It was too overwhelming to be unable to do anything, even if he couldn't be blamed for it. "You too, Beanspark, thanks for visiting. I.. don't exactly have the *largest supply of herbs, but I'm hoping what we have might be enough for a little lesson,"* Marigolddust said softly, a bit of a sheepish smile crossing his features. Beanspark. One name among quite a few that he would have to memorize, not that memorizing his clanmates' names weren't just as important as the other healer's. He had to work on it as a whole, and who knew, maybe he would become a master at it like Laurelblaze. (edited)
- The young, stormy toned medic's eyes widened slightly at Beanspark's last words. "O-oh, I'm... Sorry. About the fact that she's..." He started, before trailing off and continuing shortly after, "She's not here anymore." He said, finally finishing the thought as he voiced the bitterly painful words. If he could have, Marigolddust would have made sure he was far from the fresh position he was given now, both because it would mean Fernpaw was still around and because hd didn't quite feel like this was the part he was supposed to play. How could a warrior become a medicine cat and do the job as well as every cat before them? He would have thought differently on the idea if he had known Honeysong just yet, but that wasn't the case, and he wasn't the most confident about it. @Captain⛵
prim 05-Oct-21 10:33 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | past II
It wasn’t a matter of not wanting to be loved, back then she was just not focused on chasing after cats she was fawning over… Mostly because she hadn’t been fawning over anyone back then. Even when she was Tigerpaw’s age she was a workaholic, obsessed with the idea that one day she’d be leading the clan. She always had big aspirations, wanting to take on the world with her head held high. Hence why she thought she had to constantly work to prove herself back then. ”I believe in you, but please don’t go running off again. I’ve already lost one apprentice before they got their warrior name, I don’t want to lose you too.” truly it was her biggest fear with her apprentices, she saw herself as her apprentice’s caretaker, taking responsibility over them. She had to make sure they made it to warriorhood, but doing something reckless like this jeopardized that. Not only that, but she thought she was going to lose her mind by the amount of anxious thoughts running through her head. ”We still have more work to do, but we’ll resume training as soon as the entrances are no longer blocked. I can’t exactly train you properly in a ruined camp.” she flashed a reassuring smile towards her apprentice, her tail swaying a bit as she then turned back to the wall of dirt that was almost mocking the pair of them. ”So let’s tear this thing down so we can do that, right?” @Shade
Shade 06-Oct-21 08:17 AM
"I won't." The apprentice's mumble was quiet and subdued, but sincere. She gave her mentor a last reassuring nuzzle on the chest before the torbie pulled away. Wiping her tears with her wrists, Tigerpaw returned to her station, this time a stronger hint to her voice when she nodded, "Right." @prim
Ice 06-Oct-21 09:02 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Mistypaw }
The past several days had been excruciating for the lynx-point who was so used to being out in the forest for most of the day. Being trapped in camp had brought forth unpleasant memories that she wished had remained forgotten in the deepest recesses of her mind. Alas, that was not the case and thus had busied herself with tasks all day long for the sake of the Clan and her own mental state. The open entrances were a huge relief. With the Clan beginning to run in its normal course, Icestar felt more relaxed and optimistic that their situation will become resolved. Excitement prickled the dark pads of her paws as she strode towards the thorn tunnel. It had been too long… The stone walls were beginning to become ominous. Glancing back towards the Highledge was a mistake. The inner glee drained from her rapidly. Icestar froze, watching the faint outline of a light brown tabby looking down at her harshly. All it took was a tight squeeze of her eyes and when they opened once more, it was gone. Icestar shook her head desperately. @wild™ (its okay!)
Ice 06-Oct-21 11:47 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Beanspark }
Beanspark’s arrival presented hope to be as powerful as she had claimed during the meeting. Unfortunately, Marigolddust had minimal experience in his new duties and healing his tired and injured Clanmates would prove to be a challenging first task. Hopefully, the SkyClan medicine cat would be willingly to aid and teach the young tom a few tricks to getting Icestar’s warriors back on their paws. The silver-masked molly wandered the campgrounds in search of the feline, wishing to speak with him. While Icestar wished to thank him, she needed to determine his intentions. Beanspark was a fairly new healer and she wanted to get to know him more: to see what type of heart he contained. Where could he be? A scowl etched across her masked features as she weaved through a group of kits dashing across the clearing. @Captain⛵

Beanspark - Icestar
"Don't cause too much trouble!" Beanspark purred warmly, just a few tail lengths behind the dashing kits. He had given them a quick check up as an example to Marigolddust, who was dealing with the last kit on his own. Beanspark was confident he would do well, even if he was uncertain. ThunderClan was in good paws. Before he could turn back, though, he noticed ThunderClans leader scowling as the kits nearly trampled her, suppressing a giggle. "Oh StarClan...kits." He purred, approaching her. "Sorry about that Icestar. They're a bit rowdy after being cooped up for a few seconds." Beanspark noticed the somewhat determined look in her gaze; she was on her way to do...something. "Did you need something?" @Ice
Captain⛵ 06-Oct-21 12:06 PM
Beanspark - Marigolddust
"That's alright! We'll figure it out. At the very least, I can always take you herb hunting." Beanspark swished his tail in excitement. "Oughtta be interesting in a different territory." Beanspark frowned as Marigolddust continued, feeling the bitter hurt that the fresh medicine cat expressed. "No, it's okay. Life happens. We just have to live out the rest of ours." Beanspark placed a reassuring tail on the taller toms shoulders. Well...it was more like his midback. Beanspark is short. "Try not to think of yourself as a replacement, because you're not. You're your own medicine cat, separate from her. And you're doing just fine." Beanspark reassured him, feeling a pang of sympathy for him.
