Springy 🦤 23-Oct-21 11:07 AM
Marigolddust • Wrenpaw • The News
- Past - Marigolddust's own fur wasn't as dirty as Wrenpaw's was, as it was flatter and a but shorter. His grey fur kept close to his body, more like a thin blanket rather than a fluffy, thermal one. It kept him warm enough, but such short fur was bothersome when it came to colder temperatures. It was just another reason why he wasn't at all fond of the cold, or leaf-bare. The season really only brought him discomfort, even if Laurelblaze and quite a few others seemed to enjoy it so much. Fortunately, though, such fur meant that the mud had difficulty getting under it. It was difficult to get matted, and instead it usually only held a thin layer of crusted mud and dirt, not enough to be a real challenge to get out until the mud was dry. Because of this, Marigolddust found it a bit difficult to try and imagine how much easier hardened mud would be to get out than wet mud. Glancing up at the sky, Marigolddust tried to be asp onto some sort of response. "I don't think it's going to stay rainy for much longer," he mentioned, content with the final decision of his words. It was still fialry cloudy, but he could almost feel the rays of sunshine on his pelt again, like it had after the landslide. Perhaps that was just him trying to hope, though. Sometimes, and more often recently, he found himself forcing himself to hope for something good, so that maybe, just maybe that thing would happen. It hadn't yet worked with Fernpaw.
- It wasn't hard to tell that Wrenpaw felt guilty as soon as he had reacted to her words, and her feeling of guilt over him made he himself feel guilty himself. It was odd, how feeling like guilt or shame could do things like that.. and it definitely didn't feel good. It was a relief to see Wrenpaw begin to relax after he had given her the reassuring lick, although he could tell that shame still weighed down on her. "You weren't prying at all. It's just... Weird, you know? Sometimes things change, and we just have to go along with it. It was just my thoughts prying at me, not you. And.. And *please don't feel like you have to do anything. I can't be the only one mourning a loss, anyhow,"* he said gently, truly hoping that the statements would be enough to do as he wished. He didn't want Wrenpaw to feel like she should do anything, especially not on his part. Just talking about it made him uncomfortable, but at the same time, he would rather not let Wrenpaw see that too clearly. If only he could actually control his emotions, without letting it be the other way around. Wrenpaw should have to feel the way she did now.
"I can show you just how much I've improved!" Yes, she must have improved a lot, having to do all of the hunting without him. Although his smile still held the afterlife of sadness, he nodded. "I'm very excited to see how much of an amazing hunter you are now," he agreed, even though he wished that he hadn't had to miss watching her get better over the past few days. It seemed so wrong, watching Wrenpaw enter camp with prey, but not with him by her side. It was like she was already a warrior, and it was an understatement to say that he wasn't quite ready for that. Sadness morphed into anxiety as his mind was brought back onto the topic of what he was here to tell. Wrenpaw already seemed at unease. That couldn't be a good thing, could it? Adverting his gaze once again, Marigolddust tried not to stammer and remained unsuccessful. "W-well, we'll still be training just like we always do. Accept.. I might not be as... *Free with time after lessons, and we might have to cut sessions down a little bit at times."* He explained, and even he himself could tell that he was only trying to stall before giving the true announcement. @tremb
wild™ 24-Oct-21 04:52 PM
──────────────── 𝐌𝐈𝐒𝐓𝐘𝐏𝐀𝐖 // APPRENTICE OF THUNDERCLAN
Icestar's reply came as that which was both expected yet unexpected at the same time. She had figured the older feline would disagree with her statement, perhaps confront her on the matter even. Such was more or less the case, but her next words - while having generally been expected - she didn't think they'd affect her the way they ultimately did. Would those things happen to her? Surely not. She wasn't weak or anything like that! Mighty warriors didn't suffer such injuries...right? "Well- What're you trying to say? It's not my fault so many others get injured. Maybe Thunderclan just needs to be stronger and not so weak. Weaklings as warriors certainly would make for a reasonable explanation to such a situation." She countered, in hopes to make herself feel better. Injuries happened because one was weak...surely. Well, that probably wasn't exactly true - but what else could it mean? Mistypaw shook her head, whiskers quivering. "So, with that in mind, what if we make a deal? I'll come help you, but only for protection purposes. I gain whatever knowledge it is on what stinky herbs look like and you have help. Kinda. Does that satisfy you?" Her odd-colored gaze flickered to the lynx-point, tail flicking about to and fro. @Ice
tremb 24-Oct-21 07:47 PM
{ Wrenpaw & Marigolddust | past } She did feel a bit relieved when he said that he didn’t feel like she was prying. She still couldn’t help but think he was just saying that to make her feel better, but she gave him a small smile anyways. Her amber eyes were full of sympathy as he spoke, and she tried to think about what it would be like to be in his situation. Wrenpaw had never experienced grief, and though she didn’t want to, it made it hard to understand exactly what her mentor was dealing with. She knew he was hurting, but she could never truly understand the depth of the pain and loss that he felt. She thought about what it would be like to lose one of her friends, or her kin, and the thought made her heart ache but it still wasn’t the same as actually losing one of them. Was did truly hurt though, was knowing someone she cared about was in pain and that there was nothing she could do. She shifted on her hindquarters, sighing softly. ”Life is full of changes, I guess. Good ones and bad ones. I know I shouldn’t feel like I need to do anything, I just can’t help it. I just… always want to help everyone even though I know that’s not realistic,” she admitted. Perhaps she had known that all along, but she was just now realizing that she was helpless in the face of everyone’s problems. There was no solution, no matter how much she wished there was. She was happy when the subject returned to her hunting. He seemed genuinely excited to see how much she had improved, even if it had only been a pawful of days since she’d began hunting on her own. Of course she had already improved through practicing with Marigolddust during their training sessions, but the solo hunting seemed to have sharpened her skills even more. It was probably knowing that it was up to her to feed her clan and to bring back as much prey as possible. Motivation like that was enough to make any cat try their absolute hardest. It was also an excellent opportunity to prove herself to her clan, and perhaps it would bring her one step closer to her warrior ceremony. Sure, she knew she was a bit too young for that still, but she knew all of her hard work wouldn’t go unnoticed. She smiled. ”Yeah, it’s great. I don’t get so nervous when I hunt now! I actually feel, like, confident I guess.” It had taken her quite some time to gain confidence in any of her skills because she was always so worried about not being good enough, but she felt different now. She believed in herself more, and it was a nice change. In some ways that felt like an even bigger deal than her improved skills. She used to think she always be unsure of herself, always doubtful of her abilities, but she didn’t really feel that way anymore. She tipped her head to the side, a confused look crossing her features. Why wouldn’t he have enough time? What could possibly make him so busy that he wouldn’t be able to dedicate time to their training sessions anymore? Now she was worried all over again, and her worrisome gaze stayed fixed on him as she waited for him to give some kind of reason or explanation, but he never did. ”O-oh,” she said, sinking a canine into her lower lip. Had she done something wrong? He had seemed to excited to get back out into the forest with her, but now he was saying he wouldn’t have as much time. ”Can I ask why?” Disappointed amber eyes glanced around the clearing, and hope sprang in her chest as she thought she made a realization. Perhaps he would be busy with camp repairs? Even when the entrances were cleared and warriors could come and go again, they would still have a lot of rebuilding inside of the camp to do. Surely the clan needed their strongest warriors to help with that, right? That had to be the reason Marigolddust wouldn’t have as much time for training as before, but that was okay. It would only be temporary. That seemed like a reasonable explanation, right? So why was her anxiety
still making her stomach churn like she’d eaten a spoiled mouse? @Springy 🦤

"Clans have been through worse over the generations," meowed the tom calmly. "A little rain won't be the thing to take us out." Of course he had no idea about the bigger dangers at play. @prim

Springy 🦤 27-Oct-21 04:51 PM
Marigolddust - Wrenpaw - The News
- Past - It was a bit tricky to see Wrenpaw's sympathy as a good thing, although he knew that she meant well. He hated the fact that pity felt so uncomfortable when you were the one receiving it, but he couldn't help but live this fact now. There was no doubt that he would react the same way if something this heartbreaking happened to Wrenpaw, but the attention wasn't something he was at all used to. How might he feel if she went through this? Perhaps if something happened to make Coyotepaw disappear would make her feel this way. The brown tabby tom was like Wrenpaw's Fernpaw, wasn't he? No, maybe they weren't that close yet... Marigolddust had only recently taken in the two apprentices' close relationship, and wouldn't know how Wrenpaw would feel if her long-legged friend was gone. How would he react to that? He was supposed to be the one caring for others now, not the other way around, and Wrenpaw shouldn't be too worried anyways... right? This was just a wave of sadness that would pass in no time. Fernpaw was probably still out there somewhere, no matter how many times Laurelblaze might have used the word "casualty" in the same sentence as the sandalwood's name. Why should he have to feel sad when he knew this, and knew that she would come back? And he was confident that she would. She had to.
- "it's nice of you to want to help others, and you should be as confident in yourself as I do. You deserve it." Marigolddust said softly, his gaze mirroring a little bit of her sympathy, causing the reflection of the emotion to spring back at the honey toned fem. He sometimes found himself feeling the same way, but now that that was his job, it wasn't such a bad trait. But Wrenpaw's role in the clan wasn't specifically to find herbs and mend other's wounds, though. And confidence was easily something that he had trouble with. These new tasks of hers seemed to be effecting her in some positive ways, even if the fact might be buried by all of the misfortune that was brought onto the clan meanwhile. Why? The question seemed to echo as it bounced off of the walls of his mind, slicing through all other thoughts like claws through prey. He knew the answer, of course; it had been bothering and pestering at him ever since his meeting with Icestar and Laurelblaze. But saying it out loud, to a cat he cared about as dearly as he did Wrenpaw... that seemed like a greater task that he wasn't sure he was capable of completing. You never know what might come unless you try, he thought quietly to himself, hoping that the quote would keep him from shying away from his goal. She would find out, anyways, so what was he so worried about? He had nothing that he could hide, and this would hopefully just soften the blow for his appretnice. Yet his anxiety didn't leave him, even as he brought together the words. "Well, we need a replacement for Fernpaw," he started, the word 'replacement' almost making him flinch as he said it, "And I've agreed to take that place." @tremb
prim 28-Oct-21 11:15 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Wolfprowl | past II
His statement only made her feel a prickle of guilt, her clanmates were blissfully unaware of what was at stake here. An internal war was happening, where clanmates were being turned against one another in the midst of a crisis. All because of a cat she once trusted, one she let into their clan under the guise she was going to redeem herself. The cat who went on a rampage in their camp, causing the deaths of two of their clanmates, and is only continuing her campaign of revenge and chaos. A cat she once considered a friend, a cat she’d abandoned for the sake of her clan. Laurelblaze battled with herself often, especially lately, if that decision was truly for the best, if she’d just stuck around a little longer that her friend would have truly changed. Maybe more cats would have survived, maybe this could have been averted… Maybe- Stop, stop it right now. She internally chastised herself for those thoughts, the belligerent demonization of her own actions. The deputy had to accept she could not alter the course of fate, that she could not have seen into the future and understood what actions the other tortoiseshell would have taken. She couldn’t have prevented it, and that was what she hated most— what struck the most fear into her. She and Silentwing were once birds of a feather, fiercely devoted to their respective clans, but the other’s devotion led her down a dark path where she eventually spiraled. It petrified her, Laurelblaze loved her clan dearly, and wanted nothing but the absolute best for them… Yet she feared if she took a wrong course of action that it’d lead her down the same path, the same demise. It was one of her greatest fears. I can’t. I can’t let that happen. ”You’re right about that, but this has seriously hampered our efforts to prepare for leaf-bare.” she was distracting herself with conversation, but these thoughts still plagued her. No amount of damp logs she could rake her claws through could cause her to shake this feeling of absolute dread. Laurelblaze needed to put a stop to this conflict and quick, she couldn’t allow her clanmates to continue to suffer. @Shade

{Laurelblaze} | Supply Patrol | present

Hence why she was here now, calling together a patrol to begin gathering supplies for the reconstruction of their dens. [Jayfang] Jayfang was alive. Was he doing well? No. But he was alive, at least. Mud stains were still dappled in his silver pelt - a very unusual thing to happen, as he took a lot of pride in it. However, he never liked water, and with all the things that happened, he wasn't exactly caring about most things. wild™ 30-Oct-21 05:43 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The braided tabby was currently lounging in camp, violet eyes retaining little to no emotion, nothing that would betray the inner turmoil among her thoughts. Tufted ears twitched as her gaze slowly drifted skyward, the heavens above much too cheerful for her liking. Returning her attention to that which was laid out before her, the dark-furred tabby let out a breath. Things were particularly slow today, but should she expect much else out of her fellow Thunderclanners? They seemed reluctant to do much as of late...as if their very spirits had been surrounded by mud and debris, trapped among it as their entire camp had been not too long ago. Sometimes, it took forever for one to move on...but for the warrioress, she found such to be draining and of no use to her. Then again, she'd never been the sentimental type to begin with. Her thoughts were broken by the call of Laurelblaze, Thunderclan's beloved deputy. The large tortoiseshell had called for her, alongside two others. Supplies? Certainly, no such thing is needed. A waste of time. The braided warrior arose from her spot nonetheless. She would not complain verbally - she'd be instantly confronted on the matter. Much of their supplies had been destroyed after the mudslide, so of course, they'd need to find new ones. Even so...she couldn't help but believe that their search would end in vain. Once reaching the trio, her gaze flickered over each feline yet otherwise, remained silent for a few moments. "Let us not rush things. Missing that which is important to us now, is not what is needed. At the same time...let us not raise our hopes. With leaf-bare upon us, I doubt we'll find much - if anything." @prim @Jennstar @-Jayfang-

Springy 🦤 02-Nov-21 06:58 PM
Marigolddust - Nectarglade - The Rubble of Remedies
- Present - Ever since Beanspark had visited him, Marigolddust knew that, despite his increasing desire to keep it secret, he had to let it slip that he didn't have nearly as many herbs as he needed to have. Even Benspark said how bad it was, and Marigolddust knew that the other medicine cat was a kind one. If he showed so much concern, then there was no doubt that Thunderclan needed help. And, in the end, that meant that Marigolddust needed it, too. His pitiful pile of basic herbs had improved a little bit ever since Beanspark's visit, growing both in size and variety, but it was still much too small. Marigolddust appreciated the cats who had helped him with his search as of recent more than they might know, all of them; Laurelblaze, Icestar, Beanspark, and a few others that the three had convinced to assist them. Marigolddust had yet to bring himself to do the same action. He felt terrible, asking cats who might have enough troubles as it was, help him. It made him feel guilty, admitting such a large weakness in the clan. He wanted to keep the fact that, if the clan continued like this herb-wise, they would be neck-deep in troubles, such troubles not including everything else. He could almost imagine all of his clanmate's heads being pushed under the water of their hardships. That's why he wanted to change his lack of finding assistance today.
- The stormy-toned tux found himself out in the camp rather than kept in his den like he had been as of recent. His golden gaze traced where rubble had been not long before, a spark of excited hope starting in him as he realized how much progress they had made. Usually, he would have considered the amount of clean-up as a very small percentage of what work was ahead of them, but recently he had found himself unable to do so. Every small step seemed like a huge leap to the tom's eyes since all of the destruction first struck the large band of cats, and his happiness over the progress sometimes managed to cloud over his doubt. Giving his head a quick shake, Marigolddust dragged his eyes off of the walls of the camp and the surrounding dens. He wasn't supposed to be focusing on that- he had more important matters to try and figure out. But for some reason, he found it to be so hard to try and walk up to strangers, asking them for help. He was the one who was given this rank, so wasn't he the one who was supposed to be able to handle it? That was how this all worked, wasn't it? How bad would it be of him, going around and asking a bunch of warriors and apprentices for some help with the job he agreed to do? He managed to break through the hesitance with a forced pawstep forwards, and more followed soon after. He continued like this as he crossed the camp, before his eyes landed on a certain fem who didn't seem very content or focused on a specific task. He recognized her a little bit, but he still had to work on memorizing everyone's names. If only he had practiced the idea more before he took all of this on.
- Reluctantly, he padded up to the warrior. "U-um.. hello, are you busy..?" he asked, his voice almost a whisper as he tried to fight off his nerves. Oh, hopefully that hadn't been too rude of a hello- had he gone too fast? He could sometimes do that when his anxiety got the best of him. Maybe just the simple "hello" would have been fine. Why in Starclan's name was he so nervous? @Fawn
Fawn 02-Nov-21 07:11 PM
🌻 Nectarglade🌻
Nectarglade looked up, adjusting her position to see with her one good eye. before her stood Marigolddust, she hadn't known the tom very well, so it was a bit of a surprise. "oh, well no, not in particular" she said, mustering up all the strength in her voice that she could, though in reality, all she wanted to do was collapse in a nice warm den, away from all the troubles of camp. Springy 🦤 02-Nov-21 09:09 PM
Marigolddust • Nectarglade • The Rubble of Remedies
- Present - "Nothing much- just wondering if you'd mind assisting me... With collecting herbs and whatnot," he said, trying not to rub a paw against the other in an attempt to try and avoid the awkward feeling that he could feel growing in his own chest. It was nothing much to do with Nectarglade, but more with his own worries that never seemed to silence. He couldn't help but feel that he was being rude with every word he spoke, but why was that? These doubts as to whether or not he was being polite enough bothered him too much, causing him to instinctively add a little bit more to his original statement. "I can ask someone else, though, if you'd rather not, I'm just looking for any extra paws to carry some herbs." He added, speaking a bit quicker as he spoke. He wasn't used to these type of things, and had been feeling too emotional recently to react to such things rationally.
- Sure, it might not hurt anybody else, him being increasingly anxious and all, but every emotion he felt felt as if it were elevated to a higher, unnecessary level. He had been feeling too sad, too scared, too doubtful, too aggravated at himself- the only emotion he couldn't find or strengthen as much was relief or relaxation, but hopefully a little trip out of the camp with company would help to change that. He had only really gone out herb hunting with Fernpaw and Beanspark, and Fernpaw was gone and Beanspark was away, leaving him fairly lonely. He was so used Fernpaw sharing the medicine cat's den with him that now that he had it to himself, besides a larger amount of patience than he had ever seen in the den, he felt more independent and grief ridden than he wished. Cats had visited his den often since he had became the medicine cat of Thunderclan, coming with news, coming to check in, coming to see friends and family, coming to drop off some herbs... But he knew that their visits would steadily decrease the better the condition of the camp became.
- When that would be, though, he was unsure. The business with Silentwing that Icestar and Laurelblaze had informed him about made him far too fearful for his own good. That was another reason he wanted company when going out to collect herbs. They had informed him of the vengeful dark forest fem and Beetlestreak's undeserved end, warning him to be prepared to protect himself if necessary. Unfortunately, Marigolddust want known for his strength or his fighting skills, and the chances he had against such a cat were low to zero. So, the most he could really do is be on his guard when he slept (which hasn't been at all easy, considering his lack of sleep from both fear of Silentwing and grief over Fernpaw) and always have some sort of cat nearby. Of course he wouldn't tell Nectarglade about this, though; he was forbidden to. Plus, nobody else needed to know that the clan was only getting in more and more trouble. @Fawn

Captain⛵ 06-Nov-21 11:17 PM
Beanspark - Icestar
Beanspark twitched his ear, thinking on the question. "I...honestly don't know. We took a small trip around camp to gather some cobweb and such for injuries, but we didn't go very far at all. With all this going on I...didn't even think to ask." He pinned his ears back, looking at the ground. He honestly didn't even know ThunderClan had such a place on their territory. Beanspark was suddenly overwhelmed with the feeling that he had no idea what he was doing. He couldn't look Icestar in the eyes anymore as he tried his best to recall anything about the very place he was sleeping. Almost nothing. @Ice
Springy 🦤 07-Nov-21 09:22 PM
Marigolddust • Nectarglade • The Rubble of Remedies
- Present - A pleasant feeling of relief settled over Marigolddust as Nectarglade agreed to his request, although his new, more confident smile faltered for just a moment at her question. Quickly, his expression turned from that of relief to that of reassurance that might have seemed a bit too desperate in the eyes of any cat mindful enough to take notice of it. "Thank you! It's very appreciated, I promise. And of course, I'm fine- it's probably just the sickness through camp that's making me seem that way," he said, trying hard to wipe all of his previous nervousness off of his features. Nectarglade meant the question in good nature, of course, but some cats, including himself, couldn't quite help it; it was a bit tricky, being anxious and worried all of the time, and that trait combined with that of unnecessary humiliation didn't make a very good combination when it came to them being recognized. He felt as if he should put on a stronger demeanor as the medicine cat, and as a Thunderclanner in general. Even now he felt embarrassed over the fact that he had let the fact that he was feeling so figity at the moment slip. But, of course, he would use all of his power to keep this from being shown, even if he wasn't the best at it.
- One such attempt was his urge to change the topic. And, of course, he appeased this want. Standing, he turned partway and beckoned for Nectarglade to follow. "You can just follow me, if you'd like- I can just describe to you what we need, unless you know what certain herbs like marigold, catnip, chamomile, and poppy look like?" He offered, staring the last part half like a question rather than a statement. He honestly had no idea what knowledge other cats had on topics such as herbs, and he didn't wish to make Nectarglade feel as if he were being rude and claiming she was unintelligent by telling her what she already knew. If the case we're different, though, and she did end up not knowing different herbs, then he would like to take the chance to try and show her some. The more cats around that knew how to recognize the healing plants, the better. That way, if anything were to happen to him- which he won't worry himself over the topic right now- they had backup, and there could be more paws present to collect herbs. Starclan knows how many herbs they needed- they were less than unprepared for the coming season of leaf-bare. @Fawn
Ice 09-Nov-21 09:54 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Beanspark }
The pitiful state that Beanspark had transitioned in struck a chord in her heart. ” It’s okay,” she assured. ” Obviously, you are more familiar with SkyClan’s territory.” She tried for an amused comment, a half-smile playing at the edge of her lips. It fell as the medicine cat’s disheartened expression was as visible as ever. How could he have known about the abandoned Twoleg Den? He was no ThunderClan cat. ” Don’t place impossible expectations upon yourself,” Icestar said gently. ” If you have time, why don’t we go together to see what state it’s in,” she suggested. Marigolddust was probably busy settling into his new den. ” And next time, you’ll be able to know where it is,” the lynx-point gave a playful wink. She then stood up from her spot and gave her pelt a satisfying shake. With her fur all ruffled, she was ready to venture in the wilderness. @Captain⛵
Captain⛵ 09-Nov-21 07:43 PM
Beanspark - Laurelblaze
Beanspark very slowly backed out of the medicine cat's den, letting out a sigh of relief as he cleared the entrance. Marigolddust had finally fallen asleep while Beanspark ran out to grab some chamomile. The medicine cat had been struggling to relax and rest, which Beanspark understood completely. But he also stressed self care, especially for medicine cats. You can't treat a sick cat when you're sick yourself. Beanspark sat down and closed his eyes, his nose pointing towards the stars. With a smile on his face, he sent several prayers to starclan requesting their protection. It was a moment of calm, bliss, and silence... prim 09-Nov-21 09:16 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Beanspark | present
The ThunderClan deputy for the most part had been overseeing repair efforts on the camp, and despite the fact that one of their most recent hauls of supplies had gone missing in the past few days, she knew something was amiss. They had traitors within their walls, and considering they were hosting a medicine cat from a neighboring clan in their disheveled camp— the deputy wasn’t exactly happy about the situation to say the least. It was taking much of her self-control not to round up all of the traitors at once and give them a punishment worth the crime, but she had to wait— they had to draw Silentwing and her coconspirator out. They were the real threat here, and she wasn’t going to let the other clans take advantage of her own in their time of weakness. Not when they still needed to replenish their strength and the supplies for their camp. Besides that, there was another matter she was concerned about with Beanspark’s presence in their camp— Marigolddust’s training. She considered the gray tuxedo tom a good friend of hers, and she wanted to know how he was faring in his education as a medicine cat. She understood the transition from the role of a warrior to that of a healer was not smooth for most, thus she felt obligated to check and see how her clanmate was doing… By grilling his mentor with questions. ”Beanspark.” she approached the much smaller SkyClanner, practically towering over him. ”We need to talk.” Very foreboding indeed. @Captain⛵
Captain⛵ 09-Nov-21 10:06 PM
Beanspark - Laurelblaze
Beanspark's moment was destroyed and his prayer interrupted. His fur lifted as he turned angrily to the rude ThunderClanner. It was less anger for him, though, and more anger for his friend. "Shh!" He hissed, motioning towards the medicine cat's den. "We can take this elsewhere. I won't have his well-deserved rest interrupted." Beanspark's hiss was stern, but not cruel. He sort of surprised himself with how assertive he was being. Hearing a flash of Specklerose in his own tone made some of his annoyance dissipate, but that didn't stop his tail from twitching irritably as he walked away from the den. Turning back to the deputy with a deep breath, his annoyance melting off of him, he gave her a smile. "Sorry about that. He hasn't slept in a while...he really needs it. Now, what did you need?" @prim
prim 09-Nov-21 10:35 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Beanspark | present
The burly deputy of ThunderClan was taken aback by the harshness of the SkyClan medicine cat’s tone, her ears flickering as she stared down at him in a mixture of shock and suspicion. ”I’m not looking to interrupt his rest.” she glanced inside the entrance of the medicine cat den to see the sleeping form of Marigolddust, before she looked back to Beanspark. ”But I wanted to talk to you about Marigolddust’s training.” she didn’t return the easygoing smile he flashed up at her yet, her gaze narrowing as she prepared her first line of questioning. She knew better than to threaten a medicine cat, but she wasn’t going to let him toy with her clanmate if she could help it. He was a guest in ThunderClan’s camp, he was quite a ways away from his home in SkyClan’s gorge. ”I hope everything is going well with him. Is he taking to his new role?” she stood up taller, puffing out her chest as she carried herself with great dignity and strength. She was not going to betray weakness, even in the face of adversity. ”Marigolddust is my friend, and I want to make sure he’s doing all right. Speaking of which…” her gaze darkened, and she leaned in a bit closer, a steely expression forming across her features. ”…If you mistreat him in any way, I will know.” @Captain⛵
Captain⛵ 09-Nov-21 10:44 PM
Beanspark - Laurelblaze
Beanspark looked over at his sleeping form, worry etched across his gaze. It wasn't until Laurelblaze made her threat that he returned to meet her dark gaze with his own steel one. His smile vanished with a small twitch of his eye. Beanspark had been threatened by big, mean cats enough in his life. He wasn't scared of them anymore. "I don't expect you to know this, Laurelblaze, but medicine cats don't see borders. We're family, each of us. If I ever mistreated him, I would face the wrath of my own mind, let alone all of the other medicine cats. But that also means we'll all know if you mistreat him." His gaze turned sharp and his tail lashed. "Just because we are medicine cats doesn't mean we're able to be physically intimidated." Beanspark, despite his heart racing in fear, wasn't going to let her get to him like this. He stood his ground firmly, not letting an ounce of insecurity enter his stance, voice, or gaze despite him feeling it in every inch. @prim
prim 09-Nov-21 11:13 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Beanspark | present
Her pupils narrowed even more, but she cracked a small smirk at the attitude this tom carried with him. ”Just remember he is my clanmate first, I’d never bring harm to him or allow it to come within a few meters of his presence.” she took a step back, taking a deep breath as she glanced over towards Marigolddust yet again. Even when he was a warrior they became friends, in a way she saw him almost like kin in her eyes. She was clearly being protective over him, not out of mistrust in the other clans, but as a good friend should be. Laurelblaze was loyal to her clan, and by extension, her clanmates. ”I have faith Marigolddust will turn out to be one of the very best of your ranks as medicine cats. Just know that I am always watching out for him, just like I am always watching out for all of my clanmates.” her posture remained firm, and she was unyielding in the fact she was still going to fiercely protect Marigolddust if it came down to it. Laurelblaze was just that determined to do so. @Captain⛵
tremb 10-Nov-21 10:31 AM
{ Wrenpaw & Marigolddust | past } The initial emotion that washed over the caramel apprentice was shock. Marigolddust was ThunderClan’s new medicine cat? It wasn’t like Wrenpaw didn’t think he was a good option for the clan’s new medic, the news had just caught her by surprise. It was the last thing the apprentice had been expecting to hear, but still, she thought StarClan had made the right call. Marigolddust surely would make a fine medicine cat. He was kind and caring, and no doubt smart enough to learn all the herbs. Still, Wrenpaw wasn’t sure exactly how to feel about the news. She was happy for the tom of course because serving the clan in this way was a great honor and a very crucial role to clan life. On the other paw, a bit of sadness swept over her because her mentor was traveling down a new path without her. She had always looked forward to the day where she would become a warrior just like him, and they would be warriors together. Now that was all changing, but she had to remind herself not to be selfish. This wasn’t really about her, it was about Marigolddust. He deserved nothing but her full support and happiness on the subject. A smile parted her lips, so broad that her teeth showed. ”Oh, Marigolddust that’s great news! You’ll be a wonderful medicine cat,” she purred, flicking him softly with a white tipped tail. Her words had been true, and though other thoughts were threatening threatening her mind, she kept a happy expression. He had said that he would still be training her until she became a warrior, but was that really a wise decision on his part? Would he truly have time for his new duties as a medicine cat and training Wrenpaw to become a warrior? Being a mentor already seemed like a great task, she wasn’t sure how he could manage that and learning everything there was to know about being a medicine cat at the same time. Of course Wrenpaw would never doubt him or his abilities, but she was afraid of becoming a burden to him. What if he became stressed out and exhausted and it was all her fault? She would have to train extra hard during their sessions and make sure to practice everything she learned on her own time when he was doing medicine cat things. Surely his levels of stress would remain low if she could ensure that her training was easy for him. ”Are you sure you want to finish my training? I mean, of course I wouldn’t want to be trained by anyone else but you, but… that seems like a lot of work. I don’t want to stress you out,” she said, shuffling brown and white paws across the rock she sat on. (I know this is short and it took me forever ;-; ty for being so patient <33 ) @Springy 🦤

wild™ 11-Nov-21 12:11 AM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The sun shone down cheerfully upon those of Thunderclan, dancing about upon the land below, casting a warm, golden light upon the earth and the creatures among it. Such was a welcoming delight - when compared to the chilly air that surrounded them, a moment of warmth was much appreciated. Such was a treasured moment for many, especially after drastic events, things seemed to have generally returned to normal...save for the underlying sense of tension, that is. Working alongside her comrades hadn't been easy, as a matter of fact, she'd done her best to avoid doing so altogether. If she could help it, anyway. At times, there was no way out of aiding her companions in the darkness, in that which had lurked in the shadows, unknown to the public. For now. Hollowgrove knew that in due time, they'd unleash their true power upon those around them. And then, they'd fall, their fate resting in the paws of the very group who'd caused such destruction. It would be a day that would be remembered for ages, for moons upon moons, generation upon generation. They'd be a force to be reckoned with...a force which demanded upmost respect But today would not be that day. As she entered the camp, a bird was clamped between her jaws. Violet gaze hovered over the camp briefly, as if considering whether or not to set her catch among the fresh-kill pile or not. Instead, the tabby turned away, heading toward the mouth of the medicine cat den. Dropping her prey, her voice rumbled, tumbling down the entrance. "Marigolddust." Came a simple word, as she turned away. Perhaps, he was out doing...healer things. She had no need for herbs and the like...merely, a word or two. @Springy 🦤 (Sorry for the late start! </3)

Springy 🦤 11-Nov-21 09:57 AM
Marigolddust • Hollowgrove • A Little Conversation
- Present - Despite the rather beautiful day today, or at least during the season of leaf-fall, Marigolddust couldn't be found out in the camp enjoying it. No, instead he was busy in his own den, fairly deep into it for that matter. He had too many herbs to recognize, too many to learn- there was no chance he would give himself the time to take in the sun's rays when there was so much work needed to be done. Ever since the landslide, everything had been destroyed. Now, his den was fairly intact, just a bit muddy with small piles of rubble at select areas. His herb storage was no longer empty, but it was still too sparse to leave be. He no longer had only the basic herbs, but his gaze was widened a bit with Beanspark's teachings. Now he had new herbs in his paws, and he was spending the time now to try and learn them; mallow leaves, juniper berries, and more. It was all going to be more useful than the medicine cat might yet understand, and that was exactly what he was trying to do now. Suddenly, a voice joined his ears. Perking the large stylites, he tried to recognize it. It was faintly familiar, although he couldn't quite pinpoint which of his clanmates' it belong to. Standing, he gently set down the herbs he was busy with back onto their proper shelves, before turning and padding up to the enterance of his den. As he spotted the peculiarly patterned fem, her na!e didn't take long to come to mind, surprisingly. Hollowgrove, he remembered, before feeling a hit of panic as he realized his clanmate was turning to leave. There must have been a reason for her coming here, and it was rude to leave her hanging, especially with his new rank.
- "Wait, I'm here!" He called, trotting steadily up to the enterance. "Sorry it took me so long- I was just organizing a few things," he apologized, a sheepish smile displayed across his features as he approached the warrior. "What would you like-" he started, before he noticed the morsel of prey at his paws. "Oh, is this for me?" He asked, flattered, curious, and a bit embarrassed at the same time. He wasn't used to attention like this, or much attention at all. He wasn't sure whether he should be pleased or ashamed that a cat would feel interested in giving him prey, even if he had been receiving such donations quite a lot recently. It always made him feel the same nonetheless, although he was grateful every time. @wild™ Its completely fine! <33))

One of said traitors was mentoring one of her own kits, Tigerpaw, and she was worried, frantic that her daughter was safe, that she didn’t know anything she wasn’t supposed to know. Laurelblaze wanted to protect her kits equally, and with Featherpaw injured she found it increasingly harder on her. The pressure was adding up, and she longed for the day they could be free of this torment, this constant struggle. Laurelblaze wasn’t going to cave in, she couldn’t. But that didn’t stop her from being a concerned and responsible parent, even if her kits were apprentice-aged by now. Her ears flickered as she peered around the gradually repaired clearing, dens were looking much better than before, but nothing was perfect. The lack of supplies to restore each of the dens was showing through. They were doing the bare minimum to keep the dens stable, let alone hospitable for the elements. The one den that was lucky enough to consist of being a cave and merely needed nesting supplies for the interior was the apprentice’s den. prim 12-Nov-21 02:44 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Tigerpaw | future I
The deputy had her reservations about Finchbriar, knowing about the she-cat’s tendencies to be stuck-up and snobbish. Her superiority complex was practically tangible to anyone who even entered the presence of the prickly she-cat. Needless to say, Tigerpaw being assigned her as a mentor caused her concern, and now more than ever. Things could be dire, and she wanted to ensure her kits were going to be safe when this was all said and done. Its not like she will remain her mentor after this, I know Icestar is not going to forgive a transgression like this, for any of them. her ears flickered as she watched as her daughter’s frame physically relaxed at her sight, almost as if she was expecting someone else. ”I just wanted to talk, to check in on you. How are you?” she peered down at her smaller kit with a small smile, she still dwarfed these adoptive kittens of hers, ever the behemoth she was. Laurelblaze wanted nothing more than to go back to the days where they were tiny and still able to all climb onto her back for an impromptu piggy-back ride… but alas, those days had long since passed, and they were entering a world that could be cruel and merciless to anyone. I would know better than most… ”Have you had any issues with training? Is your mentor treating you properly?” upon realizing the implications of her question, the deputy wanted to chide herself for not even being subtle about her suspicions, the fact she wanted to round up every single one of the traitors to ThunderClan and exile them herself with their tails hanging between their legs was saying something. Laurelblaze was going to protect her family no matter what, Tigerpaw would not become a victim to one of Silentwing’s schemes. She would not lose more of her family to her. ”If there’s any problems you’re encountering, you don’t have to hesitate to come to me, I can look into it and make sure everything is okay.” the concerned mother was coming out now, and the fact she had to keep sending her kit into the face of danger was torturous enough for her— but the fact she was keeping it secret from the rest of her clan, the rest of her family. I can’t risk their safety by telling them, not when there could be anyone listening in. @goose
wild™ 12-Nov-21 04:07 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
It was only once she had begun to turn away that the sound of another approaching met her ears. From the depths of the medicine cat's den, there was a sound of hurried pawsteps and merely a moment or two afterwards, the tuxedo appeared, clearly seeming as if he'd been in a rush to keep her from leaving. The warrior returned her attention to the young tom, who gazed at the prey with wide eyes, as if this had been the first time he'd seen such a thing. With a roll of her eyes, the warrioress carefully placed her catch upon the ground, whiskers quivering. "If such is what you'd like to believe, then perhaps." She replied with a shrug. Hollowgrove was not the type to go out of her way for good deeds, but in this case, it made things more natural. She merely wanted to ask a few questions. "I only came to ask you a question or two. If you have the time, that is. It seems as if I've interrupted you." The molly stated plainly, tail swaying slowly behind her to indicate she wasn't exactly in a rush. Still, she continued onward after a moment or two. "I believe I should start with the formal inquiry of your state of mind. Any improvement from our last meeting? I can't say much has changed, but perhaps in your eyes it has." She was certain that such would be said. So many of Thunderclan seemed to believe in high hopes and unrealistic dreams, for the mere idea of soothing whatever inner turmoil they faced or otherwise, refused to encounter.
With a paw, she nudged the prey over just slightly. Yet she didn't move her position otherwise, instead, merely allowing herself to gaze elsewhere as she awaited a reply. How she despised such characters, but the clan seemed overrun with them. Even her own offspring had fallen to such a thing, which was a horrendous thought. She believed this to be a sign of weakness, falling victim to such a nature so quickly. The immature and inexperienced did not win battles, they were destroyed by the opposing force. And such was what had happened to Thunderclan themselves, only a short while ago. @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 13-Nov-21 02:54 PM
Marigolddust - Wrenpaw - The News
- Past - It was clear to see that Wrenpaw hadn't exactly expected the answer. Shock was displayed all over her features and body language, and her surprise seemed a bit odd now that Marigolddust no longer felt quite as startled by the idea. He had known for a day or two about how he was to become the medicine cat, since he had chosen to agree to it, and therefore the shock had... well, it wasn't as strong now as it had been when he was first called to Icestar's den and asked the question that had changed his life. And now it would all be official, once he and Icestar went to the moonpool the next day after the planned ceremonies. But, before his place in the clan was set in stone, or more of, set in the stars, he wanted to make sure that the second-most cat that it would affect the most in his life knew about it. Otherwise, he might be asked or requested to refuse before it was all too permanent, and he didn't want to do so without permission, even if the request for such wasn't all too clear. If he asked Wrenpaw upright whether she would be okay with him becoming the new Medicine cat, then he would have yet another cat he would need to think about when the last chance to change his decision came. Hopefully, with his acceptance of keeping her as his apprentice and taking the new rank would ease both sides.
- "I really hope so," he said with a nervous chuckle, giving Wrenpaw a grateful smile as she spoke the reassuring words. For once, he let the uncertainty behind his words roam free. She didn't seem all too outraged about the whole idea, and her smile actually convinced him otherwise. Hopefully it was a true one, and her words didn't hold some secret meaning he was failing to grasp. By now he knew how quick of a learner Wrenpaw was, and for all he knew, she might have learned how to put on a fake smile from some cat around camp. Hopefully said cat wasn't him, as his fake smiles were almost always transparent when it came to strong feelings such as sorrow or guilt. Marigolddust had experience at telling whether expressions were masks or real smiles since Fernpaw, more often than not, put on a smile to all of her patients, even when she was feeling the lowest of lows. Starclan, he missed Fernpaw. Please let her be safe, and help her to learn how to express a real smile... he prayed quietly to himself, before quickly pushing the thought out of his head as Wrenpaw continued.
- A soft look of understanding crossed Marigolddust's storm-toned features as she finished, and once she had, he raised a paw and playfully cuffed her ear. Perhaps the gesture was meant to make her relax more, or maybe it was to keep himself from showing Wrenpaw that he was just as unsure as to whether he could handle the stress. Being a mentor was enough work, but of course, when he was asked whether he would take his friend's place, he had requested to keep Wrenpaw as an apprentice. Of course he had- he wouldn't be able to live with himself otherwise. But, as he had more time to think about it, he tried to come up with how exactly he would be able to deal with it all. He was putting more weight on his shoulders than his thin limbs might be able to handle, and he had yet to figure out if they could. Hopefully he wouldn't have to wait long, and hopefully the result of this all was a positive one, rather than negative. "I'll be just fine. It shouldn't be too much work- you already know more than I expected you to, and you learn faster, too. Plus, it's just a buncha' plants. How hard could it be?" he joked light-heartedly, hoping the words would have a positive impact on Wrenpaw's mood. @tremb It's fine!! I didn't reply super fast either, and I think that it was perfect <333))
Jollykit! :) 13-Nov-21 04:16 PM
As lionstep watches his clanmated bustle around. As he purrs, his chest seizes up and he falls to the ground. His chest is a mess of pain. His breath comes in short gasps and his eyes roll back in his head. He lets out a weak yowl and he hopes it was loud enough for marigolddust to hear him. @Springy 🦤 (edited)
Springy 🦤 13-Nov-21 04:51 PM
Marigolddust - Lionstep - A Check up.. of Sorts
- Future - Fortunately, Marigolddust had heard Lionstep's weak call, although he had heard the elder hit the ground first. Stiffening, it took Marigolddust a moment to realize what might have happened outside of his den. He had felt something similar when Featherpelt had fallen and passed, although Marigolddust had hardly been present when it had happened. Panic struck Marigolddust's chest as he remembered the poor fate of Laurelblaze's father, and he rushed to set down the herbs and run out of the den out of fear that such was occurring again. Fortunately, when he exited his den, his eyes didn't land on a dead cat; instead, they landed on a fairly alive elder, although he was still clearly struggling. Concern flashed through his lemon-toned optics as Marigolddust hurried over to his older clan-mate. What was wrong with him? Marigolddust didn't recognize the feline, but he had also just gotten into the position not long ago... maybe it was the sickness that had been spreading through camp that caused this? If that was the case, then this was a new symptom that he hadn't seen before.
- Turning around, Marigolddust rushed back into his den and tried to decide what he needed in order to help the struggling tom in the camp. Think, think, think! What did Beanspark teach you? Fernpaw? he thought to himself, unable to keep his nerves from making his panic increase the longer he had to wait and think. He had no idea what was wrong with the elder, and he didn't even know if he could stop what was happening. Was he dying? Was it already too late? No, he had to hurry, or else that would be the case. He tried to search through his memories, gathering all that he remembered from lessons that he had had with Fernpaw and Beanspark. Fernpaw had only taught him about outside injuries, and that didn't seem like the case here. This new patient of his was having a different type of problem, something that seemed to give him trouble breathing; he could tell from the strained breaths and the inability to speak. What herb helped with the inability to breath, or chest problems in general? Come on, what did Beanspark teach you? You need to remember these things! he scolded to himself. He remembered that Beanspark had taught him something of the sort, just incase new symptoms popped up from the illness that the clan was being plagued with. But what was it? The answer came to his mind as soon as his eyes landed on the herbs. They were all three fairly common, although the two had had to cross into the twoleg territory in order to get one of them. Bending his neck, he snatched up the catmint, thyme, and coltsfoot, along with some wet mossballs. Once he had all that he hoped he needed, he swiftly brought them all out to the stranger tom.
- "Here, eat these- they should help you to be able to breath, and maybe they'll help you to be able to tell me what's going on," he said, pushing the herbs towards the elder. he wasn't sure if the other tom could manage to eat the herbs during his chest pain, but he wanted to see just how bad this was, even if it made him feel guilty in the process. He was panicking, and the only way to stop that was from figuring out what was happening. And so, he would try. @Jollykit! :)
Jollykit! :) 13-Nov-21 05:00 PM
Lionstep slowed his breath and ate the herbs slowly. He lays still for a moment and then sits up whilst shaking hard. He swallows the last bit of herbs and breathes deep and slowly. "T-thanks.." he says, and his voice wobbles. "I'm sor-" his voice hitches before he continues. "Sorry. Its my f-fault." He says, and droops his head down low. "I havent be-been taking the herbs im supposed to, because i figured with all the plan-plants wilting, i should save so-some for the younglings... it ca-cause of that smoke from when i w-w-was younger." He struggles to sqeeze out the words. "Dont waste too many on me.." he meows. But his face is still frozen in terror. "I thought a few times of skipping it wou-woulden't hurt me." His ears droop in shame. (edited)
@Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 14-Nov-21 09:55 AM
Marigolddust • Lionstep • Check-up
- Future - The young medicine cat visibly relaxed as Lionstep's breathing became more natural with the herbs. So he had chosen the right herbs for the situation... Maybe he really was learning and memorizing these things, instead of just forgetting them like he often did names. This relief morphed into bewilderment, though, as Lionstep began to apologize. With a small furrow of his non-existent brows, Marigolddust was quick to object. "Of course, but it wasn't your fault at all. Things like this just happen sometimes," he reassured, hoping that Lionstep believed his words as much as Marigolddust did himself. He was confused as to how such an occurrence could be blamed on the person having the spasm. In his eyes, it was like blaming a cat for having a sore throat or some similar problem. How could Lionstep imagine that it was his own fault that he had had the chest pain and trouble breathing? He hadn't expected the get the answer that he received not long after he had spoken.
- The herbs that he was supposed to take? What did the elder mean by that? "You were supposed to be taking herbs-? Were you having problems when Fern- when *I wasn't the medicine cat..?"* he asked, stopping himself from finishing his friend's name, just incase it triggered some buried grief. He didn't want to be seen crying when he was in the middle of taking care of a patient, even if just the thought of his friend made his eyes water. Marigolddust didn't recognize this cat, but then again, he was often off doing warrior duties or training Wrenpaw when Fernpaw was still around, caring for her patients. Lionstep could have easily just been patient that he had never actually run into. He didn't recall hearing about problems from a fire, although he could guess what fire had caused the spasms that Lionstep had been having. Laurelblaze had told him plenty about it, and how they had had to rebuilt the camp after the forest fire had burnt almost everything. In a sense, it was similar to what the clan was facing now, except it was mud and water they were fighting against, not raging flames of red and yellow. "How bad was this fire?" Marigolddust asked, both out of curiosity and because it might help him understand the elder's situation. "Have you been having many problems with it recently?"
- I thought a few times of skipping it wouldn't hurt me. So Lionstep was told to take herbs like these, but had decided not to for the sake of the clan. It was selfless, in a way, but it also meant that Lionstep wasn't taking the treatment for whatever problems he was facing. He knew that Beanspark wouldn't have let him continue this way, and so Marigolddust would try and do the same. "It's really nice of you to be thinking of the others in the clan. I understand what it's like to put them before yourself. But you *really need to take care of yourself, too, or the kits in the nursery might loose a cat that they look up to. We don't want that, do we?"* he asked, before continuing with his tone softening even more. "We also haven't been needing these specific herbs all that much.. they're just as backup. I can always gather more if need be," he offered. @Jollykit! :)
Springy 🦤 14-Nov-21 10:35 AM
Marigolddust - Nectarglade - The Rubble of Remedies
- Close Past - "That's true, I can show you when we're out searching for them," he suggested, a smile crossing his features at her enthusiasm. He hadn't expected her to seem so.. excited about this? He wasn't sure if she was actually feeling the emotion, but she definitely seemed optimistic. Her goal was accomplished as his smile widened a little bit, more genuine than the ones before, at her fairly wise statement and pride over it. It wasn't often that he met or interacted with a cat who was so positive, especially when it came to learning. Nectarglade even had a saying for it. He almost chuckled at Nectarglade's rather hyper reaction, but instead he nodded. "It *is definitely good to widen your knowledge,"* he agreed. His previous fear that Nectarglade wouldn't want to join him or that he would have ruined her day by guilt tripping her into this dispersed as he witnessed her rather half-glass-full nature. Turning, Marigolddust padded after Nectarglade, quickening his pace until he was properly caught up with her. "Well, any herb would likely work," he started, "Although, marigold, cobwebs, poppyseed, some moss, willow leaves, juniper berries, thyme, and mallow leaves are probably the most needed right now." Marigolddust zoned out a little as he spoke, listing through all of the herbs that Beanspark and Fernpaw had taught him. The first ones were for basic injury such as cuts, and the last ones were herbs that Beanspark had suggested after Marigolddust had mentioned the odd sickness that had spread throughout camp. As the two cats slipped through the entrance of the camp and into the Thunderclan territory, he tried to recall where all of the herbs could be found.
- "Cobwebs would probably be found almost anywhere, although with the landslide the ones at higher elevations were probably the only ones to survive. Marigolds and poppy might be at the hidden meadow, and juniper berries, mallow leaves, and willow leaves are at damper areas, like near the lake." he explained. "We can search for the cobwebs while we're heading towards the other areas with the herbs. We might want to start at the meadow, though- We'll probably have more luck there than anywhere else," he suggested. Of course he wanted to try and search around the bodies of water in their territory for the herbs more specific for the illness in Thunderclan, but he wasn't sure they would be able to find any. Despite his desire to find more of the herbs that Beanspark explained, Marigolddust would have rather returned to come with something rather than risk coming back empty-pawed. @Fawn
Springy 🦤 14-Nov-21 10:53 AM
Marigolddust - Hollowgrove - A little Conversation
- Present - Hollowgrove's response to his question wasn't the most direct as to what the real answer was, sending Marigolddust mixed signals. He opened and closed his mouth, unsure what to say. "U-um, alright," he said, reluctant to gather the prey. Had he taken the prey she had planned to keep for her own meal? How could he let himself be so rude as to assume another cat's prey was meant for him, just because they approached his den with it? For all he knew, it could have been for a patient inside of his den that Hollowgrove knew well enough to want to feed. Biting his lip, he stepped back, keeping away from the prey for the moment. If anything, Hollowgrove's eye roll was enough to hint that the prey was, indeed, meant for a cat other than him. Or perhaps he had simply just done something to offend the warrioress. A question or two? The statement caught him off-guard, bringing him back to attention. What questions would Hollowgrove have for him? Were they simple questions, like how he was doing with herb collecting? Maybe Hollowgrove really was just checking in on him.. although, for some reason, he found himself a bit uncertain as he responded. "I mean, um- sure, of course. You're not interrupting too much, don't worry. What would you like?" he asked, settling down into a sitting position to show her that he didn't plan on running back into the den to continue whatever he had been doing. He would get to it later. His clanmates came before himself, anyways... that was the way of a medicine cat, wasn't it? Curling his rail around his paws, he patiently waited for the questions.
- It didn't take long, and by the time he was asked, he had plenty of time to think it over. He felt a bit anxious, for some odd reason. He couldn't stop thinking back to the traitors that lauelblaze and Icestar had mentioned to him... but maybe Hollowgrove was just a curious clanmate. He couldn't quite recall if her name was among those that the leader and deputy had named, but so far, her questions proved to be an innocent inquartation. "I'm doing pretty alright, actually. Learning and training at the same time is... time consuming, but Beanspark is teaching me plenty, so I'm not so inexperienced that I have to be so worried as before." he explained, offering her a small smile after the response. "Thank you for asking. I hope you're doing well, too." he said, returning the formal greeting with a dip of his head. He paused for a moment as Hollowgrove nudged the prey closer to him. It would be even less polite to refuse the prey now. Gingerly, he reached a paw forwards and brought the prey to him, carefully using a unsheathed claw to quickly examine the prey for any hint of sickness. He had to get in the habit of doing so, in case the prey was the origin of Thunderclan's illness. @wild™

Marigolddust - Lionstep - Check Up
- Present - Marigolddust listened quietly, taking note of the little problems that Lionstep claimed to have. "Well, it sounds like these are all the herbs you'll really need, then,"* he reasurred, butting on a small smile before he realized he was missing something. Wasn't there something else that he was supposed to do, something he was supposed to suggest? Some sort of treatment that would help sore muscles and stiffened muscles, such as those in Lionstep's older body and those around the lungs. Beanspark had mentioned it faintly, but it took Marigolddust a moment to remember. "Oh! And if you ever feel like it's going to happen and you're farther away from me than you were today, I suggest bathing in some water. It helps your muscles to relax, although I can't promise you that it won't make your fur dirty." he suggested, gathering up all but a few herbs that he had brought out with him. Lionstep seemed alright now, but he had to make sure that the elder had some extras on him, just incase.
- "When it's cold?" Marigolddust repeated, concern flashing in his eyes. Who Lilyheart was, he wasn't sure, but he assumed that they were a loved one that had passed... or at least, that was the most likely situation where breaking the clan-code wasn't involved. Marigolddust didn't want Lionstep to feel like he had to stay away from whoever Lilyheart was, but he had to gently suggest it, for the sake of the elder's health. "Well, maybe you should stay away from the idea of leaving camp when leaf-bare comes around... at least without your herbs and a companion with you. The same goes with gathering herbs. It *is really nice of you to offer to help, and I would love your help, but make sure you have someone with you when yo do go out to do so, okay?"* he said, before amusement bloomed in his chest at the sound of Lionstep's excitement over sharing a story to the kits of the clan. "I'm sure they'll love it." he agreed. At the sound that these fits were usually only a few minutes long, Marigolddust felt more relaxed with the idea of leaving the elder alone in camp with the herbs. If he was capable of eating the herbs while having a spasm, then he should be fine, for the most part, at least. If anything else happened to him in the process, Marigolddust could help him more. "If that's the case, then please try and keep on top of taking the herbs," he requested, his voice nothing but friendly, all hints of strict seriousness free from his voice, although he felt it in his chest nonetheless. @Jollykit! :)

Marigolddust • Lionstep • Check Up
- Future - Nobody wanted to go with Lionstep? That seemed a bit unlikely, but at the same time, Marigolddust had been a warrior before. He knew what it was like to be busy and unable to do things such as occupy an elder to their loved one's sleeping place. So, perhaps, it wasn't quite as surprising than it may have seemed. Maybe Lionstep just hadn't been looking in the right places, or the cats in the clan truly didn't have the time or interest to ocompany him. It's rude to assume someone else is wrong, he reminded himself, and guilt was quick to spring up through his emotions. "Well, whenever you can't find anybody else, I could always join you to make sure you're alright." He offered, a friendly smile displaying across his face, although his shame in his assumptions lay secret behind his eyes. Finally, Lionstep stood up as quickly as he might have originally fallen down. So it really wasn't anything too serious or too worrisome, just a recurring problem. With one last, soft smile, Marigolddust nodded to him and paved a paw as a farewell. "Take care of yourself," he said, before the elder disappeared into the elders' den. Releasing a sigh of relief himself, he stood and turned around, returning to his den and the unfamiliar duties that waited for him inside of it. End!))
Ice 15-Nov-21 12:10 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
” All cats who are old enough to catch their own prey, gather around for a Clan meeting!” Icestar’s unexpected call rang through the developing campgrounds. Much progress has been made since the landslide and while some aspects of their lovely stone hollow was still in shambles, much of it was now well-repaired and improved thanks to Laurelblaze’s determination to make the camp fit for all sizes. Her fiery optics scanned the gathering felines below, watching as they all streamed in like fish and collected themselves in the clearing. It was a tight-knit group, perfect for the chilly, but sunny afternoon. Snow was on the horizon, Icestar could feel it from the Highledge as an icy wind tugged at her thick coat. According to her calculations, the camp should be repaired by then. If unexpected delays chose not to make an appearance. @ThunderClan

A brown tabby figure entered the stone ridden clearing. Tigerpaw slid out of the nearly done apprentice den, raspberry eyes upturned to where their lynx point empress stood on the high ledge, which had miraculously survived. As the days got colder, she yearned to tuck in to her warm nest, but whatever Icestar had to say, it must be important.
prim 15-Nov-21 12:21 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Ceremonies | present
The deputy of ThunderClan had heeded the call to gather the clan together for a ceremony, quickly departing the warriors den and entering the clearing. The burly tortoiseshell padded towards her apprentice, Tigerpaw, who’d been sitting in the clearing already, having beaten her to the space. ”Hey Tigerpaw.” she greeted the younger she-cat with a small, warm smile. She was about warrior age already, and the deputy had an inkling of what this ceremony was for, though she wasn’t exactly sure, it wasn’t as if she was involved in these matters. That was strictly Icestar’s duty by conducting these meetings and ceremonies, not hers. ”It’s getting chilly out, thank StarClan my coat is thick.” she murmured quietly, staring up at the lynx-point perched upon the Highledge, awaiting whatever came next. She’d be watching with keen interest, especially if it was concerning one of her own apprentices. She’ll have made it to warriorhood. @Shade

Having trained hard for moons, earning their warrior name and title as an official warrior of ThunderClan is an honour that I hope they value throughout their lives.” Icestar’s gaze focused upon Tigerpaw. ” I, Icestar of ThunderClan, call upon my warrior ancestors to look down on this apprentice. They have trained hard to understand the ways of your noble code, and I commend them to you as a warrior in their turn.” It seemed as if the chattering of squirrels and singing of birds even hushed into a silence as the lynx-pointed leader spoke. ” Tigerpaw, do you promise to uphold the warrior code and to protect and defend your Clan, even at the cost of your life?” @Shade

Shade 15-Nov-21 12:35 PM
”Hey,” Tigerpaw’s hushed greeting was paired with a small smile. She felt the tension between her and Laurelblaze was finally at its end, and it felt good to have their relationship back. She also felt relieved by Icestar’s introduction to the ceremony. They could all use some good news right now. A new warrior? Who could it be? Tigerpaw looked around, searching for a candidate. It wasn’t until a couple moments later that she realized everyone was looking at her, including Icestar, when she checked. That’s when it struck her. Wait, me?! Instantly her heart spiked, and she stood as summoned, but couldn’t stop the protest that bursted from her maw. ”But I haven’t even had my assessment yet!-“ She cut herself off just as the words tumbled out, stealing a look in Laurelblaze’s direction. The look on her mentor’s face confirmed that Icestar was making no mistake. Embarrassed and humbled at the same time, the young tabby she-cat walked forward and dipped her head. ”I do.”
Ice 15-Nov-21 12:50 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ // Ceremonies }
The outburst sent her dark ears pricking but her intent remained unchanged: Tigerpaw was going to be made a warrior. Thankfully, the senior apprentice responded with the traditional words of confirmation - a solid agreement to her rising in ThunderClan’s abundant ranks. It was the determination and honestly lacing amidst each word that caused a proud smile to break across her white maw. ” Then by the powers of StarClan,” Icestar continued in her confident tone. ” I give you your warrior name. Tigerpaw, from this moment on, you will be known as Tigerspring. StarClan honours your spirit and devotion, and we welcome you as a full warrior of ThunderClan.” Stepping forward to face the tabby head-on, she then leaned forward and pressed her dark, leathery nose against the smooth slope of Tigerspring’s forehead. @Shade @/ThunderClan
Shade 15-Nov-21 12:57 PM

Icestar’s touch sent a chill down her spine, and she held her head high while the clan chorused her new name. Until now she wasn’t sure if she deserved to be accepted back, or if they trusted her, but the ceremony vanquished all of that. Tigerspring looked back at her now former mentor, tears pricking her raspberry eyes. Thank you. Without Laurelblaze’s patience, forgiveness, and belief in her, she never would’ve made it here.

tremb 15-Nov-21 02:58 PM

He couldn’t handle the awkwardness between the two of them any longer. Maybe if he talked to her they could just put the past behind them and stop avoiding each other so much. tremb 15-Nov-21 03:30 PM

Shade 15-Nov-21 03:59 PM
Tigerspring felt the same way. Could it be said that she still loved him? In some way she did, even if it wasn’t much more than a special clanmate. They couldn’t deny their history. Even if she didn’t have the eloquence to say all this, the look she gave him from her round pink eyes sure did. ”No hard feelings at all,” she mewed softly, a small but genuine upturn tugging at her muzzle. Before she knew it she had her skull cradled on his shoulder. It lasted only briefly, and probably sent nerves stirring in both their bellies. Then Tigerspring stepped away and gave a big groaning stretch. ”StarClan, that was tough! I need to stretch my legs.” She didn’t head for the territory immediately though, letting a silent invitation which she didn’t have the guts to voice hang in the air. @tremb
tremb 15-Nov-21 04:19 PM
A soft gasp of surprise escaped the tom’s maw as she pressed into him briefly, and for a moment he wished she had stayed there longer. No. no more of that. He told himself. Still, he let a rather wide smile creep onto his lips for a few moments. He felt much better in this moment than he had since their split, if he was being honest. He laughed softly, nodding his head even though he didn’t understand yet how tough a silent vigil could be. ”Yeah, I can’t say I’m looking forward to that part,” he mused. He felt as if she was hinting at an invite to go on a walk, but he wasn’t quite sure. ”A walk in the territory sounds nice,” he said tentatively, not sure if his words were a question or a statement. @Shade
Shade 15-Nov-21 04:34 PM
Tigerspring beamed again. She nodded in agreement and waved her ringed tail at him to join her. She had earned her warrior title, she was finally feeling better after her heartbreak, and the clan was slowly recovering from the disaster. Feeling optimistic, Tigerspring headed for the forest. Maybe things could be okay again. @tremb end?)
Jollykit! :) 16-Nov-21 04:24 PM
