wild™ 16-Nov-21 04:28 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Hollowgrove's violet gaze narrowed slightly as the tom spoke, his constant hesitance ticking her off with each passing moment. He reminded her of her offspring - seemingly so naive, the cruel world would tear them apart without a second thought. It infuriated her that such weaklings existed - especially among the leaders of the clan. They should be strong and mighty - not those who lived on hope and faith in imaginary cats that roamed around in the sky at night. An amusing thought, yet painful at the same time. She lived among a clan of idiots. It explained their situation all too well. They'd best be grateful they hadn't fallen during the mudslide. Marigolddust's words were hardly heard as the molly stood there, lost in thought. Finchbriar was right. Thunderclan needed new leadership, and quite frankly, with a soul such as her they'd be much better off. She was unaware that their own presence among the clan had been discovered, but the growing tension and uncertainty from a few particular souls was enough for the braided feline to grow suspicious. She believed her to be an intimidating soul by nature, but something concerning how her clanmates were acting was upsetting her mind. Paranoia. No such thing rests among you. She thought to herself and with that, tossed the thought aside.
"...I suppose so." She replied at last, whiskers quivering. "I hope you've learned enough to be able to function on your own. Once this...Beanspark character departs from us, you'll be on your own. The fate of another will rest at your paws..." And such was true. Truly, she didn't harbor much confidence in the tuxedo - he seemed uncomfortable with the idea of holding a conversation with another - or perhaps, just her. Regardless, the tabby shook her head, a sigh emitting from her. "It'd be up to you to heal the clan. Thunderclan is still very much in shambles, one way or another. It is quite...the daunting task." She added after a moment, with a shrug. "I merely hope you are ready for such." @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 18-Nov-21 08:54 PM
Marigolddust • Hollowgrove • A Little Conversation
- Present - Marigolddust examined Hollowgrove's expression watchfully as he spoke, noticing all of the little indications and gestures she made as she listened to him. The young medic felt his insecurities rise with each passing moment. The twitch of an ear, the flicker of a tail, the narrowing of her eyes... Everything she did seemed to be a sign of disapproval and dislike. He knew he shouldn't be seeking approval from cats he hardly knew; Icestar and Laurelblaze's confidence in him should be enough. But, then again, being the medicine cat wasn't going to be easy if he was disliked by everyone in the clan besides the two other high ranks. The was just a mere example of what might be shown to him in the future, what might be the reaction to this new position of his. Fidgeting his paws ever so slightly to try and get rid of a bit of this growing anxiety, Marigolddust turned his gaze off of the warrior's face. If Starclan truly had been false, perhaps Marigolddust would have better understood how Hollowgrove felt, even if it wouldn't do so much. But Marigolddust knew that the cats rumored to be living in the stars weren't any fairy tale. He had met one in person- a previous medicine cat at that- and had felt the magic of their touch when he was appointed the medicine cat of Thunderclan. Unfortunately, Hollowgrove hadn't lived through such an event, and she didn't have enough faith to believe in what she couldn't see. She might have seen it as strength, but in truth, it was just as likely to bring her downfall as it was to bring Thunderclan's.
- Finally, the sharp hums of Hollowgrove's voice rung out once more, addressing him once again, rather than her own thoughts. Turning his gaze back to Hollowgrove's cold gaze, Marigolddust paused his figuring as he waited to see what she was going to say. Of course he hoped to hear that her day had been going well, but he wasn't sure whether he expected such an answer to come from her or not. She didn't look all that happy, anyways. What Marigolddust didn't expect was to hear words he had heard only in his mind being spoken outloud, although not from his own mouth. Involuntarily, the young tuxedo stiffened. He was unable to come up with a way to respond to everything that was happening, so he could only freeze and hope that he was hearing her wrong. Of course, he was wrong.
- Of course Beanspark would be leaving, maybe even sometime soon. He had his own clan to take care of, and he couldn't spend his time solely on Marigolddust, no matter how much the Thunderclanner selfishly wish he could. Quite honestly, he was terrified. Leaf-bare was coming and he didn't have a plan. Only Beanspark did, and he wouldn't be there forever. What would he do if he ended up stuck with a patient he couldn't help? How many cats might die just because he was inexperienced ormunsuremod himself? A frown tugged at the corners of his mouth as the thoughts ran wild, stampeding over all of the confidence that he had gathering, whether fake or honest confidence, it was hard to tell. I hope so. That was his core reaction; an agreement to Hollowgrove's uncertainty in his abilities. He almost said it out loud, laying cement over the opinion and paving it as fact. He managed to, fortunately, stop himself. He couldn't say such things, especially around his clanmates. It would just make them aware of how unsure he was in himself, making it so that they could think of him as nothing more than the cat who tried and couldn't. Though, perhaps that was already too late in this particular case.
- Using all of his willpower to try and push down his fear, Marigolddust attempted to speak smoothly, although, in the end, he was unsuccessful. "I-It's fine, really, I'm ready- i-it's fine.." he stammered, half to himself. He bit his tounge hard as his weak tone reached his own ears. He had stammered, he had repeated himself... Surely he couldn't be this scared. But he was, and now that he had let some of it slip, all he could do was glance around, searching for any cat who might have overheard. Maybe he could convince them, tell them that he was just tired and couldn't figure out his own words. He found himself double guessing himself, just because of something a clanmate said. Why, he wondered, was a single cat's voice so impactive to him? No, he had to try and ignore what Hollowgrove was stirring up. He had to put on a strong demeanor, for the clan and himself both. He could ruin this all by showing one of the traitors that were hiding somewhere in camp that he was so fragile, even more so than they must have originally believed. But either way, he and the traitors both had one thought in common; they both knew that Thunderclan deserved better than this. @wild™

{Laurelblaze} | Sapphireheart | present
The deputy couldn't help but to feel as if she were walking on eggshells around her clanmates. Things were getting tense, the disappearance of all three of their spies had put the entire clan on high alert, but more so the higher-ranked cats as they had been the only ones who knew about the spies being spies. Her clanmates were worried, she was worried. Three young cats go missing after multiple empty shells of rogue corpses were found on their borders, and a landslide they were starting to finally recover from? This was just phenomenal. Laurelblaze let out a small, frustrated sigh as she stepped out into the clearing from the warriors den, spotting one of her clanmates from afar. Sapphireheart, she could have sworn she'd spoken to the other warrioress in the past, but she couldn't be so sure. She knew all of her clanmates by name, but to say she was close to each and every single one of them was a stretch. Sometimes she only spoke to some about duties, though she wasn't exactly proud of that. Laurelblaze just didn't want to appear standoffish to her clanmates, she wanted to be approachable. Most of the time though, she had to initiate the conversation, just like today. "Hey, Sapphireheart. Are you faring well today?" Even if their camp was a wreck and their food supplies were running thin with the season, she was always gonna check in on her clanmates and how their moods were. Couldn't hurt even if everything around them seemed to be a mess. @🌹ɖǟառ🌹™

{Coyotepaw} | Patrol | present
The young tabby tom felt almost powerless when it was discovered his best friend had gone missing, he had hardly eaten, slept, and couldn't focus on training at all. Wrenpaw was out there, probably scared and not knowing where she was- and he didn't even know why! Three of his peers go missing after bodies show up around the territory before the landslide? What else was he supposed to think, for he, like the rest of his clanmates, did not know the true scope of the situation, that his friend had been acting as a spy on behalf of her clan in order to thwart the Dark Forest's schemes. All he knew was that she was missing, and he wanted to help her. So when this patrol was gathered together, Coyotepaw sprang to his paws and nearly sprinted to the clearing, a determined expression on his features as he stood to wait for the others. I've got to help my friend!
Shade 19-Nov-21 01:15 PM

- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Things had been...particularly rough as of late. The clan seemed to be practically falling apart still. First bodies of dead cats, then the mudslide and now...missing apprentices. Had Starclan placed a curse upon them? Something just wasn't right here and either they had upset their ancestors in some manner or these were signs of something even more horrifying about to be unleashed upon them. The russet figure's fur bristled, his amber gaze harboring that of rare concern. His whiskers quivered as he stared towards the camp's entrance, half expecting someone to come charging through it with news of the missing apprentices. Surely...surely, nothing terrible could've happened...right? His thoughts were shattered by the sudden cry of Laurelblaze. That's it. The time had come. Sooner or later, one knew they'd eventually seek out their missing clanmates and now, the deputy's voice harbored that of urgency. Whatever had happened to the apprentices would be discovered sooner or later, hopefully the former over the latter. Nothing good would await whatever they found, predator or foe. Every Thunderclanner knew this, when times reached this point. Now, as his name was called, Cardinalspark arose. 1
{A Battle at Sun-High}
The pallid gray skies over ThunderClan were typical of this time of year, but were still nonetheless was foreboding. The trees were slowly being stripped bare of their leaves, leaving strange tendrils spiraling up into the sky like skinny fingers trying to poke into the clouds above. A most dreadful sight, and for today, it only seemed to set the stage for what was about to happen. For today, there would be bloodshed, most glorious bloodshed. A wraith like figure emerged from one of the shadows behind one of the towering oak trees, black mist swirling around her paws as she peered out towards the camp entrance of the clan she hated so much, the clan who refused to grant her redemption, the clan who housed the cats who stood against her, the clan that led to her early demise. Today was the day she was enacting her revenge, after all the work she had put into turning their clanmates against them, she had an army standing behind her. Together, they would tear ThunderClan apart. Silentwing smirked lightly as she glanced behind her, staring at her followers and co-conspirator with a wicked, almost too eager expression. The euphoria of enacting her vengeance that was moons in the making was near, and today would be a momentous occasion. Taking a few steps forward, the former WindClanner entered the tunnel with her army trailing behind her, before she uttered the words. ”Attack, and show no mercy to your enemies! ThunderClan falls today!” @ThunderClan (PREPARE FOR BATTLE❗❗ )

Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 19-Nov-21 02:27 PM
As the fighting erupted suddenly, Dustycloud darted out of the warriors den with a few others in tow. His brows shot up in shock as wide, fearful amber and blue hues watched the attackers pour into camp. His heart didn't have time to sink, instead he could swear it had begun to roar in his ears at twice the speed. He froze as adrenaline began to surge through his veins and his breathing hitched. Cats to his left and right were taken down by the attackers, and there was so much blood already. He snapped out of it as the deputy yelled at him to round up the youth and get those who couldn't fight to safety. That he could do. I can do that. He shared one look with her before launching himself to the nursery. "Someone grab the elders and get them to Icestars den!" He called towards a small group of warriors, pleading that they'd follow his orders despite his skittish reputation. He scrambled to the nursery, his usual quiet and stuttered tone sounding loud over the snarls outside. "Everyone needs to get to the highledge! Get to Icestars den!" He meowed ushering kits along with their mothers to make sure no one got left behind. He snagged a kitten too afraid to move by the scruff, mentally apologizing for the way he ragdolled in his grip before following the mothers and their young towards Icestars den. Hopefully the others could hold them off long enough so that they could get inside without interruption... @prim @uhqueens/kits/elders (open) (edited)
prim 19-Nov-21 02:29 PM
{Finchbriar}
The tan tabby hadn't expected to garner the attention of two of her former clanmates with such vitriol, but she was more than capable of dispatching them with ease. "I'm bringing my family's glory and honor back that this clan has just brushed aside, that's what! Not that you would ever understand!" she snarled towards Patchheart, her claws sliding out of their sheaths as she prepared for the assault from both cats. "I think you should be asking that of your clan, when they dishonored my mother and couldn't even bother to keep her memory alive, that's what!" she spat in Cypressgaze's face, slashing her claws at her face as she attempted to remove her from her pinned form. wild™ 19-Nov-21 02:38 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
It had been a relatively quiet day, with dreary clouds resting over the land. Blue eyes were poised upon the dark sky overhead, curious as to whether or not rain would fall from them or if they'd simply reside there until further notice. His gaze caught sight of the patrol moments before they left and he briefly wondered whether or not they were going hunting or looking for their missing clanmates. Something about the way they'd left had seemed important, but both of those things were...the more he tried to think about it, the more confused he became. And then, it happened. Suddenly, screams and shouts sounded from the clan's entrance and before he knew it, the clan had erupted into a mass of fighting. It was as if a storm had unleashed its rage upon them, yowls and screams shattering the earlier silence like thunder, the sound of paws pounding upon the earth, almost seeming to make it shake. Gingerly, the tom arose, his useless leg seeming to drag upon the ground as he arose and made little movement forward. A fight had broken out. They were at war, in a sense. Wide eyes scanned the camp desperately, figuring it'd be best if he stayed out of things for now. If he he was attacked, there was only so much he could do.

Being slashed at in the face, Cypress managed to get off, head hanging from the sudden and quick assault that now etched across her features. "You idiot," Gander lifted, tears spiked and threatened to spill. Cypress was always an emotional individual. "Family legacy stays forever, but you seem to be absolutely selfish and ruining it even more with your betrayal!" A flicker of an audit to PatchHearts direction. prim 19-Nov-21 04:00 PM
{Viperpaw}
The young black tortoiseshell had been caught in the fray, desperately attacking any foe she came across as she had attempted to make her way towards the Highledge. She wasn’t very skilled in fighting yet, and she didn’t want to get killed by doing something completely stupid by picking a fight with a bigger opponent. Yet she was finding herself cornered left and right, trying to weave through the frenzy, but it was hard for a cat as small as she was. She was growing increasingly desperate, struggling to free herself, and it was terrifying. And now she had only drawn the attention of a Dark Forest warrior, while one of her mothers was fighting nearby. ”Mother! Mother help!” she cried out for Hollyfrost, before her gaze met Deerbounce’s, never feeling more fear in her life in this moment. @fuzz @Jennstar
tremb 19-Nov-21 04:03 PM
{ Wrenpaw } Running as fast as her legs could carry her, Wrenpaw burst through the entrance of the ThunderClan camp, fur bristling and lips curled in a snarl. A gory scene unfolded before her orange gaze. Everywhere she looked her clanmates were immersed in battle — a sea of writhing bodies and a symphony of furious caterwauls. The caramel fem hesitated briefly, unsure of where to insert herself. The clearing had transcended into utter chaos, and the apprentice’s mind was racing. Another apprentice was going head to head with a dark forest cat, holding their own but perhaps in need of some assistance. Wrenpaw was eager to get her paws dirty, and show everyone that she was stronger than they thought. She threw herself at the unsuspecting feline, trampling them to the ground and unleashing a round of heavy blows before leaping out of harms way, looking for her next opponent as the previous one fled from battle. (OPEN)
Stark✨ 19-Nov-21 04:04 PM
Wolfshine
Rushing into battle, the she-cat frantically looked for Needlestripe. Where could he be? Her fur stood on end as she spotted Silentwing among the bustle of cats. If she found out she failed.. she would be done for. ” Don’t worry my babies,” she whispered to her belly, ” I will keep you all safe.” She would have to look for Needlestripe later. For right now she had to hide- for the sake of her kits. She looked around for a crevice to hide in. Finding a bush, she crawled behind it and watched as the battle continued. |open|

fuzz 19-Nov-21 04:09 PM
hollyfrost || thunderclan lieutenant
The volume of camp doesn't matter when it is the familiar cry of her own child that tears through the clamour of battle. Hollyfrost's ears stiffen and her pelt stands on end; every instinct sets her nerves to live wires, tensing muscles and shifting eyes.
>
Viperpaw: the only one left unaccounted for. Yet it is her screams that send the senior warrioress into a frenzy, swatting away Clanmate and enemy alike until the black smudge of dappled shadow catches her eyes. Hollyfrost, quick to survey the scene, watches in horror as an unfamiliar dark pelt tears through the throbbing mass of bodies, claws, and teeth towards her progeny.
>
She leaps into action.
>
Claws meet shoulder as Holly blocks Deerbounce's path with her own lanky form, slamming a warning strike across the shadow warrior's muzzle.
>
"Not my kit, you foxheart," she snarls, teeth glinting with malice as she sizes up to the intruder.

Wolf 19-Nov-21 04:13 PM
Bearmask was faster than any animal in the forest, breezing through enemies so quickly that it seemed unreal. Since these cats were already dead, he made sure that each strike was made with the intent to kill, and in a matter of only a few minutes, he had already dispatched five undead warriors (because he’s so cool and awesome and epic and awesome). “You guys sounded more dangerous in stories,” he said with a battle-hungry grin as he finished another cat he had pinned off, tearing out their throat. The training he’d done with Eaglewing was paying off. He was stronger than ever. Now was hardly the time to praise himself for it though. He needed to look for the final boss, Silentwing. If he took out the Dark Forest cats’ leader, they would be weaker than ever. Bearmask scanned the area, trying to make out the feline he’d seen once during the WindClan raid moons ago.

prim 19-Nov-21 04:29 PM
{Coyotepaw}
He had managed to locate Wolfshine behind a bush in camp, and here she was, pleading for her life. His ears flattened against his skull as Wolfshine gave her reasoning, and he stared down at her, gulping out of hesitation. He couldn’t leave her to escape, she needed to be captured, to answer for her crimes! ”I-I…” he felt guilt well up in his chest, his leaf-green gaze widening. ”I won’t kill you… But I can’t let you leave. I won’t allow it, you need to stay and pay for your crimes. Springy 🦤 19-Nov-21 04:34 PM
Silentwing • The Battle
The voice of the point dragged Silentwing's eyes off of her hopeless choice of an ally and onto the leader. A hint of amusement sparked in her eyes, although behind it, annoyance over their lack in efficient success still stormed, although she knew that this was all just a delay in her plans. Cats were fighting for their lives, but those of which who were fighting for her own goals would finish successful. Even if some cats, such as Needlestripe, were weak links. "But, why? Seeing appearance of my beauty must not be much of an annoyance at all- although, I can't say the same for yours." she purred, a murderous spark lighting behind her optics as she spoke. There was nothing else she wanted more than to finish off these bastards. The nerves these cats had would be ended soon, along with their legacy. "Well, don't you have confidence?" She commented, adjusting her deathly form as she examined the two cats in front of her. With a flick of her tail, and a quick glance over the leader and deputy, Silentwing spoke the last words she planned for them to hear; at least, before they were bleeding from the throats on their own home grounds. "It's too bad you didn't take your own advice." She said, and at long last, she let herself fly- specifically, onto Icestar. @prim @Ice

By the time Hollowgrove charged into camp, bloodied and wounded, a horrid sight met her eyes. A large battle had taken place in her absence. Her gaze flickered over both Thunderclanners and traitors. Even a few Dark Forest cats were here. Perfect. Though her tone had been a sarcastic one, perhaps this would be exactly what they needed. Blood pooled in various places, the stench of it wafting into her nose. She began to bear her fangs, searching for her next target as she was now bloodthirsty. I've taken out one..why not anoth- A sudden force rammed into her, causing her to hit the ground rather awkwardly. Quickly regaining herself, the tabby rolled and arose again, thrashing about violently. "Why you little demon!" she shrieked, attempting to connect a blow. Her claws lashed out at Wrenpaw, already slick with blood. She wasn't about to allow herself to get beaten by one of their own former prisoners. If anything, she'd take this one out just as swiftly as Tigerspring. @tremb

prim 19-Nov-21 05:06 PM
{Laurelblaze}
She stiffened at the familiar sound of her former friend, approaching them with the intent on killing them both. Her stance grew firmer as she turned to face the other tortoiseshell, fury blazing in her odd gaze as she stared her down. Her fur was raggedy from battle, but she was hardly weakened, for she had been preparing for this moment. It was either them or Silentwing, and today would decide who got to walk away from this. ”One last dance, and we’ll see who is truly the victor.” her growl was low, and her fur began to rise along her hackles and spine, framing her out like a glorious mane. She was prepared to die for her clan if it came to it. But she was more prepared to finally end Silentwing’s life, if it meant her clan would get to live another day. ”Go crawl back into the hole you came out of, foxheart.” she hissed as she lunged at the Dark Forest she-cat who’d targeted Icestar first, preparing an onslaught of vicious slashes to take her down. Springy 🦤 19-Nov-21 05:29 PM
Silentwing • The Battle
Silentwing's intended outcome came out unsuccessful, at the moment, at least. First, her paws collided with those of Icestar's for just a moment, but before she could make much of a move, she was pushed away by paws of a bit of a larger size. A scowl spread across her maw and a hiss exited her throat just before she was about to hit the ground. But, by now, she was far too experienced. As the ground came closer, Silentwing moved her legs just in time, catching herself with her shoulders in a much less painful landing. As she felt her limbs touch the browning grass beneath, she sprung up with a quick, strong motion, pushing the hulking deputy enough to put her off of her footing for a moment. With the small moment, she took her chance and escaped from Laurelblaze's grasp, even if it was only for a few seconds. She could feel where she would one time have seen crimson, aware of the claws digging into her flank with the attack.
- Initially, ending Icestar had been Silentwing's goal. But changing her sights onto the larger of the two would get one problem out of the way. This was only going to delay her success, and she was aware of that. Despite how agitating it was, Silentwing would discard this challenge just as she had in the past. Laurelblaze was a recurring problem, one that she had just failed to get rid of until now. But she wouldn't let the deputy's existence roam on much longer, not on the earth that she calls home. No, this would be the end of her, Icestar, and Thunderclan as a whole. The thought brought a wicked smile to her face, the charm fading for a moment as she imagined the deaths she could give the cats in front of her. "That's a dance that I'll win, and a hole you'll join." She hissed, before leaping towards Laurelblaze. She knew by now that Laurelblaze couldn't be killed in one swoop like Beetlestreak had at Deerbounce's paws, and so she would try a different approach. Springing to the side, Silentwing used the ground to push off of, causing her to fly towards Laurelblaze's legs, claws unsheathed and ready. What was a giant, anyhow, without her legs? @prim @Iceywicey#3780

tremb 19-Nov-21 05:32 PM
{ Wrenpaw } The caramel furred molly crumpled to the earth as she was thrown by the warrior. Her ear was throbbing with pain and her muscles burning with exhaustion. The apprentice had never fought like this in her life. She thought back to a time when she was much more innocent, when she had admitted to Marigolddust how scared she was to be in her first battle. She had never expected it to be anything like this. Battling the most ruthless cats to walk the forest, fighting for her life. A life she realized could easily be stolen from her today. She writhed and thrashed, snarling viciously as Hollowgrove came crashing down on top of her, more painful caterwauls echoing from her as claws tore down her spine between her flanks. Searing pain shot through her, and for a moment her vision went blurry. There was no way she was going to win this fight, no matter how hard or valiantly she fought — she was simply outmatched. She groaned as the weight of the warrior lifted from her and a hefty kick was dealt to her hindquarters, dragging herself to her paws once more. ”You’re the one who looks like a fool. I’ll fight you until my last breath leaves my body. For ThunderClan.” She said. It was clear that the apprentice was on her last legs. Blood still poured from her ear, and now crimson streams flowed down both of her shoulders, staining her golden fur. ”Come on, traitor. Give me your worst,” she taunted, now poised and ready for the next attack. If she was going to die now, she was going to go out with claws flying and teeth snapping. @wild™

He had to be quick, he had to help! Almost as if he were swooping in before Hollowgrove could deal a full-on death blow to Wrenpaw, Shrikecatcher leapt onto the she-cat and sank his long claws into her frame. ”You’re not harming anyone today, bud!” he hissed as he shoved the other warrior off of Wrenpaw’s form, his blue-gray tabby fur bristling as he confronted Hollowgrove. Jennstar 19-Nov-21 05:49 PM
Deerbounce
@prim @fuzz As the two Thunderclan cats fought her side by side, Deerbounce narrowed her gaze. She was growing tired of this. Their side was losing, becoming ever more apparent by the fact that their prisoners had escaped and joined the fray. These cats are useless... she thought bitterly. She had had enough. She whipped around, decking Viperpaw across her head with her paw, blood spraying as her claws sliced just above the apprentices eye. She sent her flying away, before turning back to the bloody black furred warrior. "Ive had my fun...lets finish this, shall we?" she purred in a sickly sweet voice, before launching herself full force at Hollyfrost once more. Her paws landed square on the warriors chest, propelling her straight into the rocky wall that marked the edge of Thunderclans camp. There was a sickening thud that rang out as Hollyfrosts skull crashed against the rock. Deerbounce grinned maliciously, eyes filled with hatred and bloodlust.
wild™ 19-Nov-21 05:49 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
This was all too easy. As she whipped around to face the apprentice, half expecting to meet claws in front of her face, Hollowgrove was met with something else. Wrenpaw still laid upon the ground, a scarlet pool already beginning to form around her. Was this really the end of her so soon? Honestly? The warrior allowed for a cruel sneer to appear on her face, watching as the molly managed to rise. But her mere posture and gaze betrayed her - there wasn't much life left in her, regardless of her words. And she knew it. They both did. "Seems like you will. Some would deem your actions brave, admirable even." she spat, eyes poised upon the same spot where she'd laid the final blow against Tigerspring. "But they are merely foolish actions. Ones that'll end you." As the warrior stalked forward, her tail lashed out behind her, her fangs slowly appearing and jaws beginning to part. Yet she paused a pace or two from the apprentice, as if taunting her. An odd look appeared in her gaze. "My worst? My dear...you've requested death." As quick as lightning, Hollowgrove bolted forward and with an unsheathed claw, sliced Wrenpaw's neck. Believing that would be the end of her, the warriors whipped around, perhaps for a final blow...only to be knocked away. A grunt sounded from her as she hit the ground, the stinging feeling of claws sinking into her causing her to grimace, a hiss escaping her. "And yet another fool...you will pay for your actions! I was doing her a favor!" she cried, lashing out at the tom with an unsheathed paw, just as he turned his attention back to her. No one was going to ruin this for her! No one. @tremb @prim @Springy 🦤
tremb 19-Nov-21 06:01 PM
{ Wrenpaw } My dear… you’ve requested death. Perhaps she had. For all Wrenpaw knew, today would be her last. She was terrified. She tried to defend herself from Hollowgrove’s final blow, but she wasn’t fast enough. Claws ripped through the skin on her throat, and yet another stream of crimson bathed the ivory fur on Wrenpaw’s chest. The wound was deep, but lucky for the apprentice it was just shallow enough to prevent her from bleeding every scarlet drop from her body. That was, until Hollowgrove prepared for another blow. Wrenpaw winced, sending a silent prayer to StarClan as she prepared herself for the end. Alas, the blow never came. Orange eyes opened to see Shrikecatcher batting Hollowgrove away, and a shaky sigh of relief left the apprentice’s chest. Get to Marigolddust! Wrenpaw’s eyes widened. She hadn’t even seen the tuxedo in days, and a sudden wave of worry washed over her. She stumbled, sticky and warm with her own blood in the direction of his den. Would he even be there? Her breaths were ragged as she limped pathetically through the crowd of cats, tears welling up in her eyes. ”Marigolddust! Marigolddust, help me!” She cried, using all of her effort to make the words loud enough to hear over the battle cries. Please let him be okay. Please let him find me, she thought desperately. She’d almost reached the medicine den when her legs failed her, and she slumped to the earth in a pool of her own blood. @Springy 🦤
prim 19-Nov-21 06:03 PM
{Laurelblaze}
The ThunderClan deputy snarled as Silentwing managed to escape from her grip, only to be targeted next. Her fur was bristling, and she went back on the offensive when Icestar had decided to thwart Silentwing’s attempt of an attack against her legs. ”Well, you’re losing your touch, Silentwing. Can’t even keep up with me of all cats!” she scrunched up her nose as she taunted her enemy, preparing to pounce on her and attempt to tackle her to the ground, if she didn’t slip out of her range before she could. They needed to finish her, so they never had to see her ugly mug ever again. They lost too many cats to her, too many friends, family members, they had to see to it that they received proper justice. To know their killer would never again bring harm to another living being. For Cloverhill, and Reedshine… Laurelblaze yowled as she began her onslaught, charging at the former WindClanner with nothing but pure hatred in her gaze as she attempted her tackle, her paws outstretched as she launched herself at her. They were not going to hesitate, they had to fight for their lives here! @Ice @Springy 🦤
prim 19-Nov-21 06:23 PM
{Viperpaw}
She’d been following her mother’s orders, aiming low at Deerbounce’s sides, until she was suddenly slashed over her left eye, causing her to screech from pain. In it, all she could see was red, but her vision in with was blurry— but it was from the blood that was blinding her in that eye. It was the lid that was slashed, not the eye itself. She tried to wipe away her blood that was streaming into her line of sight, shaking her head from the pain of the slash as she attempted to come back to her mother’s aid… Only to hear a loud thud as her mother was slammed against the stone wall of the quarry— murderous intent in the other she-cat’s gaze. ”No…” she whispered aloud, her eyes widening as she felt tears welling up around her gaze as she stared up at Deerbounce, before it was replaced with pure and utter rage. She let out a loud cry of fury, pain evidently straining her voice as she threw herself at her mother’s assailant. ”You’ll pay for that! Every last wound on her body! I’ll destroy you! I’ll rip your head off!” she was yowling, assuming the worst of her mother’s fate, she was acting reckless… But what else could she do? She had to fight to avenge her family, to protect them from the enemies set on destroying them. She wouldn’t allow them to escape. @Jennstar @fuzz
prim 19-Nov-21 06:41 PM
{Shrikecatcher}
”I may be a fool, but I know for certain I’m much smarter than you are than to betray ThunderClan!” The blue-gray tabby tom had to keep Hollowgrove from trying to capture Wrenpaw and harming her further, he’d give her a good thrashing she wouldn’t forget. ”You know, you’re pretty cowardly for targeting an apprentice who isn’t even nearly as experienced in fighting as you are. Talk about being a total wimp!” he was taunting Hollowgrove to keep her attention drawn on him. So what if he took a few blows, he was strong enough to take it. He was big, and he could take it, he had to be a shield here so Wrenpaw and the others could escape. ”I think you should just give up already, your buddies have already been captured, you think you can take an entire clan by yourself? I don’t think so!”** he smirked lightly as he aimed a few blows at her back and shoulders, trying to knock her to the ground. He wasn’t one for murder, so he’d be trying to hold back, but he did want to try and restrain her if he could… Unless she didn’t give him a choice but to strike her down. @wild™
Springy 🦤 19-Nov-21 06:55 PM
Marigolddust • The Battle
The warrior and apprentices of the clan had received a task they didn't expect, or deserve, that day. Battle had spring out through the camp after the capture of the apprentices assigned to spy on the traitors and their ring masters. Now, fighting had broken out everywhere, cats of darkness and betrayal against those of flesh and nobility. Marigolddust was not among the many fighting. No, he was far too weak to fight, and although he was in as much danger as all of his clanmates, he couldn't bring himself to unsheathe his claws and play the offensive side. Clan rules didn't apply here, yet he couldn't protect himself and jump into the fight. Instead, he was gathering up all of the elders, kits, and queens that he could, bringing them into his den in hopes of providing them safety. "Come on! Into my den- it should be safer here," he called, hushing a queen and her kits into the den he had come to call home. If the den was attacked, he would need to try and finally bring out his teeth and his claws, but he offered them an unsuccessful attempt at a reassuring smile as they joined the others in his den. It was filling up, but it had to make do.
- Suddenly, his attention was dragged away and brought to the desperate call of a familiar voice. His attention snapped to Wrenpaw, and when his eyes landed on her, his heart stopped. It felt as if he was stuck in a pool of tar as he ran to his apprentice's side. "Oh Starclan, Wrenpaw! What happened? Stay awake, stay awake-" he ordered, his voice seriously strict and panicky. He was terrified as he realized rushed her into his den, trying to keep her out of the sight of the kits but also hurrying. "I-t'll be okay, just- just dont close you're eyes, okay? It'll be fine, I-I promise.." he choked, trying to hold back forming tears as he brought her to his pile of moss balls to try and find some wet moss for his dying apprentice. @tremb @prim
fuzz 19-Nov-21 07:01 PM
hollyfrost || lieutenant of thunderclan
The world spins for a moment before it quite literally comes crashing down on the warrior's head. Pain explodes as ears are filled with rubble and the sound of bone contacting rock; the edges of her vision go blurry and a strangled cry gurgles from her throat.
>
She barely registers Viperpaw diving forward as Hollyfrost slumps to the ground, head both spinning and fogged. The battle sounds far away; not even shaking her head is enough to regain the grip she had on reality a moment before.
>
It lasts for more than a few heartbeats. Her mouth is metallic, her crown clenched and splitting as the ebony fae staggers to her paws. The camp sways around her and she has to splay her legs to keep her footing. Teetering between this world and unconsciousness, spite lends aid to preventing her from slipping into darkness.
>
"Viperpaw, let her go," she manages to rasp out, shutting one eye as blood pours into it. The molly wipes the back of her paw across her nose, smearing crimson up her scratched cheek before spitting at Deerbounce's blurred form. "Go help the injured cats get to Marigold-dust's den. I'll handle her."

wild™ 19-Nov-21 07:04 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Yet another blow connecting. Hollowgrove could hardly stand it. Out of the corner of her gaze, she watched as Wrenpaw made her way toward the medicine cat den, her bloodied form seeming to stagger with any step. She was waiting, waiting...but her form was quickly lost in the crowd of battling felines, leaving the molly without knowledge on whether or not her wounds had truly been the death of her. No matter, for she had something else to worry about...namely, this warrior who believed he would be able to take her down. "Oh really? I'll have you know she asked for it, otherwise I would've left her alone to die by the claws of another." she replied in turn, her frown deepening at the tom's taunts. So he was one of those fighters, hm? Being one to talk a whole bunch of smack yet displaying no sort of skill. A huff sounded from her, scarlet drops falling upon the ground as she stared down her target. "Oh? And face death?" a cackle rose from her. "I don't believe so! I'll kill you before I do anything else!" she cried, aiming another blow at the tom, before stumbling a pace or so away. Silentwing...Deerbounce... She couldn't fail them. And had his words been true? Had the others already fallen so quickly? Shows their weakness. I'll stand til the end. Breath becoming ragged once more, she forced it to even out. "Who knows. With the power of those who unleashed this upon your clan, I just might. One cat at a time." Again, she lashed out, whipping about to kick the tom, perhaps able to knock him off balance. There was no way she'd be going down so easily. Not now, not ever. @prim

Springy 🦤 19-Nov-21 07:24 PM
Silentwing • The Battle
The attack was unsuccessful. Again. Silentwing scowled as Icestar got in the way of her offense against Laurelblaze, sending her claws across the dark forest cat's flank. Releasing a loud hiss, Silentwing quickly turned towards the leader. Unlike what she had originally planned, it didn't seem like this would be a battle she could win by going one-on-one with the deputy and the leader separately. They were taking the route that was far more effective, if not pitiful. If a cat were to take another's life, she should get the credit, not some cat who might have been of assistance. It was weak, leaving a battle to be won half-way by claws that were not your own. Silentwing's glare disappeared behind a threatingly playful one, an expression daring Icestar to attack. She had returned her cool, momentarily. She shouldn't have lost it in the first place, although secretly, it still stood strong. Confident charm was a good cover-up, and although the charm might have been a bit empty, her confidence was not. These cats could try. They could try over and over again. But they wouldn't win, because she had a trick they could never imagine. She just had to wait for the right time, the right place, and the right cat. These two were both strong candidates, but she only had one feline in mind. At least, for the show she would put on for everyone else present. They will live to share the story of her name, and she would get the glory she had come to claim.
- A spark of cruel excitement flashed across her face at Icestar's comment. "Loose screws are a small price to pay, darling," she hummed, before Laurelblaze's voice met her ears once more. Turning to face the deputy, a wicked smile displayed on her features, a smile which wavered ever so slightly at Laurelblaze's comment, a bit of her annoyance peeking through once more, although it was covered up again as quickly as one would cover up a truth with a lie. "Fighting with words? You can do so much better," she commented cool-headedly, giving the tortoiseshell a sickeningly teasing wink. Her eyes stayed on the mismatched gaze of the cat she had once called a friend- a friend who had betrayed her in the end. Silentwing let the satsifactory idea of bringing this clan to an end once and for all fuel her next move; an attack to Laurelblaze's token Silentwing had left her, decorating her chest. But the move had too much arrogance behind it, and she had been too confident in herself the moment she sprang. She noticed the mistake as soon as her paws left the ground, but it was too late to fix it. She had given them an opening point. @prim @Ice (edited)
prim 19-Nov-21 07:46 PM
{Laurelblaze}
It was time for her to end this once and for all, and as she leaped towards Silentwing with her paws outstretched, she couldn't help but to notice that she was smiling. Not staring up at her in fear, but she was smiling. She knew something that she didn't. She got too cocky. She let her emotions get the better of her. Laurelblaze couldn't stop her attack mid-flight, for she was aiming directly towards Silentwing, her underside vulnerable to attack from the she-cat below, the fatal flaw of a grandiose tackle from above. A weakness that could easily be exploited, was Silentwing going to strike at her here? Was this it? What was she planning? Laurelblaze couldn't predict what she was going to do, and most certainly not what the Dark Forest tortoiseshell had planned next... @Springy 🦤 @Ice
Springy 🦤 19-Nov-21 08:17 PM
Silentwing • The Battle
Despite the poor leap off of the ground on Silentwing's part, she didn't need a good pounce in order to complete what she had in mind. She needed to get Laurelblaze out of the picture, even if doing so meant that Icestar's end had to wait a moment. Silentwing and Laurelblaze had unfinished business, and perhaps that would end here, before it ended for the leader that could only watch as Silentwing finally reached Laurelblaze. Rather than land on top of Laurelblaze or sending a deadly blow down onto Laurelblaze's throat, she kept her sights on the scars on the tortoiseshell's chest, landing on the ground rather than on her opponent. Giving such a killing blow would be too quick, not nearly as effective as she wanted Laurelblaze's last moments to be. No, instead of digging claws into flesh, Silentwing thrust a paw into Laurelblaze's chest. The attack would be anything but expected, and it was a trick that Silentwing had been keepinh in secret to display in this moment. Or, rather, a future moment. This would just be a little show, a display for all of the cats around them; an event that would make the cats of Thunderclan fear her as they should. Silentwing's smile widened as her eyes stayed on Laurelblaze's, an evil and knowing look in her eye. Now was her time. Silentwing's paw was no longer visible, being hidden by the flesh and fur of Laurelblaze's chest. Silentwing didn't stop until she could feel the power of the fragile organ beating in the deputy's chest, and once she could feel the power of fists beating against her paw, she closed her claws around it. With one quick, powerful movement, Silentwing pulled against the power her claws had hooked around, bringing it part way out of Laurelblaze's form and into the open.
- Silentwing didn't let go of this new force that she had trapped in her grasp, and instead, she examined it with satisfied pride. Laurelblaze's soul was trapped between her clawed toes, unable to escape the grape of the dark forest cat. No look of surprise or fear was shown on the Windclanner's face as she took in her work, and a large grin was displayed instead as her dark, cold eyes met Icestar's. The deputy's soul was still connected to her body, only part way out of her chest, but it was enough of an event to give any cat a scare. Silentwing's crazed joy in the sight of it was just the cherry on the top. "Well, what do you think? I learned a trick or two during my time in that forest you seem to despise so much. I don't know, I kinda like it, hm?" She spoke the words casually, an unsettling chill filling blanketing her tone. @prim @Ice
Ice 19-Nov-21 08:37 PM
{ ~ Icestar ~ }
Everything happened too fast for her mind to process. The inviting glare of Silentwing was enough for Icestar to leap forward. That was when it all came down. The swipe of the Dark Forest warrior’s at Laurelblaze’s exposed chest. The deputy’s counter-attack and their collision. Something wasn’t right. With a darkened expression on her masked face, Icestar skidded to a halt, sending stray pebbles scattering in their direction. She blinked in shock as Silentwing’s paw disappeared into Laurelblaze’s body and pulled out a translucent form that resembled that of her deputy. ” What are you doing!?” Icestar snarled, baring her canines menacingly. She met the ice-cold eyes of the joyous psychopath. Her own gaze was a torrential wave of blue-green flames. She felt murderous but she didn’t dare take a step closer. If that faint glow was what she suspected it to be, she was at the mercy of Silentwing’s will. ” Murder her and I will have you begging to be killed!” The silvery-white leader spat out. @prim @Springy 🦤
prim 19-Nov-21 08:37 PM
{Laurelblaze}
It was in an instant that she was no longer soaring through the air, instead, her physical form was just standing there, a stunned expression stuck on its face... But she was not in control. She couldn't move, both forms were unable to free themselves, Silentwing held her in her grip. Am I dead? No, if she had died, she would have woken up in StarClan, she was outside of her body. Her soul was partially suspended, drawn out by Silentwing, completely at her mercy. She stared down at the former WindClanner, her jaw parted as she stared through her partially translucent paws, and back to her actual body. "Y-You!" her voice had a reverb, a slight echo to it as she glanced around, unable to free herself. "Release me! I don't need a body to kill you!" she snarled aloud, swiping her paws at Silentwing, but they merely phased through her. This was not her true form, because she was not actually dead, her soul did not contain the power of a StarClan cat that could defend itself, nor did it hold the power her physical body had. She couldn't fight back. @Springy 🦤 @Ice (edited)

🌻 nectarglade🌻
the cream and orange calico she-cat looked around, and she couldn't tell who was friend or foe, with the knowledge of her clanmates' betrail she didn't know who to trust. she began attacking whoever came at her, even if it was possibly by accident, yowling with rage Nectarglade don't do this! what if you end up hurting some innocent cat?!. she threw this thought aside though, i don't know who to trust! what if others have betrayed and are ready to attack me at any moment?!. the she-cat finally began diving into battle, blinded by rage one day the camp is destroyed, then cats start becoming sick, now this??? what's next StarClan?!** felt claws tore at her pelt, and blood began to spatter on her coat, and she felt a searing pain running across her side. she looked through her one good eye, trying to decide who was good or bad, but alas she wasn't able to differentiate the crowd around her. she continued her attacking, pain striking her both physically and emotionally *these were cats i trusted with my life if i don't know who to trust why am i still here?. that's then she was leapt upon, the breath was driven out of her, as she lay scrambling, but the cat's claws continued towards its target, leaving her more and more weary as it went on. she began blindly trying to attack but her paws never touched the cat. she was in a daze, weak from pain, she felt blood welling up from her wounds, and especially a large wound on her side and chest, she finally gave up, and she felt her body go limp, as she struggled to keep her eyes open. the cat lept from her and joined in the fray once more, but she remained there, unable to move, her body felt like it had fought a thousand battles, maybe tenfold that. the world became blurry soon, and she heard the sounds that had moments ago been so loud being drowned out, and though she fought to stay awake she feared that she wouldn't be awake much longer. Springy 🦤 19-Nov-21 10:18 PM
Silentwing • The Battle
Silentwing's ear twitched in a gesture that indicated that she had no real interest in this whole event, when in reality, she was quite invested. The pain and fear that she struck in the hearts of the cats around her was a nice appetizer for her final plan, and Icestar's own reaction was even better. Laurelblaze certainly seemed as surprised and disturbed as all of the other felines who's eyes had been drawn to the scene, if not even more so. The deputy even stammered- she never did that. Silentwing knee that better than most, and the pleasure that Thunderclan's fear gave her made her want the moment to last forever. Unfortunately, that wasn't possible. The cats would get bored of it eventually, maybe even moving against her, and she would have likely really lost interest by that time. No, she had a mission that she was here to complete, and she wouldn't be leaving until what she started was over. She worked too hard for this all to go to waste, and spending precious moments such as this to take in her own joy would only waste her to!e and give her enemies the opportunity to think. They couldn't have that, now could they? So, that meant that action had to be taken.. and it would be taken here and now, in the wrecked place the Thunderclanners called their home. Silentwing paid mind to Laurelblaze's angry demands, but she didn't shown any indication of such. She knew how much it hurt, feeling as if you weren't living but watching your own life go by. Now that Laurelblaze was unable to do anything but stand dormant and take in what happened around her, Silentwing could save the bittersweet flavour of her pain, along with those around her. Oh, what an amazing revenge the was turning out to be.
- It was only when Laurelblaze attempted an attack on her that Silentwing sent a side glance to the deputy's soul, a smirk adorning her face and a spark of satisfied pleasure springing through her eyes in a way that could display nothing more than toxic excitement. She turned her gaze back to Icestar as she spoke, her large smile failing to fade away. "Murder?" She said, mock surprise expressing through her candy-dipped tone, "Honey, you can't even *imagine what I could do to her~ and trust me, you don't want to."* She said, her words leaving her mouth like starving cobras escaping a cage, eager for a bite of something moving. Something living. Sitting down, Silentwing showed she wasn't eager to do much other than talk, and she didn't expect anything else; from the other cats, of course. She had a course of action that she was going to take, but theirs would be ruined. She'd make sure of it. "I'd hate for you to see such things happen to your beloved deputy.. you might just have to get another. But we'd hate for that to happen, wouldn't we?" Silentwing asked, putting on a nonchalant demeanor as she examined her paw, the very paw who had Laurelblaze's soul trapped between it's claws. "We can avoid such... Unfortunate events, of course, you just have to.. *agree to something, and your precious deputy can get her body back."* She offered, casting Icestar a side glance before turning her head, keeping Icestar's pale turquoise gaze on her own green-tinted ones. The smile on her face widened as Silentwing licked her lips, readying herself for the proposition.
- "All you have to do is agree to let me take your lives away from you. Every single one that remains, and I'll take your soul in exchange for her's," Silentwing announced, motioning second-mindedly to Laurelblaze's soul, her wicked smile only becoming more dark and venomous as the bittersweet words left her mouth, preserved like honey on her tounge. @prim @Ice (edited)
fuzz 19-Nov-21 10:56 PM
hollyfrost || thunderclan lieutenant
Holly doesn’t have much time to nurse her own wounds - Deerbounce is gone, but the battle still rages on around them. The steady drums of war unforgotten and unhindered by loss. She rushes to Viperpaw’s side, examining her daughter for injuries. Aside from a few scratches and obviously injured pride, she’s unharmed; the senior warrior exhales the tension in her chest and passes a tongue between her kit’s ears.
>
“You need to be careful. Keep training, and I know one day you’ll be able to fight twenty dark forest warriors with a paw tied behind your back. You’re like Laurelblaze, in that way.” She smiles, happy Viperpaw’s unharmed for the most part.
>
The relief is short lived, apparently; behind her daughter’s head, she watches the unthinkable happen. Laurelblaze is torn from her body, a ghostly disembodied soul floating, held hostage by Silentwing’s sharp claws. Holly’s voice catches in her throat - she pushes Viperpaw behind her and into a crevice in the gorge.
>
“Stay here,” she orders, leaving no room for argument. “Do not leave this place until it’s safe.” Holly fixes her with a stern glare before blocking her line of sight with crooked frame.
>
“Put her back, Silentwing! She’s done nothing wrong,” Hollyfrost shouts, bristling at her mate’s helplessness. The world swims around her with the strain but she forces it down. Laurelblaze will not die here; not if she has any say about it.
@prim @Springy 🦤
Ice 20-Nov-21 10:00 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ }
Icestar gritted her teeth. Silentwing was taunting her with that paw and her honey-sweet words. Immediately not killing Laurelblaze meant that the wretched villain wanted something from her and it didn’t take a genius to figure out what it was. To immobilize a Clan, you needed to get rid of its driving force and that happened to be the exact position she was in. It was a dirty move and Icestar only felt her anger rocketing up to the sky. There it was. The proposition was clear. Despite Laurelblaze’s soul partially hanging out from her body, the lynx-point didn’t fall into a crouch and beg to be sacrificed. She raised her chin and glared, analyzing the situation with great intensity. The main problem was that it involved trusting Silentwing to follow through with leaving Laurelblaze alone. She doubted that the snake would let her arch nemesis continue breathing while she wasn’t. However, did she have much of a choice? If she didn’t submit, Silentwing was going to rip away the dappled she’s soul in a heartbeat. Ideas played in her crafty mind until one in particular stood out. Icestar hadn’t made it this far with only her battle skills! A cold smirk played along her lips as she finally responded but the flames in her eyes were as dangerously sparking as ever. She wasn’t going to let Silentwing erode her self-confidence. If she was going down, she wanted it to be with spirit and grace. ” Let’s do it but first, let her go.” @prim @Springy 🦤 (edited)

prim 20-Nov-21 10:13 AM
{Laurelblaze}
Never had she felt so powerless, absolutely at the mercy of another cat, not since she was but a small kit laying at her mother’s side- blind and deaf like all kits were born as. She couldn’t fight back, not unless her soul was returned to her body, and Silentwing was using her as yet another pawn. I slipped up. She could never have predicted that this was how Silentwing would go out, using her very soul as a bargaining chip in her games. Though, she figured she should have, those bodies they found on the northern border seemed so eerily empty, like their souls had been ripped from their forms. It shouldn’t be possible, but Silentwing always seemed to find ways to defy their expectations, to find a way to have the last laugh… And now Icestar was willing to lay down her life, for her. The spectral form’s eyes widened, and she strained in Silentwing’s grasp in Icestar’s direction, desperately extending her paw out to her as if to emphasize what she was going to say next. ”NO! I won’t allow you to do that for me!” she gasped, pain evident in her voice as she realized just what that would mean. Her friend was willing to give up her life, in exchange for her own. Leaving ThunderClan in her paws. ”Icestar, I’ve told you I’d die for ThunderClan, I won’t let you sacrifice yourself for me. I can’t! Don’t do it!” but ultimately, she couldn’t stop her from doing it, she was still stuck in Silentwing’s grasp, unable to free herself. Yet the pain she was feeling deep down in her very being was immense, unbearable. ”Don’t! DON’T!” she was pleading now, her voice straining as she was begging her leader not to sacrifice her life for her own. She didn’t want another cat to die for her sake, because of her actions. @Springy 🦤 @Ice
fuzz 20-Nov-21 10:23 AM
"hollyfrost || thunderclan lieutenant"
Panic grips the stoic fae and she takes another staggering step forward - the battle slows to a halt around them. Laurelblaze is suspended above her fallen body; the scent of death is slowly creeping into the frozen fur and Hollyfrost feels bile rise up in her throat. She can’t stay like this for much longer, she realizes; there’s sure to be negative consequences to being torn from one’s body for too long.
>
Earlier, it had been far too clamorous to hear the dark ultimatum presented to ThunderClan’s matriarchs. Now, with Silentwing’s green eyes honed only on Icestar and the wicked grin that peels across her face, it becomes clear to the senior warrior: Icestar or Laurelblaze. Cold ice consumes Hollyfrost, rooting her to the spot. Laurelblaze is refuting the shadow warrior’s options but they fall on deaf ears.
>
It was either her mate or her best friend. Hollyfrost felt sick and the spinning grew worse. She swayed on her paws, falling forward and barely catching herself in the process. She wanted to reach out, grab Laurelblaze’s soul from Silentwing’s claws and put her back where she belonged. She couldn’t even stand, darkness too thick to see through and blood clouding the vision of one eye.
>
“Icestar, please! There has to be another way - don’t. I can’t-” her voice is no more than a pained gasp, a feeble paw outstretched to the two cats who meant the most to her. She couldn’t lose them. She couldn’t lose either of them - a reality without Icestar or Laurelblaze in it was a world too painful to go on in.
>
“Please.”
@Ice @prim
Springy 🦤 20-Nov-21 11:04 AM
Silentwing • The Battle
A new voice met the ears of the devilish fem, but they were paid little attention to. Silentwing merely cast the dark furred warrior ess a sideways glance, a look that was more of a glare than anything, as if she were watching a fly buzzing around her head. But she wouldn't try and swat at any of the buzzing creatures in the camp until after she had finish what business she had came here for. With a twitched of an ear, Silentwing's smile returned as she waited expectantly for Icestar to accept this offer; she was weak, and Silentwing knew that the point wouldn't let her Deputy die so easily, especially in such an unsettling manner. It took longer than desired for the leader to respond, but Silentwing was a patient cat. She had had to be patient for this whole plan, and she wasn't going to let it all slip away by trying to rush the process now. A small frown did threaten to tug down the corners of her mouth, though, at Icestar's response, but it disappeared as fast at it had come. "Hmm.." he hummed, debating the response. Returning Laurelblaze's soul to her body would mean giving her the power to move again. But, at the same time, Silentwing's goal was to end Thunderclan. Without their leader, the clan wouldn't be able to run well enough to fight against her power, and Laurelblaze would be weaker than usual once being returned to normal. It would be a momentary shock, but it could be enough time for Silentwing's plan to succeed. Of course, she had expected an answer similar to this beforehand, but thinking over it one more time couldn't hurt... Especially if it meant raising suspense.
- As she was about to speak, Silentwing cast Laurelblaze a sideways glance, her smile stronger than it has been for a long while. Finally, she was going to have her success, and she would get back at the clan who had refused her and the cats who did it. Returning her sights back to Icestar, Silentwing gave her the same powerful smile. "Alright, then. We have a deal, as soon as you call off this makeshift army of yours," she purred, pausing a moment as she raised her paw. She stood there until the cats around them stood down, staying still for a good moment before finally bringing her paw forward, sinking it into the chest fur of the deputy's body. She felt as the power was drawn from her paws as soon as her claw touched the heart of the deputy, Laurelblaze's soul the water of a waterfall as it's strength was dragged back into her body. As soon as the action was completed, Silentwing stepped towards Icestar, wasting no time. "It's time for the fun," she announced, smiling a wicked grin before leaping at the leader, aiming to take the first life to start the chain of stealing the rest away. @Ice @prim (edited)
Ice 20-Nov-21 11:38 AM
{ ~ Icestar ~ }
Laurelblaze’s protests flew past Icestar’s ears. She flicked them away with a tufted audit, dismissing them. She wasn’t going to go down so easily. Laurelblaze had to have more faith in her! Trusting Silentwing was unheard of. There were going to be no deals made here and Icestar was going to make sure that she was coming out victorious with Laurelblaze and the Clan in one piece. She was going to play this game on her own terms unbeknownst to the others. Hollyfrost’s cry was what disturbed her from her determined intent. Icestar froze, looking down at her best friend’s desperate words. The smirk upon her face warmed. Trust me. The silvery-white femme gave a wink, turning back to Silentwing with a spirited look. Her gaze darkened slightly at the next proposal set down but no protest arose. ” ThunderClan! Halt!” The command came crystal clear. Icestar barely had enough time for another breath when Silentwing lunged right at her. @Springy 🦤 @prim @ThunderClan

prim 20-Nov-21 11:45 AM
{Laurelblaze}
”No! STOP! Icestar, let me-!” her cry was cut off as Silentwing finally released her soul from her grip, leaving her to phase back into her dormant frame, returning to it’s rightful place. However, she did not wake up immediately, she was greeted by darkness, as if she were comatose, swimming in a sea of black and unable to find her way. She couldn’t hear, or feel a thing, numb to the rest of the world for mere moments as her body stood there, silent and still as a stone statue. Then, all of a sudden she could hear pounding, a rhythmic drumming of a heartbeat that was signifying her return to life— like the beat of war drums signifying the return of a hero from battle. Except today, it was her song of warfare. The deputy’s vision was foggy, phasing in and out as she was unable to make out her surroundings, struggling to move to see what was going on— unable to fight back, for now. ”N-No-“ she coughed, her voice raspy as she tried to make herself move, but she stumbled, her balance had yet to return to her. She couldn’t fight back like this, and she had to will herself to move, to come back to life after being halfway-dead. ”S-Stop-.” another coughing fit, her lungs felt like weights, stinging as she took a deep inhale, trying to catch her breath after being unable to move at all. As if she were petrified in place. @Ice @Springy 🦤
Wolf 20-Nov-21 12:00 PM
Bearmask—bloodied and battered from his continuous fighting of random NPCS—found Icestar, Laurelblaze, and Silentwing on the highledge when Silentwing had just taken hold of Laurelblaze’s soul. Had it not been for that, he would have singlehandedly ambushed the unsuspecting ghost. Unfortunately, he couldn’t risk preventing Laurelblaze’s soul from potentially returning to her body. He knew little of how this power of Silentwing’s worked, and he wasn’t about to go charging in recklessly to potentially cause the ThunderClan deputy’s death. Instead, he kept himself low to the ground, watching helplessly as events unfolded before him. Bearmask grit his teeth, anger pulsating throughout his entire body. This was the most annoying situation he could have ever possibly found himself in. All he needed was an opening . . . His eyes widened when Silentwing proposed an exchange: Icestar’s lives for Laurelblaze’s one. Bearmask wanted nothing more than to tear out the spirit’s throat, wiping away that cocky grin of hers permanently. Hollyfrost’s plea momentarily caught his attention. Was Icestar really going to accept? Bearmask, and most likely Hollyfrost too, already knew what the answer was going to be. Blood roared in his ears as Icestar chose to accept, commanding everyone to cease their fighting. His eyes swirled with unmistakable fury. There was no way he was going to let this happen. He had to do something. No, he couldn’t. Bearmask saw the wink she gave Hollyfrost. Icestar had something planned. Whether it was a good plan or not (most likely not because Icestar was a big dumb head lmao XD) remained to be seen. He just had to trust the cat he’d grown so close to. For once, Bearmask had to do what he was told—although, of course, he’d never admit to it. (edited)
fuzz 20-Nov-21 12:08 PM
"hollyfrost || thunderclan lieutenant"
“ICESTAR!”
>
Hollyfrost’s strength returns for her to scream in horror. Icestar, slumped forward on Silentwing’s intruding paw, body hunched in pain, is something the dark warrior can’t wrap her mind around.
>
She staggers to her paws and takes a half-step forward, stopped by her friend’s roared command. Her throat is tight, her eyes are hot, and her body quivers with the need to rush to her side, bat the shadowed warrior away, and carry her to the medicine den. To assure her it was going to be okay - it was always okay, wasn’t it? Icestar was always okay, nothing like this would be enough to take her down permanently.
>
Hollyfrost let out a strangled wail, unable to help her mate to her paws nor protect her dearest friend. She was completely, and utterly, helpless. The wink is just enough - just enough - to keep her from doing something entirely stupid.

Springy 🦤 20-Nov-21 12:17 PM
Silentwing • The Battle
The Thunderclan cats were ordered to stop their fighting, and those on Silentwing's side paused as well, leaving the grounds of the camp still, the only movement being the unfrozen figures of Silentwing, Icestar, and Laurelblaze, and perhaps a few loved one's, too. But no action was going to be made, not while Silentwing was in action and an order from their own leader kept Thunderclan trapped in time. Words were spoken; cried from the audience, pleads from Laurelblaze and the closest friends, and the loudest noise of all: Icestar's startled silence and Silentwing's silent battlecry as she leapt at the leader. The dark, ever bloodied claws of the Dark forest cat's paws became outstretched, ready to strike as she flew through the air with as much grace as a hawk swooping at it's prey. And, on the end, it would bring just as much satsifaction, but unlike a hawk finding a meal, one life wouldn't feed her hunger. She needed more than just one death at her claws. Unlike other cats, she had lost her morals moons ago, and now she was never shameful when she added more blood to her claws. No, instead, it gave her even more excitement. Excitement she had come to crave.
- She fed this hunger, if even the smallest bit, as she felt her claws slash through fur. Deep. Crimson spewed onto her fur as she landed once more, she turned around to take in the scene. Her claws had sliced through the fiery leader's neck, slitting Icestar's throat in a smooth, masterfully complete movement. She watched the point fall like a starving animal, a crazed look in her eyes as her heart raced. One life down, but there were more to go. Her sickeningly-sweet words were absent now, Silentwing's attention no longer being spent on speaking. She was too focused on the task she had given herself; a task she would complete. She stood there, waiting, as Icestar's life drained out of her. She would stand there patiently, awaiting for the leader's next life to bring her to her feet. And once it had, she sprung into action once more, moving and aiming In a new way and direction. She would do this for as long as she needed, and watch as Icestar's rein neared it's end. Her rein, and Thunderclan's glory. @prim @Iceywicey#3780

Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 20-Nov-21 12:28 PM
Most of the fighting had ceased even before Icestar's call to halt. Loyalists, traitors, and Dark Forest cats alike looked to the sight before them. Dustycloud could feel his consciousness ebbing away with blood loss as he watched the shiny ghost of his adoptive mother placed back into her body. Confusion and panic clouded his mind and his judgement, ears filled with SIlentwings demand and Icestars resign and Hollyfrosts horrific scream. He'd give up his ears to never hear such a sound from her mouth ever again. It wasnt until the leader of the attack dove for the pale fur along Icestars chest, staining it with thick red liquid that a tear freed itself from his eyes. He whirled on the nearest Dark Forest, "Make her stop!" He cried, to which the dead feline only smirked and laughed at him. Dustycloud felt utterly powerless, scared of leaving the vulnerable group of queens, kits and elders but terrified of losing a single cat down there. He was caught between innocent lives and there was no ethical or moral choice to behold. He casted a watery gaze to his clanmates cornered in the den, seeing Nectarglade just a few tail lengths away from the bottom of the High ledge. He managed to shove his hindlegs beneath him and stumble down the slope, sitting down the moment he was able. Brown paws trembled as they became stained a dark red and black color, pushing against the wound that seemed to be the worst in an effort to stop the bleeding. "I-Its okay. Its gonna- Its gonna be okay. Youll be fine." His voice trembled, careful not have salty tears drip into the she-cats open wounds. "K-Keep your eyes open if you can. Just stay with me, okay- please st-stay with me." He whimpered, having seen far too much death that day already. He looked from Nectarglade, to the top of the High Ledge, to Silentwings consistent beating against Icestars body. Dustycloud knew he would never get these nightmares to leave him. @Fawn (edited)
