Springy 🦤 22-Nov-21 10:18 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfhowl & Astermoon • Another One Lost
- Post Battle - The young medicine cat was occupied healing a cat who had earned a large gash to the back of their head during the battle. Marigolddust was relieved that the warrior hadn't died from the injuries, although they had been injured bad enough to be included in the cats who he was to heal first. None of the first cats that he was healing could move enough to be able to reach his den as a result of how major their injuries were, and because of this, he would bring what the needed of his den to them. His webs were matted with sticky cobwebs in certain places, such as between his toes (it would be a bother to take care of later), but he paid no mind to the mess. These cats were all in grave danger, but, fortunately, this was the last of the bunch. After he finished patching up this clanmate of his, he would be able to move onto an even larger group who had made it to his den. Unfortunately, it seemed he was the only one who would be healing from now on, or at least from now until he was told otherwise. Beanspark had disappeared, and Marigolddust was worried sick. The tortoiseshell was nowhere to be seen, and Marigolddust could only hope that Beanspark had made it out of the battle, instead of joining the casualties. If his lack of experience led to the young Skyclan medic's, he may as well have started a whole new war, and Thunderclan had had enough of those by now. Not go mention that he, personally, would be unable to work or concentrate through the guilty grief. But, so far, the other medicine cat's body hadn't been found, but there were much more to be identified.
- When Marigolddust had placed the last of the cobwebs on the back of the injured cat's head, he was distracted by his own name being spoken, instead of those of the deathly injured Thunderclanners. Straightening, Marigolddust glanced around for who had spoken his name until his eyes landed on Wolfprowl. Resentment and relief both sprung through his mind when he took notice of Wolfprowl's lack of deadly injuries, although these were both overrun by bewilderment as he realized how morbid his brother's expression was. Realizing Wolfprowl's grief stricken expression, Marigolddust looked down at the cat at his brother's paws. There, in front of him and next to his brother, was his sister, Lilachaze. A confused shock ran through him, causing his eyes to widen and his jaw to tighten. The emotions in his chest were confused, mixed and switched continually as his heart tried to come up wit the proper lost of emotions he should have been feeling. Marigolddust had never had much luck with his siblings, and hardly even knew them, besides perhaps Daisyglow and Wolfprowl. Even since his trip outside of camp with Wolfprowl when they both were kits, he had been hesitant around his siblings. His youngest sister's death and mother's neglect only burnt the bridges further. By the time he had become an apprentice, he had prefered his makeshift family of him, Fernpaw, Rooksnap, and others much more than his true family. Friendship had always been a stronger bond in his life than blood, especially recently, and as a result he felt complicated, looking down at his sister's lifeless body. Lilachaze had done nothing to him, had given him no reason to be out of his life. But it had been Marigolddust's own discomfort towards his family that put him in the place he was now.
- Guilt traveled through his veins instead of blood, making his heart beat as fast as if it were adrenaline. Shakily, he took a step forward, checking one final time to make sure the black tabby had no pulse. There was nothing. "W-w-what happened?" He asked, tripping over his own words as he stood there on shock. He never took his eyes off of Lilachaze's lifeless lavender ones as he spoke. @Shade @fuzz
Shade 23-Nov-21 02:18 AM
What happened? It was a stupid question, but he wasn’t about to tell him that. Instead Wolfprowl returned his gaze to Lilachaze, standing beside her and Marigolddust like a statue. Instead of responding he gently put his paw to her eyes and closed them. It was true, the family had never been close. He had made sure of that. Maybe blood, bloodshed, was what it would take to bring Bluebellmist’s remaining kits together again. @Springy 🦤 @fuzz
fuzz 23-Nov-21 06:10 AM
astermoon 🌙
The lump that has made its home in his throat was not so easily dislodged; the tears, silent fallers and free flowing, have made dark lines down Astermoon's cheeks before he's even reached Lilachaze's side.
>
He says nothing to his brothers, a quiet approach more than sufficient for the somber reunion.
>
"She deserved more," he finds himself rasping, smoothing out her disheveled fur with gentle paw. "She deserved so much more than what we gave her." The words are painful to speak, both through his tight throat and the healing scars now reopened with the loss of their sister.

prim 23-Nov-21 12:03 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Bearmask | present
The wounds from the battle that ravaged their camp were still fresh, and the loss felt by the entire clan was palpable in the air. Laurelblaze too, felt immense and heavy grief, but she had a rather thorough talking-to by their medicine cat that made her feel only a small fraction better— but it was something. Knowing she had a friend standing by her side and ready to support her leadership, even if their ancestors said otherwise, was comforting. She didn’t know what the future of ThunderClan would be, but she knew she could guide them to a brighter one. She was tired of them suffering at the claws of villains hellbent on bringing them harm, and to be seen as easy targets by the others. She knew for certain she’d be ensuring their warriors were formidable and strong, ones not to be taken so lightly if they ever found themselves in battle. They will scorch the earth beneath their paws if they have to, we will not be living in fear ever again. First things first, however, they needed to heal, in more ways than one. The wounds of the body could not compare to the wounds upon the very soul of the clan, and after moons of fighting and waiting for their enemies to show themselves, she felt relief. Even in the face of so much loss, their enemies were vanquished, they had a better future to look forward to. One I wish I could have shared with Hollyfrost… She closed her eyes for a moment, her teeth clenching within her jaw. Of course she wouldn’t let go of her grief over her mate’s loss so easily, Hollyfrost meant the world to her. She would have done anything for her and the family they had together. Her loss was devastating, and still so fresh in her mind. She wouldn’t want this to get in the way of my duties, she’d have told me to get out there and make the world a better place by now. She always was good at pep talks. the memories of her mate encouraging her, of them encouraging one another, felt warm and fuzzy still— happier memories she’d keep with her until the end of time. Hollyfrost wouldn’t want her to feel so depressed, she’d want her to bask in the joy of the future she was going to create as leader of ThunderClan… In a way, maybe she was still watching over her and guiding her along. I’ll make her proud, I owe it to her. @Wolf
Ice 23-Nov-21 12:57 PM
{ ~ Iceheart ~ }
She may not remember her whole life but Icestar’s intelligence remained intact. They were talking about her. Devastation was clear on their faces and she couldn’t quite tell whether it was because of her or the scent of blood that choked at their lungs. Cries of grief and pain rang in the background. Something terrible had happened here and her chest flipped uncomfortably at the very knowledge that she couldn’t remember doing anything against it. A bond was tied to this group of cats somehow and she felt a fierce loyalty for them. Is it because of my memory loss they were talking about? They wouldn’t be this concerned over her if she was the one that wreaked havoc upon them, would they? @prim @Springy 🦤 @Wolf
Springy 🦤 23-Nov-21 02:00 PM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
There was an ungodly amount of bodies displayed around the camp in lifeless heaps. Crimson blood soaked the grass bellow the medic's feet like red blood on a blank canvas, except the sight was far less beautiful. It was horrifying, looking out in the large spanse of blood, death, and tears that covered the camp, making it seem almost as if all of the red would never wash away again, no matter how much rain battled it. Marigolddust knew that they were going to give each and every one of these bodies a funeral in honor of their lives, besides those who had caused this mess in the first place. They had to; it seemed like the least they could do. Marigolddust couldn't help but feel sour, a moon that he wasn't very used to. The taste of iron was stuck to his tounge, even though the only reason why it would be there was from grooming the injured for warmth or comfort. Either that, or the thickness of the au stance in the air was enough to make him feel as if his throat was covered in it. He felt as if he would never smell the fresh, welcoming air that he had walked out to just days ago again. Everything just seemed so... Destroyed. Even though he was a medicine cat and should have cared for all- which in most any case, he would have anyways- but at that moment, the moment where he looked out at all of the bodies including his sister, Tigerpaw and Hollyfrost, he could think of no good end for the traitors who had started this. He didn't think they should have been exiled like they were going to be. Wasn't this punishable by death? What if they came back and brought this destruction again? We're they the reason that Fernpaw had never made it home, back to him and the rest of the clan?
- Placing a paw firmly on his tail, he brought himself back to focus. These thoughts were all too violent, too unnatural for his brain. So why were they there? Why were they pestering him like this? Slowely, he shook his head to himself, shameful, and made the decent from the highledge. He padded through the bodies, weaving around them uncertainly, as he stared at each with wide-eyed, fearful grief. All of these poor cats had never made it. Could he have saved them? Perhaps he could have prevented these deaths? That was his job, wasn't it? Carefully, as he passed each body, he checked to make sure they really had passed, hoping that he still had the chance of saving some of them. Any of them. Maybe then he wouldn't feel so ashamed of himself. @Jollykit! :)
Jollykit! :) 23-Nov-21 02:08 PM
Rainsplash could hear a pattering of paws a few tails away. She wanted to yowl, to make noise to tell them "Im alive! Help!" But she couldent. She couldent move, blink or even twitch her tail. Help! her mind screamed. She tryed to make herself move. Anything. Anything at all. I dont want to die. I want to have kits and a mate and serve in more battles and hunt for the clan. Her fiery determination pulsed through her. She almost could move the very end of her tail. But she could feel reeds pressed aginst her. Why cant I move? the thought hit her. Am i already dead, just in an dark hole? Has my soul been captured? Or worse, have i been LAMED? but she couldent belive her thoughts. Just barley, she moved her tail tip, hoping it would be enough for anycat to notice. To save her. But as soon as she did, she felt drained. She couldent move at all, and she felt tired and sore, more than she already was. Help.. @Springy 🦤 (edited)

Her heart already weighed heavy inside her chest, and as the tom beside her gently nudged her for them to start leaving the den, she almost wished they had stayed inside. It was inescapable.....the death and destruction....and deep down she knew it was something that could not be helped, but she longed for the kits to not have to go through anymore of this brutality that they should not have to be witnessing at such a young age. A heavy sigh left her, doing her best to steer the kits away from the fallen and try to reunite them with their families....if any had survived. It was depressing to see, and she could only feel her heart sinking deeper as she grieved for those around her. Why did StarClan have to let this happen? Couldn't there have been someway for this to have been avoided? Tears pricked her eyes, and she closed them momentarily to try and keep herself from crying. Now was not the time...there were still others who were injured that needed their help. Her own body was unsteady as she limped along, wanting to help others even though blood was still dripping from her clawed side, while the rest of her injuries had mostly stopped bleeding due to being smaller cuts. But she did not want to stop moving...she didn't want to be able to think about all of this. It was stupid, she knew that, but maybe if she didn't stop moving then she wouldn't have to face the facts. @wild™
Wolf 23-Nov-21 07:45 PM
Bearmask’s ears twitched as he heard footsteps approach. He looked over, watching as his former apprentice, Cypressgaze, came padding towards him. Truth be told, it felt as if it had been moons since the last time they spoke. She was the first actual apprentice he ever took on, and she showed great promise in her time of training. Sure, she could still use some touching up in certain areas, but almost every warrior did. Bearmask hadn’t seen much of Cypressgaze during the battle, too focused on the endless horde of opponents he seemed to face and on finding Silentwing. He was glad to see that she was okay. ”Yeah. It does,” Bearmask nodded, glancing at the fresh-kill pile once more before turning his attention back to Cypressgaze’s injuries. Many warriors and apprentices had been injured during the battle, leaving the Clan relatively low on able-bodied individuals who could carry out the necessary tasks needed for their Clan to thrive. But if Cypressgaze was let out of the medicine cat’s den by Marigolddust already, her wounds must not have been nearly as bad as the others’. ”Tag along if you don’t have anything better to do.” Bearmask headed for the exit, indifferent as to whether his old apprentice would join him or not. It wasn’t as if he intended to look for company, but Cypressgaze was one of the few cats he could tolerate, so he figured he may as well invite her with him. Besides, more mouths brought more prey. @~Swift~
fuzz 24-Nov-21 09:48 AM
astermoon 🌙 || pres
What constituted “too quiet” after a battle? Was it the way a crow’s cry could be heard halfway across the territory? Or that none of the kits were playing in the clearing? Maybe it was that the dark splotches where blood had stained the ground seemed to yawn, sucking all the life out of those fortunate enough to remain breathing? Astermoon can’t place what makes the camp feel so . . . haunted, but he knows the feeling well enough, now.
>
The splotched tom is seated just outside the warrior’s den, white paws darkened by muddy earth churned up by digging a grave for his sister. He can feel dark circles formed beneath red and swollen eyes, not that there is much to do about it. The bodies are still lying in the center of camp, now adorned with wilted herbs and flowers to stave off the familiar scent of death hanging around. He’d grieved, same as his brothers, same as the leader and every other cat familiar with the deceased; now it was time to wait to place the shells of cats once alive into the ground and hope fresh life would come from their sacrifice.
>
He isn’t a typically somber cat. Any day before his loss, he was chipper, full of energy and simple joy. He’s unrecognizable now; a fog settled over a teeming meadow, foreign to those so accustomed to its light and warmth.
@cobra
Springy 🦤 24-Nov-21 12:16 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl & Astermoon • Another One Lost
- Post Battle - Of course it was a stupid question. Marigolddust knew that, but what else was he supposed to say? Hr couldn't come up with anything else, and he feared saying anything else would cause him to sound disrespectful or uninjured by what he was seeing in that moment. It was either speak, or don't say a word, and Marigolddust felt that speaking was the best option, even if it hurt him to make any rhythmic patterns of sounds such as words. He couldn't keep his eyes off of Lilachaze's, even after Wolfprowl had closed them. He hardly even noticed when his only other living brother, and only other sibling in Thunderclan, joined the two. At the sound of Astermoon's voice, Marigolddust's fur pricked and he stiffened, startled. Casting a quick glance over to the marble-furred warrior, Marigolddust joined them both in silence. Perhaps they didn't know what to feel, either. Maybe he didn't have to feel so guilty. But, he did anyways. He couldn't help it- the sister he had never paid much attention to was now laying there in front of his paws, as lifeless as Periwinklekit had been the day her illness became too strong for her. The young medicine cat's star-tipped ears swerved back, blanketing over the back of his skull as he recalled the bitter memory. Why? He silently preyed, sparing a look up to the sky where the stars were now hidden. Why do you keep doing this? Spare them! They did nothing wrong! Nothing... His thoughts slowely became hushed as Astermoon began to speak, and he raised a paw to wipe away forming tears, examining his paw afterwords. Had they been formed by confusion? Shock? Grief? He couldn't even tell.
- Unlike his brothers, Marigolddust stayed away from the body. He didn't want to touch it, not when he could have saved her by doing just that. If he touched her bloodied fur now, it would only remind him that he could have prevented this. It was his job to prevent this. Yet he didn't. He hadn't. And he couldn't help but feel somehow, that this was his fault. The grey tuxedo's muzzle wrinkled as he found himself choking back a sob. Every on of Astermoon's words were correct, and he couldn't stop thinking about how he could have prevented this. Raising a paw, he tried to cover up his mouth to hold back the emotions threatening to run loose. @Shade @fuzz
Springy 🦤 24-Nov-21 12:33 PM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
The medicine cat found himself pausing at every body, checking each and every one for some sort of pulse or breathing. All of them were as lifeless as they looked, and eventually, he ended up relying on his sight, hoping that the process would go faster if he did so. Walking through the bodies carefully, Marigolddust tried not to imagine how each of them died. Unfortunately, it was tricky, seeing all of the different, brutal wounds decorating each corpse. How much had each cat suffered? We're most of the deaths quick? Who had landed all of these killing blows? Had it been the traitors, the cats who had tried to bring the end to their own clan? None of the injuries looked light or forgiving. Clearly, no mercy was given to any of these victims, and blood painted each one red. He could even make out the thick coating of blood on the darkest of fur, made present by so much previous bleeding. And all of the blood was still wet, having been shed not long ago. He had discovered this when he accidentally stepped foot into a puddle of the crimson substance, despite his attempts to dodge it. Marigolddust paused at one body in particular. This one seemed far more recent, and belonged to a she-cat who didn't look old at all. There weren't nearly as many gashes or cuts along the warrioress's flank as some others that he had seen, but she looked just as lifeless. It almost looked as if, had he been here an hour ago, he could have actually saved her. Tears threatened to slip down his cheeks at the idea, and he quickly blinked them away. He couldn't cry, not now. He had to focus on finding survivors, not blurred his vision with the salty substance.
- For a moment, though, he could have sworn the grief was making him see things. Intently, he kept his eyes on the fem's tail, looking for some sign of movement. He could have sworn if had twitched a moment before, and just as he was about to conclude that he had been imagining it, it twitched again. Golden hues widened as Marigolddust made the realization, and he quickly checked the cat's pulse. She had a heart rate, and although it might not have been too steady, it was still present. His heart skipped a beat as he quickly dropped his herbs, rushing to gather the right ones. @Jollykit! :)

It seemed others in camp were doing the same. @Springy 🦤 @fuzz

After being unable to think of anything, however, he simply decided to focus on performing some of his warrior activities. prim 24-Nov-21 11:55 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Bearmask | present
It was rare to see the deputy stewing over thoughts for so long, unless she was debating with herself over battle strategies for future use. Though her talk with Marigolddust had put some things in perspective, not every leader wanted to lead at first, but she had her clanmates' support, whether she saw it or not. Still, part of her felt guilty about succeeding Icestar this way, part of her wished she had some form of confirmation that this was acceptable by her ancestors. But there's only one way for me to find out if it truly is, and that means traveling to the Moonpool. I have to do it soon, I'll have to see Marigolddust when I am ready, but I have to oversee the clan for a little bit so I know they will be fine with me gone for a while. Taking a deep breath, the tortoiseshell's ears flickered when she picked up on the familiar voice of Bearmask approaching her. "I'd rather not be called that until I actually do go to the Moonpool, if I receive my lives I will let you know when it's fine to address me as leader... Right now, it's not the title I wish to be using when I am not sure if I can truly succeed Icestar, this is an odd case to say the least." her leader had given up all of her lives, and one of her souls, and lived, was it truly possible for her to succeed her without StarClan intervening? Nothing like this had ever happened in the history of the clans, at least, from what she knew. This was new territory, and it felt strange to be a part of it, of witnessing such a phenomenon. "And you don't know what I may be thinking up in my mind when I am sitting here in camp, I do make it a habit to make plans for the day rather than fuddle with my paws for hours. I could be thinking of a grand defense plan for all you know." she was always quick to insist she was keeping herself busy. While she was known for being a cat who took action, she did have to spend some time planning instead of rushing head-first into something new. @Wolf
prim 25-Nov-21 12:58 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Alerceclaw | future I
Another day of rebuilding, and she was spearheading some repairs around the warriors’ den. Parts of the camp was worse for wear after the battle, though the dens had surely seen better days. Even if she was now the acting leader of ThunderClan, she still had to get involved in the matters of her clan and get her own paws dirty. She wasn’t going to order her clanmates around and do nothing. She hated being idle, Laurelblaze was always an active type. The tortoiseshell she-cat hummed a bit as she weaved twigs and insulation into the roots of the fallen beech tree the warriors made their den out of… Her old den. Part of her felt nostalgic, though she’d been sleeping up in the Highledge’s den for the past few days. It was a strange change for her, but she had to admit the den was nice, it was certainly roomy. A little too roomy, it felt so empty without the presence of her clanmates around her— especially without Hollyfrost sharing a nest with her. Maybe I should ask the kits if they want to set up a nest in there for a while, maybe it’ll help them. I don’t know. She knew her kits were grieving the loss of their mother, and she felt much more of a loss when she was seeing how her kits were reacting to it. Laurelblaze wanted to ensure they were going to come out of this okay, that they would be able to recover well. Losing a parent so early in life was painful, and she knew it well. The one thing she wished wouldn’t occur to them had happened, just like it happened to her when she was a little older than they were— a fresh warrior. I have to be there for them, just like my father was there for me. They need to know they are never alone in this. But she knew everyone grieved in their own special ways, but she would nonetheless extend her offer to each and every one of them if they needed it. Her den was always open to her family. But now’s not the time to worry about that, I need to make sure this den is repaired so my clanmates have a place to sleep. Even if I’m not sleeping in here, I can still repay this den for all the good nights sleep I had in it. @~Swift~
Wolf 25-Nov-21 01:04 AM
”If you think Icestar would give a damn about you ‘undermining her rule’ right now, then you clearly didn’t know her well enough!” Bearmask retorted, scowling at the deputy. ”Icestar’s smart enough to understand. Don’t underestimate her! She knew how important it was to ensure that the Clan thrived, no matter what. You should too.” No one understood her better than he did. Even when they had differences of opinions, Bearmask always understood Icestar’s reasoning, and, in turn, she always seemed to understand his. Bearmask didn’t think there was any point in sending Icestar—no, Iceheart—to the medicine cat’s den, but he figured he should let Marigolddust do what he could before making any rash protests. ”Come on,” he nudged Iceheart, signaling for her to follow Marigolddust to his den. ”I’ll explain everything once your inside the den.” Afterwards, he figured he should help guard some of the traitors, lest they catch some of his Clanmates begin to slip. Before departing, he gave one last look at the deputy, trying to determine just what would become of the Clan with her newfound leadership. Whether she liked it or not, she was going to call the shots now, and probably for a while. Bearmask knew he should trust Icestar’s decision, but part of him ever remained the cynic. He hadn’t interacted much with the she-cat before, so he couldn’t say if she was a decent cat or not. He just hoped, for ThunderClan’s sake, that she was competent enough to lead them into the fast-approaching future. @prim @Springy 🦤 @Ice
~Swift~ 25-Nov-21 08:18 AM
AlerceClaw @prim
Nature’s first green is gold, Her hardest hue to hold. Her early leaf’s a flower;  But only so an hour. Then leaf subsides to leaf, So Eden sank to grief, So dawn goes down to day Nothing gold can stay.        HollyFrost was a distinctive creature. One who Alerce had only encountered so very few times. And although the little tension between him and the subject's paramour, the raven pigmented cadaver had still proven honor in respect. She made her own opinions all while staying loyal to her mate. True. An easily overlooked virtue. So what of it now? Laurels better half was deceased, and thence remained the unceremonious LaurelStar. It was saddening almost; the multicoloured warrioress had finally received her role at monarch, but the sidelines were short of one important individual. Unfulfilled pride. A piece uncollected, though this piece had gone to ashes, the puzzle will never be whole.     And rightfully so, the standing sachem had busied herself. It did not go unnoticed by the observative emeralds of this virile; watching whom he knew not to be too fond with in the past, but currently a tolerable presence, scurried from the warriors' den to the leaders den. Each and every time he had walked in with a dead thing in maw. Though by the third time, his steps were not retraced back to the territories; they strayed elsewhere.
It was time this oddly patterned tuxedo regarded her state. ”LaurelBlaze,” She needn’t a reminder of the change that had occurred. The change that would normally be good, but with her specifically, came the price of something she adored. ”Care to share this rabbit with me?” Having dropped it between them before he had spoken, Alerce was convinced telling her to take a break or offering help was not the best way to approach her. An offer of  his company. That’s what she needed. Therefore, she would technically be receiving both a break and keeping her pride and ego intact of not being helpless.
prim 25-Nov-21 09:50 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Alerceclaw | future I
She’d been carefully weaving another twig into the den’s walls, and when Alerceclaw had approached, she’d stopped while it was still halfway sticking out. ”Oh, hey Alerceclaw.” she turned to face the large tom a bit, before gesturing to the rather ridiculous-looking stick she was working with. ”Just let me finish up with this real quick? I’ll bother me if I leave it hanging out like that and not finishing the job.” she turned quickly turned back around, continuing to carefully push the twig back into the walls of the den, no longer sticking out where it could easily poke into someone. ”There, you wanted to share a rabbit?” she faced the warrior yet again, staring at the rabbit he’s dropped to the ground. ”I need to get a bite honestly, I still haven’t eaten today, but I wanted to get some work done before I did. Thanks.” she accepted the offer graciously, dipping her skull to her clanmate out of thanks. Better off going somewhere else in camp, however, blocking the entrance to the warrior’s den would be discourteous to the ones needing to go in or out. ”Hmm, mind heading over to that little patch of sun there? It’ll be warmer than eating in the shade.” the cold weather was ever present now, she could see the grass in the forest frosting up in the morning— yet no snowfall. It would be upon them soon, and she had to make sure the camp was ship-shape for the season. They now had to reinforce the dens for leaf-bare, and had to double their efforts in catching prey for their stores. With the cold weather, it’ll stay fresher for a little while longer, but we can’t be stuck eating stale prey every day. the deputy stared at their fresh-kill pile, which was much smaller than it was when the landslide began— having occurred just before the start of leaf-fall. She had to make sure she kept the clan fed, but I have to schedule more patrols, more of everything, so many duties at once. UGH! I can’t keep putting off the Moonpool, I have to go there. I have to make sure everything is ready before I do, damn it… @~Swift~

cobra 26-Nov-21 12:09 AM
Each day since the loss of his mother, yellow brandished the sky and illuminated the forest. At the end of his day, bold oranges melted into cool blues, and the moon rose. Around him the world continued to turn. It refused to stop so he could grieve, for he was not special. Foxpaw struggled accepting this hard truth. He, too, bore muddy paws. Hollyfrost’s mate and children carved out her final resting place together. He never wanted to experience it again - the moment reality struck him when the cold dirt met his claws. This was happening, Hollyfrost was dead. Nothing could restore the light in her lifeless eyes, or reanimate her stiff limbs. This was her finale. Foxpaw shared Astermoon’s grim expression. Grief brewed an unfamiliar, intense storm within him. Feelings he never knew he could feel struck him. No young cat should be imaging the rage induced scenes he was. @fuzz (edited)
prim 26-Nov-21 12:01 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Judge, Jury, and Executioner | Meeting | present
For the first time ever, the ThunderClan deputy would not be addressing herself as the second-in-command of her clan— but as the leader. The first of many clan meetings she’d call upon the Highledge in her time as leader. This was strange, but a momentous occasion. Yet she felt deeply disturbed by the context in which she was calling this meeting together. Today, it marked the day she would be casting out the traitors to her beloved clan— ones who had shed the blood of their clanmates, taken their lives. Part of her wished she’d just end their lives already for all the ones they had lost, but that wasn’t how things were meant to work. Public execution wasn’t the way, not for the clans, and as much as she hated them, and how they were so easily swayed to betray their clanmates, she knew she couldn’t do that. That was not the kind of leader she was going to be, she wasn’t going to wield her power to harm others without reason. They are leaving the clan without any allies, and no hope of return. That will be a fitting punishment enough. Still, that didn’t sate her boiling rage at the thought of them leaving without any further repercussions. Laurelblaze emerged from the den attached to the Highledge itself, taking a few steps out onto the rocky outcropping and staring down at the clearing below. She took a deep breath, before she finally called out to her clanmates, it was time to begin. ”Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey gather beneath the Highledge for a clan meeting!” her deep voice rang out across the quarry as a signal for all her clanmates to congregate below, her gaze burning before she continued. ”And bring every prisoner forward!” she cast her gaze towards the warriors she could see in camp currently, before she looked to the makeshift gathering place where they held their prisoners, for it was time for their judgement. I’m sick and tired of seeing them in my camp. @ThunderClan @Shade @Stark✨ @wild™ (edited)
{Finchbriar}
She was humiliated, and utterly lost at the fact that they had failed. Silentwing and Frozenmink were dead, Deerbounce had abandoned them, what went wrong? They had done everything right, struck when the clan was weakest! The next time I see Deerbounce, I’ll kill her, she left us there! She deserted us when we needed her most! Being ushered into the clearing with warriors surrounding her, the tan tabby glared up at the Highledge with fire in her gaze, her fur bristling as she refused to appear beaten in front of these fools. Her head was held high, she wouldn’t accept defeat with shame, no matter how much hatred was being spewed her way. Mark my words, they’ll see what they are missing, I will rise again. This is just another step, perhaps it is time I should cut this clan away, for now. Finchbriar sat there in silence, but her resolve was not ripped away from her. She was always the type to never give in to her enemies, even when she was beaten. I’ll be back, and they’ll never take me alive. I will destroy them all.
Stark✨ 26-Nov-21 12:12 PM
Wolfshine| The exile
The pale she cat knew that Laurelblaze would be exerting some sort of punishment on them. Regardless of the sins she committed, Wolfshine hoped that it wouldn’t be too severe. Carrying tiny lives inside her was no easy task. Whatever stressful event she was about to go through, she could do it with her head held high. Seeing the angry glare of the leader made her skin crawl. Laurelblaze has to know that she is still a good cat at heart, right? Her clanmates would hate her, but there would come a time where they would understand why she did what she did. Bringing new lives into the world was always a great gift, no matter what clan they would grow up in. Seeing Finchbriar’s scowl, Wolfshine wondered if she still hated Thunderclan so much. The senior warrior had decided to make amends with the whole situation, she had no issue serving her clan in the past. But in order to have a family, she had to listen to Silentwing. Any cat who wanted to be a mother would know that it was painful seeing other she-cats having kits. The queens were young, and happy. Even though she was a seasoned warrior, she needed that too. Whatever happened, Wolfshine braced herself for some bad news. Whether it be she has her warrior status revoked, or she stayed prisoner forever. @Shade @wild™ @prim (edited)

But now, Finchbriar had no control — And all of the fear had washed over like a huge tsunami. wild™ 26-Nov-21 12:36 PM
───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Defeat. A word and emotion she was familiar with, but not to this extent. She'd done everything Silentwing and Deerbounce had asked of her, working alongside her comrades in destroying Thunderclan's chances of survival. Their downfall was supposed to be inevitable. And yet, the tables had turned and she, alongside her companions had been the ones to fall before them. Some had died...even Silentwing had been. It was an unfathomable thought to say the least, but she'd seen it with her own two eyes. Something must've gone wrong at some point...something had to have gone wrong. This is nothing but a disgrace...failure was not among our destined path. Among my destined path. And yet, she'd been defeated. Nonetheless, she hadn't been taken down easily. Her claws bore the blood of various felines, including her late daughter's. Had it not been for that despicable tom, she'd taken another life too, that horrid apprentice's. Maybe she had. She had no idea on the status of the young molly, but such didn't concern her at the moment. What concerned her was her future. What was supposed to happen now? She'd sought after a greater purpose, a greater destiny. The lowly life of a warrior was unsatisfying, leaving her with a burning desire to seek something more. She'd been promised this. And now, with the death of Silentwing she'd never receive it. She'd be without anything. But even with this in mind, even with the cry of Laurelblaze calling forth her clan and those deemed traitors - which she was among - Hollowgrove did not fail to seem unashamed. With her head raised, she strode toward her comrades with a confident stride, her gaze burning with the same nature. Violet eyes glared at those who gathered nearby, the hint of a sneer begging to make an appearance. They can say and do whatever they please to me, I will not apologize for anything. What is done is done, no guilt rests among me.
And...there wasn't. Had they been working alongside her, they'd understand. But they were merely blind to these things. Blind to see what they'd done to Silentwing and her forces truly meant absolutely nothing. They've profen nothing. They've lost more than they've gained. This still marks their downfall, regardless of what they might think. And beside...even if she was exiled or even murdered on the spot, this wouldn't be the last they'd see of her. She still might be receiving her purpose after all. @Stark✨ @Shade @prim

Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 26-Nov-21 12:57 PM
Wounds bound the warrior to a nest that had his muscles stiff and his nose stuffy. There were so many smells from blood and herbs alike, so many sounds from cats crying to those gasping in relief when prognosis' were revealed for their clanmates, the herbs suffocated his fur and his wounds made it painful to move. One good swing of his head and the deep lines on either side of his neck would reopen. One awkward twist of his spine and it would spell the same damage for those wounds along his flank. Moving was simply out of the equation for him. He had spent days in and out of consciousness, only ever awake long enough to take a few bites of food before the exhaustion pulled him under again. Little details of the aftermath had been told to him, for Marigolddust was rather particular that his main goal was to recover, not fuel the nightmares that his overactive imagination was already a master at crafting. As he blinked open his eyes, responsive to the familiar call of a particular she-cat, he found his unfocused eyes settling on a patched tabby instead from within the medicine cat den. It took a long few moments before he could comprehend Tigerpaws presence and even longer before he could call out to her. Dustycloud closed his eyes, focusing on his own rise and fall of his chest before attempting to speak. "W...Whats... going on?" He asked, voice hoarse as he opened his eyes once more as though watching and talking was just too much at the moment. @goose (edited)
prim 26-Nov-21 12:57 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Judge, Jury, and Executioner | Meeting | present
Another strange feeling came over her, she wasn’t used to being up this high near a cliff’s edge. She’d climbed the steps before countless times to go into the den to give reports, but never had she stood so close to the edge of the Highledge. For a moment, she thought she was going to fall over the edge, it was jarring being up here rather than down below. As her clanmates gathered in the clearing below, Laurelblaze was watching the soon-to-be exiled traitors being grouped together, and she observed the various expressions and reactions of the various cats she could see from this height. Mixtures of malice and disappointment, the exchange of whispers into each other’s ears, even dismay. These cats had helped cause chaos within these walls, and brought harm to their clanmates, resulting in the deaths of three honorable warriors. No matter how they begged, or how they pleaded, she would not be swayed from her decision. They broke one of the most important virtues they upheld in ThunderClan— loyalty to the clan. Yet just beforehand, she had to make the announcement that would give her the proper authority to banish them. To remind them that she would be there to protect her clanmates from them if they dared to show their faces again. On a lighter note, it was also to elucidate the clan on their future, of her leadership. ”I gathered everyone here today to give you all an important update on the state of leadership within the clan. As I’m sure you all are aware that Icestar has lost her memories, no longer answering to the name bestowed upon her when she became leader, but her warrior name instead… She has still not recovered her memories, and much as I do not wish to say it… Leaves me to succeed her.” She took a deep breath, she had essentially stated Icestar was no longer fit to lead, and she hated it. ”I will go to the Moonpool in the near future to receive my nine lives from StarClan, and as for a deputy, I do not have anyone picked yet, but I will be looking out to select my successor. Right now, that is not the issue at hand.” Her gaze was directly cast in the vicinity of the traitors, staring each of them down with anger and betrayal in her gaze. These cats were once her clanmates, cats she once shared fresh-kill with. Cats she trusted, two of which mentored her own kits. It was time for her to give them their sentencing, her first true act as leader. ”Finchbriar, Hollowgrove, Needlestripe, and Wolfshine. Your actions during the battle were heinous and directly broke the very first rule established by the Warrior Code— Your loyalty must remain to your clan. Instead, you colluded with cats from the Dark Forest, and have been found guilty of treason to ThunderClan, and are responsible, directly or not, for the deaths of four honorable warriors of ThunderClan.” Her gaze narrowed, and she bore her fangs down at them, her fur bristling as she shared in the collective anger her clanmates were experiencing by their very presence in camp. ”I hereby exile every single one of you from ThunderClan, you will no longer be recognized as any of our warriors, nor seen as clanmates. I order every and all warriors of ThunderClan, if you see any of these traitors encroaching upon our lands, you will attack them on sight, and I permit the use of deadly force if necessary. We will not show mercy to the ones who have betrayed our clan.” @Shade @wild™ @Stark✨ (edited)

She quickly sprinted up to the front of the group, and took one last look at Needlestripe. She had hoped to tell him at a better time, but now she had no choice. ” Wait! No please don’t exile me! {Finchbriar}

───────── 𝐇𝐎𝐋𝐋𝐎𝐖𝐆𝐑𝐎𝐕𝐄 !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN

There was no need to waste anymore time merely idling about...it was time to get out of this wretched place. And so, with a flash of a grin toward the two newfound parents, Hollowgrove trotted away in the direction Finchbriar had. Onward to a greater purpose.

prim 26-Nov-21 01:29 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Judge, Jury, and Executioner | Meeting | present
As her clan reeled from the announcement she was making, the looks of fear upon the traitors faces was telling. They hadn’t expected this, but it was the only punishment befitting of a traitor— besides death, of course. Laurelblaze’s expression returned to that of a steely, cold one, unmoved by their looks of desperation and terror. Wolfshine’s cries had caught her attention, and she signaled for her clanmates to quiet down with a swish of her tail and a quick bark of ”Silence!” She glared down at the pregnant queen, addressing her personally. ”Given your condition, I will permit you to stay within the clan’s walls until your kits are born, but your punishment still stands, that’s it. Upon their birth, you will give up your rights as their mother, for they are innocent of your crimes. I will not allow innocent kits of ThunderClan to have their minds poisoned by the words of a traitor.” It was a cruel punishment, but it reinforced her position on the matter. Traitors were not to be tolerated within her clan, and if she had to stoop to that level to ensure no one else had the bright idea of turning against their clan, against the code, she would. Laurelblaze had a clan to protect, including those who were innocent of the crimes their parents committed. ”As far as I am concerned, you gave up your rights as their mother the moment you decided to betray your clan. How could I, in a good conscience, leave kits to be raised by a cat willing to betray her own clan?” She’d ensure those kits were protected, they were to be treated like her clanmates, no matter who their parents were. They had no influence over their actions, and they deserved her mercy. Laurelblaze refused to let their reputations be defined by their kin, she was done with that, and wouldn’t tolerate such behavior within the clan. I will not allow such treatment to occur as leader, no one is born evil or wicked. ”Everyone else who is set to be exiled is to leave now, or I will order the warriors to rip you to shreds right here and now.” This was setting an example, she was done giving second chances to cats who did not deserve her mercy. @wild™ @Shade @Stark✨ (edited)

He couldn't recognise his own voice when it was full of rage. How dare Needlestripe stand and accuse them of tearing a family apart? His scumbag leader murdered his mother. Ironic.
goose 26-Nov-21 01:50 PM
| Tigerpaw | @Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" "No." Had it been the heat of the moment and Finchbriars betreyal that angered the flaming-tabby apprentice to a full extent, in response for her voice of tone to sound so harsh and straightforward - yet thrilling a sadenned somber at the same time when replying to her brothers question full of concern. She darted her head away from his gaze, claws stretching out and scraping against the smooth grounds of the medicine den — Her singular ear falling against her cranium as she shook her head, dissapointment and resentfulness drowned the mollies guts. "Everything I did for Finchbriar was to make her love and appreciate me for once, but now she turns on us and works with the dark forest to tear us off one by one?!" The tip of her striped tail lashed, refusing to turn back and meet Dustyclouds multicolored gaze. "I guess Thunderclan was never enough for her." She huffed. "I guess I was never enough for her."
prim 26-Nov-21 02:18 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Judge, Jury, and Executioner | Meeting | present
Justice had been served, and she watched as Needlestripe was forced to flee from their camp as Wolfshine was taken back to her imprisonment, this was a grim reminder of how much treason can shake a clan. She never wanted to take this course of action, but they had forced her hand. Perhaps it would have been better if Wolfshine kept her mouth shut about her kits, but she felt better knowing they would be safe within the walls of the clan. She’ll ensure they receive love and attention from a family who does deserve them. For these cats had already torn her own family apart by bringing their Dark Forest leaders here, this was an eye for an eye. She watched as her clanmates finally settled back down after the excitement, her form relaxing as she observed them all with a gentle smile. ”I should have mentioned this earlier, but I wanted to tell you all how proud I am to be serving you as leader of ThunderClan. It is because of your hard work and dedication to our clan that we have survived the battle, and will continue to survive no matter what obstacles are thrown in our path.” these were the cats she could trust, loyal, precious members of her clan. They had fought, tooth and nail, to protect each other, to defend their better future. She couldn’t express the amount of gratitude that was coming from deep within her soul at that very moment for them. ”You all have proven that you are capable, phenomenal warriors. If our comrades who we lost are watching over us currently, I’m sure they’re looking down upon each and every one of you with utter pride. You all deserve to hear this.” She let out a small sigh as she felt her wounded heart ache for the presence of not only her beloved mate, but for each of the cats she would not be seeing again, not until she herself joined the ranks of StarClan. Tigerspring hurt especially for her, she was just a new warrior, her own apprentice, lost in her first battle as a warrior, when she had so much potential ahead of her. It was unfair, but she was still proud of everything she had achieved, her sacrifice ensured they lived another day, and she would carry on her legacy with all her apprentices from now on. ”I want to memorialize the ones we lost in this meeting, giving them the respect they deserve for the ultimate sacrifices they had made in defense of their clan. They upheld the Warrior Code until their final breath, and deserve to be recognized for their actions. They are all heroes, and we will honor their memory with every action we take as a clan. Hollyfrost, Tigerspring, Gracklequiver, and Lilachaze, they will each be remembered with pride.” ”That will be all, ThunderClan.”

Wolfprowl lowered his head at the mention of their lost clan mates. He might not have been close to his sister, but it still was an unwelcome truth that they had lost her.
Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 26-Nov-21 06:30 PM
Dustycloud had yet to move aside from the features across his face, for the fear of reopening his wounds was too great. He'd knocked at deaths door once and he wasnt too keen on winding up on those steps again on such short notice. His ears flicked backwards for a brief moment at her answer. Ofcourse she's not. That was a stupid question to ask! Her mother was killed and her mentor is being exiled and deemed a traitor! She's been to war at the age of- what? 9 moons? 10? Great Starclan he didnt even remember how old she was. If he had had anymore tears to shed he would have just then, as the painful realization began to settle in. A stranger to his own siblings, the young cats who now needed an older brother yet he felt just as woefully unprepared and unqualified as the day they were brought to camp. He didnt answer, even as she continued on to fill the silence. He blinked harshly as her tail lashed. There were another long few moments, watching her glare at any spot that didnt hold him in it. "Im sorry." He mumbled, his hears having dropped already. "Im sorry. And y-you shouldnt think like that." He meowed, brows pinched and up turned slightly. Springy 🦤 28-Nov-21 11:55 AM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
Marigolddust wasn't quite sure what was wrong with Rainsplash. Of course there was something- otherwise she wouldn't be all bloodied and passed out. Although, was she really passed out? Was she already asleep, or did he still have a chance of keeping her awake? What would he have to do? As he tried to recall all he could about keeping a patient awake, he quickly went through the small bunch of herbs he had gathered. By now he was fairly aware of each, being able to tell their name after a moment of thought, although the uses of the newer herbs could still be lost on him at times, especially times such as now. From what he could recall, he didn't remember any of them being useful for keeping a patient awake and aware of their surroundings. The only herbs he knew were ones that were meant to help with sleeping, and that was the last thing he needed. It took him longer than he would have liked to figure out the best course of action, but once he had picked up a wet moss all to begin on the bleeding wounds, it came to him. The water held in the small, spindly leaves was fairly cold, affected by the changing temperatures of the world outside of his den. Suddenly, an idea came to him. He was never able to sleep when it was chilly (which would likely pose a problem, considering the fact that Leaf-bare was only getting closer), and because of this, perhaps the same would be true for the fem in front of him. Picking up another mpssball, he transfered some of the water from the second to the first, wanting it to last long enough for him to work on the warrioress's wounds. (edited)
- Carefully setting the ball of cold, wet moss onto the side of Rainsplash's head and letting the chilly water keep her mind vivid, he began working on her physical wounds with the rest of his stock. The first wound he worked on was a gash on the back of the she-cat's head, patting it gently with the moss to stop the bleeding. Marigolddust suspected that the wound was what caused her to black out, and it didn't look like something he could just brush off. What would happen if he received that energy? Would he pass out like Rainsplash, or would he be able to make it or not? He tried to guess Rainsplash's situation as he imagined how his own body would react, but whether his guesses were accurate or not, he had no idea. Quickly, he snatched up some marigold petals and began to chew them into a poulice, carefully beginning to spread the paste over his clanmate's wounds, hoping he wasn't already too late. @Jollykit! :)
Jollykit! :) 28-Nov-21 01:19 PM
Rainsplasg could feel cold water drip onto her pelt, soaking into her skin. She shivered every so slightly. Wait! It worked! Her muscles seemed to be slowly relaxing, and mabye the state she was in was passing. But as she became slowly aware of her cold pelt, she also became aware of something else- her wounds. And they hurt. Ow... she groaned internally. Her pelt was already blood covered, and the cold water wasent helping even a bit. At this point I'm going to freeze to death before I can move again. She could almost taste Marigolddusts anxiousness. I wonder why hes so worried.. She thought through the possibilites. I dont think anything too bad happened. she declared. Her bones where aching less now, probably a sign of her soon to come awakening. She could barley feel her tail-tip at this point because it was so cold. Why is it so cold? Warm the water up! @Springy 🦤
Springy 🦤 28-Nov-21 01:41 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl & Astermoon • Another One Lost
- Post Battle - As the sound of Wolfprowl's suggestion met Marigolddust's ear, the medicine cat quickly raised a single moon-dipped paw up to his eyes, wiping away what years had begun to gather. He stepped roughly on his tail, trying to bring himself back to attention so he could focus on getting everything ready for the burials. Unfortunately, the action only made his eyes water harder. Unwilling to let his voice break the weak wall keeping his tears from falling, he nodded instead, turning to gather up the necessary herbs. Of course he knew what they were and where they were- it was his job, now, anyhow, even if he was still just getting started on learning. He had recently become familiar with lavender and vigil, even if both had been only vogue topics in Beanspark's lesson. The Skyclanner was back home now, but Marigolddust was still growing more and more familiar with the two herbs. With so many passed cats and bodies to bury, it shouldn't have come as such a surprise to him. It was a bit painful, learning things like this in such a difficult, hard situation. Marigolddust cast Astermoon a quick glance with a grateful look behind his eyes, the look itself offering his brother a thanks, despite the fact that he wasn't exactly assisting Marigolddust as much as he was paying their lost sister a final favor. Slowely, the young tuxedo followed his brother into his den, and once they had entered the familiar place, Marigolddust began his search for his lavender and vigil. He didn't have much of either, needing to use both for more burials than he had ever expected to experience, let alone so early on in his time with the rank, but he managed to find enough eventually. Gathering up the necessary herbs, he left his den and returned to Wolfprowl's side with the plants, forcing his eyes not to stray on Lilachaze too long. @Shade @fuzz
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 28-Nov-21 01:41 PM
Gave +1 Rep to @Shade
Springy 🦤 28-Nov-21 02:29 PM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
Marigolddust couldn't help but stiffen when Rainsplash's flank vibrated with a shiver, revealing that the water was a bit too cold. For a moment, he almost took the mossball away, not wanting her to be in too much discomfort while he worked on her injuries. Unfortunately, he knew that she was supposed to be uncomfortable. Otherwise, she might drift off to sleep, and of she did, she might never wake up again. Or, at least, wake up to nothing but star-vielded cats. So, although he wanted to take the moss off for awhile, he left it there, hoping to see more movement from the unconscious cat. The tail twitch was a good sign, and the shivering even better. Maybe if he let the cold soak into her fur a little bit longer, she might just wake. If not, then hopefully she would come to reality when the mossball warmed with Rainsplash's natural body temperature. It definitely wouldn't get any colder than it was already, buy if he really had to, he might replace it and therefore replace the chill, whether he wanted to or not.
- Turning his focus away from the mossball and Rainsplash's reaction, Marigolddust finished spreading the marigold petals paste over her wounds. Once he had completed the job, he carefully wiped the poulice off of his paws and onto the grass below. He didn't want to waste it, but he couldn't exactly save it like he wanted to. It would likely just go bad, plus, being unused to things like this, he couldn't help but feel it was a bit disgusting. Just the taste of the petals tasted unnecessarily gross. With a shake of his head, he showered off the thought. Carefully picking up a bundle of spiderwebs, he began to spread the thin strands over Rainsplash's injuries, covering over the marigold poulice along with the injuries themselves, making it so the cobwebs covered the wounds in a net to keep it clean and keep the paste stuck, unable to be brushed off by the nature around the camp. Hesitantly, he stepped back, double checking to make sure he had all of the gashes and cuts patched up. Once he was sure he had, he reluctantly nudged Rainsplash's shoulder, checking one final time to see if she was ready to wake. When she was, he would have to recommend being careful when resting and not leaving camp without a companion, just Incase some damage was done to her head. @Jollykit! :)
Jollykit! :) 28-Nov-21 02:47 PM
What is he doing? Rainsplash was growing irritable. She wanted to know what he was doing. She wanted to recoil from the smelly paste he was plastering on her pelt, but she couldent. Again, she shivered. Its so cold... She could almost feel her nose turning blue, the coldness niping at her nose like a tasty mouse. She could finnaly almost move her limbs, the feeling of tiredness amd stones on her slowly lifting away like a bird to the sky. I wonder how long it will take... she struggled against sleep, and the cold helped her cling to awakeness. Springy 🦤 28-Nov-21 04:12 PM
Marigolddust • Rainspark • Finding the Injured
Movement. More an more movement followed one after another; first the nose, then her ears, and finally her paws. Excitement jumped up in the young tom's chest as he watched, overjoyed that he might have actually been able to save the cat, despite the fact that she had seemed as if she might have already been lost. Perhaps if he could succeed in this, he would have more of a chance with everyone else. Maybe then he would be more experienced, more deserving of the title as the clan's medicine cat. Then, perhaps, he might be a little bit of a better healer, a more reliable medic to all of his clanmates. Quickly, Marigolddust edged a bit closer to his clanmate, offering her shoulder another soft nudge before pausing a moment, trying to decide the best course of action. He could try and groom her fur the opposite way, giving her warmth that might made it easier to move. No, it would just make it more difficult for her to stay awake. Maybe he should try to communicate with her, to see if she could open her eyes or speak at all. Or should he wait? Should he try and be more patient and see if she would come back on her own? But what if she couldn't? Subconsciously, he made the decision.
- "H..hello? Can you hear me? Can you open your eyes?" He asked, hesitant and uncertain as he spoke the questions. He would take a perk of her ears as an answer to the first question, or the action of opening or keeping her eyes closed as an answer to the second. He didn't exactly expect her to be able to speak, not if she had received brain damage from whatever had caused the gash in the back of her head, but he had hopes that she might be able to register his words. He couldn't tell of she was too groggy and had been in a deep sleep, or whether she had just been paralyzed. No, not paralyzed... She couldn't have been moving as much as she was if she had lost her control of her nerves. He didn't want to make a move out of impatience and effect the she-cat negatively, and so he sat back and waited, trying to see if he could get a response of any sort. Anything would work, and any increased movement would be a relief, even if it was something aggressive. @Jollykit! :)
Jollykit! :) 28-Nov-21 04:50 PM
The voice of her clans medicine cat echoed through her head. It seemed to swirl around and inject itself into her brain. It felt like an electric shock, and she felt.. Alive. She slowly opened her eyes, the sun burning her eyes. "M-marigolddust?" She said slowly. She couldent seem to speak any faster, even though her brain was racing. Also, her voice was terribly quiet. Did it damage my vocal cords? She began to panic, and her face grew pale. But the sight of her clanmate helped soothe her. But she had a terrible headache, and it hurt almost as bad as when she had hit her head on that terrible rock. "Is... it ober?" She fumbled around the words, her ears ringing and her head throbbing made it hard to think and speak. She still felt like stones were piled onto her pelt, and she decided to stay still instead of moving. (edited)

prim 02-Dec-21 02:06 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Dawn of a New Era | Marigolddust | present
It was time. She no longer could wait anymore, it was time for her to begin her journey to the Moonpool. Laurelblaze could feel herself growing more tense the longer she stood out in camp, trying to muster the courage to even step close to the pool. She’d never been to it before, only knowing the general area of where it was. She didn’t have a reason to go there, not until now. Breathe, it’s gonna be okay. She never felt so nervous in her life. This was monumental, one of the most sacred ceremonies of the clans, where so few ever experienced it. Laurelblaze would be receiving her nine lives, this would be the last time her clanmates would ever be calling her by her warrior name. And I’m gonna have to get used to introducing myself again… Damn. she took another deep breath as she stared up at the slowly darkening skies. Soon Silverpelt would be exposed to all who could witness its glory, and she’d be convening with the stars amongst its band. Who will I meet? Who will want to see me? I can’t overthink this, I have to be brave. I have to lead my clan now, its up to me. She stood in camp, awaiting her friend to accompany her, the new leader was thankful she wasn’t going to be alone for this. Marigolddust was going to stand beside her through it all, and she had nothing to worry about. I’m gonna do this, now or never. @Springy 🦤 (I’m just typing this starter so you can reply at any time <3)

Springy 🦤 02-Dec-21 04:49 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Dawn of a New Era
• Present • For some reason, Marigolddust never thought the day would come where Laurelblaze became Laurelblaze, let alone him accompanying her there. Although she seemed the most worthy cat Marigolddust could think of for the position, the idea made him feel nauseated, and it wasn't from the clan's sickness. The young medicine cat wasn't very welcoming to change, and it always made him feel more fearful than he was usually. Now was such a situation, even after all of the change he had had to go through in the past moon. But, for once, he wasn't so scared that this change would end in disaster. No cat was dying because Laurelblaze was becoming the leader- Icestar- Iceheart, was very much still alive, even if she didn't have her memories anymore. Now, Marigolddust was finishing up in his den, checking up on the last of his patients before he left the vine-veiled enterance, ready to start his search for the soon-to-be leader. He didn't have to search long as his eyes landed on the hulking tortoiseshell form. As he approached his friend, he offered her a soft smile. He could tell she was a little nervous, more nervous than he was at the idea of being in the presence of Starclan again. "Hey, Laurelblaze. Are you ready?" He asked, his voice hushed out of reflex. He didn't want to wake too many cats, anyhow- not that he would have speaking normally. But, perhaps he wanted to speak quietly so that it was easier for Laurelblaze to relax. If he were to be completely honest, he couldn't help but hear his words as a reflection of those that Icestar had said to him before she had taken him to the Moonpool for the first time. Now he was going there again, except he was the escort.
- It was an odd idea, and one he wasn't completely sure he was comfortable with. It was far from his normal, to say the least, but his 'normal' had become quite skewed recently. Hopefully he would be better at this than he expected he would be, at least good enough to keep himself from ruining everything for Laurelblaze. All he had to do was watch, right? Make sure everything was going well? That seemed easy enough, didn't it? Perhaps he would be alright if he wasn't the focus this time. Comforting was much easier than needing comfort, anyhow. @prim
prim 02-Dec-21 05:07 PM
{Laurelblaze} | Dawn of a New Era | Marigolddust | present
Laurelblaze had been putting on a brave face, but she couldn't help but to crack when Marigolddust asked her if she was ready. Letting out a groan, she reluctantly nodded, murmuring: "I don't think I'll ever be but I don't exactly have a choice in the matter. Let's get going and get it over with." she shook her head as she peered back up at him, having nearly thrown her head to the ground when she let out that dramatic exhale. She was being a big baby about it, or at least she suspected that would be what Hollyfrost would be saying to her right about now, probably looking down at her and laughing at how silly she was acting. This was supposed to be a joyous occasion for their clan. The ascension of a new leader to the Highledge was upon them. Taking a deep breath, the tortoiseshell stood up tall, looking to the camp entrance with a fiery gaze. "Alright, alright, no more fooling around. We have to go now." she swatted herself with her tail for a moment, forcing herself to take the necessary steps towards the tunnel leading out of camp. Luckily for her sake, in the repairs to camp they had made adjustments to the size of the tunnel. She no longer had to crawl through it, now she could walk in and out as she pleased without getting her fur tangled anymore. A necessary change... Thank StarClan for that landslide so I now have it. Wait, what am I saying? She shook her head as she stepped out into the clearing leading to the rest of the forest. They'd be walking together for some time through ThunderClan's territory to reach the Moonpool, but her paws felt like weights every time she took a single step. Oh StarClan, just send some lightning my way and I'll pick up the pace. I might need the coaxing. @Springy 🦤

fuzz 02-Dec-21 08:01 PM
astermoon
Numbness was a disease, one just as deadly as bleeding out or falling from a deadly height. Astermoon feels it creeping through his pelt, a silent frost that’s going to turn his heart to ice the longer he dwells on its absence within.
>
The white tom clears his throat and pulls himself to his paws, shaking his fur out. Lilac wouldn’t want them moping about, anyway.
>
Astermoon, unaware of the eyes frozen to him, disappears inside the warriors den and re-emerges with a bundle of moss smelling particularly like Lilachaze.
>
“Do you want to get your mom’s, or do you want me to?” He stops beside Foxpaw on his way out of camp, eyes looking more seasoned than he truly was.
@cobra
fuzz 02-Dec-21 08:15 PM
astermoon || past
Wolfprowl and Mari were far more methodical than the cow-spotted cat could ever hope to be. He’s not got the stomach for such close proximity to blood - in fact, he’s fighting down bile watching them clean off their sister’s corpse as they prepare her for the vigil.
>
A hefty sigh escapes between pursed lips; no more tears remain inside to cry. He can feel the burning of dry lids with each blink, finally registering the other cats beginning to line the hollow with their loved ones. His heart aches for the loss of life so tremendously in their beloved Clan, but none more so than his sister. He sighs again. It’s all he can do, it seems.
>
“How’s Icestar?” he rasps, smoothing a clump of fur on Lilac’s cheek.
@Springy 🦤 // @Shade
Springy 🦤 02-Dec-21 09:17 PM
Marigolddust • Laurelblaze • Dawn of a New Era
- Present - Marigolddust's lemony gaze hazed over with empathy at Laurelblaze's resentment to the idea of going to the Moonpool to take her place as the leader. He understood exactly how she felt, and couldn't help but relate the current situation with his own. Needing to replace one of your closest friends and take on a position with more responsibility than you've ever had before was stressful, not to mention full of grief. They were both new at this, and didn't want to be where they were if it meant the cats before them could stay able enough to have the position. "It's... It's not easy, I know. But I promise, it's not gonna be too bad, especially when you have a whole clan that's backing you up." He said softly, brushing against her shoulder gently as he moved so that he was standing a pawstep ahead of the tortoiseshell, trying to provide her with companionship while hinting that he was prepared to leave whenever she wished to. He wasn't the opposite of used to seeing Laurelblaze in a mood such as this one, although it had begun to feel a bit more familiar the longer that he was the medicine cat. As an apprentice, he used to think she was an unbeatable hero, perfect and wise. Now, he was less oblivious, and he realized and understood that she was only a cat, just like him and everyone else. She had emotions, and she had struggles. Perhaps that made her an even stronger champion in his eyes. Soon enough, Laurelblaze had gotten a hold of herself, and Marigolddust found himself trailing along besides the fem as they made their way out of the camp enterance. As the two slipped out of the enterance and out into the territory with newfound ease, Marigolddust realized that he had become the leader of the two. Pausing, he glanced behind himself to find Laurelblaze taking on a bit of a slower pace.
- After a moment of hesitation, Marigolddust stopped his own progress so that he could fall into step with Laurelblaze. "Would you like to take the lead?" He offered, although he said the words with quite a bit of reluctance behind them. He didn't want to push his friend farther than she wanted to go, but at the same time, the sooner they got this over with, the sooner she could relax about it. If she allowed herself to slow the process, it would only make the end of it all stray farther and farther away. Perhaps if she was the one to lead him through the forest, her pace might quicken with a bit more ease behind each pawstep. He wasn't very fond of leading trips like this, anyways, especially not when wandering into territory he hardly knew. @prim if you want we can go to some sort of territory/skip to the #moonpool !)) (edited)
Springy 🦤 02-Dec-21 10:11 PM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
- Past III - Finally, the whites of the warrioress's eyes were made visible as her eyelids opened, letting the she-cat look out at the world around her once more. She even managed to speak words, comprehendible words at that, and recognize him. Relaxation immediately caused his muscles to slack, a sigh of relief slipping past his lips as he calmed. He had done it- he had awoken her, and she didn't seem too have too much brain damage, at least from what he could tell so far. Sure, her words were quiet and slow, but that might prove to be an easy fix with time and practice. A smile spread across his features as he met Rainsplash's gaze, holding it for a few more moments, just to make sure she wouldn't drift back off into whatever sleeping stage she might have been in before. "Yes, I'm here," he concluded, offering her a kind expression as she began to step further into reality. He paused for a hesitant moment, though, at the fem's question. After a few seconds of thought, his smile returned to his face, curling the tips of his lips into a smile pf reassurance. "Don't worry, it's done and over with. You're safe now." he calmed, his voice soft and purposely more relaxed than it would have been if they were still in risk. The smile on the medicine cat's face immediately faded as Rainsplash vomited, her gaze turning unfocused and painful. Frowning now, Marigolddust tried to figure out what was going on. Was this bad? How bad might it be? Was it severe enough for him to fall into panic again? "Can you move? So you feel sick? What hurts?" He asked, voicing the questions one after another as he tried to figure out what was happening and how he could fix it.
- Was she retching because of her head injury? Was it because of the clan's sickness? Was it something else? Carefully, Marigolddust brought vigil out of his pile of herbs, offering it the the she-cat. "Try eating this- it should help get whatever bad things are making you sick. Do you feel like you can eat? This'll help you to, if you don't. You need to eat." He said, worry showing steadily through his gaze like sunlight through glass. @Jollykit! :)
Springy 🦤 02-Dec-21 10:25 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl & Astermoon • Another One Lost
- Past II - At his and Astermoon's return, they had begun to work on Lilachaze's body, working to clean and ready her for the vigil once the time came to move onto that part of the process. Or, at least, he and Wolfprowl cleaned up her bloodied wounds. Wolfprowl didn't seem to have too much trouble with the sight of the gore, but Astermoon seemed as if he had a bit of a different case. Marigolddust could tell merely by the look on his face that he wasn't very comfortable with all of the blood, and Marigolddust had the urge to suggest for him to leave so that he didn't need to feel sick over it, although he kept silent. Lilachaze had been important to all of them, even if they hardly knew each and had only spoken at very select times. Marigolddust had been forced to be alright with the sight of so much blood when he had over a dozen patients thrown at him, needing medical assistance for wounds he couldn't have ever imagined previously. Lilachaze's wounds looked like nothing works than anybody else's wounds in the medicine cat's eyes, his yellow gaze marked by the blood-filled moon the clan had experienced.
- "I-Icestar?" Marigolddust repeated, sparing a stray look over to his mottle-furred brother at the question. He couldn't keep his voice from cracking as he spoke, still affected by their sister's death, but he gave it his best attempt. It took a moment for the tuxedo to think over how he should respond to the inquiry. His answer would be fairly negative and greivious if he were to be truthful, but the other tom needed hope right now. Should he answer in lies to spare his brother from further hopelessness, or tell the truth and bring his mood down further? Well, he would surely find out eventually, anyways... So perhaps speaking honestly wouldn't be so avoidable. "She's... Well, she hasn't regained many of her memories at all yet.." he admitted, speaking softly as to avoid having passing ears overhear. Marigolddust wanted nothing more than for Icestar to regain her memories and recognize somebody, anybody, but so far, he couldn't help her. She couldn't recognize anything she had once known, and it felt as if she was a completely different cat overall. Perhaps she was. @Shade @fuzz (edited)
Shade 03-Dec-21 02:23 AM
Having disowned the family long ago, Wolfprowl worked in a very detached manner. Still, the death of kin made him feel… vulnerable. Along with grief that he fervently shoved down, he struggled with the need to feel strong. It was all they could hope to have right now, if any. He had accepted Icestar’s retirement before Marigolddust even answered the question. After what had happened, and her loss of memory, there was no way she could lead. He kept these thoughts to himself though, the only hint of them being a small frown on his face as he groomed Lilachaze. @fuzz @Springy 🦤

She rolled over and attempted to stand, her legs shaking. The scratches she got on her flanks sent sharp pains of resiliency.
