Springy 🦤 05-Dec-21 09:47 AM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
- Past III - Rainsplash made it clear that she had no interest in consuming the herbs he had to offer, even though they were the best remedy that he could think of for the situation. Was there another strategy that would work better, something that was more natural and acceptable? Did Marigolddust know that course of action, of was he left to be hopelessly bewildered? A lump formed in his throat as he tried to think over what he was supposed to do, a fearful doubt that he couldn't quite swallow. He watched helplessly as Rainsplash tried to stand. It was movement, of course, and that was a good thing, but the fact that she was unable to stand without becoming nauseous or dizzy wasn't as good. Perhaps she'll get better with time, he thought, the idea more hopeful than anything. It could have made sense in the situation, though. She had been gaining more and more control of her body the longer that they waited, and she was regaining her strength slowely. Maybe if they waited long enough, she could return to her normal health without much interference. It would be best if she tested and waited in his den, so that he could keep watch over her condition and make sure that she ate, despite her refusal to do so now. Whether or not Marigolddust was strong enough to carry another adult, he wasn't sure. But he knew that all of this would be Bette if it was done in his den, and she wouldn't want to come to full healthwhile being exposed to the weather and the horrifying sights of their camp, which looked. Ore like a battlefield now. And, in a way, it had become one only a day ago. "Are you alright if we move you to my den? I'll leave you alone then, and we can wait and bring you back to full health," he offered, hoping that the idea sounded more pleasing to the warrioress. @Jollykit! :)

>
For a moment, Astermoon is taken from his own grief and turmoil to reflect on the shaken state of the tuxedo beside him. His paws halt in Lilachaze’s pelt, glancing at Marigold-dust from the corner of his eye, and back to Wolfprowl.
>
Subtly does a tail wrap around Marigold-dust’s shoulders. “I’m sorry, that’s . . . awful, Mari.” His voice is still gruff and he returns to his work, but there’s a closeness he’s trying to find now, in their shared upset over the state of the Clan.
>
A few more rearrangements and he would’ve assumed Lilachaze was simply sleeping. Astermoon settles back on his haunches and examines their work. “Would either of you like to say some words first?” He glances between what’s left of their family, resting on Lilachaze at the end. She looked so small but peaceful here. ’I’m sorry, Lil.’

The virago's fluid tone told this tom otherwise; she was a master of faces and emotions. A dip of his skull and he did just that; wait as she finished her work, tail waving as he stepped back. Viridian eyes watched the work. Not being fond of delicate handiwork himself, his brutish activities never offered him time for it either. A hum once she finally turned his way, gander flickering back up to the harlequin pigmented pair of the new leader. "Sure," Picking the thing back up, the bachelor strode over tot eh desired spot, letting it fall and sitting by it. He too - has noticed the fresh kill pile, it took an idiot not to comprehend the shortening that it will be facing as well as all the others in the other clans. So sharing a meal was the best option for now. Conversation was a challenging search. Alerce was sure Laurel was already asked about her leader status by now several times. Surely, there were other conversation options. "I didn't think it was possible for you to get cold," Gentle topic. Harmless. His scalpulae protruding as he dipped down to take a nibble at the large hare. "You seem to be made for durability."
prim 07-Dec-21 12:39 AM
{Laurelblaze} | Alerceclaw | past I
While it was true she took longer than most to truly feel the effects of the cold, she wasn’t immune to it. She too preferred taking shelter in the sun when leaf-bare’s cool zephyrs coursed through their territory and left a chill running along every single cat’s spines. Laurelblaze may have appeared impervious, but she too had to admit sometimes she could get a little chilly. ”Hah! I wasn’t asking for myself.” a quick joke, the she-cat puffed out her chest to make her point as she sauntered into the patch of sun with a smug expression on her face for her humorous comment. ”I’m not immune to the cold, you know, I may be all big and furry but I too can suffer from the cold… I just handle it better.” She hadn’t been laughing much in the past few days, but she was getting there, slowly. Trying to cause oneself to see the positives after going through so much in such a short period of time was a struggle for her. Laurelblaze still was reeling from it all. It hurt still for her, she imagined it might always hurt, but she had to keep on living— find some joy in the life she had already. What else was there for her to do? The tortoiseshell femora stretched out her limbs as she sprawled out in the sun, letting out a pleased sigh as she felt stiffened limbs crack and release tension from all the delicate work she had been doing. *Honestly, I’d be better off just shoving the materials into the dens, but that’d just be half-finishing the job and it’d be sloppy. No, it required a deft touch, and she was more than skilled enough to handle den repairs. She might be a fighter at heart, but Laurelblaze also was able to build and maintain dens like her life depended on it. Her time spent with her father maintaining the nursery had taught her well. @~Swift~
Springy 🦤 07-Dec-21 09:35 PM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured
- Past II - At first, it had seemed u certain as to whether the fem really wanted to go to his den or not. Her head injury was clearly cussing her problems, and it made it a bit difficult to tell what she was thinking by skewed facial expressions and gestures. Cold. He would have a nest of moss ready for her in his den, although he would likely need to get more, as to provide her with the warmth she needed. He had been needing to gather more moss recently so he could make extra nests for unexpected situations such as the one, but by the end of the day, there had still been no spares. He had to preserve each bundle of the soft plants as if it were scarce morsels of food. Moss was a necessity with healing more than a large amount of other herbs and resources were. He needed it to provide patients with drinks, to make nests, to clean wounds, and, especially with the coming season of leaf-bare, to provide his patients and himself with warmth. The chilly season was only looking closer and closer to the damaged clan, but every time Marigolddust though too much on the topic he would panic. Of course he still gathered as many herbs as he could, but they were becoming harder and harder to find with the change in weather, not to mention being washed out and drowned by the landslide that seemed to have happened so long ago. The amount of cats he had to tend and care for was unbelievable, and they sucked up his resources almost ga than he could collect them. As a result, he never gained any more than he already had, no matter how much he labored to try and grow the amount of plants stationed on his shelves of herbs. This left him at a steady, continued rate of hardly any herbs. (edited)
- Shaking himself out of his thought, the lemon-toned eyes of the young tom wandered back to Rainsplash, and he could finally see some hint as to what, or rather where, she truly wanted to be, and it seemed that that place was his den. So she can relax and heal with some time, he thought, relief washing over his muscles as he sent her a knowledgeable nod, bending down enough so that, with the effort from both of the cats, he managed to get the warrioress onto his back steadily enough for her not to risk falling off. The weight of the older cat made his lengthy, thin legs tremble with effort. He wasn't at all used to using his muscles, even when he had been a warrior and had hunted daily for the clan. He had never been a cat for strength or toughness, rather, he was much better with agility, speed, and stealth. This didn't exactly help him with the situation, and it took him a decent length of time to manage to drag Rainslash to the enterance of his den. Taking the moment to make a deep inhale and exhale, he continued to slowely carry the she-cat into his den, through the patients, and to the neat he had had prepared for such a case. Setting her down in the soft moss carefully, Marigolddust released short, shallow pants before regaining his breath. Thank Starclan he hadn't dropped her on any of the patients, or at all- even if he had been fairly close to doing so.
- As Rainsplash was settled into her temporary nest and Marigolddust had gotten control of himself, he immediately went off to grab some moss, soaking some in the small pool of fairly clean water- or, rather, as clean as he could get- in the corner of his den. Once he had finished, he returned with the moss, offering his clanmate the wet moss to quench her thirst and some extra moss to orotect her a little bit more from the cold breezes that had come to sweep themselves into the den. "Do you need anything else?" He asked, offering a kind smile and curious expression, not wanting to leave her when he could still be attending to her needs. She was his top priority right now, but once she was satisfied, he would likely go back to organizing his herbs for future and present patients. Though, of course, he wouldn't leave without making sure everything was set. @Jollykit! :)
Springy 🦤 07-Dec-21 10:04 PM
Marigolddust • Wolfprowl & Astermoon • Another One Lost
- Past I - Marigolddust failed to take notice of the small frown that had tainted Wolfprowl's expression, and was instead focused mainly on Astermoon, along with Lilachaze, now that the question had been asked. As his brother's tail made contact with Marigolddust's own shoulders, the medicine cat couldn't help but tense a little more. Physical contact with his siblings was something that Marigolddust wasn't accustomed to, and it was clear that that had yet to change. Perhaps it would, someday, if the three remaining family member did happen to get closer again. But it wasn't certain how long that would take for them to accomplish, and Marigolddust couldn't help but remain nervous around his kin. Curling his tail a little closer to himself, his eyes never strayed at his sister's lifeless, unmoving features. With Astermoon's apologize, Marigolddust quickly shook his head. "It's not your fault at all, it's just... A problem. We'll figure it out,"**** he said, his voice soft and unsure, despite the confidence that was meant to be displayed alongside the words. Of course he didn't know if he would manage to fix Iceheart, and he wasn't sure what he would do if he couldn't. Would Laurelblaze take the place as Thunderclan's leader? Was she emotionally ready for that? Physically? Would it be too much for her to handle? Would they ever get the old Icestar back? Marigolddust didn't know the answers to any of his questions, and thinking about it only made his anxieties grow stronger. (edited)
- He stopped this steep incline as he put his focus back to her herbs in his own paws, as well as his brothers'. They were preparing their sister's body- he should be focusing on that, rather than worrying over a cat who might still have a chance of returning to normal. Would either of you like to say some words first? The question was one that he hadn't expected to need to answer at the beginning of the day. Now, he still couldn't quite get past the shock of everything that had happened. What would he say? What should he say? He wasn't sure, and he couldn't be confident in his emotions at the time. His mind and heart were both confused, fuzzing in and out as they trying to wrap themselves around the events of that say and that moon. He had a lot to think about, and he just wasn't sure he would be able to get through this part of his thoughts so early on. Even so, this was the only chance he would get. He had to say something, didn't he? "I... I hope to see you in a dream sometime soon, Lilac," he said, his voice hardly even a whisper as he spoke. I want to make this up to you.. I'll be waiting... He thought, trying to find some sort of answer or response behind the cold features that had once been so familiar to him before Periwinklekit's death and Wolfprowl's harshness as a kit. He didn't know what he would do if she really did show to him during the night or at the Moonpool. What would he say? Perhaps not even days if thought could give him a proper answer, and so he assumed he would have had to do something he wasn't very fond of; improvise. But maybe it would be worth it, just so he could see her again and finally say sorry. At least that part of the plan had been cemented. @fuzz @Shade (edited)
Shade 07-Dec-21 11:54 PM
Wolfprowl didn't speak nor shake his head. He merely sat there and closed his eyes. Was he processing grief, or simply trying to block out the situation and forget all that had just happened? You'd never be able to tell. It was almost completely dark now. More bodies were gathering in the center of the clearing, along with their kin. They had a long, sad night ahead of them; the vigil was beginning... @Springy 🦤 @fuzz end?)

Springy 🦤 08-Dec-21 10:28 PM
Marigolddust • Rainsplash • Finding the Injured | Healing Session
- Past II - Relief must have been contagious, because as a sudden sense of relaxation washed over Rainsplash, Marigolddust shared in the feeling. So the water did a good job at helping her, or at least her dry throat. That was definitely a good sign, and so was the smile that she shot up to him. He didn't want to imagine what could have happened if he had taken a little longer to find the fem, or hadn't realized she was alive at all. How many bodies could he have passed that hadn't really been dead? Perhaps he would check every pulse from now on, even if I out of a hundred cats would truly still be living. He didn't want to risk loosing clanmates due to his own laziness or wellbeing, for that matter. It was a good thing that that had become his job. Now, it was the rules to be self-sacrificing, even if he didn't quite understand just how much of a burden or a pain this could become for him in the near future. The work he had gotten failed to teach him the lesson he might one day learn, as he would have tried to help each cat who had become his patient in any case. It was quite odd sometimes, when he realized just how fitting he could be for this new to of his, even if the stress held more weight to it than hunting or patrols. He had never been one to enjoy inflicting pain on others or going around the territory, always with the risk of finding mischievous outsiders. Now, he could be a mischievous outsiders and still have little to no trouble, not that he would either way. (edited)
- With his smile being soft and relieved, the stormy furred tom nodded a small, acknowledging nod. "Well, then, you're recovering quickly, even if you haven't exactly regained enough strength to stand... If you don't mind, I'll leave you here to relax and recover, and you might even be able to sleep now that you've reached a fairly comfortable waking state. Anyhow, no more medicine talk... Just let me know if you need anything else, okay? I'll be over there, sorting some herbs if you ever need me." He said, tossing his chin softly in the direction of his herb shelves in a attention-aiming gesture. And, with that, he dipped his head respectfully to the warrioress, before beginning to get his herbs ready for the next patient that might need his attention, sending Rainsplash one more glance back before putting his focus on the world of herbs. @Jollykit! :) End! peri™ 10-Dec-21 10:36 AM
When light shines directly behind an object or perhaps even a shape, that thing turns into a silhouette. In the simplest of terms, a silhouette is the dark shape and outline of a figure against a lighter background. Often dark and color, as stated before, silhouettes target the outline of the object the light is reflecting off of rather than going straight through it. Although not meant to be scary most of the time, they can come off as quite dour. In any case, the sun was rising and it was a new day. A new chance to start things over, perhaps? At least, that’s the way Smokingshore looked at things. Optimistic, yes, but cautiously optimistic at that. She had been duped before. Her pelt was a mix of black and ginger and her eyes were a blood-chilling green although one pupil had a speck of red in it. It wasn’t noticeable to most, but she knew. She knew everything there was to know about herself after all, because if she didn’t, who would? Surely not her parents - StarClan knows where they were by now and she didn’t care enough to know. Her tail was long, extraordinarily so, with a scar at it’s base. She also had a scar running up the rightmost side of her neck - that was a near death experience if she had ever known one. But, against the shadow of the rising sun she sat, looking off into the distance like she was thinking about something philosophical when she was in fact not thinking about anything at all. smokingshore | a new encounter! | @GahlikPAh
GahlikPAh 10-Dec-21 10:57 AM
Brindlesnake Much like she approached the world as an outline- a silhouette, he breeched it with a sense of dichotomy to her refraction. He was a looming feature- like a single brown leaf on an oak tree- echoing the death of the warmth before them and ushering in the cold. His eyes were that contrast- the one represented by the leaf. They stormed over those who approached- reverberating their chill off the rich brown color of his tabby coat. The tiger striped tom was quite unusual- yet for few he was a mimic of one before him. Those few were likely fading- elders to be clear. The tabby tom caught sight of the ginger and black she cat- his large head tipping to the side as mumbled his memory over and over for a name. Part of him felt like he had seen green eyes like that before- perhaps loved them. His past life mate, a dusty feather of some sort? He hadn't the mental strength of memory to connect the familiarity. All he knew was that the color green was quite alluring. " Are you content to loiter- or will you come sit beside a stranger and converse? Rest assured, I make no aspersions, while I may sound blunt- there is no offence drummed from my end." The tabby tom straightened his head and shifted his paws, stormy gaze awaiting her response. " In the event you should wish not to remain a stranger- I will extend to you my name. I am Brindlesnake." @peri™ (edited)
cobra 12-Dec-21 01:23 PM
Astermoon's voice pulled him away from his violent thoughts. Foxpaw's gaze snapped up to meet his. The warrior's question processed in his brain, and after a moment of uneasy silence, the apprentice turned away. "I'll get it" He couldn't recognise his own voice. Like a lake during Leaf-Bare, it was frozen over, and deep below darkness lurked. Hollyfrost's scent overwhelmed him. Foxpaw inhaled it deeply. It comforted him. "What are we doing with the moss?" His returning question seemed naïve. A part of him knew what Astermoon planned to do already. @fuzz worlds worst writing)
fuzz 12-Dec-21 01:30 PM
🌙 astermoon 🌙
@cobra
He waits patiently for the younger tom to reappear, eyes as hollow as they had been in Aster's own reflection. To be given such a heavy burden at such a young age...Astermoon wouldn't wish that upon any cat.
>
Setting down his moss, he responds, "We're going to put it in their favorite places, to honor their memories." If they couldn't see their loved ones in life, perhaps they could visit where their memories still lived strongest.
>
He nods to Hollyfrost's bedding. "Where did your mother like to take you? Or your earliest memory of her?" Lilachaze's would be harder to remember, it had been so long since they had shared a memory...
cobra 13-Dec-21 11:22 AM
Foxpaw shivered. "The house" Came the quivering answer to Astermoon's question. "She found us there, with Laurelblaze. It was her favourite place" According to Hollyfrost, she already loved to visit the house. Her love only grew when she stumbled across a bunch of little kittens. He wished he was still that little kitten. "I am sorry about Lilachaze" It struck him suddenly that he hadn't even offered his condolences. He could feel the smack upside the head Hollyfrost would give him if she knew he was being so impolite. @fuzz
prim 14-Dec-21 09:10 PM
{Laurelstar} | Featherpaw | present
A steady rhythm had returned to the camp it had seemed, despite all the chaos that had ensued in the short time it had been since the battle. Laurelstar herself had been more active within camp than she had in the time just following the brutal conflict, able to talk to her clanmates, able to muster the confidence a leader needed. She was brimming with vibrance, like new life was coursing through her. Vitality through her nine lives was evident, she felt as if she could conquer the world with just a single slash of her claws. Yet it was never enough, she wished Hollyfrost was here to see her. As much as she missed her mate, she knew she couldn’t stop looking out for their family. Holly wouldn’t have wanted that, it was up to her now to look out for their children. One of which had been a concern since the landslide had occurred. ”Featherpaw? Are you around?” she called to her son for a moment, trying to spot his dark tabby fur amongst the camp as she looked around. He had been severely injured in the landslide, his leg being crushed under a large boulder and having to have been freed. The battle surely must have been hard on him as well, he must have been so scared. StarClan knows it was for the others, I can’t imagine how they’re taking it right now. She had to ensure her kits would be safe. That they would be able to move past this and smile again. They deserved all the love and happiness in the world in her eyes. She had to ensure they could recover. @wild™
wild™ 15-Dec-21 07:50 AM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
Featherpaw had always been a rather absent-minded tom, constantly among his own thoughts or another world entirely before being brought to reality by something or someone. But since the war, he'd become more absent entirely...and he hardly seemed to realize it. His mind had become particularly foggy, thoughts muddling together into a hazy mist that refused to release him of its clutches. Blue eyes were horribly dull as if he wasn't actually among his own body, merely limping about mindlessly. Whenever this behavior was brought up, he either uncharastically ignored it, tried to avoid answering or ultimately melted into a puddle of misery. To be honest, he despised his new life - he was saddened and couldn't seem to make himself genuinely smile or another for that matter, stuck in this dark pit of despair. It almost seemed as if someone had struck him multiple times over, despite his worst injury being his leg. It would probably never heal and become normal again, which was quite small when he thought about something else that would never be normal again. His life. Their life. Thunderclan's life. Icestar had been murdered - though she apparently arose once more, she was unable to lead her clan for any longer. He wondered if that meant he'd gain a new mentor...Icestar - or rather, Iceheart now - seemed rather odd as of late. He desperately hoped against it, but he couldn't locate any optimism within him to tell him otherwise. A sigh escaped him at the thought. Another loss.
But perhaps the worst loss of all had been Hollyfrost. The whole family had been shocked to their cores, broken and shattered on that gruesome day. Though he felt horrible over it still, his worries reached to his mother, Laurelstar. Having only gained her name a short while ago, he wondered if she was recovering from the previous events or not. Iceheart and her had been close...Hollyfrost and her especially close...and now, both had more or less been taken from her. He wondered how she was managing with her new role. Maybe she needed a hug. The tom wouldn't have to search for the tortoiseshell, hearing her beckoning a few moments after he'd finished those very thoughts. The black tabby rose, limping in the direction of the large feline, blue eyes poised upon the familiar figure. His tail swayed slowly as he reached her, whiskers quivering as he gazed up at his mother. "Hi, mom." he greeted, a small smile upon his face. "Did you need me for something?" he inquired. Perhaps she needed him to assist her in some sort of task. He hadn't been able to help out a lot since the mudslide, but he was ready to fix that now if such was what his mother wished for. @prim
prim 15-Dec-21 11:37 PM
{Laurelstar} | Featherpaw | present
He was up, finally, but clearly wasn’t able to walk like she hoped he could. It would be a struggle for him, she knew it, but she was positive he could manage as a warrior in this state. They’d find workarounds in his training, she was sure of it. Just after I find him another mentor, unless Iceheart is still up to it, maybe it may help jog her memory. she watched her son approach her and she flashed him a small smile, pleased to see him. Seeing him up and active felt better than seeing him injured and nest-bound. Featherpaw was strong, and she was proud of him, just as she was her other children. ”I just wanted to check in on you. I wanted to ask how you were.” she was straightforward and to the point, not beating around the bush. She wanted to get an insight into his headspace right now, to see how she could possibly help him and the others. This was a rough time for all of them, the pain of Hollyfrost’s loss was evident in their family, she wanted to see how she could help them— if she could. ”I know the battle must have been scary, believe me they’re never easy to deal with. Especially when we lose so many cats at once… I’m sorry.” she let out a shaky sigh as she remembered the day it had occurred so vividly. The metallic scent of blood hanging in the air, the sounds of cats yowling and screeching as they ripped each other apart and suffered injury after injury. It was horrific, her camp being turned into a battlefield. I won’t let us be infiltrated so easily ever again. Our clan will be safe from now on. @wild™
wild™ 17-Dec-21 03:13 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
When compared to everything that had happened in Thunderclan recently, the last thing that was on his mind was himself. He frequently thought about his mother, siblings and mentor...perhaps she'd be his former mentor now, as every time someone brought the lynx point up, there seemed to be a sense of unease and despair among the air. The tabby worried about her honestly, fearing the moment he put together enough courage to speak to her himself...would she even recognize him? The very idea is what kept him from doing so, however silly others might view it as. He'd lost so much in various ways and quite frankly, he wasn't ready to lose his mentor among the mass of other things that were gone forever. As the tortoiseshell spoke, Featherpaw could feel his eyes beginning to burn with tears that begged to form and spill from his eyes, but he forced them back. This was probably not the time for that - his mother had even more duties to tend to now and he was old enough not to need to be held by her as he sobbed. No...he had to be strong, just like her. If she could lead a clan in these rough times, then he could manage to keep a firm grip on his own emotions. The tom inhaled a shaky breath, letting it out slowly as he turned his gaze toward Laurelstar's Please don't fail me, voice. "Why are you sorry? Those cats hurt you just as much as they hurt the rest of us...maybe even more. It's not your fault they did all those mean and horrible things..." he managed to say with a mostly steady voice, somewhat surprised at the apology he was given. Why would anyone who fought alongside them be sorry? It wasn't their fault... "I'm sure if you could've done something to save everyone...you would have..." It was honestly scary to see the entire thing play out, horrifying even. He could've lost Laurelstar too.. @prim
prim 17-Dec-21 05:02 PM
{Laurelstar} | Clan Meeting | present
Laurelstar’s first steps onto the Highledge as the now formally-recognized Leader of ThunderClan felt heavy, weighed down with exhaustion and weariness from the moons that had come to pass. Weighed down by the pressure of expectations from her clanmates, weighed down by the grief for the cats who she loved and then lost, all in a split second. Each moment she thought of the cats no longer with them, her clanmates, her family, it threatened to tear her apart. Yet after receiving her lives, she was expected to lead them, to be strong and to do right by the cats still among the living. She had a duty to uphold to them all. Hence why she was gathering them here today, to address them formally. The russet-toned sovereign ascended the steps to the ledge jutting out from her new den, her posture tall and regal, like a newly-coronated queen taking her first steps to her throne where she’d address her subjects. They had to acknowledge her as their new leader, the cat who they’d follow into battle at their head, the one who’d lay down her life for their sakes. She held so much power at the tips of her paws, and here she was, about to dictate how she was going to wield it. ”Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey gather beneath the Highledge!” @ThunderClan
cobra 17-Dec-21 05:05 PM
Foxpaw's good ear perked at the sound of his mothers voice. Quickly, the apprentice scuttled out from his den and sat beneath her ledge.
wild™ 17-Dec-21 05:09 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
The sound of his mother's voice was a familiar one. A powerful one that carried over the camp with ease, one that didn't waver in the slightest. But now, as he gazed in her direction, stationed upon the Highledge, it seemed...different. Once a different cat stood upon that same ledge. And one before them and one before them. It was a place where leader's stood and she was one of them now, as strange as it was to think about sometimes. With a flick of an ear, he arose at her beckoning, blue eyes wide and curious. As instructed, the apprentice took his place among the others, ears pricked with interest. What would today's meeting be about? Something normal like ceremonies? Or something more drastic that concerned the clan? He would prefer something more subtle in all honesty. Perhaps their lives were finally becoming more stable.

Springy 🦤 17-Dec-21 05:30 PM
Marigolddust • Clan Meeting
The work that lay in constant wait for him in his den had begun to shrink down as he healed more and more of the clans I jured members, much to his relief. Fortunately, cats didn't get so beaten up every day as they had during the day of the battle, and he was prepared to search for as many herbs as possible once he didn't have any more patients to worry about. He would have. Plenty of time to spend searching, anyhow, and he would have healed the cats who couldn't help him before, even if they had been willing. Now, he found it easy to leave the cats in his den for a few moments, and one such moment was when he heard Laurelblaze's call ring through the camp, calling forth his clanmates to the foot of the highledge. Curiousity plucked at his ears, causing them to perk and making him straighten, looking out of his den and at the growing crowd. Her first meeting as the leader, he realized, before standing and, after checking up on all of the cats in his den, walking out of his den to join those who had gathered together. He knew it was difficult for Laurelblaze to face everything she had lost by standing in place of Icestar, and, in general, she hadn't been feeling the best, plauged with guilt and greif. This must have been something important, then, mustn't it? Passing by only a few cats, Marigolddust made sure to remain on the outermost layer of the group, away from the majority of the commotion, but moving closer in so to hear the coming news better. He couldn't think of any cats who would be gaining a new rank, but, again, he wasn't the most aware of the positions of all of his clanmates. He found himself unaware of the idea of any other news, uncertain what else might change. Perhaps it was everything that happened that caused him to be oblivious enough to make such assumptions, but he wouldn't hear what he expected he would today. (edited)
prim 17-Dec-21 05:30 PM
{Laurelstar} | Clan Meeting | present
”If it isn’t obvious enough, I have received my nine lives from our warrior ancestors, and now am the leader of ThunderClan. I intend to use my power to protect you all, and to keep every single one of you safe.” She spoke with a firm, unwavering tone, her heterochromatic gaze burning brightly with a new resolve. Laurelblaze was no more, she was now a fully-recognized leader of one of the forest clans. She had the power of their ancestors blessed upon her, and she was ready to take on every single obstacle in her path. A new age had dawned upon the clan, and she was determined to lead her clan into glory. ”Together we have weathered destruction from disasters, found traitors amongst our ranks, and have defeated an old evil that had been dogging us for moons, and here we stand. We have survived together due to your valiant efforts, and I am proud to be blessed with the opportunity to lead you all.” Her flames had nearly died out during the landslide crisis, and in the aftermath, but here she was now, ready to spark the flame that would ignite a brand new inferno, ready to scorch the world that lied ahead of her. ”Together, we shall rise again and honor the ones we have lost, I will ensure no one ever takes advantage of us ever again. We will not live in fear any longer, for we are stronger than our enemies will ever know.” ”ThunderClan shall stand tall, as we have for countless generations before us. No one shall take advantage of us ever again. I will ensure our prosperity remains, and that we will have a bright future to look forward to.” She blinked for a moment, gesturing for the crowd to remain quiet, for this was not the only reason why she had gathered them today. Her gaze swept across the crowd, and in her heart, she knew it was time. ”However, I cannot do that alone.” (edited)

AlerceClaw
Grapplers kissed the snow ridden ground, meeting with the terrain as per the gathers the hierarchs of this clan would broadcast. The peculiarly pigmented tom eventually made his way to the crowd as the just-as-so-interestingly patterned sovereign began her speech.Surely it was winter, and as usual, perhaps the fae was meaning to encourage more hunting. Where IceStar previously stood, now stood the new clan leader. Laurel - as he so learned, had settled into her position as hierarch quite fluidly. Silently. None to console her just as her mate did. Reliance for emotional dependency was on the clan members now, though of course such a level of trust so soon onto just anyone can not be disposed onto. Laurel - until further notice, was alone. Her independence radiated. And even if just a moment, Alerce envied it. (edited)

peri™ 17-Dec-21 05:36 PM

She knew this was coming, of course, because every leader had needed a deputy, needed someone to pass the torch to when their time had run out. It was always exciting to find out who it would be, though, who would take over when Laurelstar’s reign was over. She knew whoever it was would be a good pick because she had full confidence in the leader and her options. Chewing the inside of her lip, she remained silent as she awaited the big reveal. Her gaze moved from the leader around to the group of cats and back up to the leader. Everyone seemed on edge and rightfully so, this would likely determine ThunderClan’s future. (edited)

Springy 🦤 17-Dec-21 05:41 PM
Marigolddust • Clan Meeting
Marigolddust's heart swelled with Laurelstar's speech, proud of her for having the guts to admit that she had been low, even if the realization made him feel far too much like a grandfather. With a twitch of an ear, he ignored the connection, and instead smiled up at the new leader. Perhaps the meeting was just one to introduce her into her new position, letting all of Thunderclan know that they would call her by her new name. It could have been enough for a clan meeting, he knew, although he found himself becoming hesitant as the speech continued, making the crowd around the large tortoiseshell suspenseful. What did she plan to announce? What was going to happen? Why, exactly, had she really brought together this meeting? Would there really be any ceremonies today, or was it something else? Golden eyes widened at Laurelstar's last statement, a new idea finally dawning on him. Was this what it sounded like it was? Curiousity didn't fail to continue strong in his gaze as he tried to meet Laurelstar's, but he felt newfound anxiety as his thoughts wandered further and further into the idea he was sure would be coming. Was this what he thought it was? No, maybe it wasn't... Perhaps she was just nearing the end of her speach. But, despite what he was trying to figure out, he knew that only one announcement would be led up to so strongly, an announcement he wasn't sure he was ready to hear. He didn't like change, and, in fact, despised it. This announcement could concrete that change, and he couldn't help but feel scared. Anxiously, the young medicine cat listened on, awaiting the news to come.
spark's clone™ 17-Dec-21 05:42 PM
Cloverpaw
Although usually quite uninterested in these scenarios, the older apprentice studied the newly made leader with some form of newfound curiosity. Did this happen to mean Laurelstar would already be choosing her deputy? Of course there would be several cats anticipating this announcement, as could be seen by the many wide eyes staring up at the multicolored she-cat with awe. I wonder.. Cloverpaw had been quite reserved - which wasn't uncommon, but she'd been almost traumatized to even speak, and yet when she looked at felines like Foxpaw and Featherpaw, Laurelstar's kits.. she felt some pang of jealousy. One thing Clover had always failed to have was a loving mother. Of course she was excited about the new deputy, but deep down was some sort of growing hatred in the molly's chest. But she wondered who it could be... just to take her mind off it.
prim 17-Dec-21 05:44 PM
{Laurelstar} | Clan Meeting | present
It was a fact of life, that a leader could not oversee a clan alone. The Code decreed a leader must have a successor set in place, and for her, the time had come, and she had her decision in mind. One cat in particular stood out amongst the crowd, and she knew the clan would be in good paws when it was her time to pass it on to the said individual. A cat who had shown dedication to their clan, one who strived to serve, a cat she could trust with the fate of her clan when her time as leader came to an end. A cat who was truly worthy of the title of deputy. She stood tall, brimming with confidence in her decision and how she was addressing her clan. She had faith in them all, but this one individual had stood out to her over time, and she was truly pleased to be finally revealing her decision at last. Laurelstar felt it in her bones that this decision would be the best for the clan, and that she would be picking an excellent candidate for her deputy. A cat she knew she’d work well with, someone who she knew would conduct their work with diligence and with great zeal. ”I have decided on who I will select as my deputy. I have gathered everyone here to bear witness to this occasion.” her twin hues of ocean-blue and honey-amber bore down into the crowd, though the cat she was preparing to promote was the primary recipient of said attention. She could feel the tension on the air, the clan was buzzing, wondering who would be their next deputy. Who she would be leading the clan alongside, her second-in-command. A comrade she’d share power with, a sentinel who would report to her and help her carry out her work as leader. She knew just who would suit the job, one she knew could handle the pressures of leadership. One that could blossom into it as she had, for she saw incredible potential in them. ”I say these words before StarClan, so that the spirits of our warrior ancestors may hear and approve of my choice…” ”The new deputy of ThunderClan is…”

prim 17-Dec-21 05:59 PM
{Laurelstar} | Clan Meeting | present
”…Alerceclaw.” The tortoiseshell admittedly had a feeling the tom would one day be the one standing atop the Highledge, as her successor, however. He was a dedicated and loyal warrior of ThunderClan, and it had made her decision notably much easier. These two traits she believed were incredibly important for any leader of a clan. They could be a talented, and gifted warrior, but true loyalty and tenacity in the face of adversity were the factors of which she believed forged an excellent leader. This would be the start of a new part of his life, and she knew he would be great. It was always a difficult change to cope with, but she had the upmost faith in him. If he had any worries, she would be more than willing to impart her knowledge from her time as deputy unto him. StarClan knows we’re both new at our jobs, though I hope all the time I spent shadowing Icestar had prepared me enough. I’ll have to do the same for him. She flashed him a confident smile and gestured for him to step forward from the crowd, she could see all eyes were trained on him, a spotlight practically being cast down upon him. This was a momentous occasion only so many cats ever experienced in their lives, and whether he would accept the role or not was to be decided here and now. ”Do you accept the role of deputy of ThunderClan, Alerceclaw?” She sincerely prayed he would say yes, for this would be an incredibly awkward affair if he did publicly decline. Might cause her reason to doubt her authority, but she might have been overthinking it. This was the right decision for the clan, she just knew it. Her gut feeling was almost never wrong, and she knew he would be the best successor she could possibly have. She was positive the rest of the clan would agree with her decision as well. It was all up to him whether he would accept the position, and she wouldn’t judge him for any decision he would make. It was his choice, after all. I really hope he does accept it though. @ThunderClan @~Swift~
~Swift~ 17-Dec-21 06:11 PM
AlerceClaw
A small puff of air. Relieved exhalation and the mass of the population of Thunderclan had found it in their torso's to proceed with the function of the respiratory system. It took this tuxedo a moment to understand what the name was that the madame on the tall, oversized sedimentary had said. The series of vowels and consonants to make up a familiar name. His name. AlerceClaw. Emerald gander pinpointed on the sachem, rubbery black lips tightened to a thin line. Though Laurel and he got off to an exciting start, sparring at the olympics, there was still this moment now. Perhaps there was a moment then and any other interaction after that which revealed his traits to which she considered valuable. They say, sparring with someone strips you of your attributes. You speak the same tongue in motion. And perhaps it was compatible in a professional relationship that was the one suggested now. Her showcase of denticles set the toms previously rigid physique relaxed. He buzzed with honor as he forced a calm exterior, a grateful dip of his cranium, a little smile to reciprocate Laurels free language in physiognomy. "I do accept it with gratitude, LaurelStar," He was careful with wording.
@prim
Springy 🦤 17-Dec-21 06:27 PM
Marigolddust • Clan Meeting
Finally, his suspicions had been concluded, and although he wasn't surprised, his emotions only sparked into something stronger, causing his tail to twitch side to side continually and making him unable to keep himself from figiting. A new deputy. Marigolddust had never known another deputy besides Laurelstar as his own before, and the idea of doing so made him more than nervous. How was he to respond? Would this new deputy like him? Should he like them? Who could it be? Would they betray the clan, too, while it was still struggling? Starclan, please say they'll be a good choice... Don't let Silentwing trick us one last time. He silently prayed, closing his eyes in anticipation as he awaited the name that would change the clan from here on out. He trusted Laurelblaze's decision, and could feel nothing but guilt at the fact that he found himself becoming so uncertain. But, unfortunately, he couldn't keep himself from becoming anxious over something such as this, especially when even a cat as strong and vigilant as Laurelstar could be tricked into making a choice too wrong to take back. And, to be honest, he worried that he would t work well with whoever might be chosen. He hoped for a cat with a good nature, and, to be honest, the virtues that Laurelstar explained sounded... Well, reliable. And, to complete this new sense of relief, he heard something he didn't expect to hear; a familiar name.
- "Alerceclaw?" He gasped, the medicine cat talking more to himself than anybody else. He let his eyes land on the tall form of the familiar, almost nastalgic presence of the dark tuxedo, eyes wide and mouth hanging open slightly, agape. Marigolddust hadn't expected to hear the name of the warrior, out of all of the others in the clan, being called, but, somehow, the decision was one he was comfortable in, which was rarer than some might expect. He knew Alerceclaw was an honorable warrior, and perhaps this new rank would up his mood a little, give him more of the strength and fire he had in his prime, as he had explained to Marigolddust when they had first met. Marigolddust had been a kitten then, and Alerceclaw had been teaching him early on how to do the hunters crouch. The tom was definitely a good teacher, even with kits of all ages, from his experience. Slowely, a small smile appeared on his expression. Maybe this could be a good decision, one that would better the clan as a whole, even if it meant that their next talk might turn out to be a bit awkward. Training a kit to fight and then being by their side while they took on the job of healing could, as he guessed, be a bit uncomfortable if done incorrectly. But, even so, it would be worth a try once they had the time where Alerceclaw was free for a conversation, after all of the congratulations that would certainly be shared.
Shade 17-Dec-21 06:48 PM
Wolfprowl sat there, silently and begrudgingly approving. Alerceclaw was a good warrior, like him. He'd make an even deputy for Laurelstar. Palekit watched from the edge of the nursery, hanging back from the crowd. She didn't want to give them an opportunity to give her odd stares. She didn't know Alerceclaw well at all yet, but she hoped he was nice.
prim 17-Dec-21 08:09 PM
{Laurelstar} | Clan Meeting | present
It was set in stone then, her deputy was chosen, and Alerceclaw accepted the position with gratitude. This was a defining moment in their clan’s history, for this would affect their future forever. She looked forward to seeing how Alerceclaw would progress as her deputy, and how they would work together in mapping out the fate of ThunderClan. She looked forward to their future, she was positive he would be an excellent leader one day. For now, it was a matter of him adjusting to his new role. She’d have to discuss it with him soon after this, it was quite a lot to remember and to learn. She had quite a rocky start as deputy, and she wanted to help him out as much as she could so he could avoid such a problem. ”Well then, I’m glad… ThunderClan this meeting is adjourned!” she dismissed her clanmates with a swish of her tail, before her odd gaze rested back upon the dark-colored tom. ”Alerceclaw, I would like for you to come to my den so I may discuss what to expect from your promotion.” she dipped her skull to the tom, before she took a few steps back from the edge of the ledge, turning around so she would enter the small cave that the Highledge jutted out from. It would be quite a bit of information to be taking in all at once, but she was sure he would manage. Being a deputy was a far cry from being a warrior, but it brought with it it’s own sense of accomplishment and excitement. Only so many cats ever became one, it was most certainly a pivotal part of a cat’s life to become one. She slipped through the entrance of her den, sauntering towards her nest where she took her seat— awaiting the tom to follow after her so they may have their meeting. @~Swift~
peri™ 18-Dec-21 05:35 PM
Smokingshore had never been particularly close with those in her family. In fact, she had considered herself estranged from them on her own terms. A lot of things led up to this, but the catalyst was, she thought, that night with her father. A shiver rolled it’s fingers down her spine at the thought. It was raining that night, she remembered it clearly, so clearly to the point where it was playing on loop in her mind her again. She was still quite young when the whole situation occurred, but she was old enough to remember. And sometimes, she wished she didn’t. Memory was the burden of one’s existence. Thankfully, a voice dragged the odd-pelted female out of her eidolon and she turned her gaze upward to face him. She felt herself smile the slightest bit as he continued speaking, flicking an ear like she were flicking away a fly. She knew conversation wouldn’t hurt, especially in her state, so she replied with a flick upward of her tail tip. ”Conversation never hurt anyone,” mused she with a side eye of knowing towards the tom. Gaze trailing up, the feline continued: ”Besides, we meet many strangers in this lifetime. Why not make it one less?” At the mention of names, she laughed the slightest bit. ”Brindlesnake. A pleasure. Call me Smokingshore,” her name rolled off of the tongue easily. Or so she thought. In any case, her evergreen gaze found itself fixated on him again, awaiting his response. smokingshore & brindlesnake | a new encounter! | @GahlikPAh (apologies for how long this took eeeek)
tremb 19-Dec-21 12:53 PM
Wrenpaw 🍃 past The golden and brown pelted molly slipped once more out of the apprentices den, turning her face up towards the sun and drawing in a deep breath. It was quite cold, but seeing the sun light up a cerulean sky was a very welcomed change from the last moon of heavy rains. Soon snow would blanket the ground she walked, but for now dainty brown and white mitts tread on dry earth. She waited just outside of the den for Gullypaw, a little smile on her face and her white tipped tail waving to and fro. ”It’s a beautiful day, isn’t it?” She asked the tom as he exited the den beside her. Wrenpaw had always been a rather high energy feline, so being stuck inside had been miserable for her after the battle. She’d spent plenty of time cooped up in the medicine den, and then in the apprentices den after that. Today, she could finally enjoy being in the camp and basking in the sunshine. Still, she would be lying if she said she wouldn’t rather be out in the forest hunting or training. Perhaps she could go see Marigolddust later and ask if he would let her go hunting. Her amber eyes flicked towards Gullypaw. ”So, how about that clover crown?” @Soop
tremb 19-Dec-21 05:25 PM
Wrenpaw 🍃 present It had been a little over a moon since the battle with the dark forest cats, and Wrenpaw’s wounds had finally healed enough for her to get back to her usual duties. Well, her physical wounds had healed at least. Though the worst seemed to be over, her mind was still plagued with uncertainties which had left her feeling a bit on edge. She would wear the scars that she received in battle for the rest of her life, and even an entire lifetime couldn’t erase the memories of what had happened or the images of the things that she had witnessed. Still, things were seeming better and brighter especially now that she was able to leave camp again. She had missed out on an entire moon of training, and it was hard not to think about how far that may have set her back. She had been expecting to receive her warrior name within the next couple of moons, but now the young molly wasn’t so sure. All she could do now was play catch up and hope that her clan would notice all of her hard work and determination to get to where she needed to be. Her first hunting trip had been a bit touch and go given her lack of physical activity over the last moon and due to the layer of snow that now covered the forest. It hadn’t made for ideal hunting conditions, but when the golden pelted fem returned to ThunderClan’s camp she had not returned empty pawed. Her attempt to catch a squirrel had unfortunately failed, but she supposed the two mice that now dangled from her jaws swinging to and fro by their tails made up for that. She hated to admit that she had gotten a little rusty, but at least she hadn’t entirely lost her ability to feed her clan. Dropping her catch on the fresh-kill pile she turned towards the outskirts of the camp, leaving small imprints in the snow as she walked. She headed for the group of flat rocks that the elders typically used to sunbathe. Except there was no sun today, only gray skies and the promise of more snow, leaving them unoccupied for the time being. She brushed some of the snow off of the smooth surface with a forepaw, clearing away an area for her to sit. And there she sat, watching her clanmates going about their day as if disaster had never struck their clan. A small smile upturned the edges of her lips. It was overall a very peaceful leaf-bare day. @cobra (edited)
Soop 20-Dec-21 06:02 PM
Gullypaw @tremb Gullypaw quickly followed the molly outside, getting the sensation of the sun on his fur and the brightness of outside the den over with and adjusted to quickly. It had been a while since he saw the brightness and bustle of the ThunderClan camp recently and only just now found himself lucky to have this verdant jungle of a territory. As a little kitten he had taken this for granted, as did plenty of other cats most likely. Oculars the hue of ripe pears, his large irises darted over to look at the beige-and-brown molly, meeting her lovely sunshine amber gaze for a moment before letting his own eyes drip to the ground. "Erm, yes, it is." As the pale molly queried about his favorite pasttime, his ears seemed to prick up, his eyes ripping off of the ground to look at Wrenpaw like peeling the fur off a warm piece of prey. A shy smile graced the dark tabby's visage and he gave a final glance at the ground before trying to make eye contact. "Ah, yes, the clover crowns. My favorite spot to make them is outside camp, but we might have to ask to go outside, since all of the recent stuff, and, y'know.." He trailed off, not sure what to say next. That, and a dark flicker surfaced in the globes of his eyes, something like rememberance, but much more hurtful.
peri™ 21-Dec-21 02:03 PM
The morning had come swiftly, the aubades of dawn singing ardently across the camp. The phosphorescence of the fiery sun had replaced the white lumine of yesteryear. Although this change had been welcome, she had sometimes longed for the aegis that the cloak of night had served her with. It was a time to get away, a time to recollect your bearings and prepare for what the next day had to offer. But sometimes they didn’t give you that time to prepare. Sometimes, sadly enough, dawn fell quick upon midnight’s heels, covering it’s tracks. She had felt herself, over the moons, become more and more fond of the night and it’s happenings. Although some used it as a getaway from the goings-on of their life, she found it to be quite the opposite. It was cold, but the type of cold that brought you in curiously like it was a friend that was willing to listen to your problems and try to help you through them. Like a little angel on your shoulder, curiously enough. Her silhouette was like a pinprick against the blazing glory of the sunlight but, if you squinted hard enough, you could make her out. There she sat, always at the dawn of a new day. This was routine for her, to sit there and wait potentially until someone came up to her. Yet this time was different. This time, she was waiting for someone very specific to walk up to her. After all, training didn’t begin until both of the parties were awake. That’s just how it worked. So she waited, preparing to stand up if need called for it. smokingshore | slice of life | @Soop (sorry this one took a bit oops)
cobra 21-Dec-21 04:19 PM
A moon flew by before Foxpaw knew it. Training with Astermoon kept his mind off of Hollyfrost. Some days, being so preoccupied, he'd forget about her passing, and rush home to tell her about his day. It was only when he'd pad into the warriors den and see her nest missing and no scent of her around, would it hit him. Today wasn't one of those days. Astermoon instructed him to work on duties in camp today, instead of being out in the forest. Foxpaw wasn't happy, but he knew better than to chat back, especially with his mother as leader. Laurelstar could be seriously scary when she was mad. He didn't want to be on the other side of her sharp tongue anytime soon. fuzz 21-Dec-21 04:35 PM
🌙 astermoon 🌙 || {foxpaw}
@cobra
Astermoon’s laugh is a hollow echo of what it once had been. The piebald tom nods his thanks and takes the lead out of the camp.
>
He’s familiar with the old abandoned twoleg nest at the edge of the woods. Not many cats went past the one deeper in the woods - it was where the healers had grown their herbs for longer than he’d been alive. Once, chasing a fox off ThunderClan land, he’d found a second deeper, closer to rogue lands than the former.
>
He motions for Foxpaw to stick close but makes no note of whether the younger tom heeds his silent request.
>
“How old were you?” He doesn’t look at Foxpaw as the pair trod on in silence, nothing but birdsong to cut through the excruciating silence.

prim 23-Dec-21 11:46 AM
{Laurelstar} | Sunkit | present
The skies were a muted tone of blue today, even with the sun not obscured by the presence of feathery clouds, as was common this time of year. The first snowfall had occurred during the night, but it was light, and hardly even coated the ground with a small layer of frost. The season was only beginning, however, and she knew it would only grow more harsh as time went on. They had to make sure the dens were reinforced and ready for the season, especially after the battle and the landslide derailed much of their repair efforts. They had gotten started earlier on, but it was not finished yet. So much work to do, and too little time. The russet-toned tortoiseshell sovereign had been caught up in so much work around camp that she had nearly forgotten to stop and take a breather. She was type to allow herself to get engrossed within her work, not stopping until the job was done, but this was too much for a single cat to work on alone— and thankfully there were other cats around to help in the efforts of repairing their camp, and she’d get back to work once her break was over. Even if she was leader of ThunderClan, she still had her part to play in handling duties around camp. From here, she could oversee the efforts of repairing camp and keep track of what needed to be completed still. Essentially, she was idling for now. @🌺Ruby🌺

prim 23-Dec-21 12:59 PM
{Laurelstar} | Sunkit | present
Her quiet observation at the current state of camp had led to the conclusion that they were a little over halfway finished. Some dens were almost fully reinforced, namely the nursery and the elders’ den, as they housed those who were most susceptible to the effects of the frigid zephyrs of leaf-bare. In fact, one of said individuals was toddling out of the nursery right about now, and it didn’t take long for the leader’s gaze to meet hers. Laurelstar flashed the kit a small smile, her bushy tail swaying as she sat up a bit, trying to appear regal and poised. Essentially trying to make herself appear cool to the kit, like she wasn’t taking a few seconds to herself. This would be a good distraction before she needed to return to her duties. ”Hello Sunkit, are you wandering into camp by yourself?” the leader greeted the young she-kit with a softer tone, one she typically reserved for the younger members of her clan. Soop 23-Dec-21 03:58 PM
Gullypaw @peri™ The frigidly cold morning had crept upon the new day like icy claws. Icicles hung down like glass stalactites from the long, slender branches of the oaks and beeches and the dawn was silent and grayed except for the sweet birdsong that graced the camp. The sun had finally come out to play from its gray cloak of the wintry clouds and brandished its luminescence onto the camp, glistering wonderfully onto the snow powdered atop the pale, spiky grass underpaw like millions of fireflies ready to take flight from the ground. Still, most felids chose to lie dormant in their warm dens, some cats piled atop one another or pressing together for warmth in the chilly environment. The kits nestled at the queens' bellies and the elders all snored gently near each other. And for the apprentices...well, all but one lone tom was missing. A dark tabby tom, small and slender, slipped out of the den, still in the middle of stretching out his legs and smoothing down his fur, which still had scraps of moss clinging to it. He padded out gingerly into the snow - it was the first leafbare he could remember, so the sight of the camp sprinkled with frozen dew and snow was quite awebringing. It felt cold and stung a little on his soft pawpads, which were beginning to grow callouses from being out. This was his first training session since he had chosen to sit in his den and grieve for his lost grandmother, and do nothing else. He swallowed. Hopefully Smokingshore wasn't waiting too long on him. - (edited)
Gullypaw picked his way out of the den - planting two, then three, then all four paws in the freezing snow. It clumped at the fur between his pawpads and made his ankles slick and sodden, but to get to his training session he sort of had to make his way through this. He was relieved to see his mentor sitting serenely, only a fox-length or two away from where he stood now. Walking awkwardly in the snow, Gullypaw approached the dark she-cat, his apple-green irises sparkling with anticipation. "Did I keep you too long?" he asked her softly, cautioning himself to be quiet. "I-I...erm, I'm ready when you are.."
peri™ 23-Dec-21 05:12 PM
The sibylline feline had not been waiting long, much to Gullypaw’s felicity. The morning had been boreal, the breezes that had pranced through had made the air borderline algid, but there, flickering slightly in the darkness ahead, was the tiniest bit of warmth that cascaded through her body. Slowly, carefully, that feeling spread like a blanket would over a shivering child, chilled to the bone by the winter’s forthcomings. But she was no child, and the chill in her bones was from nothing more than her own antiquity. Although she was well into her older years now, she couldn’t help but long for the feeling of being a child again. The curiosity that came with it. But, as the saying goes, there were always two sides to the same coin. Her childhood had been her kryptonite. It was something she had kept locked away in the back of her mind, kept clandestine for moons to come. Family had never been her forte, after all. Not since the incident. And she remembered that night well. Raining. It had been raining. She had heard the polemic from her nest that night, it had roused her. And so, she had tried to intervene, tried to get them to stop bickering amongst themselves. And then he struck. She could still feel the pain she first felt when he struck her. That was something that never went away. (edited)
The caliginous she-cat had been half paying attention when the apprentice had approached her, lost as always in her own fool’s paradise. You couldn’t tell, thankfully, from the expression she had on, but it took her a second to regain her bearings. Verdigris flames locked target on the apprentice as his voice registered and a small smile crept upon her lips. ”Not in the slightest. In fact, you’re right on time,” came her antiphon as she rose to all four paws, turning back to face him again. ”Come along, I’m going to show you the territory,” again, her tone was even and gentle, a respectful flame lit in the back of her throat as she turned back, ready to begin their journey. smokingshore & gullypaw | slice of life | @Soop
Soop 23-Dec-21 07:48 PM
Gullypaw @peri™ "Oh, good." The apprentice let out a small breath of relief, a short exhale of air that billowed near his muzzle, only to flutter away the slightest before disappearing with a swirl. "Yes, Smokingshore." Obediently, the apprentice offered her a respectful dip of his head, then followed her at an even pace as she got up and began to pad forward. The notion of bowing your head to your superior was one that Gracklequiver had taught him as a kitten. She had looked so excited for him to become an apprentice. It made him quite depressed to think about, but he tried waving the thought away before he let that familar feeling well up in the bottom lid of his eye. Luckily, nature gave him a reason to feel better, as a snowflake drifted down from above, landing perfectly on his nose before melting at the stark contrast of temperatures. In turn, it made the small tabby sneeze. Embarrassed, he shook his head, letting out a small sniffle to clear out his nostrils. As Smokingshore led the way, he couldn't help but keep examining his surroundings. He never knew how cruel yet so beautiful leaf-bare could be, like a rose. It had its gorgeous, sweet-smelling petals, but the thorns were a different kind of story. Catching the slightest notion of his mentor glancing over at him, Gullypaw craned his neck to look at her for a moment, before turning his head away to look at some very pretty icicles. Then, a question surfaced in his mind. "Hey, Smokingshore?" he mewed softly, looking over at the dark-coated warrioress again. "Is it always this pretty in leaf-bare?" He paused for a moment, watching his small paws turn up the snow under his steps, leaving nothing but an odd patterned trail of slush behind him. Then, he asked, "Do you ever get tired of looking at it?" (edited)
peri™ 23-Dec-21 08:44 PM
The esoteric feline had a genuine affinity to the facets of nature no matter what part of it you were discussing with her. There was a certain unseen pulchritude to it that not many seemed to pick up on and it was one that she had revered dearly. At the apprentice’s inquest, the vaporous warioress felt herself slip into a macrocosm of thought, stalling for a second. That word the apprentice had used, pretty, had been subjective in terms of beauty. She had felt herself question the sanctity of the word many times prior, wondering if it still meant now what it had meant before. It was a term of endearment, now more than anything else. She had felt herself slip under this current before, the flux of meddling with intent to learn more. There had been a time, moons upon moons ago, where curiosity was only a mere idea, something people talked about in order to spark conversation. But now it was here. It was real and it was everything she had thought it would be. But alas, that feeling, as raw and visceral as it was, abated soon enough. She knew it would. All good feelings have to come to an end. (edited)
After a moment or two of silence, she felt gravity pull her to earth again and she blinked, her eyes alight with a blaze of glory. He had asked her another question. Luckily for her, the mask change had been swift and quick so that no one could notice she was lost in her own mind again. ”It is. Although pretty is an understatement, I think. Sublime,” she said, pausing to take a breath as she flicked her tail tip, the scar that resided at it’s base showing in the new sunlight. After a moment of blissful silence, she spoke again. ”Do I tire of it? Not in the slightest. In fact, every time I go out, I seem to find something else to love about it,” her voice, then, had lost an edge of it’s gentleness but it had been replaced with a soft note of awe in terms of just how pretty the world really was. Sometimes we underestimate it’s beauty. Finally, the task at hand returned to the forefront of her mind once more and she raised a paw as if to start walking again, looking ahead but speaking one last time: ”Now come along. I’ve got a lot to show you, and I’m sure you’ll marvel at it,” At least, she always did. smokingshore & gullypaw | slice of life | @Soop
prim 25-Dec-21 08:57 PM
{Laurelstar} | Sunkit | present
The leader could understand the young kit's curiosity at the happenings outside of the nursery. Such commotion wasn't commonplace within the confines of the quarry, chatter between warriors about construction as well as cooperation in organizing supplies for further use. Sunkit would come to understand in time, for this was the prime season for reinforcing the dens around camp. Her naivete was amusing to say the least. "Well, if the noise is bothering you, you can come by me and we can drown it out by talking. I don't mind hanging out." The ThunderClan leader had made it a habit in the past to be approachable, despite her would-be scary exterior to kits who considered her a stranger. Kits who might think she'd eat them for breakfast, kits who thought she'd turn them to stone with one mean glare. It couldn't be farther from the truth, for kits at least. Soop 26-Dec-21 09:32 PM
Gullypaw @peri™ Gullypaw gazed up at his alluring cat of a mentor as she opened her sleek, small jaws to respond. Hearing her smoky yet sweetened voice sent a tingle down his spine - he felt lucky to have such a molly for his mentor. He felt as if she was too good for just little old him. Was that weird? Blushing a bit from his own consciousness, Gullypaw fought with himself internally, trying to decide on a determinate subject to think about. He was so submerged in his hurricane of introspections that it made him jump when Smokingshore spoke once more. He felt guilt for not listening before, a sea of clashing emotions in his mind palace making him dizzy all of a sudden, but it all was erased when she recited another sentence. I've got a lot to show you, and I'm sure you'll marvel at it. His heart quickened, excitement welling in his heart and reaching his face, where a blossoming expression of energy reached his features. When he was happy, he looked much better. Such a smile so sweet was in need of protectment - the giver himself was blind to his own beauty. -
"You will, really? I mean, I've never..." As they trekked on in the blanket of white, snow clumping 'round their ankles and their toes sodden and frozen, Gullypaw once again gazed down at the ground, a little too embarrassed to meet Smokingshore's glistering irises. "I know you're my mentor and all, but...No one has really, erm, invited me like that...I, it's nice, but I can't help feeling a little weird...uuu, my chest is getting warm." He mumbled that last muse to himself, feeling his cheeks redden. Smokingshore must think he was an idiot now. That, or that he was depraved of socialization. To which, that wasn't awfully incorrect. Wrenpaw, the beige and brown apprentice and a denmate of his, was the one to finally comfort him in his ocean of sorrows that he was drowning in, and he felt completely estranged from that feeling of warmth at first. It made him anxious to think that he was different from the others. All he wanted was a normal life. Was that so much to ask for...? Gullypaw shook his head. Maybe he was just....overthinking. This was his first training session since Gracklequiver had passed away protecting him. He needed to stay calm. Maybe if he got through this, everything would eventually go back to normal. He'd learn more. He'd grow. Maybe, just maybe make a friend or two. He wanted to make his grandmother proud of him. But how could he ever do that if he kept dwelling on the past? But...he couldn't just forget what happened. The leer in the demonic spirit's eyes, Gracklequiver's scream doused with her own ichor, and the sickening thud of her body at the ground. The carmine liquid spattering his paws.... No. Stop that. Stop thinking about it. Gullypaw huffed, a small cloud of air puffing out near his nose. He decided he'd try and keep calm today and relax. He needed to, if he were to ever progress. He had to do it, for his future. - (edited)
With a new determination alight in his oculars, he tore through the snow, bounding forward and leaving heavy imprints in the ground. For her.
~Swift~ 27-Dec-21 11:35 AM
∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ & MarigoldDust
Pity for Hire
Stepping beyond the borders of clan camp was now something the Bengal-Savannah feline had to think about before doing so. No longer a should he? but a could he? Patrols were sent out - it was a peculiar feeling; being able to tell what his former equals should do. To order them about. There was a hunting patrol sent out with a couple of cats, they should be fine. He could have helped but not there was an anchor keeping him here. He was an asset that simply can not go out and frolic. And so, the multicoloured masculine kept in his spot, pale manus disturbing the snow beneath as his weight shifted from one column to another. But on the topic otherwise, the bachelor had intentions with reconnecting with individuals he had not in a long time shared a conversation with for a while. One of which was MarigoldDust. It was a significant point to be made that to this bachelor - it felt like yesterday that he helped the feline in the hunters crouch and such as a kit to prepare for apprenticeship. Time flew. It waited for nobody. And naturally, like anyone else could have, Alerce did sometimes put pause on his own life. He needed a breather. He needed to let days, weeks, and maybe even moons go by in a blur. His head was underwater. Today, breathing had never felt so great. @Springy 🦤
