fuzzy's beagle :) 27-Dec-21 11:53 AM
The morning light pierces through the darkness like a razor knife cutting through Scotch tape, slowly waking up the lazy brown tabby cat. That lazy cat was none other than Brownstripe. His muscular features told others he was disciplined and diligent; but, when it came to waking up, his muscles did him no good. Looking away from the sunlight and gathering up all the warmth from the sun only strengthened his resolve to not move from his position. No. Get up! Get up you stupid mousebrain. You got things to do. Get up! Get the hell up! Like always, his more sensible side of his mind betrays his will to sleep again. Getting up was a struggle and the strong muscles he had worked so hard to gain did nothing to help him as he stumbled a bit to gain balance. Come on. A warrior never accepts defeat. A warrior never quits. He told himself and turns towards the entrance, which was a bad idea. My eyes! Holy mother of- My eyes! ARGH. The brown tabby quickly covers his eyes with one paw and walks out of the den. Fortunately, his eyes adjusted to the brightness of the day and he was able to examine the camp to see if anything new was occurring. @~Swift~
~Swift~ 27-Dec-21 12:54 PM
∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ & BrownStripe @fuzzy's beagle :)
Meek and the Bold
Darkness was a concept many touched for the sake of exterior understanding, but only to abandon it without further chase. Few delved further into the concept of this subject to beyond simply the exterior and taste the bitter interior of it. There was more to the absence of light than the colours and antics. But of course, further analyzing would offer the exercised truths and theories that darkness was actually not as literal as light. Darkness - despite being the genesis of everything, was more illustrative than light. A powerful opposite nonetheless. This polychromatic combatant himself had risen with the sun. It was nothing more of a habit for the bachelor apart from finding the need to escape dreams no matter their luxurious value. Alerce was a self sabotaging individual so much so that he often envied the effortless self respect others had of letting themselves sleep in even as the sun climbing higher from the horizon. Eventually they all filed up a few hours after the sun bent long shadows across the campsite from the treetops. One included Brownstripe - to Alerces fortune being of spirit to go hunting with, even if they seemed to be temporarily distracted by the bright light of day. The sun was usually strongest in leaf bare after all. "BrownStripe," Authority and confidence rippled from the demeanor of this newly appointed deputy. "Let's go hunting," The warrior needed to wake up after all and a hunting expedition often did the trick.
Springy 🦤 27-Dec-21 01:08 PM
Marigolddust - Alerceclaw
- Present - Change... it was an idea that Marigolddust had grown to dislike quite strongly. It always brought misfortune with it, despite the occasional good that came as a result of it's visit, and was never a comfortable thing. Yet, even with this strong opinion, he couldn't stop it. The only cats that could were the ones who were walking above his head, although the light of the sun had brought them into hiding. Unfortunately, they didn't seem to think it was very important to stop all of the misfortune that had managed to find Thunderclan. Instead, they let more and more of it come to the camp, hitting the cats who were a part of the group with more trouble than they had had for moons. Marigolddust wasn't an acceptation to this; if anything, he might have been one of the cats who had had to go through the most change. Going from a warrior residing in the medicine cat's den to the medicine cat himself was one of the biggest alterations, along with the fact that he had to deal with not having his best friend by his side anymore. Every time he thought too hard on where Fernpaw might be or whether she would return, his heart ached, serving to be more painful than it was worth. Yet, he couldn't stop himself from wondering. Had she joined Starclan? Why hadn't she visited him in his dreams yet? She could do that now, couldn't she? Or was she restricted? Or... or did she not want to see him?
- The grey tuxedo's muzzle wrinkled as he scowled at himself. He shouldn't be occupied with these thoughts- he had to focus on the now, and that "now" needed as much attention as he could give it. Leaf-bare had hit the forest clans, and he was less than unprepared. Raising a paw, he gently tried to wipe the stressed thoughts out of his mind. Okay, so, what was his plan today? Slowey, he looked around his den and at the decrease in patients that occupied it's nests. Well, that was a good sign, and it meant that he had the chance to collect as many herbs as he could. Although, how many6 he would be able to find at this time of the year, he wasn't sure. His chest began to ache as anxiety crawled deeper and deeper inside of it, making it feel as if some sort of infection he had yet to learn about had plagued him. He took in a deep breath in the hopes to get rid of it and stood from where he was. The least he could do was try and find any herbs, right? Right. Yes, that was what he would do. But he couldn't go alone. He had learned that lesson when Wolfprowl had had to save him from the dog that had ambushed him while he had been searching for catnip. So, he might he be able to bother to join him?
- A certain cat had been on the young medicine cat's mind ever since the last meeting that Laurelstar had brought together. Alerceclaw was a cat he knew, or at least used to know, and had once looked up to. Ever since he had become an apprentice, though, the two hadn't really spoken, and things had become a little... awkward, between them. Now, the same warrior who had taught him how to do the hunters crouch for the first time was the next in line to take Laurelstar's place. Conversing with the new deputy was nearly inevitable, not matter how reluctant Mariglddust had been to approach a conversation that would surely be as awkward as he expected it to be. Alerceclaw was a good cat, of course, and Marigolddust liked to consider the two to be on good terms, but he was never the best cat at solving situations that weren't the most comfortable. If anything, he always managed to make it even worse. What type of reintroduction would that be? A terrible one, that was for sure, yet he couldn't prevent it. Maybe inviting the deputy to join him on a herb-gathering trip would give them a good opportunity to talk. Although, it hadn't seemed like Alerceclaw had been very intent on leaving the camp ever since he had earned his new rank.
- What if he doesn't accept? Marigolddust thought quietly to himself, hesitating for just a moment, rather than taking the first step out of his den. Well, if he didn't accept, that would be fine. Marigolddust could spare a few moments that he could spend preventing the problems he would certainly encounter later in the season... yes, of course he could. If it turned out necessary, Marigolddust could just act like he was talking to a patient. That always made the whole preventing-awkwardness thing work- well, usually. Taking in a deep breath once more, Marigolddust finally managed to get himself to pad out of his den and into the outside world. The first thing that hit him was the cold. Almost immediately, Marigolddust shivered, unable to hold back his distaste for the low temperatures. Being chilly was yet another thing he didn't enjoy very much, and yet another thing that Leaf-bear brought him. Carefully, he raised his paw, trying to wipe off what snow had clung to his paw pads before taking another step, only gaining more snow in his fur. He had forgotten how hard it was to avoid the snow, and despite how magical it seemed, he found himself sighing, disappointed. Well, he would have to try and warm himself again once he got back to his den... which, surprisingly, was much warmer than the camp, having had multiple cats inside to provide it with body heat. Squinting, Marigolddust looked away from his paw and to the bright environment that displayed itself in front of him. The sunlight that bounced off of the white surface of the snow was blinding, but he just managed to catch sight of familiar tuxedo fur. Alright, this is it, he thought, biting his tongue nervously as he slowly made his way to the older tom. "Um... hey Alerceclaw," he greeted, giving the warrior a sheepish, perhaps a bit nervous, smile. "How are you today?" @~Swift~
fuzzy's beagle :) 27-Dec-21 02:32 PM
Brownstripe had two choices: to spend his time in solitude or go out and make more friends. Because he was more of an extrovert, one choice had a mountain of more votes than the other. The previous lethargy he had quickly washed away when he felt the excitement of going hunting on his own. Today was the day he was going to surprise Thunderclan by securing the largest amount of prey any warrior could ever hunt. It was a challenge he gave to himself to maintain his motivation to support the clan with food during leafbare. Unexpectedly, all of that motivation was lost when he heard his name called. "What!?" He shouts with an annoyed voice and turns to the cat who said his name. Immediately, he straightens his back and moves to the position of attention. Oh snap. It was the deputy himself and the foolish brown tabby had just yelled at him. "Oh it's you, Alerceclaw! Oh... Well let's go hunting! Great idea!" He laughs sheepishly. Of course, he had to start off the day snapping at the new deputy. What else can go wrong? What other shenanigans could he accidentally do that would further dig himself deeper into the rabbit hole of unrelenting failure? @~Swift~
Cryptic 28-Dec-21 12:15 AM
Bandit | @prim Blue and Green optics widened, filled with curiosity as he looked up at the barrier. He was relieved that they finally arrived but he had to fight his shivering body to stay standing. The last thing he wanted was to collapse in front of the powerful leader. Bandit took his mind off his aching body to listen to Laurelstar, nodding along with what she was saying. "Wait. I can decide to stay?" He questioned as if he had heard her wrong. He had no clue what it meant to be a clan cat, so the thought of everyone accepting him seemed impossible. Would he even want to stay? He supposed he would just have to wait and see. Even if he did decide he wanted to stay, it was not his say in the end anyways. The tom looked towards the camps entrance, his mind now racing with endless outcomes. "Alright. Sounds fair enough... I'm ready." Bandit watched Laurelstar walk through before taking in a deep breath, then following. The scent of Thunderclan quickly became overpowering as they descended the tunnel, his cold nose twitching as he took it all in. His ears stood high, the commotion growing louder, then finally many cats came across his vision as they entered into the camp. His eyes grew wide as he took in his new surroundings. "I've never seen so many cats in one place before!" He stated more to himself as he marveled. Bandit's amazement quickly dwindled however as the tiny tom started to notice a few pairs of eyes on him. He suddenly felt small under the burning gazes, his own eyes shying away and down to his paws. He hoped he would make a good first impression. (edited)
tremb 28-Dec-21 08:10 PM
Wrenpaw 🍃 Wrenpaw craned her neck around to gently groom around the wounds that etched her flanks, cleaning the golden fur around it but careful not to lick them directly. Though mostly healed, the fresh scar tissue was still quite tender and sore to the touch. Still, Wrenpaw was glad she didn’t have to worry about accidentally reopening them anymore. It made training, hunting, and the rest of her apprentice duties much easier. She had tuned out her surroundings, so when Foxpaw greeted her she flinched quite violently, her amber eyes stretched wide as they fell upon his face. She laughed it off, feeling a bit embarrassed at being so startled by a greeting from her denmate. ”Oh, hi, Foxpaw! Sorry, I guess I’m a bit jumpy these days,” she said. Of course, the apprentice had every good reason to be so on edge. It was often hard to remind herself that she was safe now, and no cat was out to get her. She hadn’t spoken to Foxpaw since they had both been kits, and she was rather pleased that he had decided to come and talk to her. It would be nice to catch up with someone she considered an old friend. Of course, Wrenpaw considered nearly every cat she met a friend. ”I’m doing…” she paused, her features looking almost thoughtful for a brief moment before she continued. ”Good. I’m good,” she concluded with a little smile. It had been a while since she had been able to say that and actually mean it. She had been fortunate enough not to lose any cat close to her during the battle, although she was well aware that not many cats in the clan had been so lucky. Wrenpaw had recovered physically, and mentally she was working on putting everything behind her. ”How about you?” She reciprocated the question with a slight tilt of her head, still sporting her usual cheerful smile. ”It looks like you’ve been hard at work,” she mused, noting the moss and fern pieces clinging to his pelt. @cobra
prim 29-Dec-21 12:11 AM
{Laurelstar} | Bandit | past II
The leader of ThunderClan had returned to camp with a new face in tow, but she did not appear fearful or on edge. She was leading the young tom into her camp willingly, and she was shooting her clanmates a look that indicated there was no threat from the stranger’s scent that was flooding their senses. She nodded to the former kittypet who had been following after her to make his appearance in camp, watching as he entered her home with an awestruck expression upon his features. He already was drawing more attention to himself, and it gave the leader some reason for concern. She might have to act as a flesh shield for the poor thing if she wasn’t careful in how he was introduced. Still, she was the ThunderClan leader here, she’d tell them not to tear him apart. ”Hey! Hey! Don’t look at him like that, he’s staying with us for a while. My orders, he’s to be trained with the other apprentices.” she growled out towards some of the more hostile-appearing figures she could spot, her bushy tail lashing around behind her as she stood her ground. Better to assert herself in her decision now, she wasn’t going to let another dead kittypet show up in camp. It’d be strange for it to have happened twice, totally morbid. ”Welcome to ThunderClan’s camp, Bandit. The apprentice’s den over there is where you will be staying for now.” the brawny tortoiseshell pointed to the cave that made up the apprentice’s den on the opposite wall from where they stood, her scowl being replaced with an easygoing smile. ”As for you wanting to stay, its a matter of whether you feel as if you’d like to join our clan— but its not that simple. It’d mean you’d swear loyalty to us and the Warrior Code we abide by. Betrayal and treason are high crimes here, I highly suggest you do not break our trust.” her voice grew increasingly more bitter, but she was not going to reveal the fact her clan had practically torn itself apart when traitors were discovered amongst their ranks— and was the reason why she was even leader now in the first place. They had forced her predecessor to give up her lives in exchange for her own, but she was thankful Iceheart was alive… Even if she couldn’t remember her, she wished she could help her regain what she had lost from her incredible sacrifice. ”Again, if you wish to stay, it is not a guarantee. I will allow my clanmates a say in the matter. Though many of them have come from outside our borders, you are hardly the first kittypet we’ve had join our ranks. Just prove yourself and I’m sure they’ll accept you… If you want to stay, of course. Again, no pressure.” After losing five grown warriors, we need all the strength we can get. I need to get our apprentices trained and ready for battle in case we need to defend ourselves this season. @Cryptic

~Swift~ 29-Dec-21 05:17 PM
∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ & MarigoldDust
Pity for Hire
Change. Seemed to be the topic of things recently despite this individuals antipathy towards the subject. Change. He was force fed this subject matter by the nauseating heaping spoonful. It was constant and persistent. And there was no stopping - Alerce had come to realize early on. There was no stopping because otherwise you were dragged by the bullet train of time. So it was either being dragged till your character was no longer familiarized to you, or scrambling to keep up - or try to keep up. And only recently had this bachelor come to terms with himself. Stay one step ahead. Sleepless nights and overthought actions resulting in staying one step ahead. Was it worth it? Possibly. Because here he was; one step ahead and deputy of Thunderclan. Change. Twas a fickle creature. The sun had climbed up from the horizon now capable of watching over its realm. To which Alerce had only acknowledged with a simply glance, but of course, one could not simply stare at the sun. The bright rays mocked its contestant until the oddly patterned gladiator lowered his gaze elsewhere. An eventful morning, vigorous potent had only now settled into camp, rolling his scalpulae to release any bothersome knots from solitude patrol. There was a vital point to patrolling alone in contrast to patrolling with a coterie of others. Although it was a less persistent preference today than it was before.
The previous leader; IceStar had made sure to open his mind on cooperation with the cat amongst the clan. Cooperation and dependence on others. His worries no longer lay on them making far too much noise but instead, them getting injured. Development in his psyche wasa gradual, impressive journey. But alas, what had instigated this flexible behavior? In a perfect world, he would mention MarigoldDust. But Mari had only been a fraction of the trigger to this form of development. Mari had offered the weighted prominence of the new generation and considered amaranthine patience. Patience that eventually prolonged their interaction to eventually none at all. The two had not spared either a word for a long time. The now medicine cat had earned his place in the ranks sooner than Alerce had - and by all means, the tuxedo deserved it. Just as the day Alerce witnessed his promotion, he still believed Mari deserved it. Showing dedication and nix of despondency. Marigold was an ambitious feline all his life. Almost made it seems as if the position was made him rather than the other way around. So of course, them sharing the trilateral clan ranks, speaking with the medicine cat was ineluctable. "Hey AlerceClaw," Speak of the devil. The swivel of this sires cranial function was met with the subject in psyche. MarigoldDust. "MarigoldDust," Being deputy did not give him an excuse not to still respectfully dip his head to the other. The position much taken for granted, Mari had the knowledge to save a life. Killing was not a tough task - as rare as it was.
And killing or breaking or damaging something in any way can take 2 seconds. But healing? Healing requires patience. Healing can take forever. Patience. Mari stood for the virtue in Alerce's eyes. Nothing compared to the patience this medicine cat had in his body. It was envious. "I am doing well," Sitting up, this polychromatically pigmented celibate feline still managed to tower over the other. Genes. Thunderclan was governed by two mesomorphic behemoths. "And you?" It was the most tongue mockingly formal conversation ever. Alerce internally cringed at it. But you couldn't blame them; it has been a while since they last spoke. "It's good to see you, Mari." @Springy 🦤

∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ & BrownStripe
Meek and the Bold
The was once a time Alerce had seriously considered either choices to oppose the other. To spend his time in solitude or to go out and made more friends. His life has leaked into every possibly crevice of personality it could to finally settle into the one he had now. Stability. Thank Starclan for it. It was the figurative act of tasting all forms of sustenance to finally settle on one. Development. One simply could not escape it. The vanguard of obfuscated jurisdiction above sure did like to mold the mortals down below. "What?" Snappiness was a dreadful sound from others. Alerce's crown tilted and not the physiognomy of sheepishness nor question appeared on his features but stern dislike of the tone. Even if he weren't deputy, the toms response was inadequate. But he was deputy and this response only offered even more weighted dislike. "Surely you don't talk to your fellow clanmates like that," He urged the others acceptance to hunt with a flick of his tail, turning to head to beyond the camp grounds. tremb 29-Dec-21 05:39 PM
Wrenpaw |ThunderClan apprentice| Outside of camp? A pondering expression took over Wrenpaw’s features for a moment, honey colored gaze drifting towards the camp entrance. Apprentices hadn’t been allowed out of the camp on their own since the warriors had been trapped inside after the landslide. Wrenpaw had never been one for breaking rules, and she wasn’t about to start now. Still, there was probably no harm in them going outside of camp if they stayed close. ”Well, there is a place just outside where we sometimes gather moss for new nests. It’s within view of the camp entrance, so I’m sure it would be just fine. We could collect some moss for the elders! They’d really appreciate that. We could get clovers there too and just bring them back with us,” she suggested. It sounded like a good idea, and the molly didn’t think they’d get in any trouble for it either. It would only take them away from camp for a brief while. Her smile faded as she watched his gaze darken, and she knew he was thinking about his grandmother. She had never known Gracklequiver personally, but it was no secret that the pair had been very close. She gave him a sympathetic look, taking a few steps to stand at his side and resting her tail comfortingly over his shoulders. ”We don’t have to go out. I’m sure there’s plenty of fun things we can do right here in the safety of the camp,” she purred cheerfully. (Sorry this took so long!) @Soop

Her tail swayed over the snowy earth, as she glanced about, settling down a short distance away in case something happened from within the nursery, it would make the potentially urgent trip rather quick though with her own two already a couple of moons old, she didn't have many worries over whether or not they'd get in trouble. Her stubby, fluffy tail waved back and forth as she made her way back into camp, two rats hanging from her jaws. She spotted a resting queen nearby the nursery, and decided to share her spare kill. Her large paws treaded heavily along the murky earth as she made her way towards the sullen she, quietly setting the mouse down in front of her. "Morning. Just caught these and you looked hungry." She chirped, settling down a few tail-lengths away from the queen. She wasn't familiar with this feline, but Wisteriacloud always appreciated company and her presence was quite pleasant to most. Plus- Wisteria loved kits, and making friends with the queens guaranteed her the ability to play with some cute kits in the future. Her tail curled over her paws as she looked down at her prey, stomach rumbling. @wild™
prim 30-Dec-21 02:41 AM
{Laurelstar} | Sunkit | past II
The behemoth let out a small yawn as she inspected the camp with heavy-lidded eyes. A lazy smile had planted itself upon her features as she felt herself relax a bit as she was speaking to the young kitten at her side. Idle chatter with someone no bigger than a rabbit, always entertaining to her. ”Of course they do, but they also have training to focus on. This is secondary to that.” she nodded, answering the kit’s question with a flick of her tail. She could see a few gathering supplies for the warriors around camp, but for the most part, an apprentice’s duty was to train so they could become a warrior one day. They needed as many as they could get now that they were down eight of them. Great StarClan… I still can’t wrap my head around losing so many cats at once. The battle had wrought death and destruction upon their clan, and its wounds were still prevalent. Laurelstar had been trying to alleviate the problem, but it was proving to be quite the challenge. ”So when you’re an apprentice, be sure to work extra hard in training, so you can get big and strong.” she chuckled quietly, trying to deflect the grim and morose feelings she was experiencing in this moment with humor, putting up a front that everything would be fine. wild™ 01-Jan-22 06:12 PM
- ───────── 𝐅𝐔𝐂𝐇𝐒𝐈𝐀𝐁𝐔𝐑𝐍 !! // THUNDERCLAN QUEEN
To be honest, being among the nursery was quick to become less than desirable, exhausting even. Though the pointed molly did care for her offspring and loved them dearly, some days that old spirit would overwhelm her with desires to hunt and slay among the territory. Yet, she couldn't bear to leave her kits for that long - especially with having to nurse another litter alongside caring for her own biological two, things were quick to grow complicated. Fuchsiaburn allowed for a sigh to escape her, tattered tail twitching occasionally. Mismatched eyes caught sight of the approach of another feline, raising her head slightly as the warrior approached. Her whiskers quivered as a mouse was placed before her, a brow raising slightly as a greeting was spared from the other molly. Another thing she wasn't exactly fond of - being brought things she could easily get herself. "Did I?" she inquired sharply, eyes poised upon the warrior who stood before her. "Well, I suppose I could use something to eat regardless, but I could've easily gotten myself a morsel of prey myself." she added after a moment, tail lashing. "Though, I appreciate your...generosity. How are you this morning?" she inquired afterwards, tone softening a tad. @trainwreck
Soop 02-Jan-22 10:52 AM
Gullypaw @tremb Gullypaw jerked a bit as Wrenpaw draped her tail over his shoulders, though quickly untensed. He appreciated her comforting words, but not all the dark swirls of rememberance vanished from his apple-green gaze. He wasn't really sure what to say at the moment, but didn't have the heart to excuse himself and leave, so he just gave her a tense nod, small claws flexing in the frozen ground. Frost was beginning to creep up the blades of grass and it made his paws quite sodden, but he wasn't going to let every little thing ruin his day. He had a habit of getting overwhelmed but since Wrenpaw was here he didn't wanna make it unpleasant for her. "W-we can, er..." Gullypaw trailed off, trying to think of things to do. He hadn't spent much time playing games with the other kits in the nursery - instead, he preferred sleeping or talking to Gracklequiver, who was basically his only friend. He had been too shy to actually participate so he didn't know of many games to play. But, one thing did come to mind, that he had discovered as a kitten. But he had it buried deep back in his memories. Dusting off the fragile memory and placing it back on the shelf, the visuals and sounds all popped back in his little mind, and he looked over to the tan and brown molly. "I just thought of something. Here, this way." Gullypaw turned to the left and began padding quietly with his head held a little higher. They were proceeding to the nursery now, but not inside it - rather around it, to the back where it was more secluded. Bracken and undergrowth protruded from all sides, making it hard for the both of them to fit, but it didn't matter to Gullypaw. He was much more focused on the frost-rimed flowers in front of him, somehow still intact with white ice crystals specking their purple petals and olive leaves. "Here they are," Gullypaw said softly. (edited)
prim 02-Jan-22 08:23 PM
{Laurelstar} | Vanillakit | future I
The air was filled with a light chill as the zephyrs of leaf-bare had descended upon the clans like a frigid blight. The atmosphere at night felt thick, almost as if the very air they breathed had been frozen solid by the freezing temperatures that had made their debut at the start of this harsh season. While she, the ThunderClan leader, had survived many a leaf-bare, she knew others weren't so lucky. They did not have the thick coat she did, one that grew even more dense and long at the start of winter, one that shielded her from the cold for the most part. Hence why they had focused on repairing the dens around camp, while the efforts had been wrapped up and completed, she still was the paranoid sort. Inspecting each and every den to ensure everyone was warm and safe from the elements, especially the kits of her clan. Laurelstar always had a soft spot for them. The nursery had checked out to her standards, and she let out a sigh of relief. Normally her father would have had it ship shape a while ago, but since his passing it had fallen to her and the warriors of ThunderClan to keep up with its maintenance. She kept his legacy alive by looking after any and all kits she encountered, and she was glad his lessons of kindness towards those who could not defend themselves seemed to have a lasting impact upon the clan. She only wished she too could leave behind such an important legacy to uphold. Not soon though, I plan to lead this clan for a long time, and we still have a lot of healing to do. We will be strong. The kits were the foundation of their clan, the next generation they would pass the torch of leadership to, the ones who would inherit this clan from them. Thus it was important they prioritized their development and protection within these walls. Laurelstar would make sure the youths of her clan would become some of the greatest warriors the forest would ever know. They needed them now more than ever. @Soop

"I promise to do my best when I become an apprentice." the young she-kit said confidently to Laurelstar. She was mostly unaware of the fight that had happened in the camp since she was asleep in the nursery with Swiftstorm watching over her. @prim (sorry it's very short my brain is going burrr)
Soop 02-Jan-22 10:02 PM
Vanillakit @prim The night was dark. The shadows cut deep into the frost-rimed branches and the snow-blanketed grass, the air heavy with the bitter chill of leaf-bare. Though the twilight ether shone with the brilliance of Silverpelt up overhead, the moon was not present tonight. A thick sheet of fluffy, grayed clouds hogged the beauty of the darkened empyrean, shedding nothing but its silent tears onto the ground, only adding to the thick cloak of white that seemed to be neverending with leaf-bare. Even with the chilly weather, though, the cats of the Clans below found their way through the frozen barrier of winter. Soon enough, with the force of their calloused pads, this subzero wall, no longer glistening like ice, would crack and crack until they finally broke through to newleaf. Improvisations, though temporary, had been made - most warriors and apprentices slept pressed against one another for warm, and the queens, their young, and the elders all got the extra moss that could be found. Soft breathing emitted from the huts of the warriors and apprentices, as did the nursery with the milky scent stronger than ever. Gentle snores rasped through the air, the only noise that was just loud enough to break the hushed, almost eerie silence of midnight. Everyone was asleep. Or so, it was thought. -
The soft crunching of the russet-and-white sovereign's paws against the snow underpaw was barely audible to the members of ThunderClan, her steps light and quiet as she trod in the camp, making sure that not one kitten sniffled or a warrior shivered. But, even though Laurelstar was trying her best to be silent, her activities did not go unnoticed. The eyelids of a small, cream tabby kitten, her markings akin to the unseeable stars shining overhead, slowly fluttered open, little ears swiveling slightly as the ragged song of snow underpaw funneled into her ears. Now, who could that be? the darling girl thought curiously in her head, mismatched gaze innocent. Glancing over at Palesheen and her siblings to make sure they stayed awake, the older kit rose from her resting spot, padding out hurriedly into the snow. Immediately a frigid breeze buffeted her downy coat, not one she could stand well, but something else had piqued her interest. A tall, lone figure, the blackened camoflage of night coating her fur. If she squinted, she could just make out darker markings. But, since not much could be seen, the little one decided she'd go and investigate herself. With a few steps forward, the snow soaking through her ankles, she asked with a voice so soft and delicate - "Hello? Might anyone be there?"
Springy 🦤 03-Jan-22 04:55 PM
Marigolddust - Alerceclaw
- Present - Patience. It was a virtue that Margiolddust was fortunate enough to have, although so many cats weren't so lucky. More often than not, Marigolddust could pick at least twice the amount of impatient cats as he could with patient ones, although he knew that doing such a thing might have been viewed as judgmental and rude, so he never actually did it, at least not on purpose. Some cats were, clearly, less patient than others, and sometimes it was too apparent to be missed, even if you tried to. One such impatient cat was Cloverpaw. Despite how fond he was of her, he could never avoid the fact that he viewed her as a little... well, he would rather describe her as a fem who wasn't very interested in waiting for something to come when she could make it arrive faster. Or, at least, that was what he had seen so far- he would never tell her about it, of course, and even if he did, he would make sure to add the fact that it could sometimes be enduring. But, personally, Marigolddust didn't exactly recognize the character trait in himself, neither patience or impatience. He hadn't really thought of it much at all, and, in all honesty, would rather try and focus on others, rather than himself. Perhaps it was his selflessness that made him so patient? You had to wait for others to finish speaking or dealing with what life had in store for them, and he wasn't a cat who was going to interrupt the process. Even so, it would be a lie if some cat said that he didn't have the virtue. He sometimes made it much more clear than he intended to, and sometimes he used it without even realizing. One such time was his and Alerceclaw's friendship. After the warrior had taught him the hunters crouch as a kitten, Marigolddust had always wanted to try and locate Alerceclaw again and boast about how well he was doing, or how scared he had made his siblings... but it didn't work out that way.
- With changes came the earning and loosing of abilities, and one of the abilities that Marigolddust had lost becoming an apprentice was time. He had never really had time to try and find Alerceclaw once his training had begun, and after he had lost his sister and his mother's neglect towards him and his remaining siblings began... well, it was difficult, to put it simply. Most of the time that he had had to himself he had spent with Fernpaw, unless she had been busy with Beetlestreak. His best friend had never failed to keep him busy and put a smile on his face, even if she couldn't train by his side as he and she had dreamed of as kits. And, eventually, everything else got in the way of the littler things, such as childhood idols. And, with that, his and Alerceclaw's relationship had slowly dwindled out into the shadow of the past, and they hadn't had much reason to converse again... until now, that is. Marigolddust couldn't help but be uncomfortable, unsure exactly how he should act or what he should say to the deputy. He felt as if he was going through a test that, if he didn't pass, he couldn't give it another try, rather than the idyll scene it was in reality. The sun was high in the sky, beaming down at all of the cats below, and the snow glimmered and sparkled under the happy light, accompanied only by the gentle song of the bare branches brushing against one another above the two toms' heads. Yet, for Marigolddust, he heard another noise, too, no matter how dramatic it was. His heart beat in his ears, and he could almost feel his face heating up as a sheepish smile was displayed across his features, watching as Alerceclaw dipped his head to the medicine cat. Kit me would have freaked at this, he thought, but he ignored the thought soon after and let it drift to the back of his mind on the river of thoughts that was ever present in his mind.
- Returning the gesture, Marigolddust brought up enough courage to speak. "You too, Alerceclaw. And I'm... I'm doing well, thank you," he responded, a kind look in his eyes despite how nervous he felt. The first thing he had to focus on was not letting himself trip over his own words. If he couldn't take himself seriously, then how could Alerceclaw? Taking in a deep breath, Marigolddust took his time in exhaling, although he made the action subtle enough to almost be unnoticeable. "I was... wondering, if maybe you'd be interested in going herb gathering with me?" he asked, before continuing, his words slowly leaving his mouth at a faster and faster rate as his anxiety began to take control of his tongue, "There's not many herbs out there anymore, but if we can find anything it would be a success. You don't have to, of course." As he finished, he found his tail hugging close to his flank, and he was acutely aware of how stiff he was standing as he awaited a response. @~Swift~ So sorry this took so long! I could've sworn I replied to this HAHA))

prim 04-Jan-22 03:07 PM
{Laurelstar} | Sunkit | past II
Kits were always easy for her to talk to, they always had questions to ask, they wanted to learn everything there was to know about the world from the adults around them. She always indulged them in the more innocent of questions, “how long is my apprenticeship would last?”, “can I learn how to fight right away?”. It was silly, but all kits weren’t born with omnipotence. They deserved to know what they were getting into, and she didn’t mind sharing whatever knowledge she gained over the years as a warrior, deputy, and now a leader, with them. ”I’m sure you will, are you looking forward to your training? You’ll get to explore the forest with your mentor and learn many things. Is there anything you want to learn in particular?” she tilted her head slightly to the side, watching the kit who was looking up to her. She seemed unphased, might have missed the chaos of the battle that had ravaged their camp so recently. Thank StarClan if she did, dealing with such horrific memories so early on can be so damaging. prim 05-Jan-22 12:58 AM
{Laurelstar} | Vanillakit | future I
She never excelled in the art of stealth, that was for certain. Laurelstar was always a large cat, despite starting out as a tiny kit herself, she grew exponentially. Her size, nonetheless, had caused her to stand out like a white-pelted cat standing atop a charcoal-gray stone. The ThunderClan sovereign did not care, she preferred to be seen, she wanted any of her potential foes to know just who they were squaring up against, just who’s wrath they were incurring. Laurelstar was a powerful warrior, and was always the flashy sort. Grand displays of her strength were commonplace, but not to be underestimated… Why would she need to be stealthy if her enemies knew she was going to be present anyways? She didn’t mind the idea of her terrifying presence hanging over their heads like a boogeyman ready to reach out and grab them, they should fear her if they dared make a wrong move against her clan. Yet it was her own fear that prompted her to be doing these routine checks, and she had appeared to awaken one little kitten tonight by mistake. Her eyes widened as she spotted a young cream-colored she-kit, round, owl-like eyes inspecting their surroundings. She could feel them resting on her frame, and she blinked, turning towards the kit and letting out a small, disappointed sigh. ”It’s all right, it’s Laurelstar. I’m just doing a nest-check, making sure everyone is safe in camp. I didn’t mean to wake you.” she didn’t intend to disturb anyone’s rest, much less a young kitten who needed it most. Laurelstar was trying to be careful in her work regarding the monitoring of her clanmates’ wellbeing. The leader had made it a habit since she was appointed as deputy. She took on a more nurturing role, her clanmates were her family to her. For her own peace of mind, she had to check on them all. ”You’re Vanillakit, right? I’m sorry if I woke you up, you should get some rest. It’s not good for someone your age to stay up this late, sleep helps you grow after all.” it was the mother in her to tell this kit it was bedtime, though all of her adoptive kits were apprentices or older— and she doubted she’d adopt any more for the time being. Since her mate, Hollyfrost’s death, it felt like the wrong time, and she couldn’t fathom raising another kit without her by her side. She loved kits, but right now she needed to heal before she ever took on another as her own. I need to focus on the children I already have, they need me now more than ever. Still, that didn’t mean she couldn’t show kindness towards the youth of her clan, after all. @Soop
Cryptic 06-Jan-22 07:55 AM
Bandit | @prim Bandit let out a sigh of relief after Laurelstar came to his defense. It gave him a quick confidence boost and he lifted his head up, trying to put on a brave but unthreatening face. He put his attention back on the leader, focusing on her words and where she was pointing. Her easygoing smile encouraged a bright smile of his own as he followed to where she pointed, looking over the Apprentices den with great interest. Oh how he longed to curl up and sleep right now, the ache in his paws begging for rest. But he needed to listen and learn first. The tom reluctantly forced his gaze away from the warm looking den and back to Laurelstar, nodding along to her words while trying his best not to feel overwhelmed by all the information given to him. "I understand Laurelstar. I'll prove myself, no worries!" He exclaimed quite confidently, head held high. Bandit held the personality of a young, overconfident kittypet, blissfully unaware of Thunderclans recent hardships. Soon he would learn what it truly meant to live in a clan, the tom not prepared for the hard days ahead of him. He would need to work tirelessly for his share and for the approval of these strangers around him, if he did wish to stay. "Whatever you or anyone else needs, I'll do my part and I wont disappoint! I promise." This was a heavy promise to make but one he intended to keep. (Sorry for taking forever to respond!) (edited)
Soop 06-Jan-22 10:10 PM
Vanillakit @prim Another freezing wind stormed past, battering at Vanillakit once again and making her stagger a little; the small kitten didn't weigh much at all, despite already being at four moons old. White-flecked fur akin to the billions of Starclan's glowing eyes above - or so, that's what her mother had said they were - Vanillakit regained her composure just in time to hear the soft, sleepy-edged mew of Laurelstar. Heterochromatic eyes widening ever so slightly, Vanillakit could now recognize more of the ThunderClan sovereign's attributes from her dark silhouette now that she got confirmation that it was her - the fluffy, soft neck fur, the long, notched ears. In fact, the cream tabby seemed to be a little confused as to why she hadn't recognized the russet tortoiseshell in the first place. Fur sleep-rumpled and now windswept, the kitten stifled a shiver and then pranced towards the leader. "Oh no, I mustn't, miss Laurelstar." The little darling's mew was as soft and delicate as that of a daffodil petal. "I'm much more interested in what you're doing now. Besides, based on what I look like, I think it will be quite a while before I grow any more." The light-colored molly, pale stripes practically non-existent in the deep-cutting shadows, tilted her head, soft cheek fur swaying with it. "Whatever are you doing out here though, miss Laurelstar?" she inquired, eyelids fluttering once or twice as a more mellow breeze carried in the night's atmosphere. It was nothing to an average cat, but it looked as if one strong wind could carry Vanillakit away. "It is quite cold," she said with a nod of her head as she spoke, flicking snow off her hind paw, "and my mama says it could get so cold you might freeze to death! I don't want you to freeze, miss. I'd feel terrible." The molly seemed quite good at rambling, but it was all in good intent.

He seemed sincere, and he did impress her back in the forest when he managed to keep up with her and track her down whenever she did get ahead of him. The tortoiseshell leader would be glad to have another apprentice running around camp, a potential new warrior, but Bandit was here temporarily, according to him. Well, if he does decide he wishes to join, he knows who to come to. He wasn't the first to join their esteemed clan from outside their borders, and most certainly would not be the last. Proving himself to the clan through the work he does now from here on out was going to be essential if the clan were to accept him. Arduous training, putting in every effort to bring back prey and to defend the clan even if he hadn't sworn loyalty to them yet. If anyone bothers you, let me know and I can straighten it out. That doesn't mean you can pick on my clanmates either, remember you're our guest. I can just kick you out." prim 08-Jan-22 02:57 PM
{Laurelstar} | Vanillakit | future I
Kits were also stubborn about bedtime, they insisted they could stay up but she had a feeling she might have to return Vanillakit to her mother the moment she finally did fall asleep talking to her. It was a matter of time, and the leader figured she could afford to wait it out, might as well entertain the kit for the time she remained awake for in order to try and allow her to sleep. "Well, as I said before, I'm just making sure everyone is safe in their nests. I know every single cat in the clan, and I look out for them and ensure they are in their nest at night, unless I know if any of the warriors are doing sentry duty." the tortoisehsell femora gestured to the camp entrance with her bushy tail. Topside, outside of the tunnel that led up to the forest, there typically were at least two cats who kept guard of the camp at night. They would signal those who were sleeping if there was danger, or if there was an attack. They were always different cats as well, just to keep it fair within the clan so nobody had an inordinate sleep schedule because of one task. This kit's concern for her well-being was touching, but in truth, Laurelstar wasn't cold in the slightest. Not yet, anyways, tonight was clear for leaf-bare, the stars and the moon were visible, indicating there were no clouds in the sky to conceal them. If it were snowing, she might have thought twice before venturing down into camp in the cold, but this habit she had of checking on her clanmates at night was only a short trip, a head-count if anything. Nothing more. Vanillakit just so happened to spot her as she was making sure every single kit was sleeping in the nursery as they should. "I'll be fine, my fur is so thick that I barely feel the cold. I was only down here making sure everyone was okay, I was going to return to my nest in a little while so I could get some rest myself. It's nice and warm in my den up on the Highledge." that was certainly true, but it felt a little spacious just having the den to herself. It felt lonely, but it was hers, she had to make the best of it. @Soop
Soop 10-Jan-22 05:08 PM
Vanillakit @prim Vanillakit peered at Laurelstar for a moment, taking in her divine appearance. Her grand mane and tall frame looked warm, but she couldn't help but hesitate. Her mama had told her leaders make all kinds of sacrifices for their peers, so she wouldn't put it past Laurelstar to lie so her Clanmates didn't worry. But, it seemed as if the tortoiseshell sovereign was truthfully speaking. "Well, alright." Vanillakit said, trying to stifle a yawn but failing as her jaws stretched open and closed. Her eyelids hung over her mismatched oculars sleepily, but she refused to admit she was tired. She was going to make sure she didn't pass up this conversation so easily. "Well," she said softly, words slurring from weariness, "I wan'...I wanna make sure y..you go back to your den and get some sleep. Can I...wa..walk you..." She gestured the last part of her sentence, getting quite drowsy. She wanted to keep talking so she stayed awake but the words slipped off her tongue and she was too tired to catch them. Instead, she just looked up at Laurelstar. (sorry its short! couldnt think of anything else ^^;)
prim 13-Jan-22 11:47 PM
{Laurelstar} | Vanillakit | future I
This kit seemed insistent she return to her den upon the Highledge, and it was hard for her to not stifle an amused chuckle at her word of authority. Who was she, the leader of ThunderClan, to disobey an order from a kit! ”Alright, alright, I counted everyone in camp, so you can walk me back.” she accepted the offer with a warm, gentle smile, dipping her skull towards Vanillakit. The russet-toned tortoiseshell rose up to her huge white paws, watching the creamy-colored she-kit carefully. The Highledge was dangerous to traverse, especially at night, so she might not have the kit climb up the large boulders that acted as a staircase to the den atop the ledge. Laurelstar wasn’t going to let an accident occur, especially with a kit. She’d feel awful if Vanillakit got hurt under her watch. ”Just to the foot of the Highledge, all right? You’re still a little too small to climb all the way. It can be slippery too.” she began to slowly pad towards the steps that led up to her den. Her eyes were still trained on the kit tailing behind her, making sure she didn’t accidentally fall asleep while she walked with her. Though she wouldn’t be surprised if she had to bring her back to the nursery before she went to bed. Vanillakit was clearly about to topple over and slip into a deep slumber. Gotta make sure she doesn’t fall on her face, waking up with a bloody nose is never fun. @Soop
Soop 14-Jan-22 11:51 AM
Vanillakit @prim The little tabby molly smiled as Laurelstar accepted her offer, her drowsy visage mustering a gentle smile. Screwing her eyes shut for a moment, she tried waking herself up a bit before blinking them back open. Well, that notion had certainly been to no avail, so Vanillakit just shook her head a bit and started to pad after Laurelstar. Their silhouettes in the darkened camp contrasted greatly, with Laurelstar's tall and divine structure and Vanillakit's tiny, dainty frame. She was getting bigger, but was still quite a bit smaller than her siblings. Which was evident, because she was practically wading in the snow, the thick white coat presented atop the soil reaching up to her elbows; for the much taller leader it was only about ankle-deep. If Vanillakit were to fall asleep right now, no one would ever notice her little body snoozing away. Shivering a little, Vanillakit looked up to Laurelstar as she spoke again, giving the mottled sovereign a slow nod as they neared the Highledge. Skirting the edge of the rock, Vanillakit watched Laurelstar ascend up the stair-like rocks, then gave her a smile and a nod as the leader threw a glance back her way. "Good night, Laurelstar," she purred sleepily, raising a frost-tipped paw to give her a good-natured wave before retreating back the other way to the nursery. (end after your post?)
prim 16-Jan-22 12:18 AM
{Laurelstar} | Vanillakit | future I
The tortoiseshell leader had carefully trudged through the snow to make sure she wasn’t outpacing the young she-kit who had been hopping through the thick blanket like a fox pouncing on it’s prey. While Laurelstar could easily step through it all, being tall enough to push on through without an issue, Vanillakit did not have that luxury just yet. Too small, but she still pushed forward, insisting on escorting her back to her den. The sovereign couldn’t help but to feel proud of the kits of her clan, how strong they were. Despite the obstacles in her path, the creamy-colored she-kit was determined on seeing her quest through. She was tenacious and not afraid to confront the problems that stood ahead of her. As they finally reached the base of the steps that led up to her den, she could see that Vanillakit was drowsy, as to be expected. A kit up past her bedtime was always going to fall back into her slumber easily— but Vanillakit looked as if she were pushing herself to stay awake long enough to return to the nursery. ”Good night, Vanillakit. Get lots of rest.” she returned the kitten’s goodbye, a warm smile stretching across her face as she watched her begin to turn around and head back to her den. Watching the kit from afar, Laurelstar slowly began to ascend the steps leading up to her den, making sure she wasn’t going to collapse from exhaustion on her way back. The russet-toned tortoiseshell was climbing to the Highledge at a snail’s pace, at least until she saw the young kit slip through the entrance that led to the nursery. She was safe in her nest by now, and all was well. That’s good. she couldn’t help but to grin, only to find that moments later she found herself letting out a yawn. prim 16-Jan-22 02:59 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremony | present
The skies were hazy with pallid gray clouds hanging in the skies like an unfinished canvas of muted silver tones. The tortoiseshell leader had emerged from her den, parting the lichen curtain that hung from the entrance as she stepped outside. Slowly making her way to the edge of the Highledge that overlooked the hollowed out quarry down below, Laurelstar cleared her throat as she prepared to gather her clan together for a meeting. ”Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey gather beneath the Highledge!” came the rallying cry, the signal to all of her clanmates to congregate below her perch and to listen in on what she had to say. Though she had to admit this would be rather quick, as she only had one order of business to tackle today. Luckily, it was nothing bad, in fact she had to admit it was much more positive than anticipated. Settling herself down, the leader sat up straight as she awaited her clanmates to gather down below so she could proceed on with the meeting as planned. @goose @~Swift~ @ThunderClan
goose 16-Jan-22 03:37 PM
| { Tigerpaw } | As the dawn of the new morning mist arose — so did Laurelstars roar to call upon Thunderclan for a Clan gathering. And as the blasting voice echoed through camp, pounding rays through Thunderclanners ears — The Matriarchs adoptive sire had been the first one to have emerged through the apprentices den. The firm-blistering wind washing over the mollies coat — setting on a soft jacket of winters freezing breeze upon her tall physique. Yet Tigerpaws determination distracted her from the misty cold. She had been waiting for this day to rise — being assigned to a new and much more skillful teacher; Promised outside of the possibilities to be put under the influence of a crazed and callous mentor. Finchbriar was nothing but a traitor — combined with her lack of contribution to Tigerpaws training, and causing the she-cat to be stored away in the medicine den due to physical and mental scarring from the dark forest battle. For moons and moons — Tigerpaw was nothing but just a servant to Finchbriar.
The older apprentice bounded across the thin snow as she advanced across the clearing in a flashing pace — the embrace of a fresh dawns light washing over her frame the moment she jumped out of her shadows from the camps lonesome corners of the apprentices den. The place she promised to never lounge around anymore, she had to make herself a worthy cat to the Clan — Something Finchbriar told her she'd never accomplish to gain ever. This was her day. Another chance to fullfil expectations ingraved in her head. A chance to prove her worth, and Finchbriar wasn't looking — She didn't need to look anyway. Olive hues met with Golden-aqua oculars as Tigerpaw peered up to her tall-standing mother — skidding to a halt as she reached the center of the clearing. Brows furrowing down on narrow eyes with ambition and spurring pride — gratitude for her mothers work to find her a stable mentor to finish her training. Her tail lashed slowly behind — the tip glliding against the ground as anticipation stung her quarters. Motivated and ready ... Yet, somewhat neurotic at the same time. (edited)
@prim ))
Springy 🦤 16-Jan-22 03:41 PM
Marigolddust - Ceremony
Even though Marigolddust had been distracted by organizing his herbs on the shelves and cleaning out the most useless plants, this didn’t stop him from coming to attention as soon as he heard the call from Laurelstar. Marigolddust wasn’t too used to hearing her voice calling out the meetings, rather than Iceheart’s, but this didn’t stop his attention from always being caught by the cry. Standing up, Marigolddust was about to leave his den before he realized that it might not be the best idea to leave what patients he had alone in his den. Sure, there weren’t many cats who needed his attention, but if anything happened, he would have rather been there to attend to them and whatever problem they might have. He didn’t want to be absent for any emergencies, anyhow. So, instead of going out and joining the crowd that had gathered under the highledge light he did as a warrior, Marigolddust resided on the perch of his den entrance, straining his ears to hear whatever might be so softly spoken that he might miss. He couldn’t help but wonder what the meeting was about, but his curiosity was held back enough for him to stay where he was, rather than where everything was happening.

Emerald optical occuli breezing over the growing crowd of the clan, waiting for the announcement to be made.
prim 16-Jan-22 03:52 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremony | present
To say this wasn't personal would be an outright lie. Not one, but two of her kits were apprenticed to traitors to the clan, and now went without them for some time. While they were receiving training from multiple different warriors around camp whenever they could, accompanying other apprentices so they did not fall behind, it was not the same. They deserved a formal education where they could get it, and today she was assigning Tigerpaw a proper mentor. Someone who was trustworthy. A cat she had her eyes on quite often so as to make sure things were running smoothly with the clan, someone who wouldn't betray the clan at any given moment. Her daughter would be in good paws, and she was positive she was making the correct decision in this reassignment. Taking a deep breath, she watched the crowd gather below, and she could see that most of her clanmates had arrived, and were whispering amongst themselves as to the nature of the meeting, while others were looking up at her, waiting patiently for her to begin. No sense in waiting around, she supposed, time to get this over with. "As you all know, we lost many of our warriors when I had to exile the cats who turned traitor to our clan. It has affected many lives in camp, including those of our apprentices. Tigerpaw will be receiving a new, official mentor today to replace her former one." there wasn't exactly a protocol when it came to matters such as these, but she figured reminding the clan of the severity of exile and treason and its consequences could strengthen her point. It was never a good idea to turn on ThunderClan, especially if they intended to betray her. This was for her own kit, and she would not allow her to suffer under another cruel mentor, she refused. "Tigerpaw shall be reassigned Alerceclaw as her mentor for the remainder of her apprenticeship. I trust that his guidance as not only a seasoned warrior of ThunderClan, but as my deputy shall serve her well in her training." her heterochromatic gaze flickered over towards the dark-colored tom sitting in the clearing, she was entrusting her kit with him. Her safety and the results of her training was now his responsibility. In a way, this was a test of trust, in whether he could not only serve his clanmates and balance his duties, but also with her own kin. She believed he would handle it just fine, but after what had happened to her kit in the time she was training under Finchbriar, she was only being cautious. "Meeting dismissed." With a wave of her tail, the clan meeting had ended. Indeed it was rather short, but it needed to be done. She could rest easy knowing Tigerpaw had a more capable mentor teaching her the ways of a ThunderClan warrior. @~Swift~ @goose
~Swift~ 16-Jan-22 04:00 PM
∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ It was about time AlerceClaw would receive another apprentice. Tigerpaw in this instance was a curious pick. Not having grown familiar to them nor their previous mentor before, Alerce was really sent out to shrouded territory. But that did not intimidate him. Really, he had no particular reaction to it. It was just another apprentice assigned to him. Despite being LaurelStars daughter, the challenge remained the same. Alerce trained well. He was confident Tigerpaw would be rightfully redirected from where FinchBrair had hurled her off course. ∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ & Tigerpaw @goose Not innately someone with a stern demeanor, Alerce needed only a second of relief as he made his way down to camp for the second time this day. Everyone he had ever known to be a friend or anything of the sort had died or resorted to something like IceHeart was now. They were always only your mind replaying an important event. Only ever that. Emphasizing the past and how quickly time can fly. prim 24-Jan-22 05:07 PM
{Laurelstar} | Tumblestep | present
While everlastingly washed out tones of grey would persist in the skies above the forest territories for the next few moons or so, the ThunderClan leader would not allow the drab, morose appearance of their environment dampen her spirit. In truth, she felt quite pleased at the fact the cold weather was here for a while, she much preferred it over the oppressive heat of green-leaf. Instead of feeling like she was roasting alive under the harsh rays of the sun, she was protected from the frigid zephyrs of leaf-bare by her thick pelage of mottle russet and ginger patches. The tortoiseshell was as happy as a clam. However, she could tell not everyone shared her enthusiasm for the season. She couldn’t fault them for that either. Cold weather meant less prey, and less prey meant hungry bellies, and hungry bellies meant vulnerability to the elements, sickness, and injury. Vulnerability led to irritated cats or the persistent feeling of hopelessness, or even worse, it could spell out death if left neglected. She’d avoid it at all costs, her clan was to survive this season, her first leaf-bare as leader of ThunderClan— being thrusted into her throne just at the turn of the season. She would ensure her clan would prosper, and that they would be well-fed and warm in their dens. Most of all, safe from all those who sought to threaten them. While things seemed quiet for now, she would never let her guard down, not ever again. The sovereign slipped out of the cavern etched into the quarry wall adjacent to the Highledge, slowly descending the uneven staircase of boulders that led up to her den. She was used to the climb from her time as deputy, giving reports to Icestar while she led the clan, yet now she was the one overseeing the clan, receiving reports from her deputy. It had been about a moon and a half since she took charge, and she still felt strange about it. Yet her clan welcomed her with open arms, she must be doing something right. At least, she hoped they would be honest about it to her. They could tell her if they weren’t happy, she wouldn’t take offense. A good leader didn’t scare their subordinates into submission and ruled with an iron grip. Not unless they were forced to use such drastic measures. A last resort. @a small glass of grease™
a small glass of grease™ 25-Jan-22 11:25 PM
Tumblestep @prim Just on the opposite side of the camp sat a very fluffy tom who was currently sitting with his chin up towards the sky, eyes closed and a look of content on his face. He would sit there in the little bits of sun that the ongoing leafbare gave to them. He sat there for mere minutes at a time, longing for greenleaf to come. It only seemed like the cold had just begun and there was more in store. He didn't think about it, for now, he just loafed in the sun. He would open his eyes every so often to look around the camp, the day cats passing by and saying their hellos with polite nods as they continued on their way. He shook his fur out a bit and then opened his eyes expecting to see a semiempty camp but the sight of Laurelstar wasn't one the tom had expected, feeling confused for a second but when he saw her he smiled. "Hello Laurelstar!" He said with a grin, untucking his paws and standing up. His jaws parted in a slow yawn before quickly closing.
prim 26-Jan-22 11:59 AM
{Laurelstar} | Tumblestep | present
She wasn’t a recluse to her clan in the slightest, in fact it was rare to find her in her den in the mornings and past sun-high. Laurelstar, even in her overseeing position as leader of ThunderClan, tended to handle menial tasks alongside the warriors of her clan. Was it to kill boredom, she wondered? Or just to prevent an idle mind. She loathed waiting around for reports and doing nothing, that wasn’t who she was. She loved leading, she was proud to be the one tasked with protecting her clan and making good use of the nine lives their warrior ancestors granted her. However, she also did not want to sit around and do nothing while everyone else handled the work, not while her bones were still brimming with vitality and vigor, and while her workaholic tendencies were just itching to be let loose. The tortoiseshell was shot out of a cannon sometimes, bursting at the seams with energy. She didn’t stop until she was absolutely depleted and actually needed to sleep, she was that dedicated. Though some might call her a bit of a “try-hard”, which wasn’t untrue. Her odd-colored gaze widened as she picked up on a voice calling her over, swishing her bushy tail behind her as she slowly approached the cat who’d summoned her by name. Tumblestep, he seemed in a chipper mood today from a superficial observation and by his eager greeting. She returned the pleasantries with a small nod and a lopsided smile. ”Hey Tumblestep.” she knew all of her clanmates by name, as she should as their leader, even if she rarely spoke to some. She had to know these things. ”You’re not too chilly out here? I’d expect you to be in the dens with the others if you weren’t handling duties. This weather could freeze the whiskers off of some!” @a small glass of grease™
prim 29-Jan-22 02:15 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
The sun could be seen barely peeking through the thin sheen of the hazy clouds hanging in the once blue expanse above their heads. A calmer day for once, no snow, and the howling winds had ceased to be for the moment. All seemed well, this was a good day for leaf-bare’s harsh conditions. A reprieve from the unrelenting ice and snow, it was all they could ask for. At least it isn’t dry, a fire won’t break out since we’re getting so much snow. the ground would be moist when the snow melted and was absorbed into the soil, a layer of protection from flames that raged through their territory two leaf-bares ago. One thing they did not have to worry about. Today, she would be gathering her clan together to bear witness to a great event in any apprentice’s life. In her opinion, this was long overdue for the individual in question, and she deserved to be rewarded for her bravery in the battle and how she remained loyal to her clan when there were threats within their walls. She was not the only one, but she was the oldest, and it was high time she was promoted to a warrior. The tortoiseshell sovereign shook out her pelt as she stepped out upon the Highledge, staring down at the clearing down below. Clearing her throat, she rallied her clanmates with a loud cry. ”Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey gather beneath the Highledge!” It was time to begin, and with that, she waited. @spark's clone™ @ThunderClan

Cloverpaw

She’d been patiently waiting for her day to come, working her hardest to train. Even now she’d be considered a rather seasoned apprentice. Leadership had changed, a new deputy had been chosen, and Thunderclan was in a new era. So in turn, Cloverpaw was too. The voice of Laurelstar echoed out across camp, and she was one of the first to rise, stretching out her limbs and looking at the healing scar that extended up her leg- Marigolddust had certainly done well in helping her with that one. She could actually walk now. The black and white Molly was sly in joining the cats below the highledge, eyes blown wide with curiosity. @prim

prim 29-Jan-22 03:03 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
As she watched as her clanmates slowly congregated below the stone ledge that jutted out of the quarry’s walls, she took another deep breath and spoke once again. ”Today I have gathered you all here to bear witness to one of our own apprentices, for her actions have decreed that she is ready to be promoted to a warrior.” her gaze rested upon the molly in question, a warm smile forming on her features. It was time she granted Cloverpaw her warrior name, she deserved it for all her good deeds. ”Cloverpaw, please step forward.” She waited for the young she-cat to step forward into the empty space left in the center of the crowd, still smiling as she prepared to say the next set of scripted words that were customary for these affairs, ones she’d heard over and over again. ”I, Laurelstar, leader of ThunderClan, call upon my warrior ancestors to look down on this apprentice. They have trained hard to understand the ways of your noble code, and I commend them to you as a warrior in their turn.” the first line of the whole longwinded speech, she just wanted to grant her warrior name already, where was the fun in these sacred speeches anyways? Still, she needed to do it anyways, all a part of the ceremony. ”Cloverpaw, do you promise to uphold the Warrior Code and to protect and defend your clan, even at the cost of your life?” The leader awaited with baited breath, her bushy tail staying still behind her as she watched the black and white-furred she-cat down below. spark's clone™ 29-Jan-22 03:22 PM
Cloverpaw

prim 29-Jan-22 03:37 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
Cloverpaw’s response had sealed the deal, no matter how hesitant it may have sounded. She had made the agreement that would allow her to join the ranks of ThunderClan’s warriors— the rite of passage had been completed. Cloverpaw, from this moment on you will be known as Cloverwilt. StarClan honors your courage and resilience, and we welcome you as a full warrior of ThunderClan.” She stayed silent for a moment, to allow for a chorus of her clanmates to call out their newest warrior’s name out loud. Before she had to address another pressing matter with them all, she did not want to take away from Cloverwilt’s celebration. @spark's clone™

prim 29-Jan-22 04:12 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
Cloverwilt seemed absolutely pleased with her new name, and she couldn’t be happier for her in this moment. This was a moment every kit and apprentice had dreamed of, the day they would receive their coveted warrior name. The name they would have for the rest of their life, unless it was like her case and they became leader of their clan. One day, these cats would be the ones leading, the ones she’d be passing her torch to, or perhaps Alerceclaw would be— considering the fact that she and the tom weren’t that far apart in age. Needless to say, these cats would be their successors, they had to prepare them for the world they’d be inheriting. She let out a small sigh, noticing the crowd’s cries were now dying down. Laurelstar hadn’t dismissed them yet, and this next order of business was rather important. ”I have to ask you all to stay for a moment, for we will be conducting a vote.” she dipped her head to the crowd, before her gaze drifted over towards the former kittypet hanging out in the crowd. ”Bandit, step forward.” she gestured for the young tom to take his place in the center of the clearing. Now would be the time to determine whether he would stay with their clan or not, and this was all up to her clanmates to decide. ”Bandit, a former kittypet, has requested that he join our ranks as an apprentice. I want everyone to cast a vote as to whether they want him to do so, or not. If you are in favor of Bandit joining ThunderClan, please step to the right of the Highledge. All those who are opposed to him staying, please step to the left.” This was how they always conducted new additions to their clan, a voting system. Bandit seemed harmless, and he was eager to learn, but she would not reveal her vote until the very end, just to avoid swaying her clanmates’ opinions. @Cryptic
Cryptic 29-Jan-22 04:24 PM
Bandit | @prim The tom watched the ceremony with great interest. Without a moment of hesitation, Bandit copied the clan cats and called out for the new warrior. This whole thing was strange, very strange. He really liked it. "Cloverwilt! Cloverwilt!" He called with the brightest smile, not truly knowing the seriousness and true pride of such a ceremony. Then like whiplash, his joy was replaced with anxiety when suddenly his name was called. His eyes shot up to look at Laurelstar, wider than two moons as he stared. He was being called? He looked around at the clan cats, then did as told. He turned his eyes onto the leader once more as he walked forward. Right, Bandit recalled Laurelstar talking about a vote to determine if he stayed or not. The tom felt anxious. He did not bond with many cats since he came here, simply watching from the sidelines and slowly learning from afar. Did cats even know he was here until now? Bandit managed a smile as he stood tall, hoping and waiting for the clan cats to make their votes. No matter what happened next, he would be thankful for this experience in Thunderclan.

prim 29-Jan-22 05:05 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present

Cryptic 29-Jan-22 05:37 PM
Raccoonpaw | @prim The young tom felt his body tremble with great anticipation as he watched the clan take their places. He mostly paid attention to the right side of the Highledge, feeling his muzzle stretch wider with the brightest smile he could muster as more cats cast their votes. Seeing the majority in his favor, he turned his eyes back up to Laurelstar, his heart hammering from the sheer excitement of this occasion. Catching her nod, he stilled his movements and gave her his full attention, as if nobody was in the camp but him and the leader. His leader, now. Bandit's ears flicked with interest. It felt as if relief had washed over him. Bandit, the name that connected him to his cruel twolegs would no longer hold him to his past. First it was his collar, and now his name. Raccoonpaw. . . It felt right to him as he repeated it in his head over and over again. And to top it all off, the first Clan cat to show him any mercy, was going to be his mentor. He didn't know what to say or if he was even supposed to say anything. All he knew was that he truly did count himself as lucky. The luckiest feline to ever walk into this forest. "T-Thank you, Laurelstar."
prim 29-Jan-22 06:08 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
She had a great feeling about Raccoonpaw, even if he would be far behind on his training considering his age at being appointed as an apprentice, but she’d work extra hard to ensure he flourished. He’d be ready when he too was promoted, she’d make sure of it. The sovereign descended from her ledge to meet him down in the clearing, stepping towards him. ”Mentors and apprentices touch their noses to one another in these ceremonies, just to let you know.” she whispered quietly, just to warn him before she touched her coral-pink nose to his. A custom of this ceremony, a pact between mentor and apprentice that they would agree to do their part in the training process. She took a step back, before looking to the crowd she was now standing amongst. ”This meeting is dismissed.” she nodded to her clanmates, before turning to the newest addition to her apprentices. ”You’re in good paws, Raccoonpaw. But we have a lot to go over, a lot of catch up. You’re going to be working hard, and I put my apprentices through the wringer.” she flicked her tail, and she sounded sincere. She didn’t coddle her pupils, they were to be hardened warriors. She looked out for them, but she had to give them reality checks so they didn’t get caught off guard while they were out there. Raccoonpaw was in for an arduous apprenticeship. @Cryptic
Cryptic 31-Jan-22 04:29 PM
Raccoonpaw | @prim The newly named apprentice nodded and followed her lead, tilting his head up and meeting her half way to connect their noses. His fur bristled at the contact, the ritual feeling strangely special. A new pact, a connection between mentor and apprentice. He smiled up at the large leader with joy in his young innocent eyes, hanging on her every word with great intent. He didn't mind the thought of hard work ahead. Probably thanks to the ignorance of a kittypet that still ran freely in his brain, surely to be snuffed out in time. "Wouldn't want it any other way!" He responded with confidence. "So when do we start training? Will I grow to be as big and powerful as you? When do I become a Warrior?" The young apprentice buzzed with excitement, rambling on with no signs of stopping. Perhaps he was a little too excited for this occasion, eager to put his past as a kittypet behind him and become a brave and powerful Thunderclan cat. If only it would be that quick and simple.
