prim 01-Feb-22 11:05 AM
{Laurelstar} | Raccoonpaw | past I
Since he had been accepted into their ranks, he would have to learn that his coddled life as a kittypet had ceased to be. Raccoonpaw was one of them, he was to be trained as a ThunderClan warrior and to know their customs and rites of passage as every other cat had been taught. No more being spoon-fed, he was to be able to sustain himself and his clan now. He had a Code to follow. ”We’ll begin training at dawn tomorrow. You will want to go to sleep early tonight. As for how powerful you want to become, it is up to you. How hard you train and how much effort you put into each session can determine your results.” she wasn’t smiling, more so a neutral expression had replaced the warm one she adorned for the ceremonies. She had to be stern and unwavering, this was her apprentice, he needed to take this seriously if he was to succeed. ”That will also determine when I decide you are ready for your warrior assessment. You’re far behind for your age, but that isn’t your fault considering when you joined the clan. I have to make sure you’re going to be ready, and we’ll work hard to make sure you get there as soon as possible. I need you to promise me you will do your best during training, I don’t ask for perfection, but I want you to give it your all.” her bushy tail swayed behind her, and she straightened her posture as she looked down at the smaller tom. He was enthusiastic now, but when he learned how hard training was on an apprentice, and all the duties he would have to handle, how would he react then? Would he take it in stride? Or would he crumble? Only time will tell. ”Do you understand?” @Cryptic (edited)
prim 03-Feb-22 07:12 PM
{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | present
The behemoth of a ThunderClanner had been idly circling around the clearing in the abandoned quarry ThunderClan had made their residence in. She had been following the sun, trying to chase after the slight warmth of its rays sinking into her thick tresses of mottled fur. Laurelstar was overseeing the affairs of camp, awaiting the various patrols returning from their territory. The fresh-kill pile was steadily remaining filled, despite the season. Her clan was being fed, they’d make it through this season. Yet she knew more challenges would come later on. Issues that would arise for her clan, even if they had recovered for the most part after the landslide and the battle. The start of her leadership was wrought with challenges, one after the other. One thing at a time. One thing at a time. she had to remind herself of that mantra often, she couldn’t overburden herself. She had to work with her clan, all together. She didn’t have to take it all on by herself, that’s why she has a deputy, and a whole legion of warriors. She could rely on them for assistance. Taking a deep breath, the tortoiseshell sat up from the patch of sun she was laying in. The tortoiseshell ruffled her coat as she stood up, blinking repeatedly as she looked up, checking for any signs of her clanmates. Not many cats were in camp at this time, likely out hunting or on patrol— she’d know, considering she used to organize said patrols. @debit
debit 03-Feb-22 07:22 PM
Bluebellkit | Laurelstar Staring at the vast expansion of her home before the tiny kitten, made her feel challenged in a way. Her mind saw it as a task, to get out of the crowded nursery and into the wide-world beyond. Bluebellkit ignored her mothers voice in the back of her head, "Stay in your nest, you'll only end up under the warriors paws." But as the blue-coated kitten stared out, there weren't many warriors. She wondered why? Was it bedtime for the warriors? The only den that the kitten could point out to herself was the elders den, and her own. She could only take guesses to what the other dens held. So, with cautious yet excited steps, Bluebell moved out of the nursery. The further she got from the entrance the quicker her excited steps got and turning less cautious. Bluebell made it a few hops from the den, Pausing to finally look up at the sky. She let the sun soak into her fur, a calming warmth that she completely accepted. But after a few moments, the calm wore off, and she began looking around again. Who was here? Who could she meet? Could they tell her why there were no warriors in camp? @prim
prim 03-Feb-22 11:29 PM
{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | present
A curious mind tended to allow for the body to wander on its own. Kits were no exception to this rule, often emerging into the world with an adventurous spirit that goaded them on, to visit each little nook and cranny they found themselves spelunking. She knew that she shared those characteristics as a little kitten, her roaming eyes had scanned across the camp she knew practically like the back of her paws. It seemed that very attitude had implanted itself into the mind of yet another kitten— one who was very young to be venturing out of the nursery and into the snow. Now that had caught her attention. The ThunderClan leader’s eyes had widened at the sight, and she trotted towards the young kit, who was much smaller than some of the mounds of snow littering the edges of camp. While today was a little warmer than others, the dripping of melting icicles sending droplets of water falling down made it evident, it still was chilly out. So much so that it could be bad if this kit stayed out for too long, she’d have to make sure she stayed warm until she returned to the nursery. ”Bluebellkit.” Laurelstar greeted the she-kit with her name, blinking down at her as she towered over the practical infant. ”What are you doing out in camp? It’s a little cold out for a kit your age.” @debit
debit 04-Feb-22 12:38 AM
Bluebellkit | Laurelstar The tiny blue kitten heard the snow crunching and turned towards it. One thing her mother had taught her, was who their leader was. "Laurelstar, she served under Icestar, now our leader serves her clan, along with Alerceclaw, we listen to them, and we respect them." Bluebellkit's eyes widened when towering fem greeted her with her name, "Hi, Laurelstar!" She did a little hop as she returned her greeting excitedly. Yes! She can answer my questions. Maybe she knows where my mum is too? "I wanted to explore, the nursery is getting cramped, and my nest keeps getting pushed around. And my mother hasn't been back for a long time, so I wanted to see what the camp was like!" She knew the queens didn't mean it, she hoped. But they push their nests back so that their kits had more room to play. And a new litter had just been born, so more room was needed. And since Bluebells mother wasn't around very often, the Queens didn't have anyone to ask permission to move the nest, rather bypassing the blue and white fem and shoving her nest back. @prim
prim 04-Feb-22 03:38 PM
{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | past II
She was a young leader, in terms of how long she held the position. Judging off of Bluebellkit’s age, she might have been born right at the end of Icestar’s reign, or just as she had started her own. Needless to say, she was very young to be venturing out of the nursery by herself, though she supposed she wasn’t exactly one to judge. As soon as she could perceive her surroundings and actually walk, little Laurelkit was hard to keep in the nursery. She always had been the ambitious sort, striving to explore, striving to be the best— aiming for the top. Now, here she was, gazing out upon her clan, her clanmates, the ones who followed her command, she had made it. All those dreams came true, but not without a great cost. In a way, she was thankful her brother Jasper wasn’t her deputy, that their shared dreams as kits to be a leader and deputy duo hadn’t come true. She didn’t want him to have to have made the decisions she had to, to be put in the positions she found herself in. To lose so much. Not that she didn’t respect Alerceclaw, or would wish that upon him either— she prayed her own deputy would have a relatively calm time serving as her second-in-command, that when his time came to lead he would be ready, and through better circumstances than her rising to her throne. She blinked repeatedly for a moment, snapping her out of her thoughts that seemed to ensnare her in a fog. She shook her head, now paying attention to Bluebellkit again, who seemed to be happy to see her. ”Pushed around? Is something the matter?” she tilted her head, she knew queens would occasionally shift their nests around, but for this kit’s sake she figured she’d ask. She didn’t want to hear of any kits being bullied within her camp’s walls, it would not be tolerated. ”As for your mother, she might be on a patrol, either hunting or checking the border. She should be back soon if she was sent on a dawn patrol. Don’t you worry.” she dipped her skull towards the miniscule, blue-furred kitten staring up at her. A warm, slightly lopsided grin formed on her battle-scarred features. She always enjoyed chatting with the youth of her clan, they all had such varying personalities, especially depending on which generation they belonged to. By no means was she herself old, but she knew there was a clear divide with the cats around her age as compared to those around, for example, Marigolddust’s age, and so on and so forth. Different attitudes, she used to tout about how the senior warriors used to be stuck in their ways and how the clan was stagnating— that they needed to show the other clans who was boss. Now she was trying to keep stability within her clan, keeping the peace for now. I became what I swore to “destroy” back then, these kits will become the same. she inwardly groaned, sometimes looking back on her own past drudged up rather embarrassing memories for her. Bluebellkit and others around her age would learn of this everlasting feeling soon enough, especially after they made embarrassing blunders themselves that would haunt them for the rest of their lives. @debit (edited)

prim 07-Feb-22 02:14 PM
{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | past I
She could understand the kit’s desire to leave the nursery, she knew the feeling all too well. Even when she was small, pint-sized compared to how gigantic she was now, it felt crammed. Like the world was being kept from her through the bramble and fern walls she had once resided in at her mother’s and siblings’ side. Watching the sunlight filter through the gaps between plant matter, and all the noises she could pick up on outside. She knew it all too well. She tilted her head a bit at the kit’s question, before she nodded. ”Chances are she is out hunting, not everyone is in camp currently, though some may just be sleeping still. We run patrols close to dusk and you’d want to be at your sharpest for those when nightfall is near.” one other reason as to why the camp was quiet currently, patrols didn’t run at every single moment of the day, and once sun-high arrived, the camp would grow to be more lively as patrols returned and more cats rose from their nests. ThunderClan wasn’t exactly a haven for morning-people. She was just used to rising early from her days as deputy, and she didn’t plan on stopping anytime soon. ”We usually run them from dawn, sun-high, and dusk, and we don’t send the same groups out on every patrol. We allow them to rest after their hard work. By hunting, they provide us with our food. By marking our borders, they protect us from threats, keeping kits like you safe.” she smiled lightly, it was a simple-enough explanation, she hoped. Bluebellkit was just wondering where her mother was and it was likely she was out on a patrol, and would return later on. ”The camp will get more lively in a few hours, just give it time. ThunderClan is loud, trust me.” she shrugged her broad shoulders, chuckling lightly as she gazed towards the warriors den— her old den. How many times had she run her mouth out in camp? Had to have been at least five times, she was a rowdy one. Being deputy calmed her down a bit, but she still was a bit of a loudmouth. @debit
debit 08-Feb-22 09:21 PM
Bluebellkit | Laurelstar Bluebell was filled with nothing short of amazement, her mind pictured the massive warriors making hard treks around the massive territory, all day every day. But instead of saying something close to the wonder she felt, her mouth got ahead of her mind. "But wouldn't your paws fall off with that much walking?" Her tiny voice questioned, lifting up her arm and shaking a tiny white paw. She felt exhausted after playing around in the nursery, but after a few minutes rest she was back up and excited. She enjoyed taking her frequent naps, her sleep schedule was very different from the other kittens and Queens. She only guessed that because she spent some nights awake, sitting at the entrance of the nursery, no matter the temperature, just watching the stars. And then spent the day catching up on those missing hours. On the few occasions her mother was sleeping with her, she didn't seem to notice when the tiny kit slipped out and spent her nightly watching away from her. She giggled along with the leader, "Well the nursery is always loud, no matter the time!" Bluebell scrunched her nose, "The smaller kittens interrupt my naps." She looked back up to Laurelstar, "Do you like naps? I think they're my third favourite thing to do."

prim 08-Feb-22 11:28 PM
{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | present
Such innocence, the leader couldn’t help but to envy the naïveté of the kitten she was conversing with. Unknowing of the hardship the world brought with it, able to live her life with joy and without a care in the world, before she was thrown out there into the forest. Laurelstar understood that with the passage of time, of course kits had to grow up eventually alongside it. They’d grow into apprentices, who would grow into warriors— cats who battled viciously for their clan, cats who had to go hungry, get sick, be injured— sometimes killed. Bluebellkit would learn of their lifestyle in time, she would learn of all these things. As every kit would. Its sad, in a way. The tortoiseshell leader curled her bushy tail around her frame as she relaxed into her sitting position, ruffling her coat as she stared down at Bluebellkit. A wistful expression formed on her features for just a moment, and she took a deep breath— the smile returning to her face after she calmed herself. ”No, the warriors are used to it by now. They can travel long distances within a day, and even then a patrol doesn’t cover much ground.” she shook her head at the kit’s question, before lifting one of her large mittens off of the ground. ”These would have fallen off by now if that was the case!” another fit of chuckles escaped her lips, her eyes lighting up out of amusement. Her question was a little silly, how many cats in their clan were missing paws from walking anyways? ”As for naps, I like them as much as any other cat, but I don’t often get the chance to take one. I tend to stay awake a lot so I can keep an eye on things around here.” @debit

prim 10-Feb-22 11:57 AM
{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | present
While it was true they could not truly “train” the kits of the clan, Laurelstar didn’t see the harm in showing them basic skills. She’d taught kits how to crouch and stalk, even if they were almost always wobbly and uncoordinated, they almost always employed those same skills in the games they played. Laurelstar wouldn’t mind showing her a few skills. ”Well… I can show you how to properly pounce, or how to swipe correctly.” the better the form they had in battle, the greater the effectiveness of the attack. However, she just hoped this kit would only use this for play purposes for now. ”Watch me.” she dipped her skull to the blue-furred kitten, taking a few steps back to prepare for her demonstration. The tortoiseshell deputy ruffled out her thick coat, before stretching out for a moment— never hurt to warm up a bit before an exhibition, even if it was for a simple paw swipe. Besides, she figured it may make her look “cooler” to the kitten. She rose her paw up into the air, before swinging it downward. Quick and precise, no hesitation in any way. ”Got that? You can try that out, just if you’re practicing avoid using your claws around camp. We never train with our claws out.” she nodded her head, before the kitten’s next comment caught her attention— a good segue into the next topic. ”We save the claws for our enemies, which can also be cats from outside our clan, if they threaten us. However, we try to avoid conflict if possible. Most of the time the other clans mind their business, as do we with their affairs.” a smirk formed once again, and she couldn’t help but to chuckle. ”If you grow as big as me, that might give the other clans reasons to not mess with us!” @debit

{Laurelstar} | Bluebellkit | present

The ThunderClan matriarch wasn’t going to show her anything complex, but she figured this would come up in the games she’d play with other kits. Why not show her the ropes so she could get used to it ahead of time? Give her an advantage over some of the kits in the nursery she was playing with, or at least put her on the same playing field as the older ones. Bluebellkit didn’t seem like the type to abuse the power she just granted her, and if she did, well she was sure the proper discipline would be issued. She didn’t want to hear of any kittens with torn ears and the like. However, she was sure it wouldn’t go that far. ”Yep, just like how they start running the moment I show up. Any one of the warriors who may mentor you in the future are all talented and will ensure you’re going to be one of the best.” she always spoke very highly of her clanmates, and the ones who stood up against threats outside and within were all trustworthy. These were the most loyal group of warriors in the world, she believed, they were willing to give life and limb to protect their clan. She couldn’t thank them enough for everything they did, and how grateful she was to lead them… Now she was just being a softie. @debit

prim 13-Feb-22 09:30 PM
{Coyotepaw} | Wrenpaw | present
Time seemed to be rolling by slowly, at least for him. In the moons since the battle the tom was just going about his days in autopilot, a blank expression on his features half the time. The battle had taken a toll on him, on his family. He continually checked in on his mother, trying to see if he could elicit some sort of reaction from her— that somehow it would trigger her memory. That she would remember him. What a way to be almost entering warriorhood. The tom let out a sigh as his shoulders sagged, not even touching the mouse he’d picked up from the fresh-kill pile— it was practically skin and bones anyways, almost no actual meat on there… Maybe he just wasn’t hungry, he’d go put it back in a moment. Coyotepaw was just swimming in unpleasant thoughts and memories… Then he recalled something, Wrenpaw. She too faced an ordeal for moons, and he never stopped to check in on her after it all. He assumed she wanted space after it all came out about her acting as a spy on their clan’s behalf. Couple that with the situation regarding his mother, it caused them to give each other space. Still, he owed it to his friend that he check on her, at least whenever he saw her next. @tremb (sorry for starting this so late ^^” )
wild™ 14-Feb-22 03:55 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Life among Thunderclan had finally seemed to settle since the war against the Dark Forest, rebuilding their clan and lives and now carrying on in general peace. Though the challenges of leaf-bare still remained, it was clear that the harsh season would be coming to an end in due time, as prey was becoming more plentiful, the sun shone brighter and the days seemed a little less chilly. Even so, snow still laid upon the earth and icicles reached down from the branches overhead. Nonetheless, it was still pleasing to be returning to that which was familiar, normal even. A russet figure appeared slinking into the camp, amber eyes bright as he looked over the area he called home. A sigh escaped from him as he padded toward the fresh-kill pile, dropping his catch among it before turning away. He stood idly as he took a moment to take in the sight of the camp once more - it was quiet. The occasional figure could be seen among it, here and there a mentor and apprentice was readying for a training session, while others chatted among themselves. The warrior decided he ought to take what time he could to rest for a few moments, lest he be dragged along on some sort of patrol or approached by another clanmate. So, he headed over toward a fairly open spot, before lying down and resting his head on his paws. @Dormamoon
Dormamoon 14-Feb-22 08:20 PM
Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
The creamy feline slipped out of the warriors den, having already gone hunting earlier, she had decided to take a short nap in her nest to rest her eyes. Ever since the fight against the Dark Forest, it had been a bit difficult for her to sleep, but now that everything seemed to be slowly getting back to normal, she hoped that would end up changing. Slowly glancing around camp, her chocolate gaze landed on a russet tom lounging in an area by himself. A small smile adorned her face before she padded over to him. "Hey Cardinalspark." She murmured softly as she approached, not wanting to disrupt him too much in case he wanted to be alone. It had been hard for them to find any alone time together since the battle, but that was to be expected with how intense everything had been. And plus they both had received injuries and had needed to recover in their own time before returning back to normal duties. "How are you today?" She asked with a sheepishly glance. @wild™
prim 15-Feb-22 07:05 PM
{Laurelstar} | Iceheart | present
All was finally at peace for her clan. Their camp was restored to its former glory, with some marked improvements, and all those who suffered injuries had recovered-- physically speaking at least. She knew the mental and emotional turmoil the battle had wrought upon her clanmates, as well as herself, would not go away so easily. She knew that it would take time for many to truly adapt to some sense of normalcy after losing so many loved ones, herself included. Her own family was coping, sticking close together, though she knew her kits were still struggling. She admired their tenacity in the face of a tragedy, but she wished that they never had to cope with losing their mother at so young of an age... Just like her. One thing she was thankful for was that the leader she had served under had survived. Even if she didn't remember her. The tortoiseshell sovereign could see the lynx-point down in the camp from where she stood upon the Highledge, gazing down at her clanmates below. She had given her some space since the battle, to try and allow her to get her own bearings on the world she was thrown into. No need to overwhelm someone in an amnesiac state, to Iceheart, she really was nothing more than a stranger, or perhaps an acquaintance who had addressed her as leader once. Now she didn't know what to call her, would they ever be friends again? She prayed they could be, even if she was now the one in charge of leading the clan, and Iceheart served her as a warrior. I pray she regains some of her memories, there are cats here who love and cherish the time they spent with her. I want her to know what her sacrifice meant to me. She wouldn't even be standing on this rock if it weren't for her. Taking a deep breath, the tortoiseshell began to descend her throne and into the clearing down below, her gaze trained on the pale-furred she-cat. Approaching her slowly, Laurelstar greeted her by name: "Hello, Iceheart. Can we talk?" @Ice

{ ~ Iceheart ~ // A Forgotten Friend }
These past moons were tough on Iceheart. Laying low, the silvery-white femme slowly adjusted to the daily life of the Clan under the close watch of Bearmask. She had stayed away from the funerals held for the lost warriors in the battle. She didn’t remember them. She didn’t know them. She couldn’t grieve for them. She didn’t even know her own kits! The awkwardness to that discovery has stuck quite prominently. Staying quiet was the best thing she could do; a silent presence barely flickering within the Clan. Iceheart’s head shot up immediately when her name was called. A slow blink portrayed her confusion as ThunderClan’s leader, Laurelstar, summoned her. She hadn’t spoken to her ever since the lynx-point had first woken up after the battle. It was best that way especially for a leader as busy as her. Why does she want to speak with me? It was quite a wonder. Besides her curiosity, she couldn’t refuse her leader’s request. Standing up obediently, Iceheart nodded in confirmation. ” Of course.” @prim
prim 16-Feb-22 08:46 AM
{Laurelstar} | Iceheart | present
A silent presence was satisfying for some warriors, but for a cat like Iceheart, she didn’t think it suited a warrior of her caliber. A hero of their clan. A leader who gave up her lives, one of her souls, to allow her clan to triumph over their enemies. She couldn’t be more thankful for her actions, and she owed it to her to ensure she was recovering— to still consider her a friend. ”I just wanted to chat, no need for the formalities.” a large white mitten gestured to the way the lynx-point she-cat had straightened her posture in her presence. She commanded respect, but she didn’t need to hear an audible crack every single time she addressed her clanmates. ”How are you feeling?” her head slightly tilted, her gaze showcasing hints of concern— though it was evident she was pleased to see the pale she-cat out and about in camp. She didn’t want to swarm her with questions, to bombard her with reminders of memories that were from the leader’s perspective, and not her own. Laurelstar had reacted out of panic during the battle, shocked by the fact she didn’t remember her. The cat whose life she traded the rest of her lives and her soul for. I can’t hold that against her, she didn’t know that would happen. I owe it to her to keep the clan safe, that includes her. her ears twitched as she waited for some form of answer. Her thoughts were just swimming around in her mind erratically, bumping into each other or merging into amorphous shapes like a school of sardines out in the ocean. @Ice

They were always only your mind replaying an important event. Only ever that. Emphasizing the past and how quickly time can fly. Even something as simple as no reaction at all can say something about her. But for now; she remained a timid, ambitious, and nervous little thing in this bachelors mind. tremb 19-Feb-22 09:47 AM
Wrenpaw ThunderClan Apprentice The days all seemed to morph together as Wrenpaw awaited the day she would finally become a warrior, though she wasn’t feeling as excited about it as she had in the past. She couldn’t pinpoint exactly why, and she knew that she should be happier, but she found herself feeling rather indifferent. Wrenpaw knew she was ready. In fact, she was more than ready. Her injuries sustained from the dark forest battle had put a delay on her training, which had held her back nearly two moons. Now she was back and stronger than ever, physically at least. Mentally, the dark thoughts of what had happened and the nightmares still took their toll on the young she-cat, though she did her best to keep all of that beneath the surface. The only thing that really looked different about her was her scarred appearance. Nearly half her ear was gone, and thick scars could be seen on her neck and around her shoulders. Still, she carried them proudly. She liked to think they make her look more intimidating, which would be a good thing considering she’d always looked as soft and gentle as a newborn. As she she-cat slipped from the apprentices den, her dark amber gaze landed almost immediately on Coyotepaw, and right away she felt overcome with guilt. She knew he’d been going through a difficult time with his mother after the battle, and she’d chosen to give him space rather than be present. It was partially because she had needed time to get control of her own traumas, but also because she didn’t know how to help her friend and she worried she’d only bother him. She was always so desperate to help those around her, especially those that she cared for deeply, but mostly the things she wanted to help with were things she was powerless against. Still, there wasn’t a day that went by where she didn’t think about the tom. He looked quite miserable now, poking at his mouse. Wrenpaw hurried over to him, trying her best to look cheerful in hopes it would make him feel a little better. ”Hi,” she said softly, sitting down and wrapping her tail around her paws. @prim

tremb 22-Feb-22 10:56 AM
Wrenpaw ThunderClan Apprentice Wrenpaw was glad that she could bring a smile to her friends lips, but it was a mere ghost of his normal smile. She hadn’t expected much different, truthfully. Coyotepaw had endured a lot in the recent moons, and it was unlikely that any cat would be cheerful after having such experiences. She wanted the tom to know how much she cared, though she didn’t really want to bring up such a sensitive subject. Instead, she simply stared back at him for a while, amber gaze brimming with emotion. For someone who usually had so much to say, Wrenpaw was unusually silent, fumbling through words in her mind. She looked from her friend to the scrawny mouse at his paws and then back again, biting her lip softly. He needed to eat, but he didn’t have any appetite, and she could understand that. Still, she wondered if she could coax him to even have a bite. ”I ate this morning,” she lied quickly. Wrenpaw was a notoriously bad liar, unless of course she felt like she was lying to help someone she cared about. ”It is tiny, though. Maybe we could share? It’s no more than a couple bites a piece anyways.” She observed. Her stomach growled audibly, her face flushing as embarrassment washed over her. As unappetizing as the mouse was, it was still food, and as much as she might deny it, the apprentice was quite hungry. She shifted a bit on her paws, her gaze quickly finding anywhere else to rest besides upon Coyotepaw. How’ve you been? Despite the time that had passed, the golden furred she-cat still wasn’t certain how to answer that question. ”Well I’ve been… better. I still have nightmares but good luck finding many clanmates that don’t.” She said with a small shrug. She was still plagued with a plethora of bad memories, but at least the actual threat was gone. ”I’m sorry for keeping my distance. It’s just, everyone who wasn’t there seems to want to know what it was like being a spy, like it was something exciting or something to be proud of. I didn’t want to tell anyone, at least not until I told you. I promised I’d tell you when I could, but I’m still sorry I kept it from you.” She began. She traced a single claw to and fro across the ground, trying to distract herself from the building anxiety that she felt. She brought her gaze back to her friend, for a few moments, at least. It wasn’t like her trauma outweighed his in any way. Sure, she’d seen plenty of cats die, but none that she held close. She had been lucky in that sense. Even the fact that she’d nearly died didn’t seem to hold a candle to what some of her clanmates had lost. ”I’m sorry for what happened. How is she doing? Your mother, I mean. More importantly, how are you holding up?” Wrenpaw knew there was no real way she could help her friend in his struggle, but at least she could be there for him to show support. He probably had a lot of things on his mind that he was holding onto. @prim

A golden-shaded figure appeared at the entrance to the warriors den, pale eyes scanning the rather empty camp before him. A cat could be seen here and there, but a majority of the tom-cat's clanmates were still among their dens. Nonetheless, the warrior padded out into the camp, toward the fresh-kill pile to grab something for himself. prim 24-Feb-22 08:45 PM

This could have been an opportunity in disguise, for the soul who had laid dormant within the body she shared with that of Icestar to finally experience life. She didn’t know the pain or the harsh experiences her predecessor knew of, a fresh, clean slate. Would they ever be the same friends again? I pray to StarClan it can be so. ”I’m not saying you should act the same, that’s a choice for you to make… Still, don’t you feel entitled to know what happened?” she meant it in a way that she deserved to know what happened to her, it was something she experienced. wild™ 25-Feb-22 10:10 AM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐋𝐈𝐂𝐊𝐄𝐑𝐅𝐎𝐗 // THUNDERCLAN WARRIOR
As time passed, more felines began to appear among the camp, gathering into various clusters or settling in pairs, save for the lone feline scattered about here and there. They were all of various ages, sizes and colors, a perfect painting among the golden dawn light. Pale optics rested upon the camp for some time, lazily scanming across it though at the same time, harboring a cunning glint among them. A pink tongue swiped across his muzzle, collecting stray bits of prey as he glanced down - realizing that such was nearly gone. He paused for a moment at this, contemplating the situation, before something caught his attention. Out of the corner of his eye, the tom spotted a figure approaching. A slender calico molly, posessing a morning meal of her own. The warrior's gaze rested upon her for a moment, silver optics gleaming with mild interest. As she settled herself a short distance away, sparing him a greeting a short moment afterwards, the tom's whiskers quivered. "Good morning..." he replied slowly, ears held erect. "Palelily, correct? You look lovely today." he added after a moment, a small smile resting upon his face. "How're you today? Are you well?" he inquirer, tail flicking about behind him as he studied her from a distance. As far as he knew, the calico was a rather friendly feline and nothing to truly worry about conversing with - unless, she was the overly talkative type anyway. @raven
Ice 25-Feb-22 10:30 AM
{ ~ Iceheart ~ // A Forgotten Friend }
Don’t you feel entitled to know what happened? Iceheart mulled over this thought. It wasn’t as if she was reborn. That cat before her memory loss was the same one who was standing here right now. Acting as if those two are separate wasn’t going to solve problems. In fact, it would be avoiding them. Even if she hadn’t realized it herself, she needed her identity. She had been feeling so lost these past moons that the emptiness was getting to her. Additionally, if she wasn’t going to do it for her own sake, she should do it for the others. According to Laurelstar, there were a lot who cared about her. The least she could do was try in some way. ” Being a leader is busy, but do you think you can help me with some battle training?” The lynx-point suddenly asked. ” No memory means I don’t remember any training I’ve had. I still want to be useful to the Clan, even if it’s like this.” Her tail flicked erratically, as if contemplating something. ” And,” she began slowly. ” Could you also tell me about your father? And what he meant to me?” @prim
prim 25-Feb-22 11:37 AM
{Laurelstar} | Iceheart | past II
Iceheart didn’t seem offended by her own presumption, which brought the leader a sense of relief. She smiled lightly, the request to train alongside her was one she’d accept readily. Laurelstar had sparred with the lynx-point she-cat before, and they had their own share of competitions in the past. She nodded to the pale-furred she-cat, gleefully obliging to her request. ”Of course!” she chirped aloud, her tail tip swishing around quickly. Maybe this was an opportunity in disguise, a callback to a previous time where they trained. Maybe it could bring some sense of nostalgia for her, it could possibly help. The mention of her father made the excitement stall for a moment, but she was still smiling. He was gone, but she’d still speak of his legacy to all of those who were interested in hearing it. Especially from someone he was good friends with in life. ”My father’s name was Featherpelt. He was known for taking in many kits and raising them as his own, because of that I actually have a lot of adoptive siblings.” she was one of the very few kits of his that were related to him by blood, she was one of the kits he had with Tigereyes. ”He was being considered for deputy under Hawkstar’s reign along with you, and you two were quite friendly with one another, and worked well with each other. He was quite happy when you were appointed as deputy of ThunderClan.” she spoke highly of the tom, he was known for his kind disposition and calm personality. He looked after almost everyone in the clan, a cat who was trusted by all, and had a good reputation even outside of ThunderClan’s walls. It was rare to find such a cat nowadays, she didn’t know if it was even possible to find a cat like her father. He was unique, a true paragon of his kind. ”He was happy serving ThunderClan, and was one of the most loyal cats I have ever seen. He was dedicated to the clan, and by extension, your leadership.” @Ice
wild™ 25-Feb-22 11:58 AM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
Hearing the cream-furred feline's apology, Cardinalspark grinned a tad, shaking his head. "Oh no, you're more than alright. I can always spare a moment for you, Honeydrop." the tom purred, dark ears twitching. He observed the opposing feline for a moment, whiskers quivering as she continued, a light bit of laughter escaping the russet tom. "Ah, that's good to know then. I have an image to uphold, after all." As he settled down once more, the russet warrior listened to the molly's words. Such would be appreciated - now that they were free from the ideals of war, all they needed to truly recover was for leaf-bare to release them of its harsh season. Day by day, it's chilling grip seemed to lessen, making way for warmer days and bountiful prey. The tom could hardly wait for such times to grace them - he'd missed hunting in those conditions, despite his longer pelt, he wasn't fond of the snow. "I must say, I'm looking forward to it, myself. That was one of the things keeping me from bringing back something extra for you - that and the fact I hadn't known you'd be looking for me today. I might've looked a tad silly hurrying through camp with an extra bit of prey, only for you not to show...though I suppose someone else would've enjoyed it all the same." Noticing he'd been rambling onward about this meal, the tom's ears laid back slightly, a sheepish smile resting upon his face. "My apologies. I just...want to make sure you're alright and all. I don't want you catching colds or anything, while you're trying to help out." he replied, referring to the last time she'd gotten sick, a playful yet equally concerned light among his gaze. @Dormamoon
prim 27-Feb-22 10:59 AM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
As the sun rose high into the bright blue skies above them all, the camp was filled with energy and activity as its inhabitants were awake for the middle of the day. Today would mark a special occasion for some of her clan’s younger members, a promotion, and it was a special one. They would be adding two new warriors to their ranks, so this was to be a celebratory affair. With that in mind, the burly tortoiseshell sovereign of ThunderClan slipped out of her den upon the Highledge and stepped out onto the perch that overlooked her clan’s camp. She cleared her throat, before rallying her clan with a loud cry: ”Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey gather beneath the Highledge!” Confidence and authority permeated her tone, her clanmates were to appear for this ceremony and support those who were being promoted. This was a part of their recovery, and these two cats had worked hard to earn their names and ranks. It was high time they were promoted at last. With that being said, she sat down at the edge of her throne, looking down at the growing crowd below, their expectant eyes trained on her now that she had their undivided attention. @ThunderClan @tremb
{Coyotepaw} | Ceremonies
At the call of the ThunderClan leader, the lanky tom had stepped into the clearing along with the rest of his clanmates, looking up at Laurelstar who stood upon the Highledge. He glanced around the clearing, his stomach was doing flips already. Today was the day, wasn’t it? He didn’t even get to groom his fur a bit, he’d look a little unkempt for the ceremony. Coyotepaw gulped nervously, his paws shuffling beneath him as he awaited the next words to be uttered— looking around to see if anyone he knew was here. What name am I going to be stuck with for the rest of my life?
tremb 27-Feb-22 11:10 AM
Wrenpaw ThunderClan Apprentice At Laurelstar’s summons, Wrenpaw was quick to slither from the apprentices den where had spent most of her morning fretting about her pelt and anxiously awaiting the ceremony. It wasn’t unusual for the cream furred molly to be a bundle of nerves, but today was unlike anything she had felt in quite some time. The day had finally come for her to receive her warrior name, and despite how much she’d tried to prepare, she still felt as though she wasn’t ready. She hurried to Coyotepaw’s side, noticing quickly that he looked just as anxious as her. She gave him a wide grin, smiling past her worries and almost forgetting them for several moments. She remembered when they had become apprentices together, and discussed becoming warriors together as well. She never thought it would actually happen, but alas, here they were about to walk into the next step of their lives together. A small purr rumbled in her throat. It had been nice to always have a friend at her side. @prim
Cryptic 27-Feb-22 11:11 AM
Raccoonpaw
With great excitement and enthusiasm, Raccoonpaw darted for the Highledge the moment he heard the call of their leader. Ever since his own apprentice ceremony, he had developed a great enjoyment for the occasion and always wanted to be present to show support for his new clanmates. The ring-tailed tom happily sat then turned his bright gaze up to Laurelstar, giving her his full attention as he waited for her to speak again.
Springy 🦤 27-Feb-22 11:38 AM
Marigolddust - Ceremonies
Apprehension tickled at Marigolddust’s chest as he looked up at Laurelstar’s from the crowd below her ledge. He wasn’t sure he was ready to not be a mentor anymore, and he wasn’t sure if he was ready to stop addressing Wrenpaw with the name he was used to, but with the warrior name she would earn today. What would it be like, not to mentor her anymore? How different would it be? He remembered how nervous he had been when he had first become the honey furred fem’s mentor, and now he wasn’t sure if he was ready not to be. He didn’t doubt that Wrenpaw was ready- he had made sure to explain just how ready he knew she was skill wise. But she could tell that she was nervous now, and, placed next to her for the moments before she would step forwards, he brushed his tail softly against hers and gave her a smile in the hopes to reassure her a little, before focusing again on Laurelstar. He didn’t want to take all of the attention from her and Coyotepaw today. They reminded him a bit of himself and Fernpaw, although the two had only been able to share their apprentice ceremony, as her becoming the medicine cat apprentice had gotten in the way of their warrior ceremony. He was happy to see that Coyote and Wren could share this ceremony with each other, though. He didn’t doubt that Coyote had and would serve as a good friend to be by Wrenpaw’s side. She’d be alright without Marigolddust teaching her, he was sure, although he did have a feeling it would be a bit lonely, not visiting and being around her every day.
prim 27-Feb-22 11:38 AM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
Once the majority of her clanmates had settled themselves beneath the Highledge, Laurelstar parted her maw to continue on with the ceremony. No time like the present, she supposed, time to nip these apprentices’ nerves in the bud. Get the hard part over with. ”Today, I have gathered you all here to bear witness to the promotion of two of our own apprentices, for they are ready to become full-fledged warriors.” her heterochromatic gaze bore down into the frames of Coyotepaw and Wrenpaw, the ones in question. She took a deep breath, she wasn’t afraid to address a crowd— she was actually quite happy for these two cats. A smile was evident on her scarred features, even from where she stood all the way up on top of the ledge, overlooking the abandoned quarry where they made their home. ”Coyotepaw and Wrenpaw, please step forward.” she gestured for them to approach the center of the clearing, where the space was cleared out by those congregating in the midst of it, allowing them passage through. It was time. ”I, Laurelstar, leader of ThunderClan, call upon my warrior ancestors to look down on these two apprentices. They have trained hard to understand the ways of your noble code, and I commend them to you as warriors in turn.” Those same words which have been uttered for generation after generation, familiar to the ears of any warrior, were finally being conferred to these two apprentices. She was granting them their warrior names, and this marked a monumental occasion in their lives. A moment to be proud of. ”Coyotepaw and Wrenpaw, do you promise to uphold the Warrior Code and to protect and defend your clan, even at the cost of your own life?” Their answers would determine it all, and she waited for their acceptance as she kept her gaze trained on the both of them. @tremb
{Coyotepaw} | Ceremonies
He was right, it was today. He took a deep breath to steel himself before he stepped forward, feeling a wave of relief wash over him as he spotted Wrenpaw appear at his side, she was also being promoted today. That brought a sense of comfort to the young tom, and he flashed her a small smile out of reassurance. They could do this, this was just a ceremony, the same old song and dance for everyone in the clan. They could easily handle this, they fought cats from the Dark Forest, they fought traitors, they helped save their clan. This is child’s play. At the command to step forward, the long-limbed tom looked up at the russet-furred tortoiseshell above them, listening closely to her words. Do you promise to uphold the Warrior Code? There was really only one answer, the only correct answer for a warrior of any clan to say. ”I do.” He felt his anxieties wash away.
tremb 27-Feb-22 11:54 AM
Wrenpaw ThunderClan Apprentice As Marigolddust’s tail brushed over her, her amber optics met his and for several moments she stared at him, sadness lingering in her gaze. After today he would no longer be her mentor. They wouldn’t spend their days in the territory together anymore, learning, laughing, or teasing one another. Would they still be close? No, no, of course they would. Wrenpaw knew better than to worry about that. She touched her nose briefly to his cheek. ”Thank you for everything,” she whispered softly before turning back to face Laurelstar. With Marigolddust there and Coyotepaw at her side, it wasn’t long before she felt all of her anxiety and fear ebbing away. This wasn’t a moment to fear. This was a moment to celebrate, a moment that every cat within every clan spent the early parts of their lives looking forward to. Wrenpaw’s eyes grew misty for a moment, though she worked hard to hide that from those around her. She felt as though she was feeling every single emotion at once right now, and it threatened to steal the air from her lungs. I do. Coyotepaw’s words echoed in her ears. He sounded confident, so sure of himself. This made Wrenpaw feel stronger. This was their moment. She stood up a little straighter and lifted her head a little higher, her voice ringing with conviction when she spoke. ”I do.” @prim
prim 27-Feb-22 12:06 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremonies | present
Their words of acceptance rang true in her ears and she flashed them a gracious smile, nodding in acknowledgement of their answers. Clearing her throat once again, the ThunderClan leader announced at last: ”Then by the powers of StarClan, I give you your warrior names. Coyotepaw, from this moment on you will be known as Coyotestep. Wrenpaw, from this moment on you will be known as Wrenfrost. StarClan honors your courtesy and intelligence, and your courage and determination respectively, and we welcome you as full warriors of ThunderClan.” she conferred the new names and titles for the two youngest warriors of their clan with pride, her eyes gleaming as she addressed them formally. They had made it, their hard work had paid off. She led the chants of their new warrior names with exuberance, celebrating their accomplishments and contributions to the clan that had made this moment possible. They deserved all the fanfare possible, this was one of the most important moments in any warrior’s life! ”Coyotestep! Wrenfrost! Coyotestep! Wrenfrost! Coyotestep! Wrenfrost!” @tremb
Springy 🦤 27-Feb-22 12:58 PM
Marigolddust - Ceremonies
A small purr emitted from his throat at the soft nudge from his apprentice- ex- apprentice. ”Of course,” he replied, his voice soft as he spoke. He would miss teaching Wrenpaw and taking her out into the territories, and, in a way, her becoming a warrior was the last step in him becoming the full fledged medicine cat. Without having a warrior apprentice to worry about, he would be left only with his medicine cat duties, fully teking on the role rather than part-time like he had over the past few moons. He wasn’t sure how prepared he felt for it, but he assumed that it would be a lot less work. Unfortunately, it also meant that he would have more time to think, and to remember everything that he had had as a warrior. An amazing apprentice, normal duties, and close friends. He didn’t mind being medicine cat, of course, and was happy to take the role. But he couldn’t help but wish that Fernpaw and Rooksnap were still around to see him here, or even still around in general, even if it meant he would have remained a warrior. Then, it had become time for the two apprentices to become warriors. Marigolddust listened intently, interested, excited, and perhaps only a bit sad. He knew that he and Wrenpaw would still remain close, but he had never been a very big fan of change. Wrenfrost. The name tasted sweet on his tongue, even before he started to chant it and Coyotepaw’s new name, Coyotestep. Both of the new titles felt perfect, albeit a bit different than he was used to. The steady rhythm of the clan’s cheering for the two continued even when his thoughts wandered to both of the cats’ futures and what they might hold for them. He know that his own wouldn’t include mentoring again for a long time, and he would never teach a cat to primarily do warrior duties again.
- No, the next time he would be appointed an apprentice would be on Starclan’s word, and they’d work side by side with him to keep the clan healthy. Truthfully, he couldn’t help but wish that he could stick to being Wrenpaw’s mentor instead.
raven 27-Feb-22 07:33 PM
P a l e l i l l y | Thunderclan A gentle multicolored gaze rested upon the tom, who licked bits of prey from his maw carefully. Palelilly took another bite of her own meal, plush audits flickering as the tom answered her greeting. The bashful femme turned her gaze away at the compliment, tail flickering. "Thank you- Flickerfox, is it?" She questioned, whiskers twitching as she returned to her breakfast. A kind smile spread across her face. "I'm doing well today, however I'm quite bored. It's hard to find much to do with all this snow." She complained. Palelilly had always carried a disdain for leaf-bare and the cold seasons. She'd much rather be warm. A chilling breeze rustled her fur, causing her to shuffle her stance. Palelilly finished her meal rather quickly, pushing the feathers into the snow as a temporary solution. Her bulbous tail flickered before curling over her paws, protecting her delicate toes from the wind chill. Her gaze refocused on the tom seated next to her, awaiting the next comfortable banter he'd provide. Palelilly loved keeping company with members of the clan simply because of the familiarity. Every conversation was similar, no matter who you spoke to. Not one cat was significantly different from another. "How've you been lately, Flickerfox?" She finally questioned, audits swiveling. @wild™
Dormamoon 28-Feb-22 11:28 AM
Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
A shy smile adorned the feline’s face as she listened to his response, glad he wasn’t upset at her for disturbing his rest though she still felt bad about it. Her body relaxed as their conversation continued, enjoying the sound of his laughter as they joked back and forth with one another. ”Oh I’m sure you do, though it might not be much to look at.” She teased, eyes sparkling with mischief. It wasn’t long ago when she would have been so nervous to playfully joke with a tom, but Cardinalspark made her feel so much at ease whenever they spent time together. ”You were? Well it is the thought that counts, Cardinalspark. I do appreciate that.” Honeydrop purred in response to his comment, knowing how hard it could be to try and find prey at times during the cold season, but she was still touched by him thinking of her. She found it cute as he apologized for rambling on a little bit about the food, blushing a little while he continued to speak caring things towards her. Ah yes, catching a cold. She remembered the last time that happened to her. It hadn’t been life threatening or anything of the sorts, but still miserable, nonetheless. She had overdone it trying to help everywhere she could, while remaining soaked from the rain and chilled to the bone with her short fur. It was then when the russet tom would check in on her, bringing her fresh-kill or keeping her warm while she recovered. Despite being sick, it was one of her favorite memories. ”I saw once the warm season comes, we should head to the stream like old times.” The creamy she-cat suggested with a grin, thinking back to the times they would stop by the stream after hunting and spend some time lounging about or even going for a quick swim. @wild™
Ice 02-Mar-22 09:18 AM
{ ~ Iceheart ~ // A Forgotten Friend }
The admiration in which Laurelstar spoke about her father was clear. Iceheart’s ears pricked at every word, listening intently. It was confusing when the ginger-and-white femme talked about her relationship with Featherpelt. Iceheart must have done something incredible to be chosen as deputy over the tom. It seemed like they were still good friends over it too but unfortunately, she couldn’t remember. She knew she had been there during it but no memories came into mind. It frustrated her. ” He sounds like a wonderful warrior,” the lynx-point spoke softly, fur brushing against the bare thorn tunnel of the camp entrance. ” Do you know how many siblings you have?” Iceheart questioned, forcing her bubbling anger away. Clearly, not only was Featherpelt a dedicated warrior but a committed father as well. Raising kits was not easy. Not that Iceheart knew anymore but she had a vague idea on how taxing it must be to juggle two different, time and energy consuming roles. @prim
prim 03-Mar-22 09:14 AM
{Laurelstar} | Iceheart | past II
Her respect for her father was evident in every word she spoke, in truth he was almost universally liked by anyone he encountered. He could be a voice of reason, he had friends from all walks of life and was a cherished member of the clans. A truly peaceful, gentle cat who could calm down almost anyone he encountered. Practically a saint in her eyes, a cat she never could become, but could honor and try to uphold the legacy of. ”There’s a lot, I don’t think I can count them all.” she let out an awkward chuckle at the question, her gaze lighting up for a moment. Her father practically took in any kit in need of a family, and gave them love and made them feel welcome in the clan’s walls. She wanted to do the same for her own kits, having taken on the same habit for a little while. Though since she had adopted that entire litter she found with Hollyfrost out in their abandoned Twoleg den out in the woods, she hadn’t taken in any since. She didn’t know if she could without her again, it was still so fresh in her mind, even if a couple moons had passed already. Not a day passed where she didn’t think of her. And our kits are growing older and older, and she can’t witness them becoming warriors. A sigh escaped her lips as her gaze grew wistful and cloudy for a moment, a pang of grief echoed within her heart for a moment. So many cats she loved were no longer with them, cats she and Iceheart both knew so well, and grief always seemed to know how to rear its ugly head back into these conversations. ”He was one of the best, I know he’s looking out for us from wherever he is now.” @Ice
prim 03-Mar-22 07:10 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremony | present
The sun was ever present in the sky as it overlooked the camp below. Shining its rays down upon the sand-colored rocks, the camp was basked in golden light. It was later on in the day, but the camp was ever busy, with familiar faces hustling and bustling down in the clearing. The ThunderClan leader had lost track of time when she realized she was to conduct a ceremony today, for one cat in particular. Figuring now was a better time than never, the tortoiseshell stepped out upon the Highledge, gazing down as her clanmates as she rallied them together with a call. ”Let all cats old enough to catch their own prey gather beneath the Highledge for a clan meeting!” The call was made, and she awaited her clanmates to gather in the clearing down below. She watched with interest, waiting for the cats she’d be calling upon for this ceremony. @ThunderClan @Emberlion, Tigerstripe &Cow @Fawn

Emberlion, Tigerstripe &Cow 03-Mar-22 07:46 PM
Tigerstripe The leader's yowl rang across the camp. Tigerstripe emerged from the mossy den. His fur shone as he moved towards Highledge. The tabby smiled at the much younger Sandkit. He knew why the clan meeting was being called, to apprentice the kit. His heart pounded knowing that he could be chosen to mentor Sandkit. " She could be my first apprentice!" The unlikely possibility danced across his mind. He tried to conceal the obvious expression, knowing if he wasn't chosen, he would be devastated.

Sandkit
Sandkit heard her leader’s call and hopped over to the center of the camp, her green eyes ⏃ gleam. Her paws were restless beneath her as she waited, and she wanted to squeal with excitement. ’ oh please let this be it, please let this be it ‘ she pleaded silently, eyes darting from one side of the camp to the next while cats began to gather in the clearing.

prim 03-Mar-22 08:18 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ceremony | present
As the growing crowd of cats appeared down below, gazing up at her upon her perch, the tortoiseshell leader had dipped her head to greet them all. Her heterochromatic gaze swept across the clearing for Sandkit, the one she was to promote today. This was a milestone for any clan cat, the day they reached six moons of age meant they were to be promoted to that of an apprentice. This was momentous indeed. So many cats were being promoted this moon, it was a good sign indeed. ”Today I have gathered you all here to bear witness to the promotion of one of our own.” her gaze stopped at the sight of the young she-kit who was watching her with those bright green eyes of hers. ”Sandkit, please step forward.” She gestured for the kit to enter the clearing ahead of the Highledge with a swish of her tail. She was smiling gently, hoping to ease the kit’s nerves as the clan watched her from the sidelines. ”Sandkit, you have reached the age of six moons, and it is time for you to be apprenticed. From this day on, until you receive your warrior name, you will be known as Sandpaw. Your mentor will be Tigerstripe. I hope Tigerstripe will pass down all he knows on to you.” her gaze then turned to the tom she had appointed as Sandpaw’s new mentor, her gaze stern as she expected him to keep her safe and train her well. ”Tigerstripe, you are ready to take on an apprentice. You have received excellent training from Flickereye, and you have shown yourself to be trustworthy and a swift hunter. You will be the mentor of Sandpaw, and I expect you to pass on all you know to Sandpaw.” she then took a step back, allowing the pair to greet one another and accept each other as mentor and apprentice. As well as to allow the clan to celebrate their brand new apprentice amongst their ranks. Chanting of Sandpaw’s new name could be heard, including from the leader herself. ”Sandpaw! Sandpaw! Sandpaw!” With that being said, her work here was finished. ”This meeting is dismissed.” @Fawn @Emberlion, Tigerstripe &Cow (edited)
Fawn 03-Mar-22 08:34 PM
Sandpaw
As soon ⏃ Laurelstar said her name she knew it was her moment. She stood up and stepped forward, trying to settle herself so she wasn’t so fidgety. As her leader was speaking she felt ⏃ wide smile slowly spreading across her face. She looked over at Tigerstripe, and the smile fully took hold, she bounced over to the Tom, looking up at him with the most joyous look in all of the clans. Her clan mates were cheering her name, and she couldn’t help but burst with pride that she was finally an apprentice, ’ Sandpaw…Sandpaw! ⟟ can’t believe it! ‘. ”you’re gonna be my mentor?!” she said excitedly with her still squeak-ish-kit-ish voice. @Emberlion, Tigerstripe &Cow

Ice 04-Mar-22 09:08 AM
{ ~ Iceheart ~ // A Forgotten Friend }
She smiled at that. ” Hopefully you can name them all!” Iceheart exclaimed, sea-green eyes glinting with amusement. It didn’t last long, especially with Laurelblaze’s mourning expression. ” I think he’s in StarClan. Why wouldn’t he be? He seemed like an amazing Clanmate.” At least, that’s what she has been told in the past moons: good cats go to StarClan. Bad ones go to the Dark Forest and some with unfinished business, roam the lands as spirits. Iceheart glanced back at the camp from the top of the stone hollow, admiring its beauty. The rocks glistened with early morning frost and the snow was still thickly blanketed over every surface possible. An innate feeling arose within her chest: to fiercely protect everything contained within the quarry. Is this how a ThunderClan warrior is supposed to feel or did this come from somewhere else? @prim
Shade 04-Mar-22 12:30 PM
It had been a couple weeks since Wolfprowl had left Scarletpaw in the meadow after their first training session, which had been... unproductive, to say the least. Their stubborn tempers - one fiery, one stone cold - didn't mix, and the warrior's blunt criticisms hardly went over well. She hadn't spoken to him since, and he'd rarely seen her, but he didn't go chasing her. If she wanted to sit on her training, that was her will. Finishing his grooming with a last couple of licks, Wolfprowl prepared to set off for an assigned patrol. He was just about to file out of camp with the rest of the group when... @Skeptical Moxxy™
Skeptical Moxxy™ 06-Mar-22 05:19 PM
Scarletpaw || Wolfprowl [present]
@Shade "Where do you think you're going?" The vibrant calico emerged bristling and proceeded across Thunderclan's clearing in several long stride, thrusting herself into Wolfprowl's path. Bright occulars narrowed, glaring daggers into Thunderclan's easily most apathetic warrior and her mentor. It'd been several quart moons, newleaf on their tails as the last snowpacks were melting, and the grey masculine hadn't bothered even poking his nose into the apprentices' den. If it hadn't been for following her compatriots by example she'd not even know a proper hunting crouch and caught her first measly mouse several sunrises past. Scarletpaw yearned to reach out and shove the warriors chest of claw off an ear but she lingered stone still. "You're a real dung mentor, Wolfprowl. I've half a mind to go to Laurelstar."
prim 07-Mar-22 09:56 PM
{Laurelstar} | Iceheart | past II
The joke coming from the lynx-point about her memorizing her family’s names caused her whiskers to twitch out of amusement. ”Believe me, once the number of kits your father takes in exceeds ten, its going to be hard to memorize their names. A while back I had to ask kits if my father was raising them or not, it got confusing.” she wasn’t even lying, her father’s habit of picking up new offspring to raise was quite the feat, but it made figuring out who she was related to confusing. Though it was nowhere near as perplexing as it was back then, most were grown by now, handling their own affairs. Some didn’t stay with the clan, either. ”He has a good heart. I know he’s looking out for everyone.” her bi-colored gaze drifted back to the paler she-cat, a faint smile adorning her lips as she watched the she-cat inspect the camp walls. ”Something the matter?” she tilted her head slightly, her tone changing to that of a more concerned one. Laurelstar needed to know if everything was all right, if there was anything amiss that needed to be dealt with. Did she see something wrong? wild™ 11-Mar-22 07:31 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐋𝐈𝐂𝐊𝐄𝐑𝐅𝐎𝐗 // THUNDERCLAN WARRIOR
The pointed tom-cat turned pale optics toward the opposing feline, dipping his head a tad at her words, whiskers quivering slightly at her inquiry. "Indeed, it is I." he rasped in response, fluffy tail swaying about behind him as the warrior returned to gaze at his own meal, as if making sure it hadn't somehow come alive again and ran off while his attention was directed elsewhere. He was pleased to note that the prey still laid before him, generally untouched. His ears flicked as the opposing warrior spoke about her day so far - claiming to be particularly bored this morning. Boredom wasn't an unfamiliar concept to the pointed tom-cat - it was easy for him to lose interest in something, regardless of if it was alive or not. He was ever the curious fellow who drank up knowledge like a thirsty soul does with water, he was typically parched for such. At the same time, he was such a quick learner he often found himself satisfied with what he gained far too quickly, or that which he received knowledge from would leave him far too soon. Occasionally, he'd busy his mind with various thoughts concerning whatever had captured his interest beforehand, of all the possibilities it could hold - though even that would grow boring with time and he'd be forced to find something else to wrap his mind around. This had led to quite the sticky situation more than once, though Flickerfox hadn't changed his ways even so.
-- "I suppose I'm alright. Alive and soon to have a full belly, they say that's living." he replied, swiping his tongue over his maw. "I must admit, today is going pretty slowly...you say there's nothing much you can do, though I see a number of things one could invest their time into. At the same time, I know others lack interest in various areas, unlike myself...so what may interest me, could easily turn away another." At that, he turned to his prey - which was merely a pile of bones, feathers among other things. He broke off a bone, before snapping it in two. "Like say, bones. Bones are fascinating. They come in various shapes, sizes and weights even. Though oftentimes, they're all that's left of the carcass. No one else finds any interest in dining on them, yet they could serve as...multiple things." The tom continued, before putting the remains of his meal in a small pile. @raven
wild™ 11-Mar-22 08:22 PM
- ───────── CARDINALSPARK !! // WARRIOR OF THUNDERCLAN
The russet warrior turned to glance at the cream-furred warrior next to him, ears lowering as he placed a paw upon his chest. "Not much to look at? Ah! I know it's been hindered by a few scars here and there, but I do believe I still have decent looks that rival those around me." He replied in a mockingly hurt tone, before a sly smile appeared on his face. "And besides, I've got character." he added, with a wink. Cardinalspark had always been an easygoing, charismatic character who was easy to get along with so long as one's persona didn't clash too harshly with his. At times, such would happen as the russet warrior wasn't always the most serious feline in the clan. He was often playful and even immature at times, though one could count on the feline during times of need all the same. He was a prideful feline who was rooted to his clan, though wasn't one who'd be subjected to stereotypes nor classical images. The feline was pleased to know that Honeydrop hadn't been upset over the fact that he wasn't able to bring her some prey. She was understanding as usual, which was one of the reasons why he liked her - he didn't have to worry about being a certain way around her or worrying over the fact that his actions - or lack thereof - could upset her. Of course, he still did worry from time to time, most likely due to the bond he'd developed between himself and her, though it wasn't like the times during his youth where certain things were expected of him or certain actions were despised. He could simply be himself. At her words about the stream, the tom purred. "That would be ideal. We could go in celebration of new-leaf...so long as it's not too chilly. In any case, I'd love to go again sometime soon...which wouldn't be long. We haven't done anything like that for quite some time..." he mused, with a quiet breath escaping him. @Dormamoon
~Swift~ 11-Mar-22 10:28 PM
∘◦ AlerceClaw ◦∘ & Seakit @Ice Lounging was a luxury this deputy took for granted as a warrior. Some things a mortal takes for granted and realizes its value once its no longer within reach. We always want what we cant have. Everything falls into this trap. Young and old. With a yawn, the peculiarly pigmented tom found himself stretching his physique and letting it set down on the uneven terrain of Thunderclan camp. It was an early morning, and as much as he failed to be a natural early bird, the narcoleptic bachelor found himself growing fond of the serenity such an hour of time brought to the territory. Everyone was still sleeping. It was an hour that was not often disturbed. If a time of day had to be disturbed, people often chose nighttime. But early morning was always silent. It was almost improper to think; the usual bustling campsite now emptied out. Like some fever dream rather. But it couldnt have been a fever dream when he clearly felt the sun embrace his figure in the occassional moments when the clouds in the firmament did not occupy its radiance. The snow clearly melted away from beneath this endothermic gladiator. This was no fever dream. Nor did he wish it. It was his temporary Nirvana.

Honeydrop // Cardinalspark
A soft giggle escaped the feline’s lips as she listened to his dramatic display of pain. ”I never realized you were such a great actor.” She mused with a smile, though with his type of personality it wasn’t surprising to see that he was a tom of many talents. ”Maybe you’re not so bad after all.” Her tone was teasing as she playfully nudged his shoulder, fully relaxed beside him as they conversed back and forth. She had definitely missed their conversations, but clan life could be pretty busy at times, especially in the cold weather when everyone was hunting extra to try and fill in the lack of prey. ”In celebration of new-leaf? That sounds like a good idea, plus it would give us a chance to be alone.” Honeydrop said with a teasing glint in her eyes, before placing a quick lick to his cheek. ”I’ve missed our small talks. They were always quite entertaining.” She stated softly, thinking back to their times spent together. It had been a while since they had first started hanging out so much, and she could only assume that maybe…their feelings towards each other were the same. Though, of course she could be reading the whole situation entirely wrong between them, and if that was the case, what was he thinking of her right now for licking his cheek? If he didn’t feel the same way towards her, she only hoped that he took it as a friendly lick from one friend to another. They were close enough for that, right? Her cheeks became a little bit rosy as she began to overthink her actions, and ducked her head down shyly in hopes he didn’t notice the heat filling her face. @wild™

Ratpaw;
The large brown tabby Tom moved into the camp clearing for that darkness of the apprentices den that he had been hunkered down in. His large paws crunched against the semi frozen ground, lavender gaze looked across the camp clearing, before moving his way to the fresh kill pile. He had hunted much earlier that morning and it would be time for dinner by now, and he could probably just nibble at a mouse. He picked out a medium sized one from the few he could see amongst the other discarded carcasses, tugging it away from the body heap by the tail. He turned and headed off to the side of camp, plopping onto his rear before flopping all the day to his side. Dropping the prey between his front paws, his claws unsheathed, moving to slice apart then mouse for easier consumption. @prim

prim 14-Mar-22 08:44 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ratpaw | present
With the changing of the seasons, it was evident that her clanmates were emerging from that lulled state leaf-bare brought with it. The snow was mostly melted, though some patches did remain in spots littered around camp. Laurelstar could even see clumps of her winter coat beginning to shed from her frame, thinning out as warmer weather came. Almost as if a switch flipped and it told her dense fur to beat it. Alas, her coveted cold weather was to leave them, and she would be a very cranky, long-furred feline during the warmer weather. The gigantic tortoiseshell had emerged from her den upon the Highledge, doing her daily once-over of her camp below, inspecting the state of affairs of her subjects and their home. She did not treat them like subjects per se, but they did look up to her for guidance. She was their leader. It was her job to ensure they remained safe. Things were to her liking, everyone was engaged in typical activity for this time of day. Some were coming in from early-morning hunts, others arising from their slumber. She couldn’t help but to be pleased, everything was well. It had been a long time since she could truly rest easy after tending to her clan. It was… Freeing, knowing she didn’t have any enemies looking to rip into them all. She could breathe again. The sovereign descended from her perch, down into the quarry below. She carefully padded down the boulders that made up the staircase that led up to her den. She then entered the camp, shaking out her coat that sent red and ginger-colored hair strands flying into the air. She would look a little raggedy for the next while she assumed. Her clanmates were used to this already, she was positive of that. Speaking of clanmates, she could see one digging into a meal already— an apprentice. ”Good day to you, Ratpaw.” she flashed the young tom a polite smile, her bushy tail swaying. She didn’t want to startle him all of a sudden, getting his attention before sparking a conversation was the safest bet to go with. @ever ☼ ™

She would alert Alerceclaw to tell the patrols he sends out to be on high alert. They couldn’t afford to lose warriors now, even if they were slowly replenishing their ranks with new promotions. prim 15-Mar-22 10:13 PM
{Laurelstar} | Raccoonpaw | future I
She always had a soft-spot for those seeking refuge within her clan. It was s tradition ThunderClan had held up since ancient times, welcoming in outsiders who sought to join their clan. Much of her family consisted of cats who had been brought into the clan from the outside, she cared for them, she wanted her clan to be a safe haven for all. They would be cared for and protected under her rule. She wanted to be a benevolent leader, one who defended the helpless and inspired courage from her clanmates. It was also why she took a certain apprentice under her wing, so she could make sure his enthusiasm and zeal for training wouldn’t cause him any harm. Everything was good in moderation. ”I’m here, Raccoonpaw.” the lichen curtain hanging outside of her den’s entrance parted ways as she stepped out, staring down at the younger tom with a gentle smile. It was rare for an apprentice to go seeking out their mentor, but Raccoonpaw was just so eager, so on top of it that he went out of his way to seek her out. She admired his work ethic, in a way, it reminded her of herself at his age. So bright, so willing to train, wanting to grow stronger— so naïve to the world. The harsh realities of it hadn’t fully settled in for him just yet. She didn’t want him to go through half the amount of trauma she had endured in her years alive, he didn’t deserve to ever suffer. ”We’ll get going, come on.” she nodded to her apprentice, tail swishing as she looked up to the golden skies of dawn for just a moment. It was getting warmer out now that the sun was rising, but the remnants of leaf-bare’s chilly winds were still present. It was exiting, but it was taking its sweet time. She couldn’t wait for the mornings to be pleasantly warm when she woke up at the crack of dawn. It’d make training much more bearable for all of her pupils. Plus she could spend time at the lake more often and wade in the water a bit, she actually enjoyed it, though she didn’t possess the proper skills to truly swim like a RiverClanner. @Cryptic
