Springy 🦤 16-Mar-22 10:56 PM
Marigolddust
- Present - The weather seemed to have become a little warmer the further the forest progressed into the season of New-Leaf, Leaf-Bare slowely fading away into the background like an awkward stage in a apprentice’s life. Clumsily, it continued to slowely pass by, stooping between cold temperatures and temperatures that were warmer than what they had had throughout the previous moons. Sometimes, Marigolddust could have sword he could see some green hints in the branches that lay like a blanket over the forest, hanging above his head like a unevenly built nest on dewy ground. But, this only came with mere glances. Whenever he tried to pay more focus to the areas in question, he found nothing besides the grey-brown of dead branches. He had come to think he might have been imagining it all, his excitement for warmer seasons outrunning the reality of his situation. The weather was still quite chilly, although it was becoming warmer and warmer every day, and snow still fell, although it had become more sparse and broken by small showers of rainfall. Even so, Marigolddust’s heart beat faster at the mere anticipation of New-Leaf taking away this horrid stage of Leaf-Bare. Really, it hadn’t been all that bad, and nothing more than a few colds and scrapes from falls had sprung up because of it. Even so, the medicine cat didn’t want to take chances. The sooner this season was gone, the less likely a wave of green-cough or something similar might break out. This was his first Leaf-Bare as the medicine cat of Thunderclan, and he had done fairly well thus far in the journey. If sickness as bad as greencough broke out in Thunderclan, though, it might be a different story. He had yet to cure a cat from greencough, since he had received no reason to do so, and therefor he was inexperienced; not to mention, he had only ever had one training session with another clan’s medicine cat.
- He would be having one with Otterpop soon, of course- they were still in the planning stage for Marigolddust to travel to Riverclan to train, but it was more progress than he had made for awhile. Ruining the opportunity of being trained by Beanspark and Specklerose wasn’t the best course of action in benefitting his professionalism, considering the fact that, besides Otterpop, they were the only cats who could have taught him, but he had decided it had been out of his power. He hadn’t known that the Dark Forest had plotted to attack them, nobody did. Well, none thought that they would do so as early and with as much of a blow to the clan. He, Iceheart, and Laurelstar- Icestar and Laurelblaze then- had been the only ones aware of it, along with the poor apprentices who had been thrown into the Dark Forest with the traitors, his previous apprentice included. Marigolddust grimaced, before giving his head a firm shake. He didn’t like thinking back to the events, and he didn’t need his day to be ruined just because he was thinking back to something that couldn’t be prevented or changed. He had no responsibility in it, although perhaps he should have checked on Wrenpaw more. But she was Wrenfrost now, and she could watch out for herself perfectly fine. She didn’t need him, not now that she was a full-grown warrior. He was more proud of her than he thought he had ever men in anything or anyone before, besides the fact that certain instances with Fernpaw might have been a match. Marigolddust released a small sigh, quickly sending his tongue over his whiskers as he tried to focus on the present. It was a nice day, and everyone was walking around and enjoying the warmth of the day, overall, at least.
- He should have been out having a nice meal, maybe making conversation with a cat or two. He was terrible at talking to others, but he wasn’t sure he would be able to handle the loneliness of his den for much longer. So, he hoped that he might not feel quite so isolated today, although he couldn’t bring himself to approach anybody. He was still too young and insecure to bring himself to do so, especially with cats he hardly knew, and he didn’t want to ruin someone’s day by acting particularly awkward or sheepish around them. It would only make it worse if he started such conversations, wouldn’t it? So, instead of acting upon his wishes, he sat there, tail curled around himself, doing little more than daydreaming himself approaching another cat with full confidence and starting a good conversation. Starclan, he wished. @wild™ ignore the ridiculous length of this starter HAHA))
prim 17-Mar-22 05:44 PM
{Laurelstar} | Ratpaw | present
Her own namesake was rather fitting, being dubbed Laurel for her mottled tortoiseshell pelt. Her parents were caring, and they dubbed all of their children with kind names. While Ratpaw may not sound the most pleasant, it wasn’t the worst. Rats were clever creatures, and they worked together with the packs they lived in. In a way, they were loyal to one another, though she wouldn’t probably name her own kits after them. Ratpaw, however, didn’t really have much of a choice in the matter. Just like how she couldn’t have given herself a cooler name that sounded more threatening, though her enemies would quiver in fear after hearing her name anyhow. She was a well-known presence across the forest clans, she wasn’t to be trifled with. ”I mean, I can also just order you to not bring me food, as the leader of your clan, you know.” she grew stern for a moment, her gaze hardening. His insistence was kind, but she knew ways around the loophole. Her steely expression melted away into amusement, clearly she was just joking around with the tom. She didn’t mean to cause false panic for a moment, though she didn’t want to be fretted over by a child practically. She could take care of herself, she wasn’t ancient! I’m thirty-two moons old damn it! Perhaps he wasn’t aware of how stubborn the leader of ThunderClan was either. She was practically the most stubborn of them all! Just try her. @ever ☼ ™
wild™ 17-Mar-22 08:40 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
The sun had already risen over the horizon, casting its golden rays upon those whom dwelled below. The rays danced upon the morning dew, the remaining snow and ice that had begun to melt away, slowly but surely. It caused these things to sparkle, to glimmer, to shine - as if a promise for a brighter future sometime soon. The birds had begun to sing together once more, insects had returned to buzzing about in the annoying way they do and critters of all kinds had begun to return to the undergrowth, skittering about among the shadows. Yes, things were returning, slowly but surely. New-leaf was coming and he couldn't wait for it. At last, freedom from the harsh season of leaf-bare was on the horizon. Featherpaw couldn't say that this season had been particularly harsh or dreadful - when compared to the stories some warriors and elders spoke of of leaf-bares among the past, this one held little in comparison. And besides - since coming out of the war moons ago, Featherpaw would much rather deal with little prey and potential illness than traitors and scary cats who harmed his loved ones. The image of his mother's soul being taken from her body was still ingrained in his mind, as was the image of the lifeless Hollyfrost. In all honesty, he still hadn't gotten over that loss and frequently suffered from nightmares despite the war having been long over. Perhaps childish, but he couldn't help it all the same.
-- To make matters worse, he had a constant reminder of his troubles - his lame leg. He had earned it during the landslide and unfortunately, hadn't been able to assist his clanmates during combat, save for ushering a few kits to safety. He had hidden himself among the darkest corners of the camp to merely watch and quite frankly such actions were cowardly - he despised the day he ever did such. Though, it wasn't like he'd be much help either way, but he'd lost so many things that day - two cats that were quite important to him. Hollyfrost, his mother and Icestar, his mentor. Though Icestar - now Iceheart - was still alive, he'd hardly spoken to her since that fateful day. Even training sessions had been rather slow, though uncomfortably silent. And he felt bad for doing so, but dealing with one who didn't remember you despite moons of training was...hard. So, he simply chose not to speak - otherwise, he'd find himself questioning her all over again. So, perhaps the Stars had been kind to them and allowed Thunderclan a relatively easy leaf-bare this time around. He certainly was grateful for it, whatever the reasoning behind it turned out to be. The black tabby allowed a sigh to escape him as he hobbled out of the apprentice den, blue-green optics flickering about the camp. His gaze landed upon Marigolddust, the clan's medicine cat. Perhaps he ought to spare him a word, it didn't seem like he was particularly busy at the moment. He decided it would probably be best to bring him something to eat - out of courtesy, of course. So, he limped his way over to the fresh-kill pile, selecting a squirrel before making his way over to the tuxedo tom.
"Mornin', Marigolddust. I hope you're hungry, cause I brought you something!" he greeted the tom, slightly muffled. He sat the prey down before the tom, his tail swishing about in a wide berth. "How're you today? You look as if you've been out here for some time, though aren't sure what to do. Either that or you're just really good at sitting still." Featherpaw chuckled, settling down nearby the opposing feline. @Springy 🦤 (You're absolutely okay, haha! Gives me plenty to work off of <3)
1
Springy 🦤 17-Mar-22 10:13 PM
Marigolddust - Featherpaw
- Present - Fortunately enough for Marigolddust, it turned out that he had gotten lucky today. The chances of himself actually approaching another cat were very low, unless it was one of the cats who he considered close friends of his- which, unfortunately, amounted to quite a low number. Although he felt that he was friends with most every one of his clanmates, considering he was the medicine cat, he never truly got the opportunity to become close with many of them. Usually, a cat comes to his den looking to have some sort of pain they were holding relieved, and then once he does just that, they leave and never bother to visit again until they’re hurting once more. Marigolddust couldn’t help but feel like he had done something wrong every time that a cat showed him kindness and then disappeared as soon as they’re impairments were fixed. Perhaps they would come by more if he spoke more, or if he wasn’t so calm? Maybe if he managed to catch them onto conversation after he was done healing them? But, no, that had never turned out to work very well. His clanmates were simply too busy to give the medicine cat some of their time, and he understood. Of course, he was being selfish looking for every cat who stopped by to come visit again- it was lonely, yes, but he couldn’t take up every cat’s time. He could only be prepared for the next visitor to arrive, and then be ready to not see them again for awhile. Was this what the life of a medicine cat was like? Lonely, even when your den was occupied by a dozen other cats? Marigolddust had primarily tensed at the sound of a voice next to him, his tail giving his body a squill squeeze before the startlement wore off, Marigolddust’s eyes landing on a tom who had approached him from the side opposite of where he had been looking.
- It was more than likely that he would have noticed the apprentice if he hadn’t been so observed in his own thoughts, but he tried not to make that so clear as he gave Featherpaw a smile and a respectful dip of his head; a gesture he offered cats perhaps a bit too much, considering it’s usual strength in it’s representation. ”Oh, hey, Featherpaw. That’s for me?” he asked, yes landing on the morsel of prey the apprentice offered him. A warm emotion budded in his chest at the idea of the tom sparing his time to give Marigolddust something he could have easily acquired by his own doing, as ironic to his previous thoughts as it was. Featherpaw was one of the handful of cats who Marigolddust remembered the names to, and it was for good reason, too. Featherpaw was a friendly and kind tom, from what Marigolddust had seen and experienced, and it was hard to forget the name of the cat who served as the processor of one of the most difficult injuries Marigolddust had had to heal in his growing time as Thunderclan’s Medicine cat. He had also proven to be one of the very few felines who Marigolddust couldn’t quite fix. It was a miracle and a blessing sent from Starclan, the fact that he had managed to only be unsuccessful with very few patients despite his lack in training, but he felt absolutely terrible about it. He could still recall when Featherpaw had earned the injury to his leg. The limb had been crushed by a fallen boulder from the side of Thunderclan’s camp, and, on instinct, Marigolddust had come at the sound of Laurelblaze’s call and assisted her in removing the gigantic stone. He hadn’t known what to expect to witness underneath, but he had gone forward without hesitation anyways, even though he didn’t doubt he would have been much more reluctant if he had known the mess of Featherpaw’s leg they would find underneath the wreckage.
- Marigolddust had tried his best, but despite his best efforts, he couldn’t repair the destroyed bone of the apprentice’s leg. And, so, the tom still had the same limp today, and it never failed at making Marigolddust feel guilty. But the tuxedo kept his eyes away from the lame leg for now, keeping eye contact with Featherpaw instead. He had enough confidence to do so as of recent, which he was proud of, although he wasn’t sure how long his progress would go from taking one step forward to one step forward and two steps back. Marigolddust adverted his gaze back to the prey and gave an embarrassed chuckle at Featherpaw’s observation. ”Well, that wouldn’t be completely inaccurate. The first one, I mean- although I’m not too bad at staying still, either,” he said, his tone having a hint of playfulness to it. He was uncertain whether his words were a joke or not, but he decided he’d let the young tom decide, rather than himself. He wasn’t the most decisive of felines, anyhow. @wild™
ever ☼ ™ 18-Mar-22 09:22 AM
Ratpaw;
The lean tall tabby chuckled and gave a simple shrug in response to her words. He didn’t seem too threatened by her words, besides he had his own come back working up. He flashed her a charming half grin, “You could.. but would you really not allow a young striving apprentice catch you a meal to show the progress in his training?” he asked, almost sounding offended towards the end, but with that half grin it was clear that he was also just joking. “I mean, I guess I understand. Being the leaders an important job,” he began again, looking across the camp clearing briefly, before leaning away some. “Such important time should be bided to more pressing matters. No time to spend having fresh-caught dinner with an apprentice.” @prim
Skeptical Moxxy™
Scarletpaw || Wolfprowl [present]
@Shade "Where do you think you're going?" The vibrant calico emerged bristling and proceeded across Thunderclan's clearing in several long stride, thrusting herself into Wolfprowl's path. Bright occulars narrowed, glaring daggers into Thunderclan's easily most apathetic warrior and her mentor. It'd been several quart moons, newleaf on their tails as the last snowpacks were melting, and the grey masculine hadn't bothered even poking his nose into the apprentices' den. If it hadn't been for following her compatriots by example she'd not even know a proper hunting crouch and caught her first measly mouse several sunrises past. Scarletpaw yearned to reach out and shove the warriors chest of claw off an ear but she lingered stone still. "You're a real dung mentor, Wolfprowl. I've half a mind to go to Laurelstar."

wild™ 18-Mar-22 08:41 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
For better or worse, the last thing Featherpaw was was overly observant - as a matter of fact, he hardly knew what was going on half the time. Lost among his own little world of fantastical realities or merely his own thoughts, it wasn't uncommon for him not to realize what was going on before him - let alone the smaller details others were able to pick up among others and their surroundings, leaving the poor tom-cat to figure things out by himself...which, typically led to him getting lost among his own mind once more. He wasn't exactly scatter-brained nor a true daydreamer - resting somewhere in the middle of both traits and quite honestly, his general lack of observance was merely to blame. He always meant well, but he wasn't the most attentive feline among Thunderclan. Though, after suffering the loss of Hollyfrost and partial loss of Icestar, the tok had tried his best to pay more attention to those around him. He wished he'd done so during the time the beloved black molly was alive, as well as while his mentor still obtained all her memories - he felt as if he could know so much more about them, but now he'd practically lost his chance at doing so and was now suffering in more ways than one. Though, he couldn't say such a lifestyle was easy - trying to focus on things was hard, especially when there was so much to watch and observe, it was difficult to pick just one thing. So, he decided he ought to pair what he wasn't good at with something he was good at - observing another while having a good ol' chat. Surely, this was something he could handle.
-- "Yep! I figured you might be hungry, I don't see you around much but that might just be due to our differing roles. Still, I don't want you to go hungry, so I brought you something! Don't worry if you can't eat it all, I'll be happy to lend my own belly to assist in any leftovers." And yet, unbeknownst to the black tabby, he'd already begun to fail at his challenge. He failed to notice the subtle tensing of the opposing tom, the limited eye contact and the embarrassed chuckle that followed his own statement. His ears merely twitched in response to the medic's words, his tail flicking about behind him. "Is that so? What's up then? Can't decide on what to do first? Don't worry about that too much, I understand that all too well. I can never seem to figure out what to do in a timely manner...whatever that is. I feel like I make choices fairly quickly, though apparently I take quite a while according to others. Hm..." The tabby apprentice trailed off, offering the tom a kind smile. "We should have a contest one day to see who can sit still longer then, cause I'm pretty good at it too." His whiskers quivered a tad, blue-green eyes bright. "Though, I must say sitting still for a long time can get pretty boring...you should try getting in on some action every now and then. Though, I'm not sure how well that'd work, since you're the medicine cat and all. I've never seen a medicine cat like that before - adventurous, daring and whatnot, y'know?" Featherpaw rambled onward, already seeming to drift off into his own thoughts once more. @Springy 🦤
Pip 18-Mar-22 10:42 PM
Sparrowfeather Sparrowfeather poked her head out of the warriors den, ears flattened to her head. She perked up at the smell of Newleaf it brought the chirping of birds! And finally no snow! She stuck her head fully out of the den and- PUFF a wad of melting snow smacked down onto her head. She snorted- shaking her head and stepping away from the warriors den. Patting down her wet fur. She would go to the fresh-kill pile but she hadn’t gone on a hunting patrol yet… if she could just find Sandstride… maybe she already left. Sparrowfeather sat down across the freshkill pile, leaning against the walls of the camp. Pinefoot still wasn’t talking to her… they had fallen apart.. did he really not want to talk to her anymore? She sighed. Every time she looked for him he would just vanish. And they still had their crow: Clo. It’s still rather weird that a bird would take such a liking to a predator… Sparrowfeathers ears perked at the sound of footsteps. Its Keenstreak! she backed up behind a fern- hoping he wouldn’t approach her. Yet he did, his tail swinging behind him, his left eye was still blurry and scarred and his dark brown fur still looked matted from when Pinefoot scratched it up. ”Sparrowfeather! How’s my favorite warrior doing?” Sparrowfeather chuckled nervously. ”Fine…” she slowly started to edge away. Keenstreak put his paw out. ”We haven’t hung out in awhile, huh? How about we go hunting. Just the two of us? Like old times- I mean they’re not that old..” he laughed and Sparrowfeather gave a half hearted smile. ”Maybe-… I uh-“ ”Great! See you in a bit!” Keenstreak trotted off happily humming. Sparrowfeather gave another defeated sigh. When was she going to stop getting into these situations? @Bronzewing (edited)
Bronzewing 19-Mar-22 01:43 PM
@Pip Pinefoot's life hadn't changed much since the other days. He was still the same ruddy brown cat, his fur now a bit thicker due to being further away from kithood than before. He was a rather impressive looking feline, even more so now that the cold and barrenness of winter had shaken itself away from his fur. He moved around the camp with a small twitching smile on his face, nodding at Clanmates he crossed paths with, being a rather friendly young tom with a desire to prove himself in ThunderClan. Rubbing his head, he caught a conversation on the wind- and he did remember the voice of Sparrowpaw. Sparrowfeather, he reminded himself now, having some trouble recalling that the apprentice he used to hang out with was now the same rank as him. And it hadn't even been that long ago, did it? He wondered why he had never bothered to speak to them since that one fight. Well, they were going hunting anyway. Maybe he could step himself into their small patrol, claim that more cats were better than two- and besides, he planned to step out of camp at that moment anyway. With a nod of his head addressed to himself, he padded up to Sparrowfeather. "Hey." he said as a small greeting, not waiting for a response before he launched into his reason for being there. "I heard you were going hunting, yes? I planned to go out myself- but more cats are better than one, wouldn't you say? If you'll take a third Clan member along, I'll be willing to join the pair of you." He wasn't the biggest fan of running into Keenstreak again, but it didn't matter. He just wanted to go hunting, maybe keep an eye on them in case they did anything a bit strange. Besides, solo hunts got... lonely sometimes.
Pip 19-Mar-22 01:51 PM
@Bronzewing Sparrowfeather watched as Pinefoot made his way over to her- his fur had grown out a bit during bareleaf. Hers hadn’t seemed to grow out at all, in fact it was still thinning out. He looked older too. Which made Sparrowfeather mildly self-conscious of the fact she still probably looked like an apprentice. Her brow raised in surprise as Pinefoot so casually walked up to her with a flick of his tail. He wanted to join their hunting patrol? Sparrowfeather could barely contain her surprised look. ”Yeah… of course you can join! Keenstreak is slow anyway” she gave a small nervous smile. She didn’t want this conversation to end and she didn’t feel like asking any big or saddening questions that might make Pinefoot uncomfortable… like their fight- or the fact that he might not have showed up for her warrior ceremony. So she stayed on a more familiar topic. ”Your crow finally likes me.” Sparrowfeather blurted out. ”Oh- also I got tired of calling it a crow so it’s name is Clo now.” Sparrowfeather straightened her posture. ”I mean- you can still name them something else- you just didn’t seem to keen on a name..” her sentence drifted off into silence. She missed being able to talk to him casually- not in this forced and uncomfortable way she felt. You haven’t see anyone near the border, have you?”
Springy 🦤 20-Mar-22 12:02 AM
Marigolddust - Featherpaw
- Present - Marigolddust was quite relieved that Leappaw had failed to notice certain things in his demeanor and held himself, such as his sheepishness and uncertainty. Such were habits he had yet to shake, although he hoped that he could figure out a way to avoid them sooner rather than later. They were tiring and annoying, and always made him seem and feel weak, although it also kept him from being intimidating and often lead him to be quite easy for other cats to approach, if they decided to approach a cat with the title of Medicine cat, that was. He was aware that some didn’t, nervous around cats that had higher ranks in respect than them. He would have felt the same, if the medicine cat before him hadn’t been his best friend since they were kits. Leappaw, on the other paw, seemed to think along the line of a handful of others, not seeming at all nervous around him. It was quite a relief, if the stormy furred tuxedo were to tell the truth. At Leappaw’s comment on Marigolddust’s hunger, the medicine cat paused for a moment, only now realizing that his stomach did feel fairly empty. With the realization, he found his stomach threatening to grumble. He hadn’t eaten as much food since the landslide due to the sickness that had broken out afterwords, the habit growing from his attempts at pinpointing whether or not the illness came from the prey they had. He hadn’t quite broken it yet, but it have grown to merely become something he often forgot; he would go throughout the entirety of a day with only having had one meal at times, forgetting that he could starve more often than not. (edited)
- ”I guess I might be a little bit hungry,” he noted, before glancing back up at Leappaw and the morsel of prey between his jaws. A gracious smile spread across Marigolddust’s features at Leappaw’s kind offer, and at his rather amusing suggestion that followed suite. ”Well, thank you. It’s really appreciated, but you can lend a hand either way, if you wish to,” he said, motioning to the food and then back to the apprentice I’m front of him. Albeit the fact that the tom was quite hungry, he didn’t wish to be rude by claiming the whole meal, especially since Leappaw had been the one considerate enough to offer him the prey. Marigolddust examined the other tom, and as he listened to the other feline speak, he found himself feeling quite amused with the apprentice. He definitely had some energy, and he liked to talk, too. Marigolddust was used to this, having had had Wrenfrost as an apprentice, and he found it to be quite an enduring trait. This familiarity of the situation seemed to assist him in speaking smoothly and fairly confidently, too. ”Nothing much, I don’t think. I’m just not used to giving myself free time, always fussing around herbs and such. I thought I’d give myself a break today, although, I don’t think I’m very good at relaxing,” he admitted with another chuckle, uncertain as to whether the sound was meant to be as uncertain as it sounded. ”Who can sit still the longest, hmm? I mean, I can sit pretty still for quite awhile- I’m not sure if you’d stand a chance,” he joked. He hadn’t realized that he would find himself so much more comfortable with Featherpaw this quickly than he was with most anyone else, more than likely due to how much of Wrenfrost he saw in the tom. They were so similar, except it seemed Featherpaw didn’t hold quite so many anxieties, and might have been a little more aloof, too.
- Hesitation came after Featherpaw’s next words, brought upon the two by Marigolddust’s lack of certainty in the statements. It was true; medicine cats usually didn’t get much action, at least not anywhere besides their own den and Starclan. But in those places, quite a lot happened- births, injuries, deaths, knowing conversations, prophecies, healing, and more. Except, it wasn’t exactly the action Marigolddust suspected Featherpaw meant. Finally, he decided to break the short moment of quiet between the two. ”I get some action sometimes, although not quite so much of what you’re thinking about. And actually, I have- I would never mess with Specklerose,” he mentioned, before leaning forward and dramatically whispering to Featherpaw, ”She’s a little scary.” with a paw next to his may, as if covering his mouth from being seen by wandering eyes. It was a joke, of course, although he was still quite intimidated by the fem. Marigolddust made that clear with his tone and dramatic gestures. @wild™
Bronzewing 20-Mar-22 01:28 PM
@Pip He chuckles in a rather cordial manner. “I would believe he is. The old cat’s getting on in moons, ain’t he?” He purrs. He was going to leave the conversation at that and just wait for them to head off, but he should have expected that Sparrowfeather would have more questions. “Ah, the crow? You can keep them, if they finally like you.” He says with a touch of disdain in his tone. “They kept messing up my hunts- and besides, I don’t think they liked whenever I would go after their own kin. If you’re willing to deal with it, go ahead. As long as I get to see it sometimes.” He smiles. You definitely feel stronger towards it than me.” he meows. “By the border…? Not really. You looking for somebody specific?”

Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 20-Mar-22 07:21 PM
An elusive form slipped into the heart of the forest dwellers home. He was not often seen within the bramble walls of the camp unless mandatory for patrols or deposit prey upon the fresh kill pile. The warrior, how ever capable, had no apprentice assigned to him nor did he have anyone he'd consider himself especially close with. Despite being raised alongside many of his denmates, he didnt even share the den space with them. His old nest had long been tossed out or moved in to by now. Ever since the battle with the Dark Foresters, the tom had sought out a small, solitary shelter for the rest of his nights deep within Thunderclans territory. Under twisted roots, there was a nest for one tucked away and hidden in shadow which served as his own den. It was entirely unsafe to house alone, he knew this, but he found himself unwilling to reintegrate with his peers for fear of disrupting what ever amount of normalcy they had achieved in his wake. Besides, he really wasnt meant for sleeping amongst so many bodies with all of his tossing and turning and mumbles. Not to mention the night terrors that had managed to wake nearly everyone at least once a night during the nights proceeding the battle. So, yes, sleeping in solitude was best for everyone at the end of the day.
The freckled feline dropped two plump mice upon the pile, content with his first catches of a quickly arriving newleaf. Now that he had come for what he needed, it was time to leave. He'd turn around and scurry right back out into the wilderness like a shadow fleeing the sun, careful to avoid the High Ledge as much as possible. He could still see the blood dripping off of it... Dustycloud shuddered at the thought before setting himself back on track. Today would be different from his usual routine because he was going to talk to someone, maybe even make a friend if he got lucky enough. The issue was, the heavily scarred feline wasnt exactly sure as to how one would go about making a friend. Starclan knew it had been quite a while since he'd actually tried to. He lingered by the fresh kill pile, his one-intact ear burning with embarrassment at his own social awkwardness before hasitly retreating to a shaded spot near the edge of camp. He sat down, puffy tail curled close to his side as he waited for... something. @Soop (meant to start this sooner but work got crazy yesterday ) (edited)
Soop 20-Mar-22 10:47 PM
Vanillakit — & Dustycloud @Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" The morning had been pleasant so far; the harmonical aubades of the early birds during dawn were a soft, euphonious greeting to a new day. The sun took no time to climb high up in the zenith, blue skies a vibrant sheet powdered with the gentlest clouds, looking to be made of the smoothest silk. Everything seemed perfect today — well, at least that's what went on in the little, easy-to-please mind of Vanillakit, a polite little cat who seemed to enjoy the little things in her everyday life. Now at five moons old, she simply enjoyed the innocent, relaxed bliss of kithood while she could, though was hardly convinced that her upcoming apprentice ceremony next moon was a particularly bad thing. Now nearing noon, the wild scents of the oak trees and floral aroma of wildflowers clustering at the edges of camp delighted the little one's tiny nasal cavities; she bathed her body in the warm, welcoming sensation of the sunlight on her starkissed back, multicolored eyes gazing fondly upon the camp as she ran out to play. Palesheen had granted her access to the wide world of camp two moons ago, and Vanillakit was determined to explore every nook and cranny, surprising herself every day with new things she found, like a chrysalis of a monarch butterfly or a shiny pebble. She had even made a friend or two, apart from her dearly loved siblings. Similarly, today she was out to complete her objective of aquiring a new one. Her sweet, innocent eyes, so round and clinquant as ever, traced camp curiously, paws skip-hopping on the ground jovially as she made her merry way through camp. Just as she was about to begin her daytime routine with a small wood mouse for breakfast, she spotted a cat lounging near the prey pile, looking quite tense and awkward for a feline that was not currently occupied with a duty or conversation. Friendly as ever, she padded over. "Good morning, sir!" Vanillakit mewed politely, little ears twitching and soft tail flicking as she stood in front of the taller tom. Being five moons old, she was almost as tall as a young apprentice, finally having contracted a growth spurt — but she still had to look up upon the warriors as they had the upper paw in the category of height in her conditions. "Might I trouble you with a wee bit of conversation?" (edited)
Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 21-Mar-22 11:13 AM
Blue and amber eyes watched as this pale little form approached him without a second thought. He worried briefly that her guardians hadnt properly enlightened her on the premise of stranger-danger. Before she even opened her mouth he was looking beyond her at the rest of camp, mismatched gaze seeking out worried parents or queens. But then he remembered: He wasnt a stranger, he was a clanmate. Or at least he was supposed to be. It unnerved him, the sudden realization that alienating himself so far had begun to take its toll. He almost didnt hear when she began speaking. Sir? Dustycloud blinked down at her, surprised at her diction. He had to stop himself from looking around again, wondering if she had mistaken him for someone else. But then again, who could he ever be mistook for with scars like these? It was true, as he sported a ripped ear, a mark against his temple, two large slashes across his face, another winding around his left foreleg and even a bite mark complete with neatly set puncture wounds. All gifts from the Dark Forest. He averted his gaze to the ground between them, overcome with the desire to leave but he stayed put only for fear of offending the kitten before him. She shouldnt have to look at someone that looked so completely like patch work. But then she spoke again, expectant for a response. He found himself meeting her gaze far easier than expected- kits were always easier- before he offered what he hoped to be a convincing grin. "I-" He cleared his throat, hoarse from disuse, "Sorry, uhm, y-yea sure if you want to." He patted the empty space next to him, purposefully inviting her on the side with the least amount of scarring. "W-Whats your name?"
Deep breath. You can do this. Shes just a kit. In hindsight it was exactly what he needed. To be bombarded with someone of his own rank felt like a bit too much at the moment, as he was well-aware of what some of his old denmates thought of him. At least with someone younger there was all the chance that she hadnt heard all the rumors about his instability. @Soop

He didn't point out her bristly demeanor or brash greeting, only answered her question with a simple, "Patrol." @Skeptical Moxxy™ did this ping not come through?)
Soop 21-Mar-22 04:16 PM
Vanillakit — & Dustycloud @Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" Being a kitten with quite an observant, mild nature, Vanillakit was prone to making friends with just about anyone she ran into, save for the occasional feline who despised younger cats such as herself with every fiber of their bitter being. Unlike some, Vanillakit was not one to nip at your ankles or beg for demonstrations of battle moves; being more interested in critters and plants, the small tabby was prone to a more gentle approach, preferring a piece of casual conversation. She was quite the mature one, making it easy for her to converse with warriors; even more timid and awkward ones such as Dustycloud. "Splendid!" Vanillakit purred, taking a seat to the left of the chocolate felid. She curled her small tail as much as she could around her undersized, dainty mitts. "My name is Vanillakit. I don't think I've seen you in camp much, sir. Your eyes are definitely a nice thing to see, as I happen to have an odd pair myself." She grinned jubilantly, pale yellow and blue gaze looking up upon the speckled warrior curiously. Her eyes traced the ragged scars criss-crossed across his figure, but she paid no mind to the like of it. In fact, she rather admired the look of the leathery lines where past wounds healed — it was a nice reminder of this particular cat's bravery and courage in battle, willing to put himself in the way of any danger that could possibly put ThunderClan in jeopardy. But, choosing to act respectfully, she did not speak of it just in case Dustycloud was uncomfortable around the topic. "Anyway! What's your name, sir?"
Cryptic 21-Mar-22 06:33 PM
Raccoonpaw
The young tom was indeed very eager. Always taking initiative for training and helping around the camp, but even though he already did his best to be helpful, he couldn't help but crave more.. He wanted to lead patrols, fight in battles, and go on hunts all on his very own. He was eager to learn as much as he could as quickly as possible so he could become a full Warrior of Thunderclan. He truly didn't understand why training has to take so long. Perhaps if he continued to show his eagerness to learn and trained as often as possible, he could become a Warrior much earlier? He could only naively hope. At the sight of the older molly, Raccoonpaw excitedly bounced up on his paws with a bright grin on his tiny muzzle. "Good morning Laurelstar!" He greeted, seeming unable to stand still as he shifted from paw to paw. The moment she confirmed they would be going, he gratefully purred and wasted no time in following her, but not before curiously following her gaze up to the sky. Only when he looked at the golden sky did he realize that perhaps he might have come for training a little too early? Laurelstar didn't seem to mind however, so he quickly brushed it off. "So what are we doing for training today? Will I finally be a warrior when we finish?" He couldn't help but ask as he followed his mentor closely, his attention all on her even before they headed out to the territory. This question was one he tended to ask often. Any little thing he did or accomplished, he thought that was enough to become a Warrior. But he would learn in time that his thoughts were foolish and completely wrong. It took much more to be a Warrior, yet he still didn't seem to understand at the moment. @prim
Bronzewing 21-Mar-22 07:11 PM
@Pip He purrs, flicking his tail across the ground as he stretches out his paws in preparation for the upcoming hunt. "Then let's go- before all the prey hear about us and rushes off!" he meowed, standing up to his full height. He followed them- not at the friendly closeness of friends, but in a respectful manner that most cats on patrols would assume. He stayed at the back, sometimes coming closer to look around, but for the walk he stayed towards the tail of the group. ( #thc-inner-territory ?)
prim 21-Mar-22 10:57 PM
{Laurelstar} | Raccoonpaw | present
It was rare for any apprentice to be promoted to a warrior earlier than usual, unless they conducted a feat that was exceptional for their age; Something worthy of granting them their warrior name. Laurelstar herself didn’t receive her warrior name of Laurelblaze early, she was old enough to have been promoted to a warrior like usual, she had just proven herself in a major battle that it superseded the need for a proper warrior assessment. She had proven her loyalty through protecting her clanmates and fighting to bring their kidnapped leader home at the time, though she truly doubted something like that would ever happen again. She refused to be taken hostage ever, they’d never take her alive. Besides, it seemed rather pointless considering an entire clan would come after her seeking to rescue her. She was their leader, they were loyal to her. Besides, that battle was rather petrifying for her at the time, she’d earned quite a few scars during it. His head was racing towards the future, and she felt like she was mentally clothes-lining him by trying to slow him down. He couldn’t learn everything he needed in the span of one single day, no one was that talented. ”Easy there, Raccoonpaw. You’re already going too fast and that’s only gonna cause you problems in training. You can’t rush your training, it might actually slow you down in the long run.” she rested her tail on his shoulders for a moment, her voice growing stern as she looked down at him. Her gaze was hardened, focused, she did not want him to fail, she wanted to ensure he got the best possible experience out of his training he possibly could. She wanted to make sure he would be all right, that he’d be able to protect himself once he became a warrior. I don’t want him to end up like the others. I can’t lose another apprentice, I don’t want him to meet the same fate as they did. What he didn’t know, is that most of her apprentices had either disappeared or perished. Only one of them who even reached warriorhood was alive, the other, Tigerspring, had lost her life in the battle against Silentwing’s forces right after she was promoted. Her very first apprentice, Applepaw, had perished in a fire, and Dreampaw had vanished one day. After all these experiences, she was fiercely protective over her apprentices, Raccoonpaw and Bouncepaw, the two pupils she had under her care currently, had her undivided attention. She had to ensure they would be careful. ”Trust in me, Raccoonpaw, I know you’re excited, but please just take my advice. You’ll know when you are truly ready, just be careful. Pay close attention to everything I say, and you’ll be okay. Got it?” He’ll be okay. I’ll make sure of it. @Cryptic
Springy 🦤 22-Mar-22 10:05 PM
Marigolddust - Laurelblaze
- Close Future - Grey clouds covered the entirety of the late-day sky, like dirty sea foam blanketing the surface of the pure blue waves of the ocean that Marigolddust had only heard stories of. Despite the fact that the end of the day was slowely dawning on them, coming closer as the minutes ticked by, and the thick layer of precipitation tried its best to block out any sunlight that threatened to peak through, the warm rays appeared to win the battle. Everything was still bright, as if it were midday, rather than mere hours away from the setting of the sun that was so well hidden behind the wall of greys. As the slowely crawled out of Leaf-bare, New-Leaf seemed to make the days bleed on longer and longer, providing the forest clans with more sunlight than starlight. Even the gatherings and moonpools had seemed to grow a little bit short with the change in the length of the daytime and nighttime, or had been squedueld at earlier times than they would have been if they had still been trudging their way through the climax of Lead-bare. In this newfound sunlight, the fairly large, steady-falling sleet that sprinkled down onto the fur of the medicine cat, that of which was fitting enough in color to sink into the clouds above his head without much difference in color, only a shade or two darker than the billowy wisps above him, landing carefully on his forehead and quickly bleeding into his fur. He let a small shiver pass through his spine. It was a decently warm day today, with much higher temperatures than they had experienced in earlier moons, but the chill still clung to the land around them, and it stubbornly kept thin snow layers coating the ground, and seemed to still cling to the falling droplets that only got the chance to threaten to become pull water droplets, rather than a mix of ice and water both.
- It was an odd type of weather, that was for sure, but Marigolddust needed some air. The stench of herbs had begun becoming stronger in his den now that the weather was getting warmer and offered the plants moisture, rather than dry cold. The air was humid, and humidity didn’t do well at preserving his herbs, he found. Recently, he had had to dispose of larger amounts of herbs, but he also found himself finding more of the herbs that had been absent from his den for too long. He found himself visiting the meadow often, and recently, when he set his eyes of the grasses that began to peek out of the mounds of snow that had gathered throughout the cold season, he could spot some flowers peeking out, too. He was excited for when he would have an easier time gathering what he needed, and, for the first time in his entire time as the medicine cat, he would have a rather easy time finding the herbs he needed, such as goldenrod, which he could identify without assistance, having had learned about it during his time with Fernpaw. Perhaps I’ll visit the meadow again today and see if any of the herbs have fully grown yet. I should try to pick them early, so that my store can get larger faster, he thought. Maybe he could try something to dry them out, too- perhaps hanging them up with cobwebs in the sun would work? He had heard of the tactic before, but he wasn’t sure just how useful it was. Well, no matter, he would discover in time, he hoped. @prim thought I’d write a starter, since we mentioned doing a rp with them before! Take however long you want to respond, I know this might be a little unexpected, but I wanted to get to it while I hate time, and idm waiting for a response )) (edited)
Ice 23-Mar-22 09:47 AM
{ ~ Iceheart ~ // A Forgotten Friend }
Her faraway look flickered back to life and she turned back to Laurelstar who seemed ready to fight off any adversary that showed itself. ” Everything is alright,” Iceheart quickly assured, hoping that Laurelstar’s rising hackles would relax back onto her broad shoulders. ” I just…” Her voice died, unsure of how to describe the feeling. ” I felt something strange.” As this might be taken in the wrong way, she quickly added: ” Not in a bad way. It just felt foreign as if it was coming from somewhere else.” Perhaps she was crazy but the Clan had gone through wild events. It was unlikely that she would be ruled out as odd, especially considering the legacy she had left as ThunderClan’s leader. It was a protective thorn barrier during such a vulnerable time. ” Do you think Featherpelt is watching over me too even if I don’t remember him?” It was a sudden question that had latched onto her when Laurelstar was describing his passion to adopt every kit he laid his eyes on. He seemed like he was such a caring individual. Did that mean he would still care about her even if she didn’t know him? @prim
Ice 23-Mar-22 09:56 AM
{ ~ Seakit ~ }
Not everyone was snoozing away in their dens. A small, slim shape lurked in the shadows of the quarry walls. He was careful to not let the moonlight touch his silver-brown fur. His steps were clumsy but the loud buzzing of the crickets masked the noisy mistakes he made. The tabby paused, familiar sea-green eyes focusing on the relaxed deputy that lounged in the far side of the camp. His guard was down and this was Seakit’s opportunity to strike. The apprentice-aged kit crouched down and wriggled his shoulders awkwardly, attempting to remember what his father, Bearmask, had taught him. Another glance was stolen towards Alerceclaw. Still distracted, he thought with relief. Another sturdy wriggle was given before Seakit burst out from the darkness and scampered right towards the thorn tunnel. If he disappeared quickly enough, Alerceclaw might not notice. @~Swift~
prim 23-Mar-22 09:43 PM
{Laurelstar} | Marigolddust | future I
This time of year was always awkward with it’s transition into a sunnier, warmer environment. No longer frigid outside wherever she stepped, the zephyrs that coursed through their territory were not present. They had moved on to wherever else they planned to torment, however it still wasn’t necessarily warm out. A chill could be felt in the air, especially now that a freezing mixture of rain and ice was present, gently drizzling. She had parted the lichen curtain that guarded her den’s entrance, but her head recoiled back for a moment as she felt a droplet hit her nose all of a sudden. She blinked quickly, whiskers twitching as she stepped back out into the fray, no longer caught off guard by the sleet. The ThunderClan sovereign stepped out onto the ledge that led out from the cavern where she resided. She then carefully descended the boulders that led up to her den like stairs, her gaze sweeping across the various dens and figures she could make out from where she stood. It wasn’t long before she spotted an oh-so familiar face in camp. ”Up and at ‘em, Marigolddust?” Her lighthearted laughter filled the camp as she approached her friend, her clan’s medicine cat. She wondered if he was going to conduct a survey for herbs out in the territory, now that the weather was changing. She could have sworn she spotted some harbingers of spring cropping up in the forest, the first sign that new-leaf was upon them. The early-season flowers always were a good indicator that things were changing, that warmer, easier times were upon them. Laurelstar would have to ensure her clan was ready and keeping their prey stores well-stocked. Now that everyone in the clans would be able to feed off more prey, it could inspire other clans to get greedy. They could try to take territory that wasn’t theirs in order to gain more of the fruitful bounties they provided. They would have to be vigilant for any threats that may come in the future. Including their medicine cat, best she did check up on him to ensure he would be fine. He may have been trained as a warrior firstly, but he had been training as a medicine cat for moons, he might have gotten rusty. ”How are you doing today? Got any plans for later?” @Springy 🦤
prim 24-Mar-22 05:09 PM
{Laurelstar} | Iceheart | past I
The confirmation of everything being all right, that nothing was wrong, caused her to relax once again. She let out a sigh of relief, a calm smile replacing her alert expression that she once wore. She didn’t want to seem like she was infantilizing the other she-cat, but she was also genuinely a jumpy type. Laurelstar was always alert to danger, a possible threat would not be tolerated in her presence. She reacted fast, ready to sink her claws into anything that posed as a source of danger to her clan. No foe would get the upper hand over her, she was well-prepared. No one harmed her clanmates and expected to not face her fiery wrath. The russet-toned femora flashed the familiar lynx-point a curious expression, harmless skepticism in her gaze. ”How strange, as long as you’re feeling okay, I’m sure it’s all right.” her brow quirked, and she curled her tail around her paws. She hadn’t felt anything change around her, though in Iceheart’s case, all sorts of strange phenomena happen around her. She couldn’t put it past her if it happened again, maybe they could help her after all that had happened. She deserved the help after everything she had done for the clan, for her. There was hardly anyone more loyal to ThunderClan than Iceheart, besides herself, but she’d just be tooting her own horn. ”I’m sure he is… No, I’m positive he is. He’d look out for anyone, stranger or not. He was just that type of cat.” she had corrected herself, and a warm feeling flooded her chest. Her father had granted her one of her lives when she went to the Moonpool to be named as the leader of ThunderClan. He was kind, he always looked out for others, he didn’t have a selfish bone in his body— even if he didn’t possess one anymore. ”And there are others who are here who are looking out for you.” @Ice
Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" 24-Mar-22 06:55 PM
Again, Dustycloud could only blink. He was taken aback by the kittens direct and confident nature. He followed her movements closely and somewhat curiously, though made no move to inch closer, as though afraid to accidentally invade her personal space in any capacity. Was this how kits were supposed to act? No, surely she was an outlier, though a very welcomed one. He sat with his plush tail curled tight up against his side and his pale paws fidgeting below. He gazed down at her and, to show he was listening, his one good ear pricked forward. Especially at her use of the term once again. Sir. It really didnt fit him. He was distracted from addressing it, however, by the words that surrounded it. The warriors gaze flitted away from the kitten for a moment as the mismatched pair was acknowledged. They were his mothers eyes,- both biological and adoptive- stuck between a deep, frigid blue and the warm glow of a flame. It was the part of himself he had always admired most; the one part he could never hate. It was like he could carry this fragment of them no matter where he went. The rest of him, however, was full of muddy tones, like dirt and sand churned up in a current of twoleg runoff. These colors were his fathers. (edited)
"Theyre... nice." He offered a flash of a smile, struggling to rid himself of the darkened images in his history. He cleared his throat and made conscious effort to hold eye contact longer than 2 heartbeats and, to his surprise, it wasnt so hard. He watched her eyes trace around his scars, finding the movement grounding despite the ever present worry she would ask. She didnt, thank Starclan. "Dustycloud." He answered, clearing his throat again though the response came easier. "And, uhm, you really dont have to call me... sir." A flash of concern struck his gaze, as though worried he'd offend the young tabby. "O-Or if you want to you can, Im not bothered! I just, uhm, I just mean you dont have to is all." A nervous chuckle escaped him as he rose a paw to rub at the back of his neck in an anxious gesture. He hung it there as he continued, applying pressure to his nape as though to physically anchor himself to the spot. Breathe. Keep talking. "Uhm... yea, I-Ive got a little place on my own right now. I-I dont really sleep in the warriors den and I-" dont have any friends "-keep to myself... a lot. Sooo, yea. I mean, thats why you probably havent seen very much of me. Im really only here for patrols or to drop off prey or to get herbs." @Soop

Soop 24-Mar-22 07:41 PM
Vanillakit — & Dustycloud @Jay said "MATERIAL GWORL" The little stellifer's gentle gaze was interlocked steadily with Dustycloud's own of a similar hue. His anxious nature despite her mild outward demeanor caused her a little bit of sympathy for the flecked felid; from the way he behaved around others, it seemed that he was unsure how to react to everyday conversation. With his previous statement, about distancing himself from the rest of the camp, Vanillakit assumed he didn't get spoken to much, or, similarly, didn't make an effort to talk to others. Though she wasn't like that much herself, Vanillakit could understand that — people could be exhausting. Some could be very judgmental or volatile for seemingly no good reason, which may be the case for Dustycloud; that he was afraid of recieving the harsh judgment some cats could give. But that was why Vanillakit never gave them the attention they so desperately wanted, the reaction that would boost their fragile ego and maybe make their lonely lifestyle all worth it in the end. She smiled as the tom seemed to untense, if only a little, as he spoke. It always made the little one happy when cats felt comfortable around her. Dustycloud. She finally recieved the tom's moniker. It was a name fit for his pelt of a similar manner — not dusty or dirty, but rather resembling the brownish color of dust or stray grains of dirt. It could be viewed as cute, but also cruel to be named after such a nuisance. However, Vanillakit just seemed to like the name regardless of its intentions or origin. "That's a wonderful name. Dustycloud....it has a nice ring to it!" she assured him kindly, raising a paw to shift her flower crown back in place quickly that had gone askew. She was growing fond of this tom quickly. She chose to focus in his statements in the order they had been made. For the thing about calling Dustycloud "sir" — she got that a lot from some warriors she would encounter. It was a polite way to address someone, at least in Vanillakit's vocabulary, and it was an obligation to her, but it didn't burden or irritate her at all. But, of course she would cease immediately if they so wished her to do so. "Oh! My apologies, Dustycloud, I wasn't aware of that; I don't mind doing it at all, but if you don't like it, I will stop." She grinned, moving on to his next statement. "I see. I can get why a lot of cats would like to keep to themself. I bet your den is cozy." A pause. "Dustycloud, do you ever stargaze?"
Springy 🦤 24-Mar-22 10:56 PM
Marigolddust- Laurelstar
- Close Future- The grey-furred tuxedo found the back of his mind again urging him to return back to his den and hide from the icy precipitation that found itself landed on his thin fur presently, but he kept his paws cemented to the camp stones. He didn’t want to let getting a little wet distract him from the warming weather, weather that he had been awaiting for moons by now. Finally, it seemed the warmer parts of the year were beginning to peak over the horizon, blessing the forests with their beaming rays of warmth, even if such hearth had to be seeked out of the uneven drizzle. The indecisive droplets soaked through his rather thin fur and into his skin with ease, and, for a moment, he found himself almost listening to his head and hiding back inside of his den. The longer he sat out in the weather, the more he began to realize that weather such as this might mean sickness, not only for himself, but for others as well. He doubted he’d get sick from it very easily, nor most anyone else, but the kits and few elders of theirs couldn’t help but come to mind. They were more liable to falling ill, even if he coldest weather had passed by now. He didn’t want to let down his guard. He wanted to start off New-Leaf with a head-start and an easy-going stride, not a panicked one searching for ways to heal the weaker of their ranks from sickness brought by icy weather. His thoughts came to a pause, though, as he took notice of what was going through his head. Sure, the ideas were very probable, but only if those said ‘weak’ members of the clan decided to hang out in the sleet for an hour or two. He doubted much of either categories of young or old would stray out in weather such as this, even if it did turn out to have higher temperatures. Not many cats liked getting wet, anyhow. It was quite amusing, how his mindset had changed throughout these past moons as medicine cat, albeit a little terrifying.
- Large domes perked as Marigolddust heard approaching pawsteps, ones with more weigh to them than the average cat. They were fairly orderly, although also a little bit more relaxed than others Marigolddust had noticed. It wasn’t at all tricky for him to identify the pawsteps and who they belonged to, but he looked over to welcome his friend with a glance anyhow, just as she spoke her greeting. He sent her a smile and a respectful dip of his head as she arrived at his side. The expression was more confident and relaxed than it usually was around other cats since Fernpaw’s absence, having been earned through quite a number of heart-to-heart situations the two had been through. In fact, he found himself completely relaxed- or, that is, as relaxed as one could be while in such chilly rainfall. ”Hey, Laurelstar,” he said, retuning the greeting with a gentle sway of his tail and a soft expression. The leader’s laughter was nice to hear- it was definitely a good change from the serious and grieving stage she had been going through when she had first earned her new rank. He was aware of the fact that she had been efficiently getting better the further along they went into the moons after the Dark Forest battle, but he couldn’t help but think that the coming of New-Leaf could have meant something, too. He felt as if it might have been lightening the mood in the clan as a whole, representing new beginnings and future memories that smelled of honeysuckle, rather than metallic crimson. Hopefully it would continue on from that even after New-Leaf passed. ”Im doing well, I think. Happy for the change of weather, even if that sounds a little.. ironic at the moment.” he said with a small chuckle, one that felt like it came from a tom far older than he himself was. He paused at her last question, taking a moment to think before he spoke again. ”I’m brainstorming,” he admitted. (edited)
@prim
wild™ 25-Mar-22 09:15 PM
──────────────── 𝐅𝐄𝐀𝐓𝐇𝐄𝐑𝐏𝐀𝐖 // THUNDERCLAN APPRENTICE
For better or worse, everything that Thunderclan had gone through a few moons ago had changed him. He'd grown to know that things could be shattered in an instant under the right circumstances, everything that he knew and loved could be taken from him within moments, the very world could change so quickly, it was almost unbelievable. Such things had happened to him and others, though it had caused everyone to grow a little and perhaps develop a skill or trait that would make or break them. Featherpaw himself had gained such - despite the fact that his leg had never healed properly, it had ignited a flame within him - a flame of determination. He'd grown closer to his family and had developed a deeper protectiveness concerning his clanmates - thus the reasoning why he checked up on Marigolddust. The tuxedo tom-cat was the only medic they had. And he'd seen with his own eyes what burdens did to another. His mother, he could tell, that something has changed within her after the war - though he wasn't sure what, he knew something wasn't the same anymore. He wasn't sure if the same thing applied to Marigolddust exactly - but he knew that he was dealing with a lot, he always seemed so busy and there wasn't anyone who regularly helped him out. It was a little disheartening to see, but perhaps he preferred it that way - after all, some cats were like that. But he, for one, wanted to show the medicine cat that he appreciated his efforts and would always be available to lend a paw should he need it, even despite their differing roles.
-- "Well, only if you're certain! But you'll have to take the first bite." Featherpaw replied with a singular nod toward the prey he'd brought the medic. He could easily hobble over and get himself something to eat, anyway. What point would he have made if he brought something over, only to devour the thing? Which he wouldn't necessarily do, but since he hadn't eaten yet it was a possibility that he wasn't about to risk coming to pass. Not only would that be embarrassing, but such actions would be more than disrespectful. His ears twitched at the medicine cat's words and he nodded along. He could understand that - or at least, he thought he could, but maybe he couldn't. In any case, being a medicine cat sounded quite complicated - he was the only cat in the clan with knowledge on how to heal the ill and injured, and all that stuff about herbs he knew to - at least, to Featherpaw's knowledge. And that was an admirable feat on its own, he figured. He didn't think he'd do well in such a position, especially since his mind liked to wander so much...forgetting he had a patient - or patients - wouldn't be a good look for a medicine cat, he was certain. When the tom spoke once more, it shattered his thinking, his gaze flickering back to him as he caught onto the last of his words. "No? Do you need more practice then? You've got to be driving yourself crazy if you don't relax! Or at least...every once in a blue moon." he replied, chuckling. Though, he had to say - he couldn't imagine simply carrying on with his warrior duties without to the extent Marigolddust tended to his herbs and healer duties. Though he'd much prefer to be out more than he was, he couldn't imagine going to that length to tend to his own duties.
-- "Really? You're probably right though, I can wander without thinking sometimes - besides, I get pretty fidgety when I sit for too long, I'm already a little limited as is, so why bother limiting myself further, y'know?" Featherpaw responded with a smile, tail flicking towards his lame leg, which rested in a particularly awkward position, at the moment. It certainly had made things quite different for him, but now that he'd lived with it for some time, he'd gotten used to it and was more or less able to make do, even if he did look awkward doing so. Featherpaw's knowledge concerning medicine cats was quite limited so to speak - though he probably knew a bit more than the average apprentice thanks to being confined to the medical den due to his leg for some time, though then again, he hadn't paid all too much attention to the clan's medic all the same. Though Featherpaw was glad to hear that the tuxedo tom had some excitable moments even so - what was life without any thrill anyway...so long as it was within reason. The tom's ears twitched at the mention of Specklerose and they remained erect and attentive as the medic paused, raising a paw toward his maw as he lowered his voice. Featherpaw leaned in curiously, whiskers quivering at his words. This Specklerose character didn't sound very nice, whoever she was. "Really? She didn't cause you any harm, did she? I'm sure one of us warriors can take care of her if she dares to show her face again." he replied, blue optics flickering over the camp as if she might appear at any moment. "I would myself but...I'm not a very good fighter." He added after a moment, sheepishly. @Springy 🦤
